Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL Disney experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: Haynezey
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently purchased a DVC (Disney Vacation Club). Our first 50 points were at Saratoga Springs (beautiful resort!), we most recently purchased into Animal Kingdom Lodge and I couldn't be more happy after our first stay. We originally had 4 nights booked in a value studio which are on the "smaller" side, so we were told. When we got into our room, for two adults, the room was enormous! Even for a family with children the room would be great. We had a savanna view which I couldn't have been more happy about. The animals outside of the room were beautiful and very active all day and even in the evening. The room itself was so clean and spacious. Double sinks, separate room for the toilet and tub, kitchenette, pullout couch into a bed, everything was so great. The resort itself is BEAUITFUL! The landscaping is so well kept and everything was so clean. After our first 4 nights we extended our stay and had the standard studio room which is bigger than the value and the standard was HUGE. Big enough for 4 adults even! The pool was great. We ate at Bomas one night which was delicious! The Mara "food court" offers a lot of good options also. I can't wait to go back to this resort and my husband and I are SO HAPPY that we bought into this resort with our DVC! Thank you Disney for another magical trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing......”
Reviews.Author: nclcnn
Reviews.Content: just returned having spent 2 weeks with my husband and 4 year old son. Hotel amazing don't have any faults. We didn't have the disney eating plan and restrant was quite expensive to eat but worth it as food lovely. Best hotel i have ever stayed in .

Reviews.Title: “OPEN THE WINDOW AT NIGHT, HEAR & SEE THE ANIMALS”
Reviews.Author: Mike B
Reviews.Content: Most excited to sit on the balcony, and watch zebras, giraffes, water buffulo, walking around, the sounds that those animals just outside the window, felt like you could be sleeping on a savanna in Africa in a tent just by closing your eyes, but you open them and realize this glorious room, and You are in Disney's version of sleeping on the set of Animal Kingdom. You won't believ you eyes, ears, none of your senses prepare you for anything Disney does. It is truly a fantasy kingdom for kids, but adults are just as caught up in every moment. You will love that there are no lines to wait in for transportation, like you do with all the cheaper all star resorts. If youy have the extra cash, and this may be your only trip to Disneyworld, please do everything you can to experience this place, even if you planned on a 7 day trip, kick it down to a 4 day, and enjoy all the extras.

Reviews.Title: “Neat place”
Reviews.Author: Yorkdog
Reviews.Content: Certainly unique, savannah view is neat if you can get an upgrade so you can see the animals. Pretty pricey and not sure it is worth it but it is Disney and so that is how it goes. Overrun with loud children again Disney so if you are looking for any type of peace forget it. But the bomb buffet is awesome. Staff was great. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Time at Jambo House”
Reviews.Author: Martysue
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Jambo House in a 2 bedroom villa with a savannah view. It was beautiful. The view of the animals from our balcony was an amazing experience. The children especially loved seeing zebras, giraffes and more in such a private setting. Disney gets the african theme right to the tinest detail. The pool was terrific too - we just wish there more more lounge chairs. You could sit poolside and watch the kids all day on the water slide. Our kids also went to "simba's cubhouse" one night while we enjoyed a leisurely dinner at Jiko. Jiko was fabulous! Our server, Shelly, was wonderful and helped us make our meal selections with great enthusiasm. All in all, this was a wonderful stay. We want to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Always wanted to stay here but...”
Reviews.Author: Beth M
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (kids age 5 and 18 mo) spent the first four days at Coronado Springs and then moved to the Lodge. After being very comfortable at CS, our pool view bunk bed room at AKL was disappointing. The room never seemed to cool off, had a strange smell and was humid. The bedding wasn't comfortable and I had to laugh when they advertise Disney's Resort bedding collection in the room but it's not used there. The room was cramped - big furniture for a little space. You pay for the amenitites - we did enjoy the pool, cookie decorating and the campfire. And it was neat to see the giraffes and zebras. However, I don't feel like it was worth the extra $$ after staying at Coronado Springs. We can check this resort off our list but won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Brandon M
Reviews.Content: The AKL was absolutely amazing!!!!! I never wanna stay anywhere else. The rooms were clean and we had a pool view and never heard any noise from the pool. We only waited for a bus to the parks longer than 5 minutes one time and the food at Boma was great there was something for everyone and mac n cheese and chicken nuggets for the kids. We did online check in so check in was a breeze. We stayed in room 4010 and was close to the food court bus stop and pool. This is a great place to stay at Disney!!!

Reviews.Title: “MY FAVORITE PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy1975
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Kidani village. we had a two-bedroom villa. It was great... the resort is beautiful, the views are wonderful. The cast members were great very helpful!! Pool area is fab! Love it and would stay there again!!! Love it love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly Overrated”
Reviews.Author: falmalki
Reviews.Content: The titels says it all. Couple of farm animals and every zoo shy ones in a central large park made this hotel the huge uncalled for reputation. They have room very far toward the end of each edge, they decided to market them as the Savanah ones with the special view bla bla bla. Not worth it at all. Having experienced it, I would have stayed at any other Disney themed hotel and paid this a quick visit instead of the uncalled for premium I paid. We wake up very early and leave to the parks so won't be able to see the "Animals" that the special Savanh Rooms has the view over which. Given that the Savanh rooms are special, pay for it physically and walk the longest walk until you can reach the doors for the parks' buses. No room service after 7-8 pm! And the lodge theme makes you feel you are in a 3 stars motel! Anove all, the Disney monorail doesn't stop at it yet stops at other Disney hotels. However, buses to the parks are available. Absolutely won't visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, dirty and horrible food”
Reviews.Author: David D
Reviews.Content: We spend 5 days and 4 nights at the lodge and couldn't be more disappointed. The Lodge is dark, dated, poorly maintained, with absoultely horrible food. Would never consider it again. Love the park but the Jambo House was horrible. Had a Savanna Villa that you needed a flashlight to find you way around the bathroom and kitchen. The elevator walls were so filthy that we afriad the kids might touch them and get sick. Horrible, Horrible dated dirty place.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed many times and continue to do so”
Reviews.Author: currycook
Reviews.Content: Our family has stayed here many times since it has opened and we continue to love and enjoy the place. The value has gone a bit down over the years as the price has continued to go up. However, its a wonderful place. The positive and negative for many who know Disney well is that the AKL is a bit off the usual track. Meaning bus times will be a bit longer. However, that is also a positive in many ways to seclude yourself in the AKL and off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “The Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: JimmyT50
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is an amazing place to visit! It is a great experience. You get to see animals such as wilderbeast, zebra, giraffes and much more. You can also see birds. One bird you can see is a flamingo. You see these animals up close. I would definately reccomend Animal Kingdom lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Staying at Jambo House”
Reviews.Author: wanderingidiot
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 6 nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge (AKL) and had an excellent time. We used Disney's Magical Express to transport us and our luggage from the Orlando airport to AKL. We arrived at approximately 11am, and knew there was the possibility our room would not be ready. As luck would have it, our room was ready for us, and, having used Disney's online check in service prior to arrival, our check in time on-site was limited to about 5 minutes. Our room was about halfway down the Kudu Trail, was on the 2nd floor, and overlooked the Sunset Savanna. We had reserved a "standard view" figuring we would not spend much time in the room, and were very pleasantly surprised that we received a complimentary upgrade to a savanna view. Our 4 year old was delighted that instead of 2 queen beds, there was 1 queen and 1 set of bunk beds. The rooms are somewhat small, and I have heard that's one of the reasons AKL is a little more modestly priced than other WDW deluxe hotels. Besides the queen and bunk beds, there was a mini-fridge, a TV stand with two drawers for clothes, a small round table with 2 chairs, a closet, and a night stand. The shower and commode are behind a door, and there is a double sink with a large mirror between the bathroom and the sleeping area. There is a wall between the double sinks and the beds; however, there is no door to serve as a light/sound barrier between the two. From other reviews, this has been one of the negatives about the room layout (meaning that someone getting ready at the sink could be disruptive to those in the sleeping area). We didn't have a problem with it - we wore our 4 year old out! During our stay, we saw the giraffes, zebras and ostrich numerous time. We also saw some of the hoof stock and ankole cattle from our balcony. Across the savanna we could see Kidani Village, a Disney Vacation Club property. It was far enough away that it didn't detract from the view. One night, from our balcony we could hear the live entertainment covering Beatles songs. The lobby of AKL is gorgeous, and people justifiably rave about it. Here are the negatives - and please keep in mind, I still rated AKL as excellent. AKL is BIG. We were about 1/2 way down Kudu trail, and it took us a good minute or two of walking to get back to the lobby, then up the stairs, through the lobby, out the door, and down the hill to the bus station. Overall, we probably had a 5 minute walk from room door to the bus waiting area. It doesn't sound like much, but after a long day at the parks, it feels like a mile. We were on the dining plan. AKL's dining options are somewhat limited. I understand some of the moderate Disney hotels have food courts. AKL has 1 signature table service restaurant (Jiko), one buffet (Boma), and one quick service restaurant (The Mara). All have African inspired dishes, and some traditional American fare. I really like Boma, and enjoy trying various cuisines. My wife's taste is a little more limited, and she felt like she ran out of less exotic menu choices pretty quickly. As part of the dining plan, we received mugs with unlimited refills at AKL. These included fountain drinks, coffee and tea. We only filled them once or twice a day. Kudu Trail is on the opposite side of the resort from The Mara where the drinks were located. It was a 4-5 minute walk each way (often longer with my 4 year in tow). Had it not been so far, we might have taken greater advantage of this perk. Our housekeeper was a little gruff with us at one point (even after tipping her $5 a day). We had just gotten back from the parks and were going to have some afternoon pool time when she initially knocked on the door (probably around 3:30). I asked for 5 mins and she seemed a little perturbed. Promptly at 5 minutes, she knocked again and seemed a little irritated that we weren't quite ready for her. I had one concierge member who was a little snooty to me about a dinner reservation -- all the others were amazingly helpful. AKL is in a fairly remote corner of WDW. The only transportation offered here is bus (no monorail, no boats). Bus to Animal Kingdom is 10 mins including a stop at Kidani Village. Bus to Downtown Disney is about 20 minutes. The beds are very firm. I suppose this could be a positive, depending on your preference. Random Note - Neither Positive nor Negative Immediately below our balcony was an enclosure with a stockade style fence. When I saw two of the animal keepers outside, I asked them what it was for. If there is an emergency, and people in their rooms cannot escape through the lobby, they evacuate the guests to this outdoor enclosure instead. The positives: It's a beautiful building. The architecture is amazing. The pool is great, kid-friendly and the waterslide is a lot of fun. there is a full service bar right next to the pool as well. And, there is a playground and hot tub in the same area as well. There is always an animal to see - even at night. Go to a viewing platform, and they will let you use night vision goggles and tell you where to look. Finally, the customer service was exemplary (outside of our couple of minor encounters noted above - however, I always want to acknowledge that some could just be having a bad day. My wife hurt her knee at one of the parks. We're not really sure how she did it (no memories of a bad twist, etc), but it became swollen and painful enough that we went to urgent care. The protocol for getting medical care at AKL is to dial 911 from your room (unless it's an absolutely emergent situation). We called, the dispatcher asked some basic medical questions, and only a few minutes later people began to arrive at our room. Eric (I hope I got his name right. You can't miss him - he played offensive line for Va Tech) was on the spot supervising the situation as the paramedics arrived and checked out my wife. They gave us contact information for a local urgent care facility, and left us with a wheelchair to use for the remainder of our stay. We ended up calling urgent care, who picked us up, checked her out, gave her some crutches and ibuprofen for her knee sprain and took us back to AKL. When we arrived at our room, we discovered that Eric and hotel management had room service deliver milk and cookies to us, along with a get well soon card. The cookies and card were on a tray on the bed, the milk was in the fridge. It was a very nice touch. I would stay at AKL again in a heartbeat. The negatives I mentioned above are nothing new - I have read the same items on several sites, but they are overwhelmingly outnumbered by the positive aspects of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Disney hotel and experience I have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: TDowl
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review while being swarmed by bugs while waiting for the Disneys Magical Express outside this hotel that is has never showed up an was supposed to be here 50 min ago. There are no employees here to explaon why it is not here or what is going on. Just the fifty bugs swarming around me and my bags. There are like eight of them hanging out out front of the hotel and in the valet area. None have come over. I went and asked them three times. None were helpful or could explain. Where it is or why it's not here or when another one will come. This is par for n the course for my stay at this hotel. A little backstory. I love Disney. I used to come here as a kid. Love coming here. I live in la and am an annual Passholder at Disneyland. And just upgraded to get a pass here at Disneyworld. I was at the Yacht club all week an loved it. I moved here because they didn't have availability and the diary person recommended it. Said it was a must see as I should try it. I hated it. The rooms are cheap. The bed uncomfortable. The spread is made up of a cheap uncomfortable material. I have now been out here for an hour. And tried to go talk to people five times. No one seems to care or be helpful or that we are all still waiting. The magical express is a great thing. It ideally makes things easy on you. You are supposed to not need to worry about your bags. Not today. Before ours never showed up... We r supposed to hear from them a day early about what time our pick up is. I never heard from them an had to call three people last night to find out when it was coming. The people at the hotel were no help with this. I asked magical express what I needed to do with my bags. They said call the hotel. I did again. I said I was gonna check in and pay my bag fee. They said yes do that and I can drop off my bag at the airline check in in the lobby. So I did this. Today after getting a late check out til 1. I was in te shower and at 1130 had someone banging on my door. Ran out in a towel asking what thy wanted and try informed me I was past checkout. I informed them through the door that I had a late check out. He grumbled and went away. So then I went to the lobby to check my bag so Isis t have to worry about it. After waiting in line I was told that oh no u checked in and paid for your bag already we can't take it. I informed them that is why Ty told me to do. They said we did not tell u that. I said the hotel did. They said sorry u need to take yor bag tithe airport now. Which defeats the convenience of the magical express. I ask to speak to a manager. And one comes and tells me oh well sorry we can't do anything. And I feel like you are Disney. You are supposed to have the best customer service around and when u tell me something wrong. You need to find a way to make up for it. Call the airline. Talk to someone. Figure it out. But it was nope sorry we screwed up. Not out problem u deal with it. Now that I had my bag. I felt I didn't need to leaveforthw airport three hours early so I called magical express and asked if I could take a later bus so I had mOre time in the park. They said no they couldn't change my bus. That I needed to pave that early and should show up 15 min before my time because they always run on time and won't be late. An hour later still waiting outside for my bus. I'd talk about he terrible food at the hotel and how it was cold and bad. But I am tired of typing. Horrible service. Horrible customer service. Really soured me on Disney and making a trip back here. No one offered any apology or anything in return. Maybe I will just go to Universal and Harry Potter next time. I am writing this on my phone in the hot sun while being swarmed by bugs. A I apologize for the typos and autocorrect. Hope I don't miss my flight.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Savannah View”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Just spent 5 night at AK lodge Using Disney Vacation Club points and think we got a bargain! We chose to stay in the main hotel at Jambo house rather than Kidani Village as we love the main lobby area and the bar there. Our room was a value studio, not sure why it was classed as value as it was a full sized DVC studio and we were overlooking the Savannah. We had giraffes, Zebra an Ostrich and other animals hanging around right infront of us. We spent hours just watching them - brilliant! The room was a typical Disney Vacation Club Studio and had everything that we needed. The Pool was lovely but really busy, would have liked a quiet pool to go to like they have at other resorts but this wasn't the case here. We ended up sitting by the Flamingo area which was a bit quieter but with easy access to the main pool. Didnt use the restaurant in the lodge as the buffet is heaving and the other restaurant a bit pricey but we LOVE the Sanaa restaurant over in Kidani village, its one of our favourite restaurants in Orlando, great if you like a bit of spice, you can walk to Kidani village in 10 mins or they have a bus. My only criticism is that like every other resort the buses take forever. AK lodge is a lond way from Downtown Disney and Magic Kingdom and even the closer resorts take forever. We were on the bus one evening for 20 mins before we even left the resort! Overall we love it here and will definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “great disney property”
Reviews.Author: chips57
Reviews.Content: we really like the Animal Kingdom Resort. This was our 2nd time there. We get a room with a savannah view and bunk beds. The kids love to see the animals in the morning. The BOMA restaurant is awesome. Check in was a piece of cake with a personal greeter as we walked in that took care of us right away. There is also a very nice pool. When we were there in March, they were offering the free dining package....take advantage of that...it's great!

Reviews.Title: “Our first stay at this resort, and not our last!”
Reviews.Author: mrs_shopthe
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL for the first time and were not disappointed one bit! Upon checking in, were were most surprised to find out our room was upgraded to a Savannah View!! We had animals right outside our balcony all the time!! We stayed in a studio which has a small kitchenette area. The rooms are similar to Kidani Village (where we have stayed twice) with the Safari theme. They are very spacious here as well and very clean. The staff at AKL is wonderful! It's always a perfect vacation at Walt Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “AKL through the eyes if 6 year old”
Reviews.Author: Ssjgomes
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Arusha view room, worth every penny!! My wife and six year old son were amazed every morning, afternoon and evening! Watching the giraffes bending to drink water and waking up to see a pack of 4 girafes less then 30 yards from our balcony was awesome!! We will miss and plan on going back!!!!! Great pool and staff too!

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: WtngforGodot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in mid-April. The lobby is beautiful, as well as the property in general. The room left a lot to be desired. The bed linens were rough and the blanet was very cheap for a resort of this caliber/price. We would stay here again, but hoped for more for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, good service, could have better food options”
Reviews.Author: vs12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Jambo House villas. The villas are very spacious with a living room and kitchen, and much bigger bathrooms than the regular rooms. Definitely worth the extra money if you have 2 or more kids. We had a partial view of the savanna. There aren't a lot of animals though so don't expect a zoo. Customer service was great and they even gave us a room for a few hrs after we checked out of the villa room as our flight was later in the evening. They have a nice heated outdoor pool as well and the lobby is pretty nice. We visited Kidani as well and Kidani looks very congested in comparison. Also, Kidani is more secluded and I think Jambo is the place to be if you are looking for convenience. But that's my opinion. Travel back and forth from the parks and downtown disney is a breeze if you are staying here.

Reviews.Title: “wow”
Reviews.Author: sarah191076
Reviews.Content: I visited in October 2011 with my husband and two children ages 10 and 12 .The hotel was excellent so good that a holiday of a lift time has now turned in to just a first one as we have rebooked to go back in October 2013 I don't know who is more excited us adults or the kids. If you are their in October don't miss going to mickey mouses not so scary Halloween party well worth every penny .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing on all accounts!!”
Reviews.Author: ninny79
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2012 and everything about this hotel was simply amazing. The pool was very clean as well as the room. Housekeeping was great and took towels when needed and always replaced toiletries on a daily basis. Never without anything in room. Mattresses were very comfortable and didn't feel like i had to look under sheets for surprise visitors while there. Our room was a pool view room, and while the trees where blocking the view of the pool it was a great location. The only gripe I can say that I had was about the food, but knowing that most of the restaurants are African inspired, we knew that going in to it. The bus rides to the parks where always there with in the 20 min mark and the distance was not as bad as some make it. Very easy to get on and off. The gift shop had a ton of items such as milk, bread and the usual Disney gifts. All the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Would def stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected....”
Reviews.Author: lLola
Reviews.Content: I am giving this hotel an excellent rating because it was much nicer than I expected since Disney hotels are not known for being comparable to real "luxury" hotels. The staff was incredibly friendly and accommodating to each request from the moment we arrived to the last moments when we caught the Disney bus back to the airport. The rooms were clean. They aren't fancy but were in good condition and had a nice balcony overlooking the animals. The lobby is beautiful and there are firepits and waterfalls which add to the ambiance. We were pleased with the "club floor" extras since we could have breakfast there every morning before going to the parks. The pool looked nice and was quite large but we weren't there to swim. There are buses to each park but be aware that they get crowded at peak times and the ride to Magic Kingdom takes a while. One of the few negatives to the hotel is the quick service dining restaurant which I suppose is normal for Disney but I would prefer a place to get a better meal at lunchtime with table service or a less chaotic environment. I will probably stay here again since it is a little less than the other "deluxe" resorts and seems to be more updated. We did go to Jiko which was very good also. We did not go to the buffet but it seemed to be very busy.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience!!!”
Reviews.Author: jimmyray_19
Reviews.Content: The Exceptionally Good: The animals..... To stay at a hotel where the animals are right outside your bedroom window is truly spectacular, Sure, they put their food where you will get the best views, so it's a little "staged", but it is still wild zebras, giraffes, etc. The guides/advisors..... People directly from Africa, who are hired for a year or so, to come work at Disney and share their life, their knowledge and their passion for these wonderful animals. Grace in particular was wonderful and treated my wife and I like long lost friends. She is from Botswana, and when we go to Africa, we will try to visit her. She was that friendly! The hotel itself.. Beautifully decorated, with actual African artifacts. We were told it is the largest and most valuable collection outside of Africa itself. Wonderful, picturesque building. The food... Wow....Yummy with the perfect amount of exotic ingredients. Brought home many warm memories and recipe ideas. The Good: The hotel lobby bar. Nice location, decent servers, but tended to be pretty noisy around dinner until 10pm or so. Still a nice place for a drink and a snack. The OK: The actual rooms... Not anything special really. On the small side. But the views........ :-) What you need to know: People, you are on a Disney property. They don't do "small". Sure you walk a lot. Get over this "issue" and just walk. It's worth the effort. The building is setup in type of layout so everyone gets a chance to see the animals. Try the pool area at least once if it's not 100+ degrees. It is a very nice area and the hot-tubs are very secluded and nice. Eat at Boma for Breakfast at least once and try something outside your comfort zone. It's worth it!! Dinner is wonderful as well. We didn't try the high-end restaurant, as we simply couldn't see how the value would be any better. Bring your camera. Obviously, right??? All in all, this was one of our top 3 experiences anywhere. Worth it, if even only once.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: cakesat5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks and did not regret our choice. We booked a standard room but were lucky enough to be upgraded to a savannah room, much to my daughters amazement. Nothing like waking up at 6am to giraffes feeding next to your balcony!! The staff cant do enough to help in typical Disney fashion. This is exactly what you would expect from a deluxe resort. We had a very happy two weeks here. Lots of activities to do, and memory beads to collect when completing the activities. Always rangers on hand to tell stories, and lectures on animals etc. Look out for marshmallow roasting and stories at sunset! Lots of fun. Pool size more than adequate for the size of the hotel if you fancy a day by the pool. It is heated October onwards which really helps. There's a waterslide for the kids and plenty of poolside activities for them too. Dotted around the pool in quiet shady spots are heated jacuzzis which are lovely. One of our favourite things was the outdoor movie showing at night! The main restaurant , Mara does get busy. It worth utilising. The breakfast selection is very good. The quick service restaurant is equally as good. Portion sizes are excellent. Jiko, the fine dining restaurant is well worth a visit. Have reviewed seperately. We did hear people moaning about the room sizes, but as Brits we felt it was more than adequate , housing two double beds in it!! The transport links are worth a mention. Although the hotel is one of the furthest situated hotels from the parks, the transport links are excellent and you should not be out off the hotel because of this. We had a car and make use of the benefit of free parking around the whole of the Disney resort. If you're lucky enough to get Disney dining plan thrown in with the hotel for free, take it!! There is more than enough food on the plan offered with a deluxe hotel and we couldn't eat all our credits by the end of the two weeks and we tried!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Hong_Kong_Star
Reviews.Content: We had an overall good experience there. We had a standard room, it was clean, confortable and of a reasonable size but no view. The pool is nice and big, with a small slide but there is no wow factor (a bit old). The food & service at Boma were very good but it's a noisy place (it can serve 400 people !) Breakfast was great, so much choice and quality too. The downsides : - very expensive - a lot of people everywhere - the long queue at the shuttle to go to the park in the morning : we had to wait 20mn to be able to get into one (5mn from the hotel) and then we were packed inside it.

Reviews.Title: “Close but no Cigar”
Reviews.Author: Matthew M
Reviews.Content: We were so excited to take our little boy on holidays to Animal Kingdom and the hotel was wonderful. We paid a lot of money for the two weeks and after the girl greeted outside te front of the hotel and proceeded to tell us all about the hotel and how brilliant it was whilst watching me ad my wife go purple carrying all our luggage it was not a good start. Then they wanted to charge us even more money as my wife was not happy with the room and yes we had booked a Savannah view. We then had to carry ur bags across the lobby to where the bell boy position was and they expected a tip after this. All in all not a brilliant start. However the hotel is good it blends nicely into the surroundings and is well equipped even if it doesn't have a turn down service in the evening or full bath towels. Disney does offer a fantastic experience all round though the shuttle buses everywhere ran like clockwork and the parks just get bigger with something for everyone. My wife ad booked all passes and the deluxe dining plan which also worked really well. The Disney experience is superb just dont expect 5 Star Hotel Quality like you get in the Middle East or the Far East.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for location and kids, but not sure on the "deluxe"”
Reviews.Author: astechs
Reviews.Content: To be fair we have been spoilt by middle east hotels, however I was pleasantly surprised by this place. We spent 9 nights here with a 5 & 7 year old and my only regret is that we did not find more time to explore the place! Between, the disney parks, water parks and shopping, there was not enough time. The hotel itself is beautiful with a fantastic lobby and great views of the animals. There is ample parking and the service of staff is impeccable. The room itself was a little small but had everything we needed. Only complaint is we could not switch the AC off and the wifi kept dropping. We enjoyed the pool which was nice although a little cold. We did not try the restaurants as there was not much veggie option and it was expensive for what you get. I would recommend this place but only if you think you will have time to enjoy the hotel. A car is a must although Disney transport is great for getting you to and from the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Jambo - expensive but awesome !”
Reviews.Author: VinnyCelino
Reviews.Content: Whilst visiting Disney we decided to spend three nights there on an off the cuff decision. We paid a hefty sum ($1,900) for a room on the second floor on the left side (2239). The kids loved it, best time is morning and evening to catch the animals as they feed, we saw Red Water Hog, Ankole Cattle, Reticulated Giraffes, Zebra ( i keep saying Zeebra), Antelope, Ostrich and Pelicans. The room was lovely, slightly on the small side but the bunk beds were good and the main bed solidly made. Good wooden furniture throughout. Air Conditioning was silent AND effective unlike the one at our main hotel, the DoubleTree at Universal. Food is relatively expensive but great, we stuck to the Boma buffet as we all like to pick and mix, plenty of selection, service is great and chef's are accomodating. Best three nights of our holiday, magic for the kids and us snacking on our veranda as we watched the wildlife.

Reviews.Title: “Never gets old”
Reviews.Author: Keith F
Reviews.Content: Waking up every morning and chilling-out every evening on your balcony watching the animals is huge. The hotel is undoubtedly remote and having a car available is a must unless you don't intend going anywhere other than your hotel or the AK.

Reviews.Title: “The guides are incredible”
Reviews.Author: MA_Browne
Reviews.Content: Positives 1. The animals. Amazing the wake up to see various animals grazing beneath you. 2. The guides are absolutely amazing. I spent over an hour one morning chatting with two African ladies whose names I unfortunately can't remember - one from South Africa one from Botswana. If by chance someone at the hotel reads this, pass the message on that I really enjoyed our chat. I'd gone to buy my wife a gift from the gift shop because we were leaving that day. Without prompting, one of the guides found me wrapping paper and a gift tag. It's little touches like this that made our stay so special. 3. The Disney experience - no point listing all the usual perks of staying at a Disney resort because you probably know them all anyway if you're reading this. It is the ONLY way to enjoy a Disney World holiday Negatives - I must stress that these aren't enormous negatives. We came away with an overwhelmingly positive account of our stay. Just that in the interest of balance these were some points for improvement. 1. Unless you're paying the extra for a savannah room, it's rather pointless staying here. You can see the same animals on a trip to Animal Kingdom theme park. 2. Concierge were not at all helpful with booking the Magical Express to the airport when we were leaving. Twice I was fobbed off with instructions to merely tell the valet in the morning that we'd like to travel and that would be sufficient, despite having been told elsewhere to the contrary. Finally I asked one of the night staff at reception to look into it and within seconds our boarding passes had been printed. Thanks a lot concierge. I should stress though that this is the only unsatisfactory exchange with customer service staff for our entire stay. 3. Location. This is relatively speaking of course. It's still only half an hours bus ride from anywhere else in Disney World. It's still the furthest one away from anywhere though - half an hour one way to Downtown Disney in the evenings which was a long trip when you've had a "bit" to drink...

Reviews.Title: “Not the best choice but it is OK ... BUT ... this is not Africa folks”
Reviews.Author: off-for-a-ride
Reviews.Content: If you really want an African adventure then please use your money to go on one. You will love it, and believe me at these prices you can afford it. My personal favourite is the Okavango Delta in Botswana and if you can stretch to it the Namibian Skeleton Coast. If you "have" to be in Disney World then this is an OK choice of a hotel (not the best but OK). BUT ... this is not Africa folks ... this is a huge (5 story) hotel block surrounded by a zoo. If you accept that is what you are getting then fine, go for it. We spent two weeks in Orlando at two different hotels. The first was the Waldorf Astoria (reviewed seperately) which was cheaper and better (but not good). When we arrived at Animal Kingdom we had a big booking problem (thank you to hotels.com for resolving for us) but that meant that we started in a room at Kidani and then ended up at Jambo House so we can comment on the comparability. In our view Kidani is a smaller poor relation (fewer facilities and the pool is too small) but otherwise a carbon copy. We eventually booked into a large 4th floor 1 room suite (these are all standard hotel rooms folks, none are "villas") with a lounge and kitchen area (beware that smaller rooms do not have a kitchen despite some of the apparent advertising). The large rooms are nicely done although for the price are a bit tacky. The comments about things being too dark are frankly just silly, the lighting is perfectly adequate. Service throughout was "Disney Standard Service Level" (DSSL = lots of smiles but largely slow and inneficient). Food is also "Disney Standard Food" (DSF = overpriced and largely poor quality). This includes the so called South African restaurants at both Kidani and Jambo (I grew up in Africa ... trust me not authentic). Transport system works well from this hotel and you are not too far from everything. We liked the evening toasted marshmellows by the campfire every evening. The pool (at Jambo) is nice and the afternoon kids activities are good. Note that we have been to Disney several times so we are "fans" but let's be honest about what you get. Our favourite park was Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyInSeattle
Reviews.Content: This was our first experience at Walt Disney World in Orlando. And in true Disney form, it did not disappoint! I believe they now call the lodge 'Jambo House' since there is another section of the lodge about a 5-7 minute walk away. As you first walk into the lodge, you can't help to be impressed with the very dramatic lobby w/ wonderful decoration and attention to detail. We did not pay to upgrade to a view room to see the animals, but we could still see them from our room (not sure if they ended up upgrading anyway...). We stayed in room 2232 and it was very comfortable for a family of four. My only complaint about the room is that the lighting in the bathroom is quite dim. Brighter lighting would definitely help make it easier to apply make-up! The hotel is quite large and we found it a little confusing getting from our room to the pool area at first. A few of the signs aren't very clear. (you enter the lobby which is actually the 3rd floor, but the pool is on the ground floor). But, the pool area is wonderful and features a little slide the kids just loved. There's a bar there, too, for parents and towels are provided for free. The other thing I love about staying on a Disney property is the ease of transportation. All of the Disney hotels offer bus services to the Disney theme parks. They come every 10-20 minutes -- so easy!! While I have not stayed at any other Disneyworld hotels to offer a comparison, I can say without hesitation that you will not be disappointed in the Amimal Kingdom Lodge!!! In fact, we stayed at a smaller Marriott hotel afterwards for our trip to Universal Studios and my son said 'I really wish we were back at the Animal Kingdom Lodge'!

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit to Jambo House at Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: d_sheard
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is just as impressive the second time you walk into it and the staff are super efficient and friendly. My two younger teenage children loved the pool and hot tub which they spent a lot of time in. We only ate in Boma once this time and I'm afraid I was a little disappointed this time with the choices and how pricey it was. However, if you go over to Kiddani village Sanaa the new Indian/African themed restaurant is excellent with a varied menu. The staff at Sanaa went out of their way to reassure my daughter and go over the menu with her as she has a peanut allergy. We love the Animal Kingdom Lodge and hopefully we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great lodge, but very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Idahobungalo
Reviews.Content: We opted for the one bedroom suite i(Jambo House) for a little more privacy from the kiddo. We were really happy that we decided to go that route instead of a studio. We had a small, but full functional kitchen. We had a few boxes of groceries delivered, so the refrigerator and cupboards came in handy. It would have been nice if the toilet was separated from the shower, especially when all of us are trying to get ready at the same time. As for how much we spent...we did the 5 day hopper park pass with and our lodging together. We thought it was too expensive! The resort itself is super cool. We did like the seclusion from the chaos of the parks. They have two pools with water slides, a decent gym, an arcade, several decent restaurants, crafts for kids and massage. We went the last week of March and it was crowded. The parks were MUCH more crowded than the hotel and most times we would have rather been at the resort than at the parks! For what we paid, I thought the suite was good. It wasn't excellent but it was good. I had some issues with their pillows. The one I had was huge and I kept waking up thinking I had two pillows under me. I called housekeeping and asked if they had another pillow, but they said no (they didn't tell me there were all different). I later found out that there are several different types of pillows (each have their own thickness, etc.) so if you don't like one..try one of the others on the bed. I found one that worked! Jiko was just OK. We also ate at Sanaa as well. The chef was awesome at Sanaa and actually came out to discuss my vegan diet. He was very accommodating with the limited ingredients that he had. The resort is super clean and the animals appear to be well taken care of. All in all, we likely wont come back due to the lack of excitement we had at the parks (wrong time to go, extremely crowded, hot) as well as the high price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel, Beautiful - My New Favorite Disney Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: racerdog
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for the first time this past Easter. The hotel itself blended nicely into the surrounding landscaping - so much that I did not realize how big the property is when we pulled up and parked. We rented a car and parking was never an issue. We walked into the lobby and all I could think was "Wow!" It's gorgeous, huge spacious, with places to sit with the kids for privacy. There were many displays of African culture and crafts everywhere. The staff was super nice - I especially liked that we were greeted with "Welcome Home" anytime we passed a staff member. We reserved a room with a safari view, Arusha. We could not believe the number of animals we were able to see. We saw a giraffe sleeping underneath our balcony one night! The pool scene was very nice. The kids enjoyed spending an afternoon at the pool. Our family, from the area, were able to come visit us and spend the afternoon swimming at the pool. Our room was nicely decorated and I enjoyed the H2O Spa products (which I use at home too!) After staying at Port Orleans (Riverside & French Quarter), Coronado, Century Pop, and Wilderness Cabins, this has been my favorite. The bar has a great selection of wines, nice places to hang out, a great fire pit outside, places to walk and sit to great away from the masses. I am definitely staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A lot bigger than expected”
Reviews.Author: Robocop1
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Lodge was really a treat fro daughter to be able to wacth the animals from the balcony when she woke up in the morning and on that front in didn't disappoint. We did enjoy staying here and really didn't want to leave. it was confusing at first as we didn't realise the hotel was spilt into two separate buildings - Jambo House & Kidani Village. We stayed in Jambo house which had a view over the savannah between it and Kidani. This area is huge and there is enough distance and trees so that you're not staring into other peoples room in the opposite building. The animals actually were called in for their checks between 7am & 9am but there were usualy wnough to make an early morning viewing worthwhile and they are around until late and it's great to sit on your balcony watching the animals as the sun goes down. Rooms aren't that big but well decorated and all in keeping with the African theme. Porters and cleaners are very good and well worth their tips. My only real quibble is with the restaurants - there seemed to be 3. One that was near the pool which was self service although when we went one evening there was a woman taking our order on a notepad before we went up with our tray to collect it - frankly she didn't seem to have a clue as to why she was there or what she was was doing but we got our food nonetheless. This was also where we got our breakfast ( although you can get it at the others) and it was perfectly serviceable although i would recommend having it at a table outside in the warm rather than the O.T.T. AC. The second hotel is called Bomu ( i think) and all the staff were recommending it. Frankly i think its massively over rated. we thankfully reserved a table as we saw from the previous night how busy it got. Basically it's one massive self service carvery and although you have a waiter they are there purely to bring you your drinks and clear away the dirty dishes you rapidly acquire as you return to the buffet. The food in fairness is very good and I ate so much I didn't eat for the next 18 hours. But it's incredibly busy and consequently noisy and is anything but relaxing after a long day at the animal kingdom itself. By far the better restaurant is the Waiter service restaurant opposite Bomu. It is more expensive but a lot, lot calmer. Dishes averaged about $38 per adult for main course and $10 for a dessert. There is also a good bar there ( although Disney hotel's don't serve beer stronger than $5 apparantly) and there are plenty of quiet little corners, balconies and alcoves to sit which is a very relaxing way to watch the day draw to a close. I really liked the building and was surprised at just how big it is - our room was about a third of the distance from the reception but it was still a bit of a trek to get to your room. It's definately worth staying in as long as you have a decent savannah room view. My only complaint about the room is it's safe which is completely inadequate as its only about 3 - 4 inches deep - anyhting wider than that you'll never get in. We were sad to leave as it is quite an experience to stay there and i would recommend staying there at least once if you have children.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort but not to our Liking Overall”
Reviews.Author: 1snowiespruce
Reviews.Content: I have to say that I generally love returning to our home away from home, Port Orleans Riverside, tho we have also stayed Grand Floridian, Poly and others as well....Guess you can tell I greatly enjoy Disney. This resort visit was actually a surprise Bday gift from my spouse, a quick 4 day getaway, down to Disney and Back (I generally stay much longer onsite). The resort check in was a breeze, and they actually surprised us with a FREE upgrade to Savannah View and gave me a Bday Button. That was quite nice and greatly appreciated. The resort itself however was just not our family's style. Heres why...The resort is dark...which sounds crazy...but its a savannah and the dreary dark overcast of it tho still quite beautiful was not to my liking. It is inside corridor. I am used to Bright, Airy, SUNshiny Florida KWIM?? I missed the Florida Vibe here The indoor corridors had trays from food service everywhere...literally one had to wind their way thru them...both in the morning and then again at night, that was annoying. The storyteller was late by more than 30 minutes, and obviously had no interest and just read, and left...not Disney like at all. The food court was limited in scope (obviously themed..) so that did not work for a picky eater...The restaurant, despite having ADRs (advanced dining reservations) was behind an hour, we left (with their apologies) only to have no food available to us that was okay for our situation, and that was another annoyance. We wound up having to leave the resort...no easy task with bus only and so far from the rest of everything...The great thing about Disney is that there really is something for everyones taste and bank account, but research (thanks anyway hubby) is Really important! Despite the "resort" debacles, we all had a fabulous time of making memories to last a lifetime. Unless I experienced it first hand, we would not have known. Oh, Id be remiss without saying that waking up with a giraffe out your sliding door was AMAZING, I love animals! But as an option, anyone can walk thru the resort and go to the view stations that are everywhere to see the same thing without paying the Deluxe Rate here...we were Off season and it was more than 300 a night before the Free upgrade...so, we would not return but glad we saw that,. did that. Pixie Dust to you and yours......

Reviews.Title: “Unique hotel. Really nice to try”
Reviews.Author: fivestarNewYork
Reviews.Content: We have been trying to book a room here for vacation for a few years, and felt it would only be worth it if we got the best animal view from our room. We didnt get the view we paid for upon arrival, which was really annoying( we booked Arusha and got Savannah) but the view was still pretty good- we saw giraffes at times, and one of the rooms had bunk beds(fun). We changed rooms when one of our party left, and got an Arusha view. Its very far away from the lobby-4th floor, but great for seeing the most animals. The rooms smelled a bit and were not that clean(gross)dusty and towels were put back up wet. I had to speak to the front desk and explain in many ways how I should get a refund of the difference in the room pricestimes 2 rooms times 2 days. I didn't take no for an answer, and she finally "realized" that I was owed the difference. However, I got nothing for the inconvenience of not getting the room I had booked and confirmed, or the inconvenience of moving the family in the middle of the trip. Other than that, its a very unique hotel. The decor is gorgeous, and the animal views are great. The restaurants serve some actual authentic African food in addition to the typical Disney junk food.Great pools too.There's a nice kid water playground at Kidani-great for a day away from the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Astounding”
Reviews.Author: LMNY
Reviews.Content: I have nothing but superlatives to lavish on the Jambo House in the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The entire experience is treated with the usual Disney attention to detail and creating a total experience. The lobby is spectacular, and worthy of dedicated exploration, not only for its design, but the African art collection as well. Our room was excellent, clean and amazingly quiet, considering that parenting now seems to exclude keeping small children from running down hallways and yelling, no matter what time of night, but, alas the good people of Disney cannot control that. But what is in their control they do marvelously. The service is sincere and dedicated without being phony or ingratiating. These "cast members" are a delight and truly seem to enjoy what they are doing. I was admiring a piece of art in the lobby and a gentleman who I assume was on the custodial staff stopped to talk to me about the piece. He was so genuinely excited about it, I couldn't help but warming to the moment. And there were an abundance of activities from movies at the pool in the evening, to talks about the wild animals on the grounds. And that is perhaps the most spectacular aspect of this magical hotel: a wide variety of beautiful animals roaming freely on the property; zebras, ostrich, large horn African cattle. I can honestly say that it was worth the price of admission when on our first night as I lay down to fall asleep, I could literally look out of the window and see a sleeping giraffe. If you love nature and wild life, especially with the African theme, then spending the extra money for a room that views the grounds is extremely rewarding. I cannot imagine this experience anywhere outside of Africa. On a more traditional note, the pool and other facilities were top notch, as well. Returning from the various parks each day was made even more memorable by the wondrous environs of the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I have stayed at Disney before, but I should I return - and it is likely I will - I cannot envision staying at another property. Simply amazing. Thank you so much to each and every person at the Jambo house for making our stay so memorable. I cannot overstate how wonderful a spot this is.

Reviews.Title: “There are no words”
Reviews.Author: TrishN67
Reviews.Content: This is, by far, the most beautiful place I have ever stayed. The atmosphere, the smells, the music, the people. It will leave you breathless. The lobby is gorgeous with its warrior shield chandeliers hanging from high ceilings and it's authentic head dress. The artwork and sculptures. The enormous fireplace. The People who greet you with a smile and make you feel like you have come home...and the food is to die for. Boma is not to be overlooked. The buffet is amazing with so many choices. For finer dining there is Jiko also excellant food, just a little more upscale with a dress code. The pool is incredible. Free form with a zero entry and water slide. surrounded by palm trees and plant life. If you wander the grounds you will see giraffes and gazelles. Wildebeests, ostriches, and many other native african wildlife. You dont even have to leave the room to see this, just step out onto the balcony of most rooms and be amazed. The rooms themselves are roomy and themed with most amenities needed to be comfortable during your stay. Please, if you ever have the opportunity, the Animal Kingdom Lodge is soooooo worth money.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: coachreyes55
Reviews.Content: I spent my spring break in the Animal Kingdom Lodge with my wife and teenage children ages 15 and 14. I can not express how much we enjoyed our stay here. This is our third trip to Disney and we have moved up from the All Star Sports Resort and Wildnerness Campsite to the AKL. Although the listed check in time is 3:00 we arrived at 1:00 and our room was available and ready. The lobby is absolutely beautiful and we were quite amazed when we walked out into our balcony and observed the giraffes, zebras, ostriches, etc. Among the many benefits to staying on the property was the bus transportation, the "Magic" hours afforded to guests and the dining plan. The buses run frequently from the property to each park and we never waited longer than 20 minutes for a bus. The Mara is the fast casual dining option available with the dining plan and we ate breakfast here and a late night dinner. The breakfast options included scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, biscuit, potatoes and a Mickey Mouse shaped waffle. Other meals available include a bacon cheesburger, chicken nugget meal, pizza and salads. They also have drinks available, desserts, muffins, snacks and fruit. We also recieved a mug upon check in and you can use it throughout your stay from 6 am until 11:30 pm. The only regret about my stay was not eating at The Boma restaurant. I recommend that you make dining reservations as soon as you make your plans to visit WDW. We did enjoy a character breakfast at the Tusker House in Animal Kingdom with Donald Duck, Daisy, Mickey and Goofy. We also had a character dinner at The Crystal Palace in The Magic Kingdom with Pooh and friends. Tigger was a big hit with everyone. The Animal Kingdom Lodge provided us a tremendous vacation and plenty of memories of WDW.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Disney plus Animals”
Reviews.Author: JPBODEN
Reviews.Content: To start arriving from the UK staying in a Disney Resort what a breeze. Come off the plane and into arrvial when over to Disney Transport Reception (little hard to find but not to bad). Had to wait for a coach however when arrived lugage loaded then strainght to resort. Wow what a resort not a big as some of the other resorts near Hollywood studios however what a venue with African animals in the back garden. The family rooms are large and lots of space bunk bed for the children plus a large king size bed for a couple. The resort has a good size meal area inside and a pool side bar outside with snacks. The pool is large with hot tubs dotted around the outisde in tree shaded areas which are dim lit at night for those kid free nights. There is also in door kids areas snack bars and gym area for that early morning work out. For more money you can get a room which looks out onto the animal area however not sure how much time you will can spend on your room when there is that much to do. Transport to any area of Disney is available from the bus stops outside reception with addtion cab services available on request. Staff as with anywere in Disney will go to great lengths to complete any tasks you need or answer and questions. Over all this is a excellent resort if you like something different which is a little out of the way from the main shopping and busy centre of Disney. In summary safari theme with a relaxing edge which is what most families are looking for after a day going around Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sonny77
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so awesome that I could spend days here without leaving. The lobby is the most gorgeous I have ever seen. The detail is beyond words; pictures do not do it justice. It has so much more character to it than any other Disney hotel, and I am a huge fan of all of them. You just feel like you've been transported to another world as soon as you arrive. The theme carries through every aspect of the hotel; nothing has been overlooked. My room was very nice and extremely clean. The pool area is beautiful as well; the landscaping is so lush, the pool huge, and the bar has a lot to offer. The dining is my favorite of any hotel in Disney. Jiko is one of the best dinners I've ever had, and Boma was great for breakfast. And the savannas are gorgeous. There are so many animals, and if you do not have a savanna view room there are plenty of viewing areas to see them. The only reason I rated it four stars instead of five was because my room was extremely inconvenient to get to. Once in my room I hated to run out to do anything because it was over a five minute walk just to the lobby. The hall just went on and on. If the hotel had those nice boat rides to the parks like some of the Magic Kingdom and Epcot resorts I'd never stay anywhere else. A lot of people complained about the transportation to the parks, but I had no problem with it. If you want the ultimate convenience you have to stay at an Epcot or MK resort. However, if you don't mind a 10 minute max bus ride, you'll have no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Couple Retreat”
Reviews.Author: Justin H
Reviews.Content: After having frequented Disney over the past few years, my wife and I chose to "step up" to a nicer hotel. With Animal Kingdom being one of our favorite parks, we decided it was a no-brainer to pick the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Let me begin by saying that we absolutely enjoyed our stay. The bed was very comfortable, the savannah view was absolutely wonderful, and the staff was very enjoyable. The hotel was themed perfectly with the main lobby being absolutely beautiful. The restaurants served a fairly nice variety, though lacked in "kid friendly" cuisine. We stuck to the quick serve location whenever we ate at the hotel. Everything else, however, was perfect during our stay. Bus stops were convenient and not all that packed, the gift stores were huge with snack options galore . . . My only true complaint was the pricing. For the amount of money we spent on our room, we could have easily stayed at one of Disney's other beautiful resorts with quite a bit left to spare for food/souvenirs. But, in the end, we were very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel Stay Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Mariel717
Reviews.Content: The hotel was grand as were the views of the Giraffes, Zebras, and Buffalo, etc! The people couldn't have been nicer and the food was amazing! We would return in a heartbeat! Worth the extra money!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!! Beautiful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dinahgail
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Jambo House. It was beautiful. Online check-in let us get through check in quickly. We had a savannah view and it was phenomenal. They've improved the wi-fi from the last time we visited. The animals were quite active and there were a lot of them. Boma was a bit pricey, but sooooo good. There were no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Susie D
Reviews.Content: I had a queen bed and bunk beds in my room. I found the queen bed to be uncomfortable. I prefer a pillow top mattress.

Reviews.Title: “One of a Kind”
Reviews.Author: vlfair
Reviews.Content: We are annual visitors to Disney World and usually stay at a moderate hotel. This time we decided to splurge a little and I am so glad we did! We booked a savannah view room with bunk beds. We arrived very late the first night and were given a room with a lovely view of the roof of the utility building. They could not move us that night but we were well taken care of the next morning and all of our belongings were moved to our new room for us while we were at the park. The staff was very understanding. The next morning we ate breakfast on the balcony and watched the giraffes and zebras feed. The kids were absolutely delighted and we almost couldn't get them in to get ready to hit the parks. We even saw a baby giraffe with mama. Obviously, the presence of animals can be hit and miss but there was always something outside of our room. The hotel itself is beautiful. The bunk bed rooms seemed a tad bit cramped but it was workable. Breakfast was easily available at Mara to eat in or take back to the room. Both check-in and check-out (including checking our luggage) was a breeze. I would say the only major downside to this hotel is the location and it can be quite a long bus ride to the parks. However that would not keep me from staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice! But a few little touch ups needed”
Reviews.Author: CharryM
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Animal Kingdom Lodge for a week and found it very enjoyable. We loved the theme and had a savannah view room. There aren't many places in this part of the world where you can sit on your hotel balcony watching zebras, giraffes, ostriches etc. It was lovely! Location I was a little worried about the location after reading some of the reviews. AKL is a bit further out than some of the other hotels. However there were absolutely no problems with the location. The buses were very reliable and it didn't take too long to get anywhere. We never waited too long for a bus to arrive. There really is no need for a car if you are planning to stay within Disney World. Room Our room was lovely, beautifully decorated and a good size. Yes...as many of the reviews state, rooms are dimly lit as is the whole hotel. This is for the sake of the animals, and of course their safety and wellbeing is more important than perfect lighting! It's not as if you can't see where you are going...it just isn't bright. My only complaint about the room is that I feel that in a hotel of this standard a dressing gown and a pair of slippers should be provided for each guest. I was surprised that there were none. However, we stayed at the Hard Rock at universal after leaving AKL and it was the same story there. Perhaps this is just the norm in the local area. Dining I have written a review about most of the restaurants so if you are interested you can have a look. To summarise I found Jiko and Sanna pleasant but a bit average. Boma provided a really nice breakfast buffet. The Mara is handy for drinks if you are hanging out by the pool. But the food? Don't bother. Very unpleasant fast food...complete rubbish! Front Desk/ Concierge service This was a hit or a miss. When we checked in the guy was very friendly and helpful, but also asked for things like phone numbers and email addresses. We had already given this info when we booked and just wanted to get to bed after flying 9 hours across the atlantic. Also, no help was provided when we were getting our luggage from the bus into the hotel for check in. At a hotel of this standard somebody should help you with your bags. A few days in I went to the concierge desk as I had a few questions. The woman I spoke to was unhelpful and extremely rude. She made it very clear that she had no interest in answering my questions, and I left feeling almost as clueless as I had before I spoke to her. To some of my questions she simply answered "I don't know" and she even shrugged on a few occasions. I asked which of the hotel restaurants was the best for vegetarian food. She shrugged and told me "you'll have to call in advance and and ask for a meal to be prepared because there are no vegetarian options at any of the restaurants." Later I discovered that not only did every restaurant have veggie options...Jiko had an entire veggie/vegan menu!!!! Not impressed. A few days later we went to front desk as there was an issue with a gift voucher which would not work. This turned out to be the fault of Disney UK, but the staff were very kind and helpful, and ended up crediting money to our account although it was not their fault. This great service helped make up for the concierge incident! When we left there was once again no help with luggage and and no help getting a taxi. We were ignored by the large number of staff standing outside the entrance, who are responsible for organising taxis, buses, cars etc. It will seem that this review is a bit of a moan!! Don't get me wrong...our experience at AKL was very good! But there were just too many little imperfections, and service was not always up to Disney standards. I'm not sure if I would stay here again, simply because there are so many Disney hotels waiting to be tried out!! I would recommend this place though...especially for animal lovers!!

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from Disney”
Reviews.Author: SeaSaltTraveler
Reviews.Content: While the place sounds great on paper, the grounds look dated and in need of repair. Our room was old and dingy and smelled musty. The bed was horrible, the pillows flat. The room is definitely not worth the price paid. I've had much better at a Hampton Inn. Now the Jinko restaurant was quite good albeit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy beds”
Reviews.Author: Steve L
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for 5 nights starting 3-26 and it was a great place. My only complaint was the beds were very noisy. Both beds in out room were the same, the kids even complained. For the price that was unexceptable. Other than that it was Disney always great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravel09
Reviews.Content: We are DVC members but never stayed here before. It is my new favorite! Great vibe, beautiful lighting. So relaxing. Love the Savanah view. Always chsnging, one day I woke up to 4 giraffes outside my room! Loved Bomas too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time!”
Reviews.Author: troyt10
Reviews.Content: We just had a family vacation at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and we had a wonderful time. This is our 7th visit to disney world. We stayed in Jambo House and we just loved it. I had read some reviews and I have to say that I was nervous after reading some reviews. But, I always keep an open mind. We had a beautiful view of the savannah! It was amazing! Every day we would wake up and see the animals, it was just something to see! It was so worth it! The staff was always so helpful, and any time we needed anything we never had to wait long at all. The food at the hotel was good, no complaints at all!

Reviews.Title: “Resort has everything, plus some”
Reviews.Author: Meagan S
Reviews.Content: I just got back from staying here and again it was wonderful. Speedy checkin, thanks to the online pre check in option. The room was big with a good view of multiple animals. My room had two queen beds. Last time I had one bed and one set of bunks. There was a fridge and coffee pot. everything throughout the resort was spotless. It is very quite at night. Their restaurant Jiko was superb. The cafeteria, I believe it's name is Mara, was also very good. You must try the Zebra dessert at Mara.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, average accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: RobertEY
Reviews.Content: The check-in experience was the best I have ever had. After the attentive bellman and valets took our baggage and car we were escorted to the front desk where there was a person waiting to help us check in. No lines or delays and we checked in at 9:30 am although officially, check in is not till 3 pm. The woman at the front desk took our information and explained that we would be escorted by another man to the 6th floor club-level lounge, which we were. Upon arriving at the 6th floor we were handed over to another woman who explained the layout of the hotel and the various amenities. Amazing, 5-star service. The hotel is gorgeous. The architecture, landscaping, and so on are stunning. The grounds of the hotel are nice and there are various paths and lookout points where you may see various African animals roaming about. There are other nice areas to hang around including indoor and outdoor "fire pits" where you can warm up on a chilly night. The room however, was very small and very average in it's furnishings. It also had bunk beds in it which was annoying and took up a lot of space. It was just me and my wife staying there. With those bunk beds in the way we didn't even have room to put our bags without tripping over them. The view from the balcony was the selling point here, and we spent quite some time watching the giraffes, zebras, etc. come and go. Don't expect herds of animals out there though; you might see one or two at a time and they'll wander off and something new may appear. This is for patient animal-watchers. Overall, I felt it was very overpriced (over $500 for a Saturday night in this "standard room" with Arusha view.) I expected the room itself to be much nicer and certainly not so cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Yatch club excellent but Animal Kingdom lodge is a non service oriented hotel”
Reviews.Author: sharanyareddy
Reviews.Content: .We moved to Animal Kingdom from Yatch club where we thought we were in heaven and were treated with care .At the time of check out I had to profusely thank each and every cast member for the fabulous service. Disney truly made me feel special The standards of service disney stands by and for is lost at this resort where nobody cares for you as an individual. The staff is okay but the managers are indifferent and have an air of arragance and not hospitable. There was chinese food left in the refrigerator that had not been cleaned which stunk up the whole room when we opened the refrigerarator. The room was so dusty ( carpet) and I started wheezing so had to tell them to vacuum it again. My bed creeked every time I moved. .The lobby is beautiful. Savannah view nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Jambo House is Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: Brit_USA_Traveler
Reviews.Content: We were at the AKL from March 24-29. Had a Savannah view Club Room, close to lobby on the fourth floor. The lobby is amazing, the picture window looking out to the Savannah is spectacular. We loved having the facilities of the club level with breakfast every morning and snacks whenever we returned from a park. The room was very comfortable and to be able to see the animals from the balcony was great. We were just above the fire pit and sat there at night a couple of times. The pool is large and really nice, swam there twice before going to parks, or at night. Try the night goggles to see animals on the Savannah and definitely eat at Boma. Oh yes, and we did the sunrise safari.... Wonderful. Staff were great and I can't imagine staying at a different Disney property now. Did not want to leave, but the Magical Express package made checking our luggage at the hotel a breeze and took all the hassle out of going through an airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Amazing Service, Decent Food, Disney Does it Again!!”
Reviews.Author: JZilla78
Reviews.Content: Immaculate main lodge, great service and incredibly friendly staff at the Animal Kingdom. Average rooms were smaller and didn't provide much room to move other than to sleep and use the washroom. Savannah views were very nice but not as close to the Animals as you'd imagine and there were only a limited number of animals on the grounds. Difficult to find accommodations to suite parties of 10 and had to sit at separate tables on occasion. The buffets were average, the dining was better than average but not spectacular, everything was expensive but well worth the visit and a repeat trip in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, but kids liked the animals”
Reviews.Author: TheRamFam
Reviews.Content: This is the third time we've stayed on site at one of the Disney Deluxe resorts, and always feel the extra money is worth it for the full Disney experience. However, the Animal Kingdon was actually my least favourite of the Yacht Club (best), Grand Floridian (second) or Animal Kingdom (third). I found the decor dark and the rooms very small. This probably would have been fine, except that our "savannah" view room basically overlooked a dusty field. We were not on the savannah that had giraffes, zebras or ostriches - our had basically just a very few cattle and a few birds. My feelings aside, the kids really enjoyed the theme and my husband loved the african and indian influences in the cooking - the flatbreads at the counterservice poolside restaraunt were great and Boma, Jiko and Sanaa were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “A Disney Bonus!”
Reviews.Author: gadisneymom
Reviews.Content: We absolutely LOVED staying at Disney's Animal Kingdom Resort. We had an incredible view from our room AND our room was conveniently located to the front of the resort which made it perfect for getting to the bus station with our two small daughters. We had a nice shaded view from our balcony with the little river running below us which led to the pool. It was beautiful and relaxing to sit on the porch. The Cast Members at this resort were fabulous. They were willing to help and always had friendly smiles. The animals at the resort was a Disney Bonus! It was like being at a park within a resort! My family thoroughly enjoyed walking out to the balconies, watching the animals graze and literally walk within inches of the fence. We loved being able to spend time at the gorgeous pool and enjoyed watching the flamingos from the pool!!! It was a beautiful and very memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: smbrn
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge, Jambo House. It was fabulous and as everything with Disney, there was nothing that was done wrong! I had requested a Savannah view room and was disappointed on check in when we were told it was Pool view. But once I realized, we had a beautiful view of the pool and the Savannah was just beyond the pool and we could see that as well! It was just perfect! Everything very clean, spacious. It was a club level Studio, so we had a continental breakfast daily, snacks all day, wine, beer in the afternoon with more snacks and deserts and wine and Liquors in the evening. This was our first time at a Disney Property and I recommend it highly for so many reasons. The ease of using Disney Transportation and the ease of check in and check out! I was so impressed when we checked our luggage at our home airport and we never saw it until it was delivered to our room! And, when leaving, they printed our boarding passes, took our luggage and again never saw it until we arrived in our home airport. It was all just too easy!! Truly, truly, one of our best vacations ever!

Reviews.Title: “Dated, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: Peter P
Reviews.Content: Disneyworld is Los Vegas for short people. Like Vegas, the best experience (if that can be said) is close to the action. At Disneyworld, that means staying on the property. Jambo House is not among the great hotels of the world, but it is well done - if vintage. With two grandkids, we took a room overlooking a waterhole. It featured a queen-size bed and bunk beds. It was expensive and rather small. The tub/toilet area is dark and not particularly well vented. The best feature of the room is the little balcony where giraffe's, gazelle, cranes and other exotic animals could be seen at close hand. The kids loved it. While the room is not state-of-the-art, the staff is. As elsewhere in Disneyworld, any cast (i.e. staff) member seems ready to answer your most arcane questions. Disneyworld food is mediocre at best - with rare exception a "foodie free" zone. Our best meal was at Jiko restaurant in the hotel. The appetizers and protein with the entree was very well done. Regrettably, the sous chef had taken a double pass with the salt on both our entrees resulting in rice and vegetables that were inedible.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4Funnsun
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The staff here are all so helpful and wonderful. From the moment I arrived to when I left everything was perfect. Loved all the amenities and enjoyed my room and view. The location of this Disney resort is great, since after the day at the parks it is nice to come back and relax.

Reviews.Title: “If you are an animal lover, this is a must!”
Reviews.Author: Nori81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent a few days at Jambo House with our two college age kids. I asked for the Arusha Savannah view, which is what I would recommend, but we were much further from the reception area than we would have liked to be so I would suggest asking for a savannah view closer to the main lobby.
