The staff was courteous and professional and went above and beyond to make sure all of our needs were met. For some reason the "do not disturb" sign was taken 3 times from our door during our stay and housekeeping promptly brought us a new one each time we had to ask for a new one. We dined at all 3 restaurants in Jambo House and were pleased with the quality and variety of food available. Of course, Jiko was a phenomenal upscale dining experience (one of our favorites of the trip) and we had a wonderful and knowledgeable waiter who patiently answered all of our questions about the menu and gave us suggestions on his personal favorites. Before we left we were concerned about the transportation to the parks because AKL is a little removed from the rest of Disney World but we never had to wait more than 10 minutes for a bus throughout our entire stay (during the week of the 4th of July). The room was a little small (especially with all of our personal belongings crammed in it) but it was comfortable and quiet. I would definitely stay here again and I think it's a great hotel that offers something for everyone- just be sure to book a savanna room if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Cant beat Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: luzsbrain
Reviews.Content: Well this time around we traveled to Disney we stayed at Jambo house, its right next door to the Kidani Village. Upon arrival is was pouring buckets! They helped us empty the car and took our items up to our room for us which worked out great. We even got them to help us when we checked out. We had a one bedroom Condo.. In the living room there is a pull out couch and a chair, this Condo has just one bathroom. The 'bowl' is in a separate room but its still in the bathroom. Which means someone cant use the 'bowl' if there is someone in the shower. I would have thought that a 1 bedroom suite would have had two bathrooms - as a two bedroom has 3 bathrooms. There is a full kitchen which works great for keep costs down and having meals in the room instead of outside at the parks. And a separate bedroom with a queen bed, which is not a master bedroom. There is a washer and dryer which helps too. The bathroom has a double sink and a jacuzzi tub and its a little difficult to get into because it is pretty high, so one may have to sit on the side and throw your leg over. The bedroom and Living room has their own TVs and access to the outside deck. We had a pool view but you really couldn't tell since there are these rather large trees blocking the view of the pool. There is internet access, Free for DVC members but a fee for everyone else. We are amazed a how the sliding glass doors keep the sounds out of the rooms! At night they have been having a movie at the pool side and its pretty loud with the doors open but once they are closed its pretty quiet! You cant even hear anyone walking down the halls. I am impressed with that. The Jambo house itself its rather large. The buildings have 5 floors and a few 'wings', there is a large store at the main level and a lot of activities daily. Parking is a little far of a walk in Jambo house, when we were in Kidani Village the parking was below the building so its just an elevator ride down. This parking area is across the main entrance and down a little ways and no coverage from the sun. As DVC members they offer a towel exchange once every 3 days and a clean every 4 days. Without the DVC membership it would cost a lot more. It happens the week we stayed we never got a 'full clean' just a towel exchange. Kinda strange. We happened to have some dirty dishes and spoke with the front desk, they changed the dishes immediately for us. Of course everything is decked out in Animal Motif. There is even a sign when you leave the property that says... watch out for Poachers. Around certain areas of the building you can see the savannah. Do you need a room with view of it? Only if you really wanna see the animals daily but otherwise you can walk down the hall and see them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room...looooooooong walk”
Reviews.Author: 3inafam
Reviews.Content: This was our first family vacation at Disney World. Both my partner and I had been several times before, but this was the first time we were going to bring our daughter. First of all, let me tell you that the room was great! We chose the animal kingdom because it would be very kid friendly. We were right! Animals every morning right outside our window! (after the third morning of being woken at sunrise by strange bird calls, we were re-thinking the greatness) We were also upgraded from our standard queen, to a savanna view with bunk beds! Score! Now, for the not so good. While I love this hotel...the convenience of staying on property, and all the bells and whistles that go with it. This hotel is not for the faint of heart. So people with small children, or those who don't want to hike a mile from there room to the buses and vice verse everyday should probably pick somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AJMC791
Reviews.Content: This was our first holiday staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (previously stayed at Polynesian Village, Port Orleans) and we absolutely loved it. The pool was beautiful, the restaurants were all very interesting and delicious(though perhaps if we had been with very young kids, it would've been a challenge) and the rooms were not large, but certainly memorable due to the view of the savannah. Travel to the parks was not as bad as I had anticipated from some other reviews. The buses were efficient and frequent. The ride to the Magic Kingdom was the only one that was noticeably long. The hotel itself is just beautiful! We will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: christabKatyTexas
Reviews.Content: although its a bit out of the way to get to the parks it is so beautiful and so worth the stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience but rooms are much too small”
Reviews.Author: londonval
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great for the experience it provides. We loved seeing the animals from our room, the pool was very large, open until midnight and had a great water slide. The food was excellent - we ate at Sana - and the service is is always great - as you can expect from any Disney property. The hotel is very well organised and the staff only want to help out. Our 4 year old loved it as expected! In terms of the room it was very very small - we stayed in a standard savannah view - second floor. We had a great view of the animals - giraffes, antilopes, zebras etc. The room had two queen beds and there were three of us, my husband and my four year old. There was absolutely no space to put the clothes away or lay things out - it is the smallest hotel room i have ever stayed in. There is no door to separate the bathroom area to the rest of the room so we had one suitcase on a luggage rack in the sink area of the bathroom. We had three other suitcases and and there was not enough space to leave these open whilst being in the room. You have to open a suitcase, get what you want out of it and close it afterwards so it can lean vertically against a wall. The bedding is terrible as well, the pillows are not standard size, they are 2/3 of a standard size pillow, and the sheets are very very basic with very old blankets and worn out bedspreads. Very surprising standard - not at all what we expected. I have no idea how a family of four can manage in these standard rooms. Although we had a great time at Disney I couldn't wait to get out of the room after 2 days as it was too small. This hotel is great if you don't intend to spend any time in your room which is the case as everyone is off to Disney! Will try the Grand FLoridian or Contemporary Resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay here”
Reviews.Author: Kittygirl8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 18-23 and just loved it here. The lobby was absolutely beautiful. We were first giving a parking lot view but we got it upgraded to a savanah view for free. Our room was on the second floor ( rm 2267) which was actually on the first floor. I don't think there was rooms below us. This was great because we can see the animals better than being on a upper floor. We saw lots of giraffes which were my favorites. The mousekeeping was very good. Our room was cleaned up every day and coffee was refilled daily. We bought the Disney refillable cup which was $15, but worth it because you can refill it for free any time during your stay. Saves buying expensive drinks. Not much food selection at the Mara which is where we ate a couple of times. Did not eat at the buffet, too expensive as we did not have the dining plan. we liked this resort because it wasn't too big and everything was in close walking distance. Not too far to the bus stop and the gift shop, which was very nice. Buses ran pretty good, not more than 15 or 20 minute wait, sometimes even less. All in all we loved it here and were glad we chose to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: nialldinho
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in Sept 2010. I have been to Disney World many times but this was my girlfriend's first time. From checking in to checking out we had the most amazing time. Staying in a Disney property is like being in a different world and the Animal Kingdom Lodge even more so because of the wonderful savannah setting. Our room overlooked the Sunset savannah and every time we looked out the window there were various animals to look at. The room itself was big and comfortable with two double beds. The bathroom wasn't too big but there were two well-lit sinks outside it so it wasn't an issue. Housekeeping kept everything nice and clean and even left hand towels and facecloths in the shape of little animals which was a nice touch! The rest of the hotel is very well themed and there is plenty to see and do. The outdoor fire pits with rocking chairs were very nice after a long day in the parks. There were also plenty of lookout points around the hotel to get different views of the animals. The pool area was lovely too and there were a couple of hot tubs around it (one of which you could just about see the savannah from!). We were on the dining plan so tried to get our meals in the parks. However, on our first night we dined in Sanaa and the food and service was excellent. We also got a quick-service breakfast on our final day after we checked out which was good. Parking at the hotel was plentiful and we never had very far to walk. Bus service was also very good on the occasions that we used it. Laundry services were also very handy and it was safe enough to just leave your stuff in the machines and come back for it later on. Staff were very friendly and dealt with us efficiently whenever we needed them. Having stayed in a few Disney properties before (Contemporary, Yacht Club, All Star) and visited several others I would definitely put Animal Kingdom Lodge at the top of the list (although I would like to try Wilderness Lodge at some stage too!).

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel In All The World”
Reviews.Author: searchingamerica
Reviews.Content: If I had to pick one hotel as my favorite hotel in all the world, this would be it. We stayed here with our children in a king/bunkbed room with a Savannah view. It was awesome. The room was decorated beautifully. The public spaces at the hotel are all worth a visit, whether staying here or not. The food at the restaurant was great, especially the breakfast buffet. The staff was all "Disney friendly". But the best thing about the hotel was the view from the balcony. A bit of African safari, right here in Florida. The hotel is so great, you almost don't want to leave to go to the parks. My only complaint is the cost. Like all of Disney, the cost just keeps rising, and the rooms are getting priced out of affordabilty for most people. The rooms have gone up in price since we stayed there, so I do not know if we will be back anytime soon. Also, if staying there, do not fall for the line that the bellhops tell you about the animals being best viewed in the middle of the night. We fell for it the first night and all got up at 1:00 am to see them, only to discover that the animals are put up at night, so no animals. Score one for the help, and zero for the tourists. Still, we had a great time. Much better than the even more expensive Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: mrc209
Reviews.Content: My GF and I stayed here for 4 nights in May 2011. Our stay started off on the right foot with our room being ready for us as soon as we checked in at 10AM after an all night drive from PA (thank you online check in) We booked a standard view room and did not think the savannah view would have been worth it for a short stay when your main focus is the parks however as many others have said a pool view room is an $10 more a night and gives you a view of something other than the parking lot or valet stand. The resort itself was very impressive keeping with the african theme to every detail. Having previously only stayed at moderates (CS and CBR) I found the one-roof design of the resort to be much better and made it much easier to explore the resort and use its many offerings like the pool and three on-site restaurants. The Mara was a good QS the menus was mostly the same as you would find elsewhere. The pool is probably one of the best in Disney and easily accessible from most of the resort. As far as the buses we never has to wait very long for a bus and the ride times were 20mins to EPCOT area and 30-35 for MK. Return trips are always longer as all park buses stop at Kidani Village first (try to plan accordingly when choosing your seat.) If your bringing a car one advantage to AKL's location is the fact it is not a long drive to get off the property if you need a break. I would highly recommend AKL to any first time Deluxe resort guest as it provides mos of the features of the upper end deluxe's for marginally more than a moderate.

Reviews.Title: “Overall quite good”
Reviews.Author: jac_rant
Reviews.Content: Pros: Friendly Staff, great atmosphere and unique resort design, free transportation to resorts, great fitness center and pool, excellent food options with variety, beautiful grounds, and it's amazing to see the animals outside your window. Cons: Beds are a bit uncomfortable, over priced, internet isn't free which is absurd considering the price, outside lines are blocked and long distance is expensive, and the consierge's knowledge was a bit out of date which ran us astray a few times. Overall, it was a positive experience. With a few adjustments it could be a 5!

Reviews.Title: “Love it! We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: justducky1960
Reviews.Content: Wake up and see what animals are outside your balcony! We've stayed here twice and it's now our destination lodging when we go to Orlando. We love the atmosphere and Disney's attention to detail. The hotel is quite large but very welcoming. The staff are all very friendly and helpful. The pool is great for kids and there are choices for eating from quick/self service to an amazing buffet at Boma to a little more upscale dining - All on site! Staying in one of Disney's specialty hotels of course if more expensive, but we think it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge is a beautiful property but we did encounter some issues.”
Reviews.Author: CastleLeslie2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jambo House from 7/17 to 7/21. Most of our stay was pleasant and we enjoyed the beauty and ammenities the hotel had to offer. most notably, the pool, the lobby, the food, and the grounds, The issues we encountered are as follows: 1. There was a water issue in our room which caused the rug to become wet and resulted in a somewhat musty smell. When management was informed, they sent maintenance to the room with a dehumidifier . Management never addressed the issue that some of our luggage and clothes were drenched and the fact that the room still had the smell of a musty basement. At the prices they charge, I was not happy with the situtation and do not feel management did enough to rectify the situation. 2. On a nightly basis, a movie is shown at the pool which is very crowded with many children . During this time, a father and son felt is was appropriate to have a long toss football catch in the pool. The distance of this catch probably was the distance of 30-40% of the width of the pool. On several occasions, one of the recipients would miss there intended target and the ball would hit someone or splash someone. I witnessed 2 small children get hit. If the child was hit in the face, a broken nose would have resulted. After the ball almost hit my young daughter while she was watching the movie, I confronted the participants. At this time, the lifeguards finally put an end to the catch. It seemed like the lifeguards were just wating until someone got hurt before taking the appropriate action.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to relax”
Reviews.Author: Shawen44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night 2 days. Hall is impressive and service is very good. The room was kind of dark, but as soon as all lights are turned on it's fine. Kids loved the swimming pool and games. Ok here is my thing... although the hotel was super nice and super relaxing, I am not sure it's worth the extra $$$. We stayed in a moderate last year and it was as good as this one at half the price! I think it is more about "name" than anything else. Parks were super close because we would drive oursleves. When you stay at Disney you get complementary service to parks but some forget that you also get the car pass that gives you complimentary PARKING @ the parks. This we have discovered to be a LOT better than the buses! Less crowded and super quick. Much better than standing at midnight in those long lines to board a bus with kids in arms and bags at hand! Back to the hotel... well, the showers at pools bathrooms were even better than those in the rooms! Loved them! lol Beds were comfortable, but I must admit that I had to call room service to switch both blankets (the one between sheets & comforter) because it had hair. Not one hair, many hairs! The room also had a strong cleaning chemical smell. I didn't ask to be switched because my 6yr old was already asleep and it would've been an ordeal for us. The Mara was as good as all of the other Disney hotels's quick service restaurants. The noise from the other room did not bother us, but it was funny stepping out to the balcony and having the neighbor's voices right next to us. Listen, it may be a nice hotel to go to, but I just don't see the point of paying so much for it. We enjoyed it, kids loved it and that's it. Do not think we will stay there again. Will continue to keep looking for the Disney hotel that steals our hearts.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Terrible Beds”
Reviews.Author: spursone
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge for 5 nights following a cruise. This is a beautiful hotel with great views of animals out your balcony. The rooms with views of the animals cost more but are definitely worth the cost. The hotel is typical Disney, very nice but a bit small. Our major complaint about the hotel was the beds. Probably the most uncomfortable beds we have ever attempted to sleep on. Very hard and stiff. Each of us woke every morning with sore backs and legs. Service at the hotel was very good and friendly. The two restaurants were also very good and come with an African flair. Jiko is the full service restaurant. The food was incredible! Probably the best fish I have ever eaten. The other restaurant was a buffet. Also very good food. The buffet was very crowded and you should make a reservation for the nights you want to eat there or you will have to wait. There is also a quick service restaurant where you can grab pastries or eggs and bacon in the morning. This restaurant is also very good and the coffee is incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to go Back”
Reviews.Author: beckyfromtennessee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Kidani Village and were amazed. As you walk past the lobby toward you room, you see giraffes and other animals. The rooms are a little dark in keeping with the African theme, but they are very nice--Kidani just opened a year ago. The rooms are large and set up very well. Everything was in perfect working order. The hallways are very long and if you have a car it is best to park under the building. The pool is small but nice and you can use the one at the main Animal Kingdom Lodge buidling. Throughout the day workers from Africa appear throughout the resort to tell about their homeland. There were games at the pool for several hours each day. Some people say Animal Kingdom is too far from the theme parks but we did not see a noticeable difference. Bus service to all the parks was great. We loved our stay and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A special holiday in a special place”
Reviews.Author: AngelPawsCardiff
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom for two weeks in August 2010. We'd chosen it specifically because it offered bunk beds, which very few Disney hotels do, as our girls are now so far apart in age, they have gone beyond sharing a bed, however large or comfortable. The hotel was lovely - the decor was fantastically themed, and everything else was as you'd expect from a hotel with this rating. The stay wasn't totally trouble free, however! About a week before we travelled, I rang the hotel to check that my request for a room with bunk beds, which I'd made with Virgin, had been noted. It hadn't, so the very helpful lady in Customer Relations I spoke to assured me that we would have a family room with bunk beds. On arrival, we were taken to a beautifully appointed room with a fantastic savannah view (which we'd booked) with - you're guessed it - two queen size beds! One complaining telephone call and about hour later, we were moved to another equally lovely room, WITH bunk beds! Result! The restaurants were excellent. Boma was fantastic - there was something even for the fussiest eater, though for dinner I'd recommend making a reservation. The breakfast buffet there was brilliant - try the jungle juice, it was delicious. Even the fast food restaurant, the Mara, was a step up from other fast food restaurants in Disney hotels. They've adopted the system that operates in many of the theme park restaurants - you order your food, and receive a buzzy machine that vibrates and makes a noise when your order is ready. It's much a better system because your food is hot when it arrives, and some people aren't eating whilst others are waiting for theirs. Not sure if that system is operating on all the other Disney hotels - if it isn't, it should be! The view of the animals (whether from the rooms or from the viewing areas) is a bonus, and my husband and I would have been more than pleased to sit with a glass of wine and just watch them wandering past the balcony, but our girls, of course, had other ideas! We had a lovely stay, and we were genuinely sad to leave at the end of the two weeks. We probably didn't make as much of the hotel as we could have - there were plenty of activities we didn't take part in, and parts of the complex we didn't explore, but we did what we wanted in very luxurious surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “My other half loved it I'm not so sure”
Reviews.Author: London_Tripper1
Reviews.Content: My partner chose this hotel as he wanted his Mom to get an authentic African experience as she is at an age when she is unlikely to be able to travel to Africa. He paid for her to have a Savannah view room. She liked it but it was a long hike from the centre of the hotel which was not ideal for her. I found the hotel rather dark and brooding but my other half loved that and having travelled in sub-saharan Africa he felt it was very authentic. So its horses for courses really but I would rather try out a different hotel next time. Excellent pool facilities. Boma restaurant is great but make sure you understand how the Disney Dining Plan works before you blow too many credits on their lovely breakfasts. Negatives for us - no ability to turn off the over-zealous air-conditioning in the bedrooms (an engineer would need to come to the room so you either have to have it completely off or at their setting) which disturbed our sleep. Business centre is hopeless - one out of date computer for a large hotel that we regularly had to queue for.

Reviews.Title: “magical experience”
Reviews.Author: geri1Glasgow
Reviews.Content: We returned after a two week break here just a few days ago. We have just had the most magical memorable holiday ever. This is the most amazing hotel, if you want to have the best Disney experience then book this. our first experience on entering our savannah view room was two giraffes which made me cry. our son (8) was so excited also. the room was lovely and kept very clean, the cleaners also made little towel animals and a hammock for our sons teddies. we also got a lovely towel arrangement for our anniversary and a special message from minnie and mickey. the pool is lovely and there are always lifegaurds who are very attentive. the food in Mara is ok if a little same, same (fine for breakfast and quick snack). Boma is a buffet style and to a good standard (seafood soup, salmon for main and zebra domes for dessert are amazing), we ate at Jiko for our anniversary and this was one of the best restaurants i have ever eatin in, if not the best. the staff made us a beautiful card and had very good knowledge of the food and wine on offer. The hotel is full of interesting african artifacts and the staff are very willing to share their knowledge of the culture and animals. there is always something happening to take part in for your child and you. resort cups are a good investment it worked out at around $45 for three and we reckoned we had saved around $300 over the fortnight by just filling up twice a day and most days they were filled more often. we also did the dining plan and would recommend this as it saves a few hundred dollars also. the shuttle buses are great, as previously mentioned the AKL is further away from the parks and you can wait a while at times for the shuttle bus. always leave plenty of time for dinner reservations (around 90 mins). we were lucky to get a savannah view room, think this was as we checked in on 26th june and hotel wasn't fully booked the second week was busier. this was added bonus for us. the front desk staff are very helpful and great for recommendations for dinner etc. This was a truly amazing experience with absolutely no negatives at all. can't wait to go back! if you love the whole Disney magical experience this is the way to do it, it is expensive but so worth it x saving our pennies for the next time!

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place”
Reviews.Author: ScotiaNYJeff
Reviews.Content: I just got back from this resort late last week. We stayed on the 2nd floor about 4 rooms from the middle of the Arusha Savanna. I loved it. I am a pretty cheap person but I actually felt the view was worth it. You can get the same view from the Arusha Rock Firepit\Overlook but you can't sit on your balcony and eat dinner like I did. I did not care for the menus at the expensive restaurants but I thought the cafeteria restaurant was very good. The chicken pita was good. They also had a Cheese Flatbread pizza. That seemed sort of plain so I asked them to put grilled chicken, mushrooms, green\red sweet peppers and onions. They had to go to Boma to get some of those ingredients but they made it. It was really good and I am a picky eater partial to NY City pizza. The pool was only 3 ft or so deep but it is very nice looking and my kids thought it was fine. The entertainment staff around the pool was great. They made my very shy 12yr old want to play pool side games which never happens. There are 2 hot tubs that are under shade and a small water side. It also has a small playground. Lastly, the lobby is visually stunning. The also hold information stations during the day to learn about Africa. The employees that hosted these, as well as all the other employees, were very friendly and helpful. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: JesseWhite
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our Honeymoon. The hotel is the greatest African themed hotel in North America. We stayed in a savannah view room and the extra expense for this type of room is defiantly worth it. There is a plethora of activities to do at the hotel and at Kidani Village about five minutes away. The best restaurant in Walt Disney World is Sanaa at the Kidani Village next door! The pool is huge and even if it is “busy” you can find a place all your own to relax after a long day in the parks. Fridge in our room made it easy to keep breakfast food handy and get us out into the parks swiftly. The best place to spend a week on honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “We love AKL”
Reviews.Author: Gailieb
Reviews.Content: This trip review is way overdue. We stayed here in 2007 but I wanted to add this review to all the others I've contributed. Myself, my husband and our 2 kids stayed here in November of 2007. The whole intention of this trip was firstly to see Discovery Cove, then do DisneyWorld and SeaWorld. So I booked this hotel because we wanted to stay right in the DisneyWorld complex and it wasn't too far from Discovery Cove and SeaWorld. We loved this hotel. Firstly part of our luggage didn't arrive with us even tho we used the Disney Luggage option. The folks at the hotel did everything to find it - and did - at about 3:00 in the morning ! Which was fine, finally we got all our luggage. We ate at all the restaurants on side - we added on the dining option - and we enjoyed every meal we had on site - as well as the other choices we made at DisneyWorld. We loved our room which looked right out onto the Savannah, we had a queen bed and bunkbeds for the kids. The room was very comfortable, the bed as well. We would certainly stay at AKL again if we were to come back to do DisneyWorld.

Reviews.Title: “...has THE most outstanding restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: TeeEmm
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom lodge was a pleasant stay. Our room was a little small and surprisingly a bit basic considering the price. However it was clean and very comfy. Housekeeping did a great job. The actual hotel lobby and bar area was outstanding. The architecture and design was wonderful – and being able to see the animals roam freely was amazing. We totally fell in love with the AMAZING restaurant at the hotel called Jiko. Yes, it's pricey, but it's some of the best food we've had in a while, and we consider ourselves to be foodies. The Victoria Falls bar is friendly. The British lady who works there is super nice and we enjoyed chatting to her and the great service. It's wonderful to talk to all the people from different parts of Africa too. If you do stay there, make an effort to get chatting to the people who work there and find out where they're from – it's really worth it. It was fascinating to chat to women from Botswana and Swaziland. The whole Disney experience is really expensive, so you just have to grin and bear it and try not to think about how much everything is costing - otherwise you start feeling a bit miserable! There is a casual restaurant / cafeteria on the ground floor which was good for breakfast, snacks etc, but that was still quite pricey. The shuttle service to the parks was pretty good – but bear in mind that the Animal Kingdom Lodge is quite far out, so it takes a little while to get to places such as the Magic Kingom quickly. The massive pool and spa were great. The slide at the pool was a bit hit with our five year old. All in all a good stay. Our pockets are just more than a bit lighter now!

Reviews.Title: “Most impressive Disney hotel in all of Florida”
Reviews.Author: iGareth
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most impressive Disney hotels in all of Florida, the resort screams luxury and the savannah views are truly magical. The lobby area is magnificent and the rooms are surprisingly big. The lobby is on level 3, rooms on Levels 2 to 6 (?) with the fitness suite and restaurants on level 1. The pool is certainly big but not deep and they have 3 lifeguards on duty during pool hours, they truly keep a close eye on things. We did build the pool up in our heads in be bigger than it actually was based on what we have heard but it is ample for the size of the resort. The Mara (quick service) is clean and provides a reasonable selection however can be pricey (unless on DDP like we were). The resort mug can also be filled up here however it can only be filled up here meaning if your in your room you have a small walk to fill it up.... ideal for using around the pool however. Both restaurants are lovely but very different, one is a buffet and the other is signature dinning. We did the hotel resort guests only safari which included a massive selection of food from the signature restaurant with the chef introducing each meal, the Safari was close and personal but the meal really made is special. We found the hotel's corridors can get a little loud during the morning and after parking closing at night, people tend to pass your room speaking in full volume which can annoy slightly if your having a lazy night. Having a room as far along as possible will certainly help. While we don't have kids they appeared to have plenty of activities for them which appeared to play in to the african culture. The hotel staff are as you would expect, extremely friendly! The car park can get VERY busy so if you arrive back late you can expect to park right at the back, minor point really. Internet access was wired only and expensive. I think this is perhaps my only major criticism, not having free wifi access in any Disney hotel is plain dumb. We stayed at one of the cheapest hotels on iDrive in September 2009 and this even had free wifi! Disney NEED to resolve this at some point... as my only real down point you can imaging how much we love it hear! We had booked 'Old Key West' fro September 2011 however on arrival home we changed resort to AKL... just can't imaging staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: JPDelaware
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been to Disney several times but this time we decided to do it up the "right" way. After much research, including Trip Advisor reviews, we booked the Animal Kingdom Lodge and I have to say, in spite of a couple of critical reviews, we were not disappointed in any way. The Lodge itself was grand and quite honestly, we could have had a wonderful vacation just within the Lodge walls had it not been for the wonders of Disney's parks awaiting us. We had animals within view all day and all night. The room was clean and beautiful and the entire staff was extremely outgoing and helpful. Also, the breakfast buffet at Boma was wonderful. Only cautions: (1) be careful when you are getting off the bus that you are at the Lodge and not at the Villas because the stops are not announced and it is a bit of a pain to get back to the Lodge once you get off (they stop at the Villas before the Lodge) and (2) in the evening it's a bit tough to find things one might need, i.e. medicine, so I suppose the best thing is to bring everything you might possibly need if you're not planning on renting a car and we were not, (3) the Tusker House character breakfast is in the AK Park not at the Lodge :(

Reviews.Title: “We Love Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: cara1024
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here from March 3rd to March 9th this year. It was our second visit to this beautiful resort and we loved as much as the first time. We arrived at the hotel at 11 am and having done on line check in our room was ready with an upgrade to a Savannah View! It is a large hotel but no where near as bad as what some folks are writing here. Our room was at the end of Kudu Trail (room 4394) and it's nowhere near a half mile from the lobby. As a runner I am a pretty good judge of distance in quarter mile increments and it would be a stretch to say it was even that far. The rooms here are not huge but that's true of all Disney Resorts for the most part. They are comfortable and clean though. Mousekeeping does a great job, we left them a tip every morning. The pool at AKL is great too with a small water slide and a good sized hot tub set back out of the way of the crowds. It was a bit chilly when we were there but the pools are heated so we did get to swim a little. We ate at The Mara (counter service) a handful of times and enjoyed it. We didn't go to Boma this time but have been there twice in the past and as far as buffets go it's good. They have a dessert called Zebra Domes (which you can also get at the Mara) that are so delicious. The bar, Victoria Falls, is gorgeous and a great place to have a drink in the evening. We had no problems with buses the week we were there. The resort does feel out of the way but the longest ride is to the Magic Kingdom and it takes 18 minutes (I timed it twice) so it's not as remote as it seems. And talk about convenient to Animal Kingdom! That's about a 3 minute ride! I wish they would build a walkway like the one between the Epcot resorts, Hollywood Studios and Epcot itself. Maybe one day. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a resort we will definitely visit again someday!

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed expectations and didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: ajmuzz
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Walt Disney World and I wanted it to be special. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is beautiful and the service excellent. Before we booked, my husband was concerned that the place would smell like a zoo. It does not. We booked a standard room on the 3rd floor with a savanna view. It's not a large room, but the room isn't the reason we went to Disney, or chose the AKL.The lobby is breathtaking. We knew it was special as soon as we pulled in. The pool area is relaxing and beautiful. We toured around the other properties and none came close to setting the luxurious escape atmosphere of the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Some say it's too far away, but I don't think a 10 minute shuttle ride is too far to the parks. We want to go back and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best Disney experience”
Reviews.Author: rssej
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Kadani Resort part of the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Customer service at the front desk was terrible. We had to wait over 6 hours for our room to be ready and then another 2 hours for our luggage to be brought up to the room. They promised us a room by 4 PM (we arrived at 10 AM) but at 4 said no rooms were available. Finally after complaining they gave us a room. This hotel is enormous and we were a very very long way from the lobby. It took me 12 minutes to walk from my room to the lobby. The view from our windows of the Nature Preserve was a very narrow strip of grass. The only animals we saw from our balcony were antelope, wild pigs and cows. All the more exciting animals were kept near the lobby, 12 minutes from our room. The activity room for the kids was small and under staffed for such a large hotel. It could only accommodate about 20 people. The beds were comfortable including the sofa bed and the unit was clean when we finally got to it, however they only come back to offer service and clean towels once every 4 days. I had been looking forward to the Disney magic and this resort fell way short of my expectations. There was no magic here.

Reviews.Title: “Magical African Hotel in the Midst of Disney”
Reviews.Author: mlove17
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Animal Kindgom Lodge at least eight different times over the past ten years-- both at Jambo House, and more recently, Kidani Village. There is something about flying all day and then driving up, being greeted with "Welcome Home!" from the staff, and then stepping foot in the grandeur lobby listening to African Music and smelling spices from the restaurant below. I know that the AKL is a bit off from the rest of Disney parks, but really it's not that long of a drive. The longest drive we had was 15 minutes to Downtown Disney on the bus-- everything else is about 10 minutes or less. I have stayed in studio, 1 & 2 bedroom rooms here, and each one is unique and has full services to offer guests, including views of the animals and savannah from the balconies. It's incredibly refreshing to wake up with a cup of coffee in the mornings and see giraffes running around outside your room before you prepare to spend the day at the parks. These kinds of experiences are what Disney magic is all about. If you have a 1 - 2 bedroom villa and have your own rental car, there is a handy Winn-Dixie about 10 minutes away, as well as a Publix about the same distance in a different direction where you can fill up your kitchen with groceries. I'd advise against Disney's grocery stores because a) the selection is quite minimal and b) it's incredibly overpriced. My family and I ate breakfasts and dinners back in the room and it made the food on the trip much more affordable. The rooms are spacious and incredibly clean-- you would never know it's a nearly 10 year old hotel! All of the staff members are friendly; the Victoria Falls bar is beautiful and the pool is open 24 hours which was a blast in the evenings when it wasn't so crowded. I have never ate at Boma, Jiko or Sanaa, because in my mind they are too overpriced for what you get. However, for those who have splurged, I've heard that it's delicious. You can't go wrong if you can afford to eat at those restaurants. :) My husband's and my favorite thing to do was to walk out into the middle of the savannah at sunset, have a glass of wine, relax in the rocking chairs and watch the animals play at nightfall-- zebras, giraffes, okapis, ostriches, etc. It was incredibly magical and we felt so lucky to have shared those experiences. Disney really transports you away from the realities of everyday life! I have stayed at several properties in Disneyworld, and by far AKL is in my top three favorites. It's a must-stay place if you are planning on visiting Disneyworld more than once.

Reviews.Title: “best time at disney”
Reviews.Author: mbraz79
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a 1 bedroom villa. I loved the full kitchen, regular size fridge, dishwasher and most of all the free washer and dryer inside our villa. room was very clean. staff was very friendly. we have stayed at the kindini village 3 times. the outdoor pool and water park was a very big hit with everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and need renovation”
Reviews.Author: julianaguzman
Reviews.Content: We had a lot of expectation about this hotel, we got one of the suites with view to the savanha, and although from time to time you see the animals, is not worth for what yo pay. The rooms are really old and need an upgrade of beds, TV, linnen and duvets. We change to the Swan and Dolphin and for half of the price we got a bigger room, view and modern facilities. Forget about room service as you would have to wait for 20 minutes on the line.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort; poor customer service--two different trips.”
Reviews.Author: cckdisney
Reviews.Content: December 2010, I brought my daughter to AKL for a combined birthday celebration. Usually, we stayed at the value resorts, but we splurged for this trip since it was celebrating big birthdays for both of us. The resort itself is beautiful, relaxing and very large, and I loved viewing the animals. However, as mentioned by a previous reviewer, we found the front desk to be AWFUL during this trip at several times--particularly when checking in--and infact, I discussed the same with the front desk manager, Tina, who offered me a one-day park pass as consolation and listened to me with concern. (I also expressed my concerns to Disney in an online survey afterwards, to which I received no response.) Just last week (June 21) I returned to this resort with my boyfriend, who had never been to a Disney resort before. Six months since my last trip and nothing about the front desk had changed!! The woman (I will omit her name) standing behind the young man checking us in actually looked bored and/or irritated the entire time we were in line and checking in (about 25 minutes) and it was hard NOT to say something to her about her expression. The man checking us in NEVER smiled either! Now I do not work in customer service for a living, but I know that you should at least SMILE at the customers as they arrive and make them feel welcome! The first time I hoped it was a fluke, but after this second trip, I am not so sure. The other place that I found the workers to be dreary at best, was Mara, the cafeteria. On both stays, only ONE worker smiled at us when ordering or paying for the meals. I would rank every other aspect of this resort as outstanding--the theming, lobby, views, animals, food and the savannah rooms. But I seriously suggest that Disney retrain or refocus the AKL front desk on making a much better initial impression for this resort. One other tip--we took a walk to the new Kidani Village. Their new restaurant, Sanaa, was great and offers an incredible view of the savannah while you eat! Afterwards, we walked out on an extension hear the restaurant that basically sits inside the savannah and got a much better view of the animals than anywhere at AKL. We watched the mother and baby giraffe, ostriches and a group of zebras running around for an hour. A young lady guide (smiling AND helpful) also discussed their behaviors that we were witnessing and made the experience even more interesting! Highly recommend visiting this resort, even just for a meal and/or the animal views.

Reviews.Title: “On safari, without leaving the States.”
Reviews.Author: ermalu
Reviews.Content: This is one of our family's all time favorite spots to stay, even if only for one night. From the moment you arrive, you are transported to another place in this world. The lighting is dim and calming. If you want to get lost in a rocking chair to unwind, try the fire pits (indoor and outdoor). Unbelievable artisan craftsmanship is everywhere (every room's door has its own unique carved wood panel). But the best part of the whole experience for us is the savanna that is just outside your balcony. Throughout the day, animals indigenous to Africa wander in and out of the savanna. Even if you don't have a room facing the savanna, there are public spaces that you can go to view these beautiful creatures. (There's nothing like having your breakfast on the balcony, as a giraffe has his morning treat just feet away!) There is so much for kids to do, from swimming in the enormous pool, to playing on the playground, to speaking with the savanna guides about the animals or their home country, to decorating their own animal cookie in the restaurant (one of the many kids programs). It's the perfect place to unwind if you need a break from the Disney Parks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Concept... No Execution”
Reviews.Author: kenhsiang
Reviews.Content: It's supposed to be like staying in Kenya next to the migrating animals. But, it was more like waiting next to your window for an animal... any animal. Check-in was painfully stupid as one desk worker tried to process a line of people at Midnight. After 30 minutes of waiting, I had to ask whether there were more employees who could assist and out pops 2 more people. Did I really have to ask for this to happen? What were those people doing back there? Parking is so painfully expensive but without a car you are left to pay captive rates for every overrated / over-priced meal. And, even though you are staying at the Animal Kingdom, you still can't get there without taking a shuttle. So, with a family of 4, we were stuck through 6 Days of captivity in Disney's metropolis of parks. Buses take you to other Disney destinations. But, it's not like Anaheim where you drive a block or two and you can get regular food. Good times at the parks. The kids loved it so I guess that's the point. But, there really isn't much here for the adults. The hotel wasn't bad but it wasn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place with surprisingly crummy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: maziars27
Reviews.Content: My husband and his family (all 12 of us) stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge JAMBO House from June 4 - June 12 2011. Having never been to Disney before, I was very excited. Here is the breakdown: Lobby : Awesome! Breathtaking welcome. Plenty of seating for when you are waiting for others, TV's built into the furniture - which you wouldn't notice right away. Big open space, high high ceiling, intricate detail... good start. Rooms: We stayed in one of the Vacation Club suites which held all 12 of us comfortably. With 3 bedrooms, four bathrooms, a full swanky kitchen equipped with all the necessities. It also boasted 3 large balconies (which you could only use for a few minutes at a time because of the giant wasps who have made their home there as well) There was a pool table and an impressive solid wood dining table that comfortably sat everyone at once. Food: Meh. Really that sums it up. On our first night we all tried something different I had the double chicken dinner (counter service at The Mara). It was really just edible. Pool: Beautiful! Good Size. You never felt like there wasn't room. While it could take a minute to find a lounge chair - you will find one. There's a bar right beside the pool - so if you want to hang out, watch the game, catch a drink.. you can. The drinks however are - i guess what you'd expect from Disney - EXPENSIVE. For a whopping $10 i got a pina colada - which i can not guarantee even had alcohol in it. Extras: I don't have any children but other aspects of the Resort that I checked out were the Simba's Room (looked like a play room for kids - daycare maybe?) Arcade, and at the pool a nice big slide (which I did try a few times!) Customer Service: Ok now for the part the really disappointed me... Customer Service. I come from a customer service centric business to begin with... so my standards are already up there. Then you think Disney... Customer Service Leaders in the industry. Rumor had it - you couldn't find a miserable employee.... Well to set the record straight... I found them. At the Jambo House, Animal Kingdom Lodge. Quick Summary: It begins with our very first stop - check in. We waited in line.... and waited... and waited... while other people all around us(in other lines ie Consierge) were serviced and we were ignored. Hmmm. interesting I thought. We physically moved our selves and luggage to another line (not designated to check in) so we could get some service. Consierge. Multilple frustrations with these folks. First... very short... and unfriendly. The funny thing is every time you go up to the counter they say "Welcome Home" have you ever heard the expression "it's not what you say it's how you say it" ? Their tone , coupled with their board expression said "i'm saying this because I have to". Anyway - to keep this short I had to visit these folks four times because I kept getting the runaround. I've never been told "We can't do that" or "who told you that" or "if that's what tickets told you go see them". No ownership and certainly no desire to actually help. We wanted to make dinner reservations at a restaurant in epcot where you could see the fireworks... we were given Bistro De Paris (great food) but absolutely NO view of the fireworks. We had to leave our dinners and the restaurant to go see the fireworks and then return. This would be ok... if the expectation wasn't already set for "the best seat in the house". Crappy service, a giant lack of knowledge on how things work and zero commitment to make our experience a great one. Very disappointed here. Good thing Disney as a whole had a ton to offer in other ways and other people....

Reviews.Title: “Love the theme of this Disney hotel.”
Reviews.Author: KLfromMCO
Reviews.Content: The lodge is great. The rooms are nice and the main areas are well kept. As usual with Disney, there's a consistent theme throughout the property down to the smallest details. We found that the food was pretty good on premises. We really liked Sanaa Restaurant at Kidana Village. Great views of the animals while you dine on tasty and affordable resort food. The pool at both properties were very nice. The pool at Animal Kingdom Lodge is big enough to accommodate kids of all ages. The slide was very popular with our daughter. It also had a hot tub, a pool for small children as well as an outdoor playground. Lots of places for kids - both young and older - to play and explore. We enjoyed the views of the animals from around the property. Our only complaint was that we ended up in one of the hotel rooms that had no view. Our balcony looked out onto a large roof whereas the others in our party had views of the animals. The hotel staff was up to Disney standards and was helpful and accommodating. We enjoyed our stay and look forward to a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bendingmirrors
Reviews.Content: This was a great trip from start to finish. Animal Kingdom Lodge was one of the highlights. Although the rooms are quite pricey (and a fair way out from the other theme parks) it more than makes up for it with friendly staff, wonderful outlooks over their 'savanna' and comfortable rooms. The only gripe I had was how long it took to get to the other Disney theme parks, but seeing as you get free transport around all the parks it wasn't that much of a gripe. Next time we would definitely pay for the Disney Meal Plan, as it can get quite pricey, and having this prepaid would make a difference. Highly recommended, especially if you love animals :)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay overall”
Reviews.Author: brettystar
Reviews.Content: We visited Disney World to celebrate our 10th anniversary.I had done a lot of research on Disney hotels prior to deciding on the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We paid additional money and upgraded ourselves to a conceirge level room complete with a view overlooking the Savvana. The concierge level floor gave us access to a lounge where a free breakfast was served along with snacks all day long (including alcoholic beverages in the evening with dessert) and it also allowed us to purchase tickets to the early morning safari tour (this was well worth the money by the way). The concierge level also gave us access to the concierge who would plan our stay for us before we arrived. This service was excellent and I cannot speak highly enough of the concierge service. Check in was not the smoothest, whilst the cast member was very friendly she could not find our reservation for quite some time and did not tell us we needed to prepay the entire bill on arrival. One of the priveleges of staying on site is that you can use your room key to charge back to your account at any of the Disney properties or parks. After a moonlight swim I decided to make a purchase at the on site store but my card was not working. I was referred back to reception and told this was because our account was not paid in full. So I had to go back to my room and then back down to pay for the item and then pay the account in the morning. Fair enough. However when I tried to make a purchase later the next day elsewhere, again I was not allowed to. Another visit to reception and they promised it was now fixed. Not so, I would learn later that day. Finally on the third occasion it was fixed. We also got a recorded voicemail message on a couple of nights telling us that we were checking out tomorrow morning and that we could use express check out. This was always met with a 'sorry it is just a mistake' response from reception when we called them to say we were not checking out, but it was just annoying little things like this that made our holiday less relaxing. We had an issue losing our tv reception and we asked for this to be fixed whilst we were out. We got back later that night and this was not fixed. We got it fixed the next day but would have enjoyed watching tv that night after a tiring day in the park. Upon arrival there were two lovely gifts for our anniversary and my birthday. There were also some lovely chocolates in the room. The room is a wonderful size and the housekeeping was great (we always tip daily). It was also very special to see giraffe, wildebeest, zebra, buffalo and an array of birds outside our window every day. Dinner at JIKO (Onsite restaurant) was very nice. The menu in the self serve area was ordinary and limited but did the trick. It was relatively easy to get to and from all the parks using the Disney Transport System from this hotel. All in all a pleasant stay which would have been perfect if not for some minor incidents.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our return trip already !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: NittanyJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 8 nights in AKL Jambo House. We had a fantastic time!!! Our room was very clean and quite comfortable. Housekeeping took care of our every request. All cast memebers were very pleasant and always spoke to you in the hallways. It was a very friendly atmosphere. Cast members at the concierge desk were very knowledgeable about the surrounding area and suggested some very nice off grounds places to eat and shops to visit. The only negative comment is that the food on grounds was some what overpriced but it was good. It was quite relaxing to sit on the balcony and watch the animals graze. Definitely pay the extra bucks and get the savanna view and not the parking lot side of the building. It's worth it. This is the first time we stayed on grounds and all the extras made it so much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff but Bus Service needs Improvement”
Reviews.Author: JettRinkOwensboro
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The hotel was very nice, check in was pleasant, the room was clean and adequate size for a family of four. The only warning I would have to anyone visiting this hotel is the bus service which Disney provides was very slow and inconsistant. Average time to catch a bus and get to a park was 45 minutes. The longest wait and bus ride was from the magic kingdom which took 70 minutes. The shortage of buses caused the ride to be standing room only. I have previously stayed at this hotel and other Disney Resorts not having experienced this bus problem before. Overall I would recommend this hotel just be prepared for the wait at the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Great Adventure!!”
Reviews.Author: landzai
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my disney vacation and it was awesome living in the animal kingdom lodge. I'm 25 and I went there with my girlfriend for a week. The room is clean, the staff is friendly and the building is very beautiful. There are three restaurants in the hotel with a lot of good food. The Loddy is huge and it just feels very comfortable. I arrived at 1pm and I'm able to check in right away. I loved this hotel very much because this hotel is very speical. It is surrounded by trees and there's a lot of animals to see from your hotel room. The animals mostly come out at night because of the hot weather. The only problem is the room might be a little smaller than other hotels, but I only have two people so it really doesnt bother me much. The bus also takes longer to travel to magic kingdom and epcot (20 minutes), because they're pretty far away from each other. However, travelling to animal kingdom only takes you about 10 minutes. It wasnt an issue to me because I can walk and i dont have kids with me, but if you have older people or kids you might want to get them a wheelchair or a stroller for easier trasportation. The travelling isnt that bad because it has its own bus, so you dont have to share the bus with other resorts. My girlfriend did found a roach in the bathroom though, I think that it somehow crawled from the animal side into our room. I just flushed it into the toliet so it wasnt such a big deal. I personally think that it is a great hotel. I like the theme, the staff and the environment. But I'm sure not everybody like what I like. If an extra travelling time or a smaller room is going to be a huge issue for you, you might not like this hotel as much as i do.

Reviews.Title: “Probably would not so it again”
Reviews.Author: travelingmomofone
Reviews.Content: Just got back last night from a week at AKL Jambo house. 3 years ago we went and stayed at Pop Century and think I liked it better. We paid fir and got a pool view but really could not see the pool over the trees. The pool us great and my 10 yr old loved the slide. The rooms are small but enough room and storage for a family of 3. A few days into the trip mousekeeping stopped putting comforters back on the bed and left them in piles on the floor every day for the rest of the trip. They stopped picking up odds and ends around the room too. I left a daily tip thanking them. One day I left the tip and asked for more tissues, they took the tip left the note and NO tissue. This went on the rest of the trip. 3 days into the trip I found a GIANT cockroach in the bathroom that my husband had to kill. We ate at Jiko, it was very good. The Mara quick service was ok,not alot of choice but ok. The ladies working the pool bar were nice. The gift shop was good. I didn't hate it, just think such an expensive hotel should have better housekeeping and no roaches. We still had alot of fun just would probably stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Animal Kingdom Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: cwask
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL-Jambo House during the first week of June. We used the Online Check in system ten days before our arrival and it made our check in process extremely easy. It took us five minutes max to check in at the resort when we arrived. The only issue we had was with our room type. We had called the resort several months prior to our trip to request a king bed, this request was shown on our online reservation confirmation too. When we got to our room we had two queen beds instead. We called the front desk but there were no king rooms available – definitely frustrating since we had requested this so far in advance. We had a savanna view room which was well worth the extra money – being able to see giraffes and other animals from your window is amazing! Everyone seems to ask if the resort smells like animals...it doesn’t! They have a fire pit in the lobby so it smells like this African incense. The hotel is very large so be prepared to walk a ways to get to your room. The hotel itself is very clean and the décor is awesome. We spent our down time at the pool; there are always plenty of chairs no matter what time you get there. Its open 24/7 so take advantage of a relaxing night swim! There is a pool bar with the best fruity drinks; my fave was the pina colaVa. There are also two hot tubs which were nice. The restaurants are all very good (We didn’t try Jiko but it looked good) – the breakfast buffet at Boma was really good too. It had a good mix of traditional breakfast food and African styled food as well. We ordered room service and it was great every time. We took the bus over to Kidani Village to eat at Sanaa. This restaurant was AMAZING – it was our favorite of the whole trip, definitely go here if you can! The only complaint I have about this resort is the buses!!! AKL is pretty far away from everything (except Animal Kingdom Park) and the bus rides take a long time. We expected the bus rides to take a while but we didn’t expect to wait so long for a bus to even show up at the bus stop! Some nights we waited at least thirty minutes for the bus and by that time not everyone could fit on the bus because it was full (We took a taxi at this point) – If we were to stay at AKL again we would definitely rent a car and save ourselves time and aggravation. Parking is free at all Disney Parks and the Resort for guests staying on Disney property. Renting a car is easy enough, Alamo picks you up and drops you off at your resort. I wouldn’t let the bus situation deter you from staying at AKL – We loved the resort! It’s so unique I guarantee you’ll love it too!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, everything we could want and more.”
Reviews.Author: Bex111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge for 2 weeks and the end of May/beginning of June. We (myself, husband and 2 children aged 8 and 5) all had a fantastic time and couldn't fault the hotel. We were upgraded to a Savannah room upon check in, which was fabulous. We saw zebras, ostriches, giraffes, gazelles and antelope..the ostrich even laid an egg! As soon as we came back to the room each day, we would all go straight to the balcony to see what was out there. The room itself was a good size, we had 2 large double beds, small fridge, tv (with a fair range of channels). The room was cleaned every day to a high standard. The hotel itself is breathtaking. The attention to detail is great, with many african artifacts displayed. The lobby is really impressive also. We had booked the disney dining plan and during our stay we ate at Boma, the Mara and Sanaa (at the Kidani Village). All restaurants were lovely. The buffet selection at Boma for breakfast and dinner was huge with african inspired dishes and many other american dishes -something for everyone. My children can be quite fussy but they had no problems here. The Mara was great for a quick service meal and Sanaa lovely for a table service meal.. we had fab curries there. The pool at the hotel was great, especially for children. Towels are provided as are life jackets for the kids if they need them. The pool is also zero entry and has a lovely slide. There are also 2 spa pools which are fab. It was also lovely to walk around the grounds and view the animals on the savannah, the hotel guides were brilliant, really helpful and friendly, they had loads of useful info about the animals..my 8 year old had loads of questions for them. We hired a car during our stay so didnt really make use of the bus service..only once to downtown disney. But there seemed to be loads of buses arriving and leaving. All in all, we had an amazing time and would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - the Animals were a HUGE hit!”
Reviews.Author: DebVancouver
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge in the summer or 2010 and all three families had a great time. We were upgraded to a Savanah View and the kids loved it. Every morning different animals. The hotel was an easy bus ride to the various parks. The Lobby is more amazing in person than in the photos and the staff was great. Dave from Chicago at the front desk was very quick and full of energy. He did rub in that the Chicago Blackhawks won the Stanley Cup and knocked our team out the playoffs but that aside he was great! Have stayed at the Port Orleans in the past which was very nice but this was amazing - especially the animals! If you can afford the upgrade definately go for it!

Reviews.Title: “AKL is a beautiful property!”
Reviews.Author: kevster28
Reviews.Content: Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge is a lovely hotel. It was a great experience for our first-ever trip to WDW (2 parents and 1 teen). However, it wasn't without its faults. None were severe, but we'll likely stay somewhere else next time, for variety's sake, and to save money. Service was very fine. We appreciated the attentiveness and professionalism. However, I'm not sure our check-in cast member understood the dining plan very well, because she couldn't explain it to us very clearly. I'd appreciate having a better knowledge of it, overall - not just a AKL issue, clearly. The pool was clean and large. I'd prefer a little more "deep end" in it, but that's hardly a reason to complain. I did notice gravelly silt on the bottom of one of the hot tubs - we had to do a search-mission to find it. We had "coupons" for the arcade but had no idea how to redeem them. I was underwhelmed by the Savannah View room. It's OK though, because it was a free upgrade from a Pool View room, due to their ENTIRE Disney customer system being down when we arrived at 7:30 a.m. on Tuesday. They couldn't check us in, so we had temporary tickets all day and had to pay for food "manually" (and get it reimbursed later). Disney took care of us, but there was some extra effort and frustration involved. The buses took FOREVER to get to AKL. I suppose this is due to its location. My advice: if you see a bus at AKL that's headed for your desired park, do whatever you have to do to catch it. It could be 30-40 minutes before you see another one. Run, flag it down, whistle, whatever. This goes for return trips to AKL from the parks, too. Some friends built up Boma as the best place to eat in all of WDW. We saved it for our last evening at WDW, and all three of us were severely underwhelmed. I've had better hotel buffets in resorts in 3rd world countries. As much as we paid for WDW and their dining plan, I truly had higher expectations. The service was delightful. Our less-than-satisfaction was strictly from the food. We're taking this up with our friends, btw. I wish AKL, or WDW in general, did more for first-timers. We'll certainly go back, because the WDW experience is one-of-a-kind. However, we'll be better armed and educated. MAKE DINNER RESERVATIONS 2 MONTHS IN ADVANCE OF YOUR ARRIVAL. The other item I'll mention has nothing to do with AKL and refers more to a factor of WDW overall. You will run into some of the rudest, most inconsiderate people in the world who are guests of WDW. They'll run their strollers over you and into you, and they won't care. They'll push to get ahead of you in line, and they won't look back. More than the heat, more than the miles of walking each day, more than the waiting for buses, and more than the frustrations with not knowing some key details about WDW (as first-timers), the rude guests were my biggest complaint. I don't suppose there's anything WDW can do about it. The presence of these folks wasn't a huge surprise. Rather, it just stole some of the "magic" of the trip from me.

Reviews.Title: “extremely DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Prilemos
Reviews.Content: We were extremely DISAPPOINTED with the hotel room and room service ... when we arrived, we open the pack and play for my baby to sleep and was completely dirty with pee, DISGUSTING, we called and they brought another one that we couldn't open (yes, we have two children and we are used to open this kind of crib!)... my baby ended up sleeping in bed with us. The mattress of the bottom of the bed had no sheets and you could see it was all worn, the bed sheets were stained and the towels were very old. But the worst was the room service! On none of the days the hotel did not bother to make our beds or tidy the room, not once the quilt was put back in bed and one day a used towel was left on the floor and they didn't bother to removed the room service left over’s! We NEVER stayed at a hotel with this low level of service and quality ... the lobby and restaurants that are within sight of all are beautiful but the room was DISASTER and we pay around U$650 per night, which is a premium hotel rate in most places around the globe. We have pictures of this in case you would like to see!! Instead of making a fuss all I requested was a 4PM late check out. This was granted by the hotel, and I made sure to confirm this at the front desk when I left. Much to my surprise, when we received our credit card bill, we were charged a ½ days stay for leaving late!!! I then had to face the inconvenience of complaining to Disney’s financial department, and as a result a part (NOT ALL) of the charge was to be reversed, but almost 2 months on, it has not yet been done. Given the cost of my stay, my family and I should have left feeling like celebrities… but we didn’t. We left disappointed and the chances of returning to a Disney hotel or even Disney World are not appealing at all.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: jcassab
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous. You really feel you are in a true African lodge. The decoration and ambiance are terrific. Rooms are Ok in size and we found everything in order. The staff was helpful and willing to assist us. The fast food restaurant (Mara) was merely adequate. Food quality is not a strong suit for the Disney World resorts and parks. We didn't tried the other fancier restaurants at the property. Being able to watch the animals roam free outside your window is priceless. The only issues we didn't like is that there is no Wi-Fi available at the property (only at the sister location, Kidani Village) and that is a little bit further away from most of the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: TexasGirlie
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Disneyworld, and we stayed at the Wildnerness Lodge last time. While it was great to stay on Disney property, I wasn't sure if it was worth what we'd paid that time around. I decided to stay at AKL this time around, but only for 3 nights, just in case I felt the same way. The last 3 were at a Downtown Disney hotel. I wish I'd stayed at AKL for the whole trip! We had a bunk bed pool view room and it couldn't have been better. I decided to pass on the savannah view based on some of the reviews, plus we knew we could see animals if we really wanted to. Having them in view from our room wasn't a priority. The location turned out to be absolutely perfect. Took less than 2 minutes to get to the pool and outside to the bus waiting area. We discovered that if you just hopped down 5 quick steps in the stairwell, there was a door that led right out to that area. We rarely used the elevator to get anywhere. The room itself was very tastefully decorated, clean, and larger than what I was expecting. The only minor complaints I have are that the bed squeaked every time you moved. With me being a light sleeper, that made for not quite peaceful sleep. Also, every morning at around 6 am, I was awoken by, and could clearly hear the toilets flushing from adjacent rooms. Also, the a/c didn't seem to cool the room enough at night. But I was thrilled that it had a ceiling fan! I've always had trouble sleeping in hotel rooms because I'm so used to sleeping with one. The wait for the buses was tolerable, but why does it seem that no matter what park you're going to, that stop is the only one with a crowd??? The buses did get crowded and was standing room only at times. Ok, a little OT rant here, but chivalry appears to be dead, at least at Disney. I thought it was pathetic that there were women and children standing, meanwhile several able-bodied, seemingly healthy men sat in their seats and watched them hanging onto the rails, stumbling and trying to keep their balance during the ride. You may not want to give up your seat, but it's polite to at least offer. My husband gave up his seat each time to a woman, especially if she was holding a small child. I was actually bummed to check out 3 nights into our trip. Our other hotel was fine, but I missed the ambience of the AKL. The only sour note of our experience here would be that when we checked in, we were told that we'd been upgraded to a savannah view. While I understand, this may be considered an upgrade, I didn't like it at all. I specifically reserved a pool view because I like a pool view. Turns out they were short on pool view rooms and tried to stick us in a sunset savannah view room, which was a downgrade in my opinion. That room was not what I wanted. It looked like a view of dirt and was quite a walk from everything. I went back and told them that I really just wanted the room I'd reserved. We had to wait at the desk for 30 minutes while she went in the back to get us into a pool view room. Not a great way to start the vacation, but we got over it. If I return, I am definitely staying here again for the full duration of the trip!

Reviews.Title: “I liked it but did not love it”
Reviews.Author: catriotinct
Reviews.Content: I really did like AKL, but I feel it's very overpriced. The prices are just absurdly outrageous, but I thought that was because it's a "deluxe" resort. Well, it felt like a regular hotel room to me. Yes, viewing the animals makes it nice, but it's still not worth what they charge. We had problems at check-in, problems with internet connectivity and I did not care for the food. (My husband loved the food though.) It's kind of far from most of the attractions at WDW. I was shocked that there was only one pool and it was always crowded. If the room was priced at normal hotel room prices or maybe slightly higher, I would have thought it was spectacular. But at hundreds per night, I expect more.

Reviews.Title: “1 of Disney's best!”
Reviews.Author: Dizneyfreek
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, not too "Disney" for newbies, but enough of the famed experience that us Disney-freaks expect. It is set on the outskirts of the vast WDW resort property so it takes a fair bit longer to get to the parks, but the free Disney transportation is good so you won't be caught short. The surroundings are stunning, you must stay in a savannah view room and check off the animals you see on the provided info pack. Rooms are lovely, the pool areas are brilliant for young and older guests and the restaurants are perfect. Especially Jiko, the top end restaurant, a must for adults! This really is Disney at it's best! But it certainly isn't the cheapest!

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: RoadKing1966
Reviews.Content: The Lodge is beautiful, the rooms are great. We had booked a standard view room, but due to a error at check-in we were upgraded to a Savannah View Room. The animals that you see from your balcony are great. We only found 2 problems, (1). The staff at the quick serve area for meals could not get it together and were totally confused. (2). The wait times for buses which they say is 20 minutes is not correct. We spoke with a cast member and he told us that it was more like 40 minutes for bus pick ups and drop offs. Other than that you will love the Lodge. We had dinner at Jikos and it was some of the best food we have had at Disney. If you stay at the AK Lodge, definately try it. This was our second time staying at the AK Lodge and the two prblems we encountered we the same problems that ew encountered from the last visit also. Overall, you will love the Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “The good and the bad about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jen1970-11
Reviews.Content: First I am going to tell you about the good things: The hotel staff was amazing. They were very friendly.The inside of the hotel was beautiful. It was unique in its own way. Now let me tell you the bad. The room was overpriced. Do not pay for a savanna view because you rarely saw the animals. The rooms are small and overpriced. Trust me there is no thrills or highlights about this room to mention. The air conditioner did not keep the room cold. I’d called the third day into our stay . Someone came and looked at it but didn’t fix it. So, I’d had to call again the next day. Finally they fix it. They had to change a coil or something. So, that tells me that whomever looked at the air system really did not look. The last two night we had noisy neighbors. They woke us up in the middle of the night both nights.
