Had the weather been warmer, we would have used the outdoor patio viewing area just down the hallway. The only slight complaint we had the entire stay was the long wait we encountered checking out our luggage at the bell desk. We had requested the service before we left home--it was very convenient, but there was a long line the morning of our departure. Just remember your luggage may not arrive at the hotel when you do, so it you don't want to wait for it (they will deliver it directly to your room), bring what you need in a carry-on, check it at the bell desk, and head off for the park. By the time we had finished lunch, our luggage had already arrived. We used the online check-in service, told them our arrival would be noon, and when we checked in the room was ready. Disney makes it so easy to get to and from the airport, and the resort. Make use of all of the online services before you leave home.

Reviews.Title: “great service, clean, pure disney”
Reviews.Author: emages2212
Reviews.Content: Another trip and first at the animal kingdom. Service was great and everyone was friendly. I was able to see the change to the winter theme. I loved it! thanks !

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: yyhill99
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in, I knew we were going to enjoy our vacation. The lobby was absolutely gorgeous. There was no wait to check in, and the friendly staff upgraded us to a Savannah view room at no charge. They explained everything to us about our hotel and our vacation package and we were on our way in only about 15 minutes. Everything in the hotel was top notch. It was beautifully decorated from the lobby to the hallways and the rooms. The kids loved the bunk beds. And the view from our balcony was fantastic. We saw animals every morning, giraffes, zebras, and more right there everyday! The staff was wonderful and kept the hotel clean at all times. We dined at Boma and Mara, and the food was terrific. The gift shop had anything you could possibly need. Their pool area was beautiful, palm trees everywhere and a great slide for the kids. Also two hot tubs, which we really enjoyed. They also have a big arcade and playground area for the kids, but we were too busy to try those. We highly recommend this hotel and would definately stay there again, perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations...”
Reviews.Author: theartfultable
Reviews.Content: We visited Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge the week prior to Thanksgiving. I booked a standard room and when we arrived we were upgraded to a Savannah room with a view of the animals for no additional charge! Loved that! We opened the door to the room and the interior was nice not fabulous but the view was amazing! It was clean and roomy but we were only 3 people. We even opted to cancel our breakfast reservation the next morning and order room service to eat out on the balcony and take up the view of the 5 giraffes and wilderbeasts outside. When you enter the hotel the lobby is very nice and the view is magnificent! I was not expecting alot since I read all of the reviews, etc. It really did exceed our expectations... Sanaa's food was fantastic and if you are on the dining plan is only 1 point! The transportation was not a problem for us since we had our own car but I definitely could see it as a problem if you had to rely on the buses. The lodge is located far from everything but it seemed like all of the resorts were like that to us. We also stayed at Wilderness Resort the same week and loved the MK boat and lake view but the view at Animal Kingdom can not be beat! We would definitely stay again! The only downfall was the length of time it takes to walk from the lobby to your room ours was really far. The pool was also wonderful for kids with a small waterpark area as well and pool bar for the parents! Lifeguards were on the ball at all times... We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Adventure at WDW Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House”
Reviews.Author: amieswan
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night 7 day trip to WDW staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House. We traveled with our 4 year old son and 1 year old daughter. The parks can be quite stressful with children this age. Escaping to the Jambo House was a welcome retreat each day. The playground area was clean and offered a chance for the kids to get out thier excess energy after a lond day in the parks or first thing in the morning so that I could get ready in peace. The large pool was great and they baby pool was perfect for my baby. The hot tub was very relaxing but family friendly. (not for adults wanting privacy) Each morning we could see giraffe's and zebra's from our balcony which was a great surprise since I didn't pay for an upgraded view. All in all this was a perfect 1st visit to WDW for our family and I can't wait to go again. The food was great; the parks were fun and the hotel was a relaxing escape with beautiful grounds and exotic animals.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Perfect for our family (10 year old twin boys).”
Reviews.Author: laurantwins
Reviews.Content: When our boys were 6, we came to Disney for the first time and stayed at one of the value/All Star resorts. During that trip, we went to AKL to have dinner at Boma (delicious!). My husband and I decided then that for our next Disney trip we would stay at AKL. We just got back yesterday, and we loved Animal Kingdom Lodge. My top tips are as follows: 1. Spring for a room with a savanna view. We had giraffes, zebras, pelicans, big horned cattle and more right outside our balcony. My husband and I really enjoyed watching the animals every morning. 2. Get the dining plan, make your reservations early, and don't forget to eat at Boma for breakfast, dinner, or both. It is LOVELY to have all of your meals prepaid and not to worry about how much you're spending. 3. Get the Park Hopper tickets - we'd go to one park during the day for rides and another in the evening for dinner and the parade/fireworks. It was wonderful to come back to Animal Kingdom Lodge in the late afternoon to clean up and gear up for dinner. We'd hang out on the balcony, watch the animals, and never feel like we were wasting valuable Disney time by taking a break in our room. 4. Wake up early and get to the parks about 20-30 minutes before they open. Know which rides are on your Must Do list. Send someone from your group to get Fast Passes for one ride, then go wait in line for a different ride. Use fast passes for the big rides, and you will be able to ride everything. We are planning on a Disney Trip every four years, and we will definitely stay at Animal Kingdom Lodge again. The only downside I can think of it that it is a far walk from the rooms to the lobby, so it took me awhile to get down to the Mara for drink refills and back to the room. Honestly, I didn't mine the walk because the hotel is so beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable lodging at this theme lodge while visiting Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: lookin4luxury
Reviews.Content: The lodge was as advertized. Breathtaking lobby decor. Plenty of access to animal viewing without getting a room facing the Savannah (animal ranges). We even viewed animals using night vision equipment provided as a complementary experience at the Lodge with a naturalist assisting (9-9:30pm). Quality African furnishings in the room (refrig was included, no microwave) and just spacious enough considering we were at the parks most of the time. Queen sized beds vs. doubles found at moderate Disney resorts. We were a bit worried that the bus trips to the rest of Disney's properties would be lengthy but they were not (though we visited purposefully during low season). It was 5 min to Animal Kingdom, 15 min to Epcot and Hollywood Studies, 18 min to Magic Kingdom. We waited 10-15 min for buses and were never left to wait for another bus. Lines for buses seemed longer for other resorts than for this lodge. The pool was large enough but the slide seems to be more for the 6 and under crowd, not exactly thrilling. We used Simba's cubhouse for childcare one night. Our daughter cried when she had to leave because she was having so much fun. They serve them dinner (4-5 choices at check in)...~$11.50/hr. Boma restaurant served a comprehensive buffet introducing many African dishes (~$30/person or 1 dining plan table service credit). The breakfast buffet was lovely also (~$20/person or 1 dining plan table service credit). The hotel seemed deserted but staff said they were at 98% capacity. That's essentially what we are after.....feeling like you are the only one using the amenities. Food is expensive as it is throughout Disney...$2.75/20 oz soda or water at the machines. Full lunch for 4 was $45 in the carry out Mara restaurant or 4 quick serve credits. Very knowledgible concierge. Able to check bags and get boarding passes. Never stood in line in the lobby. Cons: Strangely creaky beds (though we travel with a white noise machine so were unaffected). TV defaults to a blaring Disney travel commercial every time it is turned on.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: moffica
Reviews.Content: I really cant say enough about this resort it is simply wonderful. We arrived mid-afternoon and the walk up to the hotel from the car park helps to build the atmosphere, the photos really dont do it justice. When you walk in the lobby it is simply stunning, we have stayed at the wilderness lodge before and i thought that was my favorite disney lobby, but the AKL lobby blew me away. We were booked in a pool view room (wasnt willing / afford to pay £1890 to upgrade). The check in was excellent, the lady who checked us in was everyhting you expect from disney, friendly and polite. Very informative about the resort and let us know everything we need to know. No mention of ugrades and being a shy englishman i didnt mention anything. She gave us our keys and directed us to the elevator. When we walked into our room, about a 5min walk from reception we were delighted. Clean and fresh everything we expect from a Disney deluxe resort. The magic then happened, i opened the balcony door and walked out to me met with Giraffe, Zebra, Ostritch and various othger birds and animals. We had been ugraded to a savannah view and what a view it was. Our savannah was always covered in animals no matter what time of the day it was. We spent alot of time sitting on our balcony looking over the savannah, the view alone is worth the money. We both agreed if we went back we would pay the extra for the savannah view, it truly does make for an amazing experience. Transport was generally good, although you are the furthest resort from most of the parks it never took more than 20mins to get anywhere and buses were very regular. Mousekeeping was excellent, towel animals left and always did an excellent job. All other staff we encountered were excellent and i enjoyed speaking to some of them about their African homelands. Pool area was very nice and clean as were the viewing areas. If you get the chance go to one of the viewing ares at night to look through the nightvision. Food options were good. I found Boma a little crouded and noisey all the time, but the food options were ok and i wouldnt complain about it, but as a couple I wouldnt go back. Jiko is fantastic and one of our favorite Disney restaurants and always try to eat their if we are in Florida whether visiting Disney or not. Mara is like all the counter service options at the deluxe resorts. Many choices and very convenient. Very good for a quick breakfast. All in all a fantastic stay. We like trying different resorts around Disney but it will be very difficult to go to another Disney resort, in fact i think the only way we will not be return to AKL is if the price goes up and its out of budget. Go and have a great time, dont worry about the negative reviews this resort is great.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; disappointed in the room”
Reviews.Author: LisaDubuque
Reviews.Content: My family stayed as the AKL in October. I thought it would be nice to spend a bit more to get a room with bunk beds and a pool view. The room itself was nice enough, but we paid for a pool view and got a room with a balcony where you had to stand up to even see the pool. Our balcony was on the 2nd floor, right above Simba clubhouse, so right outside our balcony, up to about chest level, was the awning for the clubhouse; all you could see when sitting down was the back of the awning. I thought that the hotel was beautiful, but our particular room was not what I expected. Room number was 2432. Also found some toys left over on the floor from the last guest. The cleanliness of the room did not impress me.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: whiskey19
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge - Jambo House for 2 weeks, and we were a little nervous after reading several reviews about the room size and people getting views of the parking lot. We needn't have worried. Our room was plenty big enough for 4 adults and our balcony overlooked the animal feeding area so we had views of the giraffs everyday (we were in room 2576). The beds very comfortable and there was enough space to fit 6 suitcases and there was a chest of drawers and a massive wardrobe so don't worry about taking too much. The restaurants Boma and Jiko are well worth visiting. Boma is especially good for breakfast. Jiko was our favourite meal the whole trip and if you go i reccomend the shortribs. The Mara is a quick service restaurant and the food is edible but not brilliant, although if you are on the dining plan the deserts are quite good and you get alot for 1 credit. The marketplace is also good for snacks and drinks. Transportation to the other parks is quick and the longest we had to wait for a bus was about 10 minutes and although it's the furthest hotel away from Magic Kingdom the bus ride still only took 15 - 20 minutes. All the buses drop you off outside the park entrance so no tram rides or long walks. On the way home from a park there will probably be a big queue for this hotel but if you can't get on one bus another one will be there in about 5 minutes. The only complaint about the hotel is that it's freezing when they turn on the air conditioning, you have to go outside just to warm up, other than that it is one of the best disney hotels i have ever stayed in and would reccomend it to everybody!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: TheBischels
Reviews.Content: We LOVE Disney, everything about it we have visited probably 50 times in the last 15 years and 4 in the last year and a half withour little boy. We typically stay at the moderate resorts because we spend most of our time at the parks. This time, for my birthday, we decided to upgrade to a deluxe resort via the bounce back program. This was the best choice we could have made. We stayed a total of 4 nights and I wish we could have stayed longer. Upon arrival there was no line to check in and the lady that checked us in was wonderful. She upgraded our room to Savanna view and I got roses for my birthday from them. Our room was at the end of one wing which wasn't a big deal for us. The bell service did take a little while which wouldn't have been a big deal but we had dinner reservations. The room was spectacular! A little smaller than the moderate resort rooms, but we figured that was due to the balcony and the queen sized beds as opposed to doubles. The view was on the back side but we had animals all the time morning and night which was wonderful for our little boy. The hotel has a whole host of activities for people of all ages. We participated in the drum parade and the cutural safari's, along with some other activities. We never even went to the parks because we had so much to do at the hotel. Dinning choices are limted because there are three full service restaurants on site and one quick service. The full service are pricey but it's Disney so we improvised. The staff is wonderful and the hotel is amazing. My little boy played drums with people from 5 different countries and they were super nice to him. There is so much to do that you need a whole week here. We will definitely return to AKL and we have already recommended it to all our family and friends. Don't listen to the reviews complaining about shuttle service and the hotel being spread out, that is Disney. Bring your patience and remember you are there to have fun so just relax and go with the flow.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: mxjust
Reviews.Content: I love Animal Kingdom Lodge. I always see people trying to save money by staying off the Disney Resorts and I think that the experience you have staying on the resort is priceless! AKL has so much to offer outside of a place to stay - I am actually thinking about returning and not even heading over the the Disney Theme Parks! They have a fabolous pool, tons of activities for the kids (and adults) and there are animals to see everywhere! The accommodations are great - we are definitely going again. The only downfall to this particular resort is the location - far from many of the parks but it has to be because of the animals. If you have small children and don't want to go park hoping I suggest this resort. My kids kept asking to go back to the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLIGHT OF DISNEY WORLD VACATION”
Reviews.Author: retiredteacher06-05
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge was the highlight of our trip. That is saying alot since it is in Disney World. We stayed in a savannah view room that had a balcony overlooking the savannah waterhole. We had called earlier requesting a good view of the animals. We were not disappointed. The warthogs and giraffes were so much fun to watch. We also saw Ankole Cattle, Antelope, Zebra, Kudu, Wildebeest and many birds. Be sure to ask about using the night vision binoculars! The room was spotless and roomy with two queens. Since it was slow season we received a bargain rate and the free Disney dining plan for restaurants throughout Disney World. We only ate at the Lodge for the buffet breakfast- a wonderful mix of African and American foods. The lobby is full of African artifacts- very interesting.

Reviews.Title: “Best trip yet”
Reviews.Author: pickflic
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fabulous 2 week vacation at AKL. We used our DVC membership for a two bedroom for our first week with my husband- daughter- son- niece- my father and stepmother. Then changed to the Concierge for our final week. Both rooms were extremely clean - and the staff both at check in and mousekeeping were very friendly. We met many staff from Africa and they were very pleasant and informative. The bus service here has improved and even though it is the furthest from the MK we did not have to wait more than 10 min at any one time. My father was extremely impressed with the resort but especially with the customer service and cleanliness wherever we went. Our waiter Hassan at Jiko made our dinner as did the incredible food. The bartenders both at the pool and above Boma were very friendly as was the staff at Boma. Our Concierge time was great and first rate service was given each and every time.I would not hesitate to recommend this resort to anyone and have done so many times. We can't wait to go back. Thanks to all at AKL it takes a great team to make this resort so special and you have accomplished this hands down. Mary Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: hrjtm
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a magical 8 days at this hotel in a Savannah room. The staff were friendly and attentive, the amenities were first class and we would highly recommend it. The only slight disappointment to me was boma, the buffet restaurant - I never like these eat as much as you like restaurants. the staff and quality if food in the pool bar/restaurant, were much better we found.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip- Beautiful Hotel- Disney does it right!”
Reviews.Author: chzhead2004
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, themes and amenities. We stayed during spring break, the NFL draft, and when the volcano erupted in Iceland. The food onsite is perfect, the check-in process is quick, the view is astounding. The only negatives that I can say- bear in mind, it was my 14th trip since 2001 to Disney- is that for the price, the rooms, for a deluxe, are smaller than a moderate resort for more money. And I have a bad reaction when mold is present and I did have that reaction in the room due to an overwhelming mold smell and feel. However, due to the amount of persons stuffed into the properties due to the overwhelming timeframe (see above), we could not move to another room. Jiko is the best restaurant on Disney property and the hotel is an overall beautiful and comfortable place to stay, especially on a child-free getaway to Disney when you don't want to rush around and really want to feel surrounded by Disney without so much mouse!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sept26
Reviews.Content: We all loved everything about this hotel even being woke up at7am by the sounds of animals

Reviews.Title: “We made the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: nbafamily
Reviews.Content: When you walk into the Animal Kingdom Lodge, it is like you have stepped right into Africa. There is this wonderful wood burning smell and its amazing. We had a room with a balcony and animals were just passing by us. AMAZING. Don't miss the story telling out on the patio in the rocking chairs! Make sure you have plenty of space on your digital camera cards, because there are so many photo opportunities. You will not regret staying here at all. I wish we could go back again & again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Relaxing Stay with All the Disney Extras”
Reviews.Author: redshoetraveler
Reviews.Content: We have been to WDW three previous times (2 x with kids and once without), and on this, our fourth trip we decided to splurge for our anniversary and see what all the "on property" hype was all about. It was great that they had a good disount program going while we were there, so we took advantage of the Room Only discount and added on the dining plan, which for us was worth it. Our savanna view room was still about $1900 for our 6 nights...more than we would have spent somewhere else, but we thought it was worth it this time. The service was top-notch. Everyone went above & beyond what was expected. The whole hotel is themed really well and is very warm and welcoming with all its decor and lighting. We thought the savanna view room was worth the extra money even though most of the animals were absent from our view in the morning. We had a view of the Arusha Savanna on the 3rd floor. There are a significant number of extra activities available...especially for kids. We took advantage of the night vision viewing, which was fun, and enjoyed a cultural drumming demonstration, but didn't participate in a lot of extra activities. We enjoyed all the "nook and cranny" seating available around the hotel. It seems like you can find a spot with rocking chairs or binocular or a nice fire pit hidden in many corners. The wings of the hotel are long and we were toward the end of one wing, but didn't find it a problem for us. For some, that walking would seem extra long at the end of a long day of theme parks. The bus system was usually quick and easy to use. We had one time when we had to wait about 40 mintues for a bus, but other than that, it was usually less than a 10 minute wait. We loved the Magical Express airport pickup and didn't have any problem with our luggage. It was another touch that just added to the ease of the vacation. Overall, we loved the hotel and would love to return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings, great views, it's "Disney"”
Reviews.Author: ButchandBetty
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a week's stay during Epcot's Food and Wine Festival at AKL-DVC in a two bedroom villa facing the savanna-Kidani Village. The rooms were big, beautifully decorated, full well-appointed kitchen and lovely big bathrooms. I have one complaint, there was totally inadequate lighting. All the lamps and fixtures had very low watt bulbs making it impossible to read at night or even in the afternoon. I had to sit on the balconey to have enough light to read even in the morning. We dined at BOMA, the buffet was wonderful, lots of tasty stuff. Shopping at Jambo House was good. The bus service to the other parks was good, staying at Kidani Village we rarely had to deal with full buses and they came on schedule. We most often stay at the Boardwalk and I love it there, the AKL was a great change and we enjoyed it as well but I missed being so close to Epcot and Illuminations every night. Our room was a loooonnng way from the pool so I didn't get to it although our kids and grandkids did go a couple times. I would stay there again and recommend it highly, even though I prefer the Boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “quiet refuge”
Reviews.Author: jgieske347
Reviews.Content: it is quiet, laid back and comfortable for us. our 3 yo grandson enjoys the animals from the balcony and the smallness of the Kidani pool..it is expensive, Its Disney. that being said I like that it isnt non stop excitement for us

Reviews.Title: “BEST VACATION EVER”
Reviews.Author: koltsmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at animal Kingdom Lodge for one week. We had a semiview room but there were ALWAYS animals out in front of our balcony. Staying on property was the best choice ever totally worth the money. The only issue I had with the hotel is that it spread out so it took forever to walk to our rooms. But that wasn't a huge issue. The shuttle back and forth around the property was great we never used our onw car the entire week. Will be going back here to stay GREAT GREAT GREAT Experience. LOVE DISNEY

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: kaykels
Reviews.Content: First of all, request a room near the pool or Mara. If you stay on the other side of the resort you could have a very long walk to the pool and food. If you get a good location you will absolutely love this resort. The Mara has great food for a quick grab. Boma is a buffet with African foods, as well as American classics and there is something for everybody, even my picky kids. Its out of this world !!! Try the zebra domes. The lobby is breath taking. There is so much to look at and so many nooks and crannies and places to sit and take it all in. The staff will educate you on every aspect of African history, animals, and artifacts. The pool is beautiful. it s a zero entry with a natural rock color. There are two very large hot tubs. Each evening there is a story teller around the fire pit. There are night vision glasses for viewing the animals at night. If you rent a car, and I highly suggest that you do (we go to Disney twice a year, every year and know the drill) you will love this location. Once you pull out of the parking make a right at the first intersection (Sheberth Rd.) Go about 1/2 mile and it runs into highway 192 where you will find every chain and fast food restaurant you could think of. We love this location. My hubby especially loves the Dunkin Donuts less than a mile away ! Super Target was close by as well. Whenever we go to Disney World, Animal Kingdom Lodge is our first choice ! I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Visit Animal Kingdom and you get the same experience”
Reviews.Author: DCbeachgirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for two nights and for the price I was not impressed. Yes, it has animals you can see out your window and yes we paid a ton of extra money to see the zebras and giraffes but overall the resort was not worth the price. If you have small children like we do, stay along the monorail (perhaps Polynesian or Grand Floridian). The first morning we waited at least an hour before a bus came to pick people up at the hotel to take them to Magic Kingdom. Each time the bus came it was already packed with people. I'm not sure but it must pick people up at Kidani Village before making it's way to Jambo House. Food and coffee were nothing to write home about. Atmosphere itself was rather nice to see but not worth the price we paid. Don't be surprised if they deny your request for a late check-out. When I called to ask for a late check-out they flat out denied it telling me that someone else in my section had already requested one and they could not grant me a second one. Check out was at 11 and I needed to check out at noon. I didn't find that the employees had good customer service skills or were very accomodating to guests.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing holiday”
Reviews.Author: tashcymru
Reviews.Content: We stayed using Disney vacation club in a studio accommodation on the 5th floor of the kudu trail which is at the rear right hand side of the property! At first I thought this would mean I wouldn't get to see any giraffes and zebras when i woke up and looked out from the balcony - but how wrong could I have been! They are. Free to roam as they please so we would often wake to up to 4 giraffes 3 zebras some ostrich even a few gazelle and other animals also - it was wonderful and my 2 1/2 year old son though that was amazing! This was defo worth having the savannah view room! So recommend that you do it if you can! Location wise it is a little further from a lot of the action of disney other than of course animal kingdom - but don't let that deter you from staying at this hotel! I didn't find the buses too difficult to use they can become a litte crowded T peak times throughout the day eg first thing in morning and after fireworks at night! But that is to be expected. Pool at the hotel is fantastic we thoroughly enjoyed using it and it was often busy even at night. Hotel restaurants were great - we ate both breakfast and dinner at BOMA and breakfast and lunch at The Mara. I cant comment on Jiko as we didn't dine there but it was often busy during dinner periods and looked quite popular. Overall this hotel is one of my favourite disney hotels that I've seen and I would return again and would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Animals out the Window make it all worthwhile!”
Reviews.Author: Bookman54
Reviews.Content: We went back to Animal Kingdom Lodge after a four year break, as my significant other woke up wanting to see the giraffes outside the window again. Overall, we really enjoyed it, especially the Sunrise Safari exclusive to the Concierge level. This is a large, large hotel, with long corridors and occasional waits at the Disney shuttle bus stop. Otherwise, while busy, you don't feel crowded. The lobby is spectacular, and the African art scattered throughout the hotel was quite interesting. The service was excellent, Disney's trademark, although it appeared to us that Disney is now waiting for a request to fulfill rather than being pro-active. Major initial problem, the 3rd floor (lobby-level) wheelchair room faced the central savannah at eye level with the observation area - not conducive to privacy or relaxing on the bed while viewing the animals. Our prior stay's wheelchair room on the Sunset savannah is now no longer considered savannah-view due to a major increase in an enclosure outside - which removed the close giraffe viewing opportunities we had enjoyed four years ago. The concierge level was helpful, but primarily for Disney activities. The coffee service there ends at 10 PM - with no provision for night owls. Amazingly the only internet option is a fixed Ethernet port at $10 per day. Hotel staff did pass along the possibility of wifi in the lobby area in the coming year, maybe. The pool area was not relaxing: think massive child's swim party with appropriate noise. Along with the Sunrise Safari, the best new option is the use of night-vision scopes after 9PM at the savannah by the pool. Cool to see the green-lit giraffes and other animals. Overall, the Disney service and the animal views trumped all the minor issues. We genuinely enjoyed our stay, even if we had to learn to slow down and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Misumbini
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for our first time trip to disney to see the animals from our room and there was plenty of that. Zebras, Giraffes, all sorts. Our room had two double beds, and a TV. The room was small and crowded for the four of us, bathroom was small as well and the shower and toilet area was too dark. I didn't think it was all that clean either. No disney movies for the kids in the room, no free internet, no microwave, only a small fridge. I was a bit disappointed. There are three food options, a fancy african restaurant, a buffet type and a fast food thing. I would have liked to see the fast food place to have more healthy options for everyone, not just the kids. It's not cheap either. Concierge area, very helpful. Must book for all meals and be prepared to wait EVEN if you have a booking! LOADS OF WAITING IN DISNEY IF YOU ARE NOT A WAITING PERSON, PICK ANOTHER HOLIDAY!! The hotel itself is beautiful, there's an arcade place and a lovely pool, shame about the small rooms. This is meant to be one of the best ones and I didn't think it was all that. I guess you only do it once...Bus services to all the parks is great. Couldn't believe there were people there on their honeymoon!! It's ok ONCE. we were told by someone else who lives there to stay in the resorts the first time for the experience and if you ever go again (god help you), stay outside the resort and rent a car...MAKES TOTAL SENSE!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, place was very special.”
Reviews.Author: spookyjudy
Reviews.Content: Everyone was wonderful, staff was very accomadating. Our only problem was shower water was warm, not hot!!!!! We wish they would of had coffee or soft drinks available after 10pm on the concierge level. The kids loved watching the animals on our balcony as did the adults. Room was beautiful. Just thanks for a great stay andd beautiful Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “A little pricey for a lousy bathroom set up”
Reviews.Author: PAABOO
Reviews.Content: Overall, we loved our stay; however, the bathroom set up was very cramped, the lighting was terrible and the shower was awful -- you had 2 options, get pounded or sprinkled. After walking hundreds of miles in a day, nothing's better than a nice, long hot shower but not here. We've stayed at many fine resorts and we'll spend a bit more as long as we get what we pay for - AK Jambo fell a bit short of our definition of "Deluxe." The queen sized bed was wonderful! Just when you think there's no kleenex, you'll find it on the writing desk your last day like we did.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced Over rated”
Reviews.Author: Bongo3028
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the worst 5* Hotels we have stayed in, What ever you do do not pay for a Savanah upgrade because there is no guarantee you will see the animals. We stayed for three days and it wasnt until the last hour of our stay that a couple of the animals roamed into view!! The room is only average never 5* and we never had turn down service! rip off!! The concerige is only there to book you Disney trips and tickets, dont whatever you do ask for tickets to anywhere other than Disney, you will be told " no mam I cannot help you" Fancy relaxing in your 5* hotel at lunch time and enjoying good food and wine?? forget it it, all that is available is the cafe by the pool selling the usual fast food burgers, fries & pizza!! Found most of the staff to be unhelpful and blase towards any questions asked !!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Especially for Kids”
Reviews.Author: mkouzmine
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing short of amazing, especially if you are traveling with young kids. We spend 3 of our vacation days just hanging out in the hotel and were spoiled with activities and fun. My kids learned so much from the amazing staff, mostly from Africa who played games and did educational activities every hour. My kids collected beads that they earned for completing certain tasks such as learning about how animals eat to playing the bongos. It's the staff that makes this hotel top notch. We stayed in a Savannah room and had an incredible array of animals just below our balcony--zebras, giraffes, oxen, river hogs and more. The kids loved watching them. We ate at both Jiko and Boma and both were very good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay, love the hotel”
Reviews.Author: ayhirai
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a one bedroom on the concierge level with 3 small children. The private check in was very pleasant and efficient. Outstanding rooms and decor. The nicest part of the concierge level was the food-we could almost make a full meal out of all the food that was brought out. Although a bit further from the resorts than some of the other resorts, the bus service was efficient and when not visiting the parks, there were plenty of activities to keep the children busy. Although the concierge level was more expensive, we thought it was worth the extra cost for a special stay.

Reviews.Title: “Strongly encourage you not to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Alton C
Reviews.Content: Let me start this review by asking people to read my other reviews. In general, I do not complain about hotels. I believe that a review should be based on realistic expectations, the actual price that you paid, and factors within the control of the hotel. That being said, the Animal Kingdom Lodge is a terrible value. And, I do not believe that what happened with my stay is unusal. I booked my room for October 2010 back in January. Since I was with a group, I booked it with a Disney coordinator. I paid full price for a Savanah room on the concierge level ($435.00). Here is what we got: We got a small corner room on the fourth floor. This meant that we had no view of the animals because a huge tree was blocking our view. If you have stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge, you will know what I am talking about. The building curves and my room was at the end of the curve. The end of the Savanah. In addition, our balcony was very public because there was a public porch directly to the left of our room. There was also a firepit directly under us. If the lack of a view, which I paid $435.00 a night for, was the only thing that I did not get for my money, I may not be so harsh. Why? Because, the Animal Kingdom Lodge can always tell me that they can't control where the animals go. Okay, I'll buy that. I judge a hotel by factors which are under its control. However, it was under the hotel's control to put me in a room which had a dead-on view. As a customer paying full-price, I expect to be given the "full-price" room. If I was a frequent customer that had "elite" customer benefits, then I would expect the "upgraded" room if it was available, if no one paid "full price" for a room. But, let's talk about the room itself. Because, I paid full price $435.00 a night, Which meant that I expected perfect service. I had no kleenix in the room. Silly, right? At first, I thought that was normal. I figured it was some sort of "green" thing. So, we used toilet paper. The turn-down service was just that: They turned down the bed and left chocolates. They didn't straighten anything up. They didn't update the amenities. Nothing. Just turned down the bed, left chocolates and they left. The last night...they didn't even leave chocolates. And, speaking of just leaving: The cleaning crew left everything. The towels where they were, the dirty plates. Everything. I don't know if it is a Disney thing but they didn't touch anything. Not even to clean it. After day two (2) I figured that if I put everything in a pile in the middle of the floor, the cleaning crew would take it. And, the amenities. Let's talk about them. Oh wait. I can't. During my four-night stay, I got one set. This is when I arrived and that was it. By the last night, we were rationing soap. Thank goodness we travel with our own shampoo. Now, before you start thinking that I was on the phone whining to the manager, think again. I never complained to the manager, not once during my stay. Why? Because, the Animal Kingdom Lodge knew that I was paying $435.00 a night for my room. And, they knew it was sub-standard when they put me in it. The only complaint I made was when I first checked in. I called and verified if this was really my room. I asked them to check. They said yes. I asked if my room had been inspected and they said yes. The woman said that they had "stringent" quality controls at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Okay. Then, I didn't have to call the manager to tell them it was sub-standard. They apparently already knew it since they had quality controls in place. And, since I was paying $435.00 a night for a room, I was pretty sure that my room was at the top of the list for quality control. And, as a note: I was there with a group. If I had not been there as part of a group event. I would have left. I love Disney. I go to Disney all the time. But, I have never stayed at one of the properties. I was excited for this trip. Shame on the Animal Kingdon Lodge for charging so much money and then have such low standards.

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms but fun hotel. My husband...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Average rooms but fun hotel. My husband and I stayed in a pool view room for 5 nights. Beautiful lobby and friendly staff. The food at Boma & Jiko's was excellent. The animals on site are a plus for the family. On the downside, we thought the rooms were just average and very dark, especially the bathroom. The bed was not very comfortable and was lopsided. Also, this hotel was not conveniently located. The wait for the shuttle bus was a bit long and the ride into the parks was long. Overall, it's an average hotel. It's a great place to visit but we wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'm picky but couldn't fault AKL”
Reviews.Author: Bicardi65
Reviews.Content: I could not believe some of the reviews I have read about AKL and I can be a picky customer. I loathe bad customer service, like everything to be clean and tidy, but either these people are even more picky than I or I just hit lucky, but whatever the reason I had a fantastic time and four weeks after returning I'm still longing to be back to the fun, laughter and fantastic customer service. When we first arrived we had been booked into a room with a Kingsize bed and bunk beds (not approrpriate for my children!! aged 15 & 22 yr old) we spoke with reception and within 20 mins we had been allocated another room and told we could be up-graded on the Monday if we were still not happy, but no need our room was lovely, two very comfortable king size beds and view overlooking the pool, we all instantly felt relaxed and happy. Our room was kept clean and tidy by staff with bed linen and towels frequently changed, the pleasant smelling complimentary shampoo, conditioner and body lotion came in a treat after a splash in the pool/water parks which are well maintained and guarded by vigilant life guards. Unlike some I thought the food was lovely and plentiful, we booked the Disney Dinning Plan and had some beautiful meals in the hotels, resorts and Downtown Disney, but I would recommend you pre-book because they can get very busy and that way you avoid standing about wasting precious Disney play time. AKL financially is a stretch on the wallet and you could get a hotel in Orlando of a much higher materialistic quality than AKL but you are also paying for the magic that is Disney and I for one would go back tomorrow if I could. The whole experience left me with many many happy memories I will cherish forever and in the many years I have travelled to Disney I would rate this experience as the BEST SO FAR. If I had one thing to moan about it would be ........I only booked two weeks and it should have been four...but I know next time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful, fun & relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: momcrass
Reviews.Content: The pool is very nice & has a great waterslide that even the little ones can enjoy. The complimentary life vests for kiddos who do not know how to swim was a huge perk that I didn/t know of beforehand. I wish we would have more time to see all the hotel has to offer. Lots of fun activities throughout the day for kids & families, such as a parade around the hotel lobby & large fire pit outside the lobby in the evenings with story time. Would LOVE to return again some time!!

Reviews.Title: “Visit the Lodge but don't sleep there”
Reviews.Author: AmyLeigh827
Reviews.Content: The animal kingdom lodge is a great place to visit - I would recommend going for an evening visit if you are in Orlando. Our favorite restaurant was Sanaa, which offers a great view of the wild animals from your dinner table, as well as fantastic food. It is a lot of fun to view the animals, and there are several viewing stations around the property. However, while I would strongly recommend a visit to the grounds, I would not recommend staying at this hotel. We had several problems with staff clerical errors. First, they checked us into a double bed room with a bunk bed (we had specifically reserved a king room) with a view of a concrete wall out the balcony. They also charged us more for this room than the single king we had reserved. We had to go back to the front desk to change rooms, and all hotel had available was a two-double bed room. At far cheaper hotels, the staff will often bring new room keys to you if there is a booking error - not so here. We also came during the slowest week of the year, so I would hate to see how the hotel runs during busy season. We purchased two 3 day park hopper tickets from the hotel, of which only one ticket worked when we tried to enter the parks the next day. It took the customer service more than 30 minutes to reissue my ticket, and they charged us again because the park computer systems do not interface with the park hotels, so the parks cannot refund or replace tickets issued at a Disney hotel. The customer service people were very nice about the incident, but it cost us the majority of the "extra hour" time that the park was only open to disney resort guests. When we tried to address the issue with the hotel management that evening, we were told that they can only discuss billing problems during normal business hours (ie time that should be spent at the parks). We returned during business hours and were told that a refund would be issued for the one ticket that was defective, and the refund would show up on our final bill. When we checked out, the hotel had accidentally charged us again for the defective ticket instead of refunding the ticket. The staff was very apologetic about the whole matter, but it was frustrating and time consuming. Trying to do anything at the front desk, whether it be checking in, buying the park tickets, or discussing a problem took a lot longer than it should have. Bottom line: buy your park tickets at the parks, not at a Disney hotel, and review your hotel bill very carefully. Also, be very patient anytime you need to approach the front desk. The room service was also a very long wait - we ordered one night after staying late at the parks (the hotel restaurants had closed) and were told that our food would be delivered in 30 minutes. Over an hour later, we called the front desk (because no one would pick up the room service line) and was told by the front desk that we need to talk to room service ourselves to verify that food is actually coming, and if room service doesn't answer, there is nothing the front desk can do. The food did eventually come, but we were about ready to leave the hotel to see if we could find a restaurant elsewhere. The rooms themselves were moderately comfortable, but I would put them slightly below a Best Western. The beds are very hard, and the frames squeak loudly anytime you jostle the mattress at all, so turning over in bed is sure to wake a light sleeper in the room with you. Otherwise, the rooms are average for a 2 star hotel. If you are going to stay at a Disney hotel, you might consider staying at a hotel connected to the monorail, because the busing from hotels to parks is not a fun experience. With the exception of the neighboring Animal Kingdom park, all of the bus rides were fairly long, with a long wait for the bus to come, and the buses were very crowded. The hotel did have nice restaurants, as well as a nice gym and spa. We did not use the pool, but the pool looked nice as well. The parks, as always, were great. I was told that if you stay in the most expensive rooms, the animals will occasionally come up to your balcony in the morning. So if you want to spend the money for the best room, you might like this hotel. Otherwise, just come for dinner and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: kpmdjm
Reviews.Content: we stay here almost every trip and we love it. We love the atmosphere. We love being able to see the animals, and they have the best dinner buffet.

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MicknAnnDoncaster
Reviews.Content: Two weeks of perfection, thoroughly enjoyed by our party of five including the almost 2 year old. tremendous facilities, restaurants superb, even the fast food restaurant. Very impressed with the Disney dining plan, once we had worked out how best to use it. If I was "picky" my only very minor complaint was that the disney transportation for this hotel is a bit hit and miss, and the waiting times were longer than other Disney hotels. Obviously this is owing to the fact that its location is the farthest away from the Parks and attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Disney did magic with this”
Reviews.Author: missbradders
Reviews.Content: I had booked another Disney Hotel for this years vacation but on arrival my party was whisked away to the Animal Kingdom lodge!. for a free up grade I nearly had a breakdown in the lobby.. Well after a nine hour flight you just want something to eat and go to bed. Check in was a bit fractured because reception didn't know we were staying but it was all sorted after a phone call. We had rooms on the 4th floor which is only one floor up from the lobby and bus stop and our room overlooked the car park. there are loads of places to see the animals and it really wasn't a problem. We had two soft squidgy king beds , shower room and double sinks also fridge , coffee maker and flat screen t.v and IPOD DOCK( GOOD THAT WE TOOK ONE) The lodge has three eateries We ate mainly in the Mara quick service food court , the food was all cooked to order , hot , fresh and slightly different from the other hotels I've stayed in. We also has the quick service plan which to be honest was too much food. We used the snack coupons on Fruit loops to bring home! The Boma is a buffett restaurant with an African and Morrocan flavour.Had to book this before we left the UK but it was all you can eat and the servers are really helpful.. The pool has a small water slide and two spas and a flamingo pool next door! so you feel you are in Africa.The smell of wood smoke fiils the air as two fire pits burn,It so relaxing here. The down side was there was no free wifi but a cable for a lap top which I think was free or you can buy the cable for $10..This hotel was on my bucket list and I'm so pleased we were given the up grade to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful trip to AKL”
Reviews.Author: uvahoo02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL 09/22-09/29/10. We picked the resort for my 13 yr old stepdaughter- we thought she would love the animals. We arrived to the resort at around 11am. I did online check in and only waited a couple minutes. Our room was ready even though we were early. We were in room 3014 on the Giraffe trail. It was a great location for us. It was pool view, a short walk to the lobby (no stairs or elevators needed) and a short walk to the stairs/elevator to get out to the buses. The room was a nice size. There are double sinks, a closet with hangers, a huge dresser (three very deep large drawers), a balcony with two chairs, and we had two queen beds. Our room was very clean. Mousekeeping did a great job, although we did not get any towel art even with mousekeeping tips. We went to Mara multiple times a day to fill up our water bottle. We had one meal there (cheese flatbread- yum!). We did not eat at Jiko or Boma so I can't comment on the food. The pool was great. There were always plenty of towels and chairs. My stepdaughter enjoyed the slide. The playground was lots of fun when my nieces came to visit from Pop Century. The animals were amazing! we went out to look for them in the mornings, the afternoons before dinner, and then with night vision at night when we returned. It was so wonderful to be able to see them roaming around, often times very close up. My only complaint about the resort was the bus service. We often had to wait for 40+ minutes for a bus. Sometimes they would come but would be full from Kidani. However, I spoke with another group who stayed the same week we did and said they had no problem with the buses (???). We truly felt like we were coming home to AKL after lots of fun in the WDW parks.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: HollyBonnyGirl
Reviews.Content: This place is just beautiful! When you get in you are greeted and shown to your room.The rooms are spacious with an animal theme to them, they make you feel exotic!The rooms are on the first floor and below the rooms is a lookout of some wonderful artefacts and a small stall selling Disney souvenirs. From some of the room's balconies you can see animals e.g giraffes, elephants, etc. and there is an outside area where the animals may be seen close up. Wonderful hotel, but not so cheap!!

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't as good as expected”
Reviews.Author: bloud8
Reviews.Content: Was given wrong information by an employee about something as simple as getting my luggage to my room. My brother in law had to wait 45 mins to get into his room. Desk clerk assured him twice (I heard him) say that he would call him on his cell as soon as his room was ready. 45 mins later we approached the desk again to complain only to find out the room had been ready- but no one had called to let us know. Rooms were average. I had a glorious balcony view of the front parking lot which happened to overlook the smoking area which is right next to the hotel. Nothing beats getting hit in the face with the smoke of 20 cigarettes as you open your sliding glass balcony door. Did i mention I was "upgraded" to the Lodge from the Port Orleans Riverside? Biggest mistake I made was accepting the upgrae. What a disppointment. Would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jessie11
Reviews.Content: We were a group of 12 with ages ranging from 18 months to 60's and the hotel had something to appeal to all of us. We loved the luggage service of being able to check our bags and not handling them again until they were delivered to our room. The bus was a nice service from the airport, checkin was smooth and our bags came up to our room quickly. We had the three bedroom four bath villa and it was certainly spacious and comfortable for all our needs. The trees blocked some of our savannah view but we could see zebras and giraffes at different times. Our balconies were a good size and we enjoyed sitting out there. We had gotten supplies sent to our room and that was another convenient service. The rooms were very clean and the kitchen adequately furnished. We didn't cook big meals while there, but it was nice to have the kitchen for breakfast and snack times for the children. My husband and I slept on the sofa bed and it was fine. Could have been that we were so tired we would have slept on concrete but neither of us had any complaints. We didn't eat at Boma (not sure of name) but some of our party did and really enjoyed it. We did eat several meals at the other restaurant by the pool. It was typical Disney fare and not especially good, but not completely awful either. The kids loved swimming in the pool and the slide was a hit with them. My only complaint about our stay was the bus service to the different parks. We always had at least a 20 minute wait and one driver told us that the 20 minute wait was a myth and to expect it to be longer. It was about a 30 minute trip to the parks except to Animal Kingdom. That ended up being a factor in planning our activites in the parks. All in all, it was a fantastic place to stay and we loved our visit there.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disappointment and woeful food. And terrible food. And unedible food.”
Reviews.Author: whereswally2010
Reviews.Content: Dont believe the pictures. Stayed at Jambo Lodge where the supposedly LUXURY lodge provides rooms that are tired, cramped, dingy. The blankets must be 20 years old, the bathrooms straight Out Of Africa, the worlds tiniest bath towels and the food, the worst we have ever had in any hotel anywhere in the world. The "Chilled Shrimp" on the R/S menu were on looks alone, enough to give a solid bout of upset stomach, but upon eating did not disappoint, they really did deliver on the appearance. And the Burger, from the country that deleivered the hamburger, well maybe this place would be better off to call up for Big Mac's. thje delivery time could be no slower. One time when calling for Room Service it took 12 minutes of recordings to get the operator. Maybe we should not have bothered. But then tht is faster than lining up for 20 minutes to get into a hotel restaurant. You cannot complain about portion sizes of the food. They are huge. But who can eat huge amounts of woeful food. Surprisingly, the rooms are very child UN-friendly with high beds and wooden bases that are almost dangerous. With just 2 adults and a 4 yo child in the room, there was no room to swing a cat, or even a mouse. The photos on the website of rooms overlooking the savannah are rooms with glimpses of tired giraffes, a few zebra and some buffalo in what is basically a zoo, do not deliver the image that is promised. The Disney Transport which is amazingly efficient (luckily) picks up and drops off at all the parks, but Animal Kingdom is a 20 minute jammed pack bus ride to the other parks, so unless Animal Kingdom Park is your main focus, I would recommend one of the hotels nearer Magic Kingdom or Downtown etc. Typical Disney "welcome home" staff that deliver on the service. And did I mention the terrible food.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: AmyP12
Reviews.Content: Love this place! It is Disney, would you expect anything but the best? One hint.... make sure your room has a savannah view. You can sit on your balcony and watch the animals. I think I lived out there!! Have stayed again since this trip and had view of parking lot. It is NOT the same experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for a fortnight with a six year old”
Reviews.Author: snoozum
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks with my niece for her 6th birthday in August, and in a Savannah view room. My niece is a huge animal lover so there was never really any other choice when it came to deciding on a hotel to stay in. We booked a meal plan, which I would highly recommend, and we also booked a dinner at Cinderella's Royal Table for my nieces birthday, which I wouldn't - but I'll discuss that a little later. The rooms are of an average size but more than adequate for sleeping / changing and storing your luggage. The balcony with a view of the animals was a great way to entertain a 6 year old while taking it in turns to get ready. Just like Africa? Absolutely not. But just like a 6 year olds Disneyfied perception of what Africa is like? Absolutely. And that's the great thing about the Disney hotels: everything is geared towards satisfying their expectations and everything is tailored to making their time there a special one. What might make me cringe, a six year old will think is absolutely magical. The pool was big enough to never feel too crowded and it was never any trouble getting a lounger. The food at breakfast in Boma was fantastic, although it got a little much for us after a week and I tended to grab a croissant from the Mara cafe (a bit like a fast food place by the pool). We tried Boma a couple of times for dinner, as reservations were never needed. The food there was OK, and with lots of choice, but we tended to prefer the a la carte options. Jiko - the signature restaurant in the hotel - was also very good, and we didn't require a reservation there either. They also serve Tusker lager throughout the hotel which was a nice touch. One of the benefits of staying in the Disney hotel - as well as getting the buses directly into the parks - is the room key system of paying for anything anywhere within the resort. This includes all the shops in downtown Disney aswell (inc the sunglasses shop). However everything around Disney is geared towards parting you from your money, and they are experts at it! There wasn't a day went by that my niece "needed" one thing or another, even if it was nearly identical to the thing she'd "needed" and bought the previous day. One tip is to try and book as many restaurants as you can as soon as you arrive (or even before you go) as these book up fast. We were given a booklet detailing all the hotels and restaurants when we checked in, and on the third day I rang up the Disney reservation helpline (free from your room) and managed to make dinner reservations at various restaurants for the rest of our time there. The woman on the other end of the phone was extremely helpful in helping us decide on the restaurants based on the cuisine we wanted. Our favourite restaurants were the Japanese Teppan Edo in Epcot and Citrico's at the Grand Floridian Resort, although we enjoyed every meal we had on the dining plan. Except one.... and that was supposed to be the most special meal. As I alluded to in the opening paragraph, we booked a meal at Cinderellas Royal Table at the castle in the Magic Kingdom on the evening of my nieces birthday. She was so excited, and dressed up in her own princess outfit in order to meet Cinderella. The experience up until the meal was magical for my niece - the castle looks and feels real, and she got to meet and chat with Cinderella before posing for a photograph with her. But once you are taken up the stairs to the restaurant, the magic really ends. It's busy, noisy and looks like a regular restaurant. And the food was fairly awful. They do have a kind of song near the end of the meal where Cinderellas mice come out, but by the point the magic had already been lost. Much better, and much cheaper, was the character breakfast we booked at the Animal Kingdom Park. Here you have a regular buffet breakfast but all the Disney characters come round the tables while you're eating and sign the autograph books and take pictures. It was far more informal, and far more enjoyable for my niece. Just seeing the excitement in her face and seeing how real it was for her still makes me smile; this wasn't somebody dressed up in a Donald-duck / Goofy costume, this WAS Donald duck and Goofy. We also got tickets to the Cirque du Soleil, which my niece (mostly!) sat through and was entertained by (we also booked this through the helpline from the room). The only times we ventured outside of Disney was to Florida Mall and to the Universal Studios, and we got a taxi each time. These weren't too cheap, so I'd probably think about hiring a car for a couple of days if I wanted to explore more. Overall, we had an excellent stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. It's not super luxurious, but the atmosphere is relaxed and there's a really good vibe about the place. And the main thing was that my niece loved it. The only thing I'd change is the fact that they only had one room with internet, which was a little frustrating given the size of the hotel. The service wasn't fantastic either, but I think that has more to do with the corporation than the hotel itself. You are better arranging anything you need through the central Disney helpline, which is free to call from inside your room. Apart from that, I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to others with young children, although I was glad to be free of the screaming little monsters after two weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade to the Savannah view and don't think twice.”
Reviews.Author: DimeStoreSaint
Reviews.Content: This hotel was incredible. My girlfriend and I visited for 7 days in the end of September and couldn't have been happier with the Animal Kingdom Lodge - Jambo House. The staff was super friendly, the hotel was clean, and the views were perfect. Upon arrival we knew we picked the right hotel. The cast members helped us out and our check-in was a breeze. We even got upgraded to a room with 2 queen beds instead of bunk beds (our original reservation) without having to ask. Our Savannah view couldn't have been better. Every morning we woke up to see 3 giraffes pretty much right outside out window. It was amazing. The long walk to our room was worth it because there are so many areas to stop and look at the different Savannahs this hotel has. We could also take in some of the displays put up throughout the halls as well. The food offered here was quite good. We did a room service breakfast, a buffet style breakfast at Boma and had a special tasting (we're both vegetarians) at Jiko. All were delicious. The only problem we encountered was the wait for the buses. This was never terrible, but some nights (and locations) were worse then others. It was frustrating at the time, but not nearly enough to discourage anyone staying here. I highly recommend staying here and paying for the Savannah upgrade. It's well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saracate1231
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Walt Disney World's Animal Kingdom Lodge for our week long honeymoon in July 2010. What a great place to stay! the lobby was gorgeous and so unique! All the staff was very friendly as we crossed paths walking through the lobby. Make sure you have a room with a view of the savanah as that's the real treat of this hotel. You can get great views of all types of African animals right out of your balcony with a chart in the room to help you identify them. Make sure your "savanah view" room does actually have that view. Since it was our honeymoon we specifically requested a savanah view room with a king sized bed. When we arrived our "savanah view" consisted of small patch of dirt and old trees next to maintanance barns and a view of other rooms directly across from you. We were very disappointed but after a phone call to the front desk they were able to move us and even commented that it was a horrible location for a room. The only downside was that they only had a room with two queen sized beds available. The GREAT views of the animals made it all worth it though! The rooms are very nice but a basic hotel room so don't expect anything fancy. The Animal Kingdom Lodge also offered a beautiful pool. It was VERY hot when we were there so the pool was always full. There was a great poolside bar with a very friendly bartender who made you feel at home and often stayed open past close to fill all the drink orders. The bar inside the hotel had a good menu but didn't serve any frozen drinks like the poolside bar did. Last but not least are the two great restaurants in the hotel. We were able to experience both and were very pleased. Both were pricey but on par with many other Disney restaurants. Get reservations for both as there was often a long wait if you didn't. My husband and I highly recommend Walt Disney World's Animal Kingdom Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, beautiful, can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: mb187143
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about this resort - we stayed for 7 nights, had booked a standard view room and were upgraded, without even asking, to a savanna view room. There was a distinct selection of animals on the Uzima Savanna (which our balcony overlooked) and we saw them every day - it was clear that at feeding time and in the early morning/evening would be the best times, because in the heat of the day they're obviously not roaming around in the hot sun. The reviewers complaining about not seeing animals must not have been looking at the right times of day, or maybe it was just much hotter - either way, not our experience. The buses were absolutely fine, and there was a cast member down by the bus stops every day to coordinate if one stop was getting crowded. The ride to the Magic Kingdom took, at most, 12 minutes - and honestly it's not that much longer than from the other resorts. All in all, this was an incredible resort, the staff couldn't do enough to help, and I would reccomend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel we loved it”
Reviews.Author: jasper1730
Reviews.Content: This is my favourite hotel ever. We thought the attention to the african details were wonderful.We had the deluxe Disney Dining plan good value , fab food in hotel. We loved returning to the hotel on the evenings after the parks , as we would go down to the pool at ten in the evening and spend an hour or so swimming , which was great afer a busy day. We paid for a standard room but were given a savannah view,It was wonderful to go on our balcony in the mornings and watch the animals. The hotel is expensive but wonderful for families and well worth the extra money. We will be returning next year , it will be the first hotel that we would have returned to as we like to try different ones, but I would'nt be happy if I went back to florida and did'nt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I expected!!”
Reviews.Author: carrie1626
Reviews.Content: I loved the AKL. We were 3 adults in a pool view room. Spent alot of time in the pool, great location. Spent quite a bit of time at all 3 savanahhs and saw some incredible action by the animals. The CM's from African were so amazing to talk to. Great dinner buffet at Boma. Already talking about returning there in 2011 with our parents.!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay...can't wait to go back : )”
Reviews.Author: AmyElise916
Reviews.Content: had a great time at AKL. The hotel is beautiful. The lobby is beautiful with African decor. The smells of boma ...food cooking... when you walk in are amazing. We had a savanna view. It was great to go to the balcony and see the animals after a long day at the parks. What I really liked the most was one night it was quiet and all I could here was the zebra eating the grass. The zebra was like maybe 20 feets from the balcony and I could here & see it ripping the grass & eating. My small son loved the animals too. I thought that was so neat. The beds were very comfoartable and the docor was very nice. All hand carved wood in the rooms for furniture (or least it looked hand carved). The staff was also very friendly. Disney treats you great. The perks of staying at a disney resort are great. All you have to do is get your self to the airport and they take your bags for you. This resort also has air line check in which was really great. I checked my bags in at the hotel on my home & walked on the airport shuttle. I saw my bags again at the baggage claim at Newark. The only thing that I would change would be the room size (it was a little small) but not too small . Overall my stay was excellent & I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “First room looked out to where the...”
Reviews.Author: bilkysue84
Reviews.Content: First room looked out to where the garbage goes. Ahh,, so beautiful... back to the front desk to complain about our savannah view.. next room was so much better. With a really nice view. All in all the stay was good. The rooms need to be cleaned a little better. The food was great! Worth the money! One point to Disney, the hotel is beautiful, but please stop giving those rooms that over look the garbage out to hard working people. You can put any kind of animal on the outside of the bin, but it still the garbage! Shame on you for wasting my time! I would recommend this hotel as long as you make sure you don't get the garbage bin view.

Reviews.Title: “By Far the Best Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DaveWells44
Reviews.Content: The whole experience from start to finsh was excellent The savana view is a must & although we didn't pay the extra we still got one which was awesome . The dining plan made life easy & once you got your head round it , it made meal times easy .The Mara was great for quick meals & snacks , The Boma had a great choice & whether you booked in advance or not , It didn't make to much difference on how long you waited to be seated. The room was clean & the beds were very comfy . The maid would re-arrange our daughters toys on the bed , which made her smile every day when we returned to the room . Most days we had different animals out side & most mornings Miles the giraffe was nearby ( hope he's getting on well with his new girlfriend) The staff were always friendly & helpful , the cultural talks were very interesting & fun for children & adults alike . We would stay there again & the only thing , I could say they could improve is marking the parking area , as we used the Disney transport most of the time , we would forget where we parked as there was no real landmarks to use as a reference . When we go again this hotel is where we will stay .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAChols
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Jambo House at the end of august beginning of sep. On arrival we were told we were upgraded to savanna view which was great as we were there for 2 weeks and knew we would make the most of it. The rooms are not big as you may have read in previous reviews but considering you only need them to wash and sleep in they are fine and we had bunk beds for the kids so they were confortable as were we. Staff were very freindly and accomodating. Swimming pool was perfect and had a slide so the kids loved that. There were plenty of beds and fresh towels available whenever we went down. We ate breakfast and dinner a few times in boma which is a buffet restaurant with amazing food. The mara is a quick service restaurant but was brilliant for drinks snacks and had a great bakery . The disney shop in hotel was quite big and well stocked. The lobby was very impressive and we loved the whole african feel with the african music always in the background. We never had to wait more that 10 minutes for a coach to the parks which was great but then we were very lucky with the time of year we chose to visit as apparently its the quietest time now through to october as all local kids are back in school from late august so we hardly queued for anything. All in all loved this hotel, we looked out to see zebra girraffe and deers everyday. Even though its the furthest hotel from Magic Kingdom (20 MIns) it was not a problem because it was only 10 mins to the other parks 15 to downtown disney and we worked out that had we stayed in a non disney hotel and hired a car we would have taken much longer each day to get to the parks. My children loved it and I would definately come back again. There was nothing bad I can say about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect as everything related to Disney!”
Reviews.Author: clau_sissa
Reviews.Content: The view for the savana was just perfect! The room was very spacious and clean! The bathroom was perfectly arranged! Two sinks!!! And the hotel was just great! The staff was very polite, nice and smiley! I could stay at the hotel my entire vacation and would still be worth every hour! Totally recommend it! If you can, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved It.”
Reviews.Author: SassieSue
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 14 nights from 21st August through 4th September. Lobby / rooms amazing. Attention to details are great from the giraffe patterned carpet, to the giraffes etched into the lifts. I was worried that the rooms would be too dark, however this was not the case. I loved my room, from the African wallpaper, tiles and shower curtain in the bathroom, through to the African shield on the door. It was all so different and a change from the usual decor of most hotels. I did not find the beds the most comfortable ever though, they did creak a lot and were quite high off the ground, that I worried my daughter would really hurt herself should she fall out of bed. I had a standard room, near the lobby which was great. We did consider upgrading and paying more for a savannah room, but knowing what I know now, I am glad i didnt pay the extra. I think you have ideas that the savannahs are full of animals, but there are not as many as you think, and in my opinion does not warrant the huge supplement . Disney Dining Plan was great, cannot fault the food. Boma although amazing was a bit loud/mad/busy most of the time. Disney bus service excellent and I thought the distance to the parks was fine and not too far away, although the bus to Downtown Disney is about the furthest/longest as stops at Typhoon Lagoon first. If i had to complain about one thing, it would be the pool. It is extremely busy, day and night. Wouldnt recommend paying for a pool view if you like to sit on your balcony for peace and quiet. Would of loved a quiet pool and think just the one pool is a mistake. We went late on about 9.30 pm one night, and it was still crazy, too busy to be enjoyable. Apart from the busy pool, the hotel/food/transport/staff are all amazing and this is one beautiful place to come.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic! An African adventure in FL :)”
Reviews.Author: tiggermyron
Reviews.Content: This was our 6th on site stay at a Disney resort. We've stayed at Grand Floridian, Wilderness Lodge, Polynesian and Port Orleans French Quarter. Each resort has its own unique flavor and Animal Kingdom Lodge did not disappoint! I think it was my family's favorite. The minute you step inside the magnificent lobby you are instantly transported to Africa. The hotel is filled with museum quality African art, we also happened to be greeted with a drumming celebration! The staff was friendly and helpful from the moment we arrived. Their student program brings college age kids from African nations to AKL for a 12 month program. These cast members run all sorts of activities from evening cultural presentations to crafts and Disney encourages guests to strike up a conversation with these students! They are fascinating to speak with and you and your kids will learn so much about their home countries!! The rooms are definitely deluxe by Disney standards, meaning you are really paying for the atmosphere outside your room. The animals, the various savannahs, the gorgeous (and clean) pool and the easy access to the park. We always rely on Disney transportation and only had one issue where we were late leaving a park and directed onto the wrong bus by a supervisor. The driver corrected the situation by taking us back to AKL, Food is amazing! Ate at Boma for breakfast and dinner, Mara (quick service) and Jiko and loved them all. Can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “4.5 Stars for AKL Jambo House.”
Reviews.Author: FS_Junkie_with_kids
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed in a one bedroom villa at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House from 8/27-9/1/2010.
