The hallways leading to our room were not clean, there was a lot of dust and dirt in the corners - and a lot of the lower wallpaper was damaged from the mousekeeping carts. When the decor of the hotel is meant to look a little worn, there is a fine line between worn - and dirty. We bought refillable mugs - but we always had to take them with us in the morning if we didn't want to walk 2,000+ steps round to the counter service location. It is a LONG walk! The pool is great - but you may want to consider taking clothes and changing in the pool locker rooms if you are assigned a room on the Kudu Trail as it's not fun going all the way from the Kudu Trail to the Pool and back in wet clothes, wet sandals etc. As with all the Disney Resorts the toiletry amenities are great - the H20 brand products are great! All in all - this resort is beautiful, and it has a lot of really unique benefits, opportunities, and features that are not available at any other resort.... let alone a Walt Disney World Resort. While it's not our favorite resort (Wilderness Lodge is!) it's a great place to stay, and does have a lot in common with Wilderness Lodge, it just isn't the same! We have stayed at several Disney hotels, and this just wasn't on par with the rest. The animals are a big draw, but you can go see the animals even if you aren't staying at AKL. If you have any questions about planning your Disney vacation, or if you have questions about the Disney Vacation Club, feel free to contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Our favourite holiday destination EVER”
Reviews.Author: tcrclarke
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited August 2009. This resort is just amazing as soon as you start driving towards the main gate you know you are about to see something special. As soon as you see Jambo House you'll know what I mean!!! When you walk through the massive entrance into the huge lobby that has so much to look at you wont know where to begin. We were treated exceptionally from the begin we had separate park tickets that we purchased before leaving for the US and I remember from previous visits as child/teenager that you can combine your room key with your Disney Pass I enquired about this and before I knew it they had already done it on reception for me. The receptionist was very nice and was brimming with information although as a frequent visitor growing up I knew a lot of the information needed she asked us about ourselves and our visit and really made a fuss about us after we told her about it being our honeymoon. She gave us the just married pins and some additional pins which came in handy later on in trip with loads of express passes and being greeted with "Congratulations" from every cast member and other visitors alike. I was hoping for a free upgrade but I think we lucked out on that one but our room was amazing none the less. I will always love the Disney little touches to improve your stay being welcomed when entering the hotel by a cast member with them saying "Welcome Home" every time you entered. The towel creations made by the maids everyday from the love birds to the Mickey mouse head we couldn't wait to get back to see the next creation. We were never disturbed by guest services they came in cleaned and changed the linen without us even knowing. The rooms were always cleaned to a high standard. We dined at Boma, Jiko and the Mara. All had a great variety of food and had some extremely amazing dishes. At Boma our waiter gave us a free mini selection of mini deserts which were out of this world. Jiko is by far the best restaurant at WDW amazing food and wine selection. At Jiko our waitress was amazingly nice and saw that we were on our honeymoon so gave us a free bottle of wine and Evian during our meal. You must also take advantage of the night vision animal watching that is run in the late evening you will spend a very long time watching the giraffe's and other animals grazing in the Savannah. The pool, spa's and gym were all great although we didn't pay that many visits to them. Although it was nice to take a dip in the spa or the pool after a hard day at the parks. People moan about the price of staying here but I say you get what you pay for. They also moan about it being to far away by transport it is further out than some resorts but it is not that noticeable when on the highly entertaining Disney transport. Yes this hotel is not the cheapest option by any means but it was worth every penny. Unfortunately now on our future visits to see the Mouse my wife will not stay anywhere else and to be honest I don't either. lol. . We loved every minute of it. Would we recommend to a friend ? Yes we already have... and when booking a separate holiday when we came back with Florida blues I even talked in a total stranger that we met in the Travel Agent's to book there!!!

Reviews.Title: “FLAWLESS HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: justadude1986
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. It was amazing! The rooms were great! The staff was great! The pool was great! The food was AMAZING. Forget paying money to go to Africa... stay at this resort. I've stayed at plenty of Disney resorts but this one takes the cake. Well worth every dollar spent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, Amazing, 100% Disney Magic”
Reviews.Author: Torsie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL from October 1st-15th 2010 and booked a Standard View room for 14 nights on the special offer “14 nights for the price of 10”. (We had originally booked to stay at Port Orleans French Quarter, but I checked the rates frequently and one day it was only an extra £300 odd for the upgrade so I couldn’t resist! We had a very long journey as we got a connecting flight (with Delta who were amazing) and used Disney’s Magical Express service from MCO and we arrived at AKL at around 8.30pm. When we were checking in I mentioned it was a special trip for us (wedding planning) and cheekily asked if there was any possibility of upgrading to a Savannah View room. The check in lady looked at me a little confused and said we already had a Savannah View – result! We had the most amazing room location, if they had given us a map of the resort and said ‘choose your room’ it would have been very close by! We were less than a minute from the lobby overlooking the main (Arusha) savannah. And close enough to the Arusha overlook that if we opened our balcony door we could hear the African music that they play from the back of the lobby. Magical! Our room was the best Disney Resort room we’ve had (also stayed at Disneyland Paris resorts – Hotel New York, Disneyland Hotel and Sequoia Lodge) and mousekeeping were amazing. We had lovely towel animals and an awesome congratulations card from Mickey and Minnie. Everyday we saw loads of animals, and there was a cow/antelope guy who would come within 2 feet of our balcony as he was smart enough to get past the fence so he could eat and sleep in a certain bush he liked. Before our trip I was a little worried about the bus service to the parks (we didn’t rent a car) as on a map the Resort is far out from the rest of WDW but we never waited long (except for Downtown Disney/Typhoon Lagoon buses which were sometimes 20 minutes) and the longest journey to the Magic Kingdom was only around 15 minutes. We ate at all 3 restaurants, we thought the Mara (quick service) was great, and offered a good selection, we had breakfast and dinner at Boma (buffet) we really enjoyed dinner but weren’t too impressed with breakfast. The best meal of our trip was in Jiko (Signature restaurant) the service was amazing and food was fresh and delicious, we’ll definitely be back. The staff (like in all of Disneyworld) were second to none, on our arrival night my fiancé had a bad headache, so I ventured out on my own to find the restaurant and buy us some drinks and snacks, as I got to the lobby I saw a Cast Member and asked him the way to the Mara, he walked me the whole way and we had a great conversation. On another occasion we asked the concierge desk if there was any possibility of seeing the suites as we were considering staying there again for our wedding trip, they were so helpful and showed us the beautiful vice presidential suite and also advised us to go over to Kidani Village to see the 1 bedroom villas. Kidani is a short 10 minute walk away and is definitely worth visiting, the lobby is like a small version of Jambo house and is beautifully done. We loved everything about Animal Kingdom Lodge, but the question is “will we be back?”.... We’ve rebooked already! This time we have opted to pay the extra for a Savannah view as it was so amazing looking over the main savannah that we wanted to benefit of being able to request an Arusha view room. This is for the first 5 nights of our wedding and honeymoon trip and we have raved about AKL so much that our family and friends have also booked to stay at the resort. We can’t wait to be back! Jambo!

Reviews.Title: “Long Weekend in Disney (Thur-Sun)”
Reviews.Author: BMR2723
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Disney properties in the past (Caribbean Beach, Port Orleans, Fort Wilderness) and I can honestly say that the consistency I have experienced at all these properties is worth it in my opinion to spend a few extra dollars and stay in Disney. Regardless of the level of accommodation you choose, you will truly enjoy your "Disney Experience". This time around at the Animal Kingdom, Disney did not fail to disappoint. Rooms: Spacious, clean, comfortable beds/pillows! The balcony and views of the animals was a truly unique experience that could be enjoyed by guests of all ages. The property was quite large and we had one of the rooms at the very end of the property so it was a bit of a hike (especially after full days of walking) but it was very quiet and private! Staff: I would love to attend an orientation for Disney employees, they are all so friendly and welcoming regardless of their position. Their Disney personality shines through and makes the experience enjoyable. Activities: It was cool to see how many activities they had for children at the resort, just when you felt you had too much to do, Disney throws a few more things your way. Food: Did not eat at the resort for dinner, had a snack - I'm a picky eater and do not like spicy food, I had a pizza with spices on it that I could not handle, but me knowing my eating habits I should have just ordered a cheese pizza - ha, ha! Loved the shampoo and soap - and you can even buy it at the gift shop (I guess they got wise to people grabbing a few extra souvenirs off of the maids carts - they are now locked up :)). Free transportation anywhere on the property and the Disney Magical Express is yet another added value option, frequent buses coming to and from the hotel - rarely had to wait longer than 5 minutes, and we were there on off season. Make sure you check out the night vision goggles and explore the hotel as they have a mini museum scattered throughout the property.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great theming!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisTUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom lodge for 4 nights as part of our Disney Wedding package back in April 2008. In total we were a group of 24 guests and every single one of us thought that the hotel was fantastic. The theming is great, the staff are friendly and attentive, the Boma buffet restuarant was superb and the rooms were very spacious. We had a Savannah room which gave us the added benefit a being able to view the animals in what seems to be a comfortable and roomy environment. Its worth noting that the best time to view the largest variety of animals is before 10am as it tends to get too hot for them after that. The free Disney shuttle service is also something that should be taken advantage of. They pick up from outside the main entrance and drop you at most locations within the resort. The seemed to be running very frquently and late into the night which is great if you are watching one of the firework shows etc. The only slightly negative comment that I would have is that the pool area can get very overcrowed and the pool itself isn't that big considering the overall size of the hotel. Other than that is an absolutely fantastic hotel to stay in!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: vacationmom11
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults and 11 and 13-year-old sons)just got back from our 9 days vacation. We had our reservation at the Wilderness Lodge for 8 nights, but after visiting the Animal Kingdom Lodge on our second day (we had a dinner reservation there at Boma restaurant), we decided to switch over to the Animal Kingdom Lodge. ( So we ended up with staying at WL for 4 nights and Animal Kingdom Lodge for 4 nights. We are very thankful they let us.) The Wilderness Lodge was not that bad, but we all felt like it was not a deluxe hotel at all; room was dark and filthy, no music, staff was not very friendly, and it just did not give us the feeling of being on vacation there.. On the contrary, the Animal Kingdom Lodge was much clearner and funner, staff was friendlier, and made us feel like we were welcomed and were on vacation! Every time we came back from the theme parks, the staff greeted us saying, "welcome home!" The food at Boma was excellent as well. I loved their desert!!!! This was my 4th time visiting WDW, and I must say, the Animal Kingdom Lodge was my favorite, and the Wilderness Lodge was my least favorite. The only complain I had about this hotel was the bed; the matress was way too soft and squakeeeeeeeeeeeey..

Reviews.Title: “awesome”
Reviews.Author: duke147
Reviews.Content: this place was great, very clean, great disney service, saw several animals through out the grounds, at night they provided night vision goggles to see the animals - food was good (only had breakfast there), and very reasonable in terms of price - yes its a bit further out, but i liked that - it made it quieter. i would go back tomorrow if i could

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel...with three year old and infant in tow”
Reviews.Author: lew13
Reviews.Content: So before our trip, I carefully studied TripAdvisor and read all the reviews of the different Disneyworld Resorts. Whenever I read about Animal Kingdom Lodge, review after review mentioned the bus service to and from Magic Kindom. Needless to say, I was a bit hesitant and worried that we would be spending half our trip waiting on buses/riding buses. Either we had impeccable timing each time we caught a bus, or Disneyworld bought more busses to shuttle between the hotel and magic kingdom. Not once did we wait more than a couple of minutes for a bus. With that being said, it is true that Animal Kingdom is farther away than anything else, but I knew that going in, so it didn't bother me. One piece of advice....thank the bus drivers, and make sure your kids do as well. First of all, it's the polite thing to do, and they work hard and do a good job. Second, sometimes they have little trinkets in their pockets to give to kids. As it relates to the rest of the trip, my wife and I are convinced Disney has thought of everything when they planned the Disneyworld complex. The greatest was the Magical Express to and from airport. If you are traveling with kids, or if your wife packs too much, you need to sign up for this. It made our airport portions of the trip much less stressful. At Animal Kingdom, make sure to get the savannah view...it is worth it. our kids loved waking up in the morning and going out on balcony to say good morning to the animals. Only downside was that the pillows weren't great...bring your own if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Disney Hotel, but a bit far from the parks”
Reviews.Author: Izzy35
Reviews.Content: We did enjoy our stay at AK Lodge (Jambo House). The lobby, although a bit dark, was spectacular. The room was nice and clean. We paid for a regular room, but were given a partial savannah view, which was great. My daughter really liked the pool, especially the slide. The only downfall was the distance from the Magic Kingdom where we spent most of our time (approx. 30 minutes by shuttle). However, transportation was very easy and stress free.

Reviews.Title: “Can I live here?”
Reviews.Author: Luvavaca
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. The lobby is beautiful and the rooms, while small, have a nice decor. I I loved the exotic feel. The staff was warm and friendly. I am sucker for a good breakfast buffet and theirs was excellent. I would go back for the food alone. We booked a Savanna room through an intermediary and was at the end of the hall. This a really long walk to the elevators and we did not see any of the big ticket animals-just some deer looking creatures. Next time I am going to try and be closer to the elevator and the view of the animals.

Reviews.Title: “Great, Convenient Family Trip to Disney with Small Children”
Reviews.Author: ETraveler_2010
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge April 25th - April 20th 2010. We booked out trip through DreamMakers Vacation. Lynda is the Disney specialist and provided great support and information through our booking process! She helped with restaurant reservations, booking changes, and information about all of the Disney properties. Another bonus is that if you refer family or friends to DreamMakers, they offer you a gift card as a thank you for referring their service. When looking for a hotel/resort to stay at during vacation, rooms and cleanliness are VERY important to me. I know people say that you don't spend a lot of time in the room, however, for me it is critical that the room is clean, well maintained, decent decor, and good service. I found all to be the case at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge. My family and I consisting of myself, my husband, and a 3 and 1 year old stayed at the main lodge along with my sister's family who were in a room across the hall (She also has a 3 and 2 year old) back in April and we all had a wonderful stay. The PROS are as follows: -Listed as Deluxe Property -Clean Room -Seeing the Animals - We had a partial Savannah view room. Every morning/day we saw all types of exoctic animals including Zebras, Giraffes, Gazels, Antelope, and some animals I dind't even recognize! The children loved it! It was a daily trip to the zoo! -Great Customer Service (The mini fridge in our room wasn't working and one of the wonderful folks in housekeeping came to help fix the problem. The temp control just needed to be turned down to allow the ice to thaw. In the meantime she brought a container full of ice for us to keep the water, juice, and milk we brought for the children) -More on Great Serive - We used Disney's Magical Express to and from the hotel so we wouldn't have to manage our bags and the children. The hotel has a airline and baggage check in right in the front. You can check in your bags there and again not have to carry the luggage to the airport. The day before our departure, the Magical Express Service had our boarding passes AND luggage tags printed out. All we had to do was to take the bags downstairs, get them weighed, and wait for our shuttle. Even if you don't take the Magical Express, the luggage and airline check in is available for guests of the hotel -Great Restaurants - We were on the dining plan which consisted of 1 Snack, 1 Quick Serivce, and 1 Sit Down meal per day per person (excluding the 1 year old who you don't have to pay for) The restaurants in the hotel were wonderful! Mara was the quick service which just means it's cafeteria style. But the food was good and they always had plenty of options! Jiko was the fine dining. We ate there our first night and used up 2 of our sit down meals a peice for this treat. The food was excellent as well as the atmosphere and ambiance. Keep in mind we were dining with a 3 and 1 year old in an enviornment which reminds me a little of steakhouse and the servers were all VERY accommodating to the children and no one (including the staff and other diners) seemed to mind the baby's talking during the meal. Finally Boma is the buffet. We had dinner there one night and breakfast on the day of departure! Excellent cuisine! Animal Lodge has an African Theme and all of the restaurants offered cuisine from Africa. However, diners will be delighted to find that you had many choices including a Kid's section of the buffet which had chicken fingers, french fries, mini pizzas, etc. These were options as well as the falafel, cous cous, salmon, and some other ethnic dishes from that region. All the restaurants were great! TIP ON RESTAURANTS - If you are okay planning some of your tirp, make your meal time reservations for the sit down meals in advance. Even if you call the same day it's better to have the reservation to guarantee quick seating if the restaurant happens to be crowded at that particular time. We didn't have a problem with walking up but reservations are great and pretty much accepted everywhere except the quick service dining areas. Location - Disney's Animal Kingdon is obviously the closest Theme park to the lodge. However, the shuttle service was excellent. We never waited more than 10 or 15 minutes for a shuttle. Plus the hotel had shuttle stops to Hollywood Studios, Animal Kingdom, Epcot, one of the Water Parks, and Downtwon Disney. These were all of the places we were interested in going to. Given we didnt' have a rental car (by design) we got everywhere we wanted to go easily with the children. -POOL The pool was great especially for young children and had a great water slide. They also offered free floating vests and had them in different sizes from babies, to toddlers, to older children! I thought that was great! CONS: Really not many. I thought the hotel was great. The rooms were a little small but we had two children and a crib. Upon check in we inquired about getting an upgrade which the representative happily looked into for us. If we wanted to pay more money we could have received the upgrade. The villas side may have had more room but is a bit of a walk to the main lodge where all of the main restaurants are located. This would not have been a problem if we didn't have the smaller children WI-FI The only other conern was that you had to pay to get internet access. There was a daily fee of over $10. All in all it was a great vacation. Again, booking through DreamMakers Vacation made it even simpler. Lynda booked the hotel (which we got at a 40% discount due to a Disney promotion), our flights, the Magical Express, and our meal plan all in one. It didn't cost us anything extra to book with DreamMakers and they also offer the insurance plan for unexpected cancellations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - very expensive too eat in!”
Reviews.Author: crumbleSouthWales
Reviews.Content: Firstly we arrived and were updated to a Savanah view - this was brilliant and we engaged in the animals that currently reside in the Savanh - however these are limited to Secretary birds, Zebra, Giraffes, and antelope and buffalo - there are vultures and flimingoes within the hotel itself. The rooms are extremely clean however could do with a bit of a make over at present. Staff are as expected with Disney excellent and out of all the hotels there was no pressure to tip. This became a problem this year as suggested tipping and actual given. The dollar and pound is poor hence my husband found ourselves tipping over £20.00 for a meal at Boma very very expensive - we eat three times twice in the evening and once at Breakfast - for a Breakfast it cost us £56.00 and get ready a meal for three adults £95.00 - £130.00. If you can eat out much recommended however if stayins you you need to experience the types of foods on offer and you take with you a lovely memory. As with everything it's full on Disney but the hotel has an extensive package for children but it's not really recommended as a Family hotel - my teenager found it hard to find friends of her own age. Albeiit the hotel and service was lovely and well worth doing but my time in America is over _ I'm afraid this holiday proved very very expensive but well worth it. Be prepared to walk as the rooms are far apart and take forever to get too! lots of walking when tired could do with a room closer to the doors.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel would go back - book savanna room - worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: sjb2173
Reviews.Content: Went to Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge with husband and 2.5 yr old for a week, 1st trip to Florida/America. Hotel beautiful, room good size and lovely, had a 2nd floor savanna room - amazing, giraffes, zebras etc - at all times of day, daughter loved it. Booked with virgin and paid for the deluxe dining package - worth the money as food prices expensive (as you would expect in 5 star) - bit of a minefield to work out what you could have at 1st but good as you could use them for character breakfasts etc. Pool and slide great and really good childrens playground. Childrens food in Boma for evening buffet could have been better - more choice, ate in a la carte rest (can;t remember name) 3 x as childrens meals of much better standard. Was a bit of a pain having to make reservations for restaurants - yes even if you are actually staying in the hotel - as guests from outside can eat there too - even for breakfast - we often went as they opened and just walked in - but make reservations before you go away even if you don't use them you have still got them - especially if going in peak season and if you want any character breakfasts/dinners or you will be disappointed. Free Disney park buses great and every 20 mins from hotel, staff very friendly and helpful. Make sure you budget for tips though - we spent $125 in a week and we did not always tip if service not up to paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience for Entire Family”
Reviews.Author: FirstMate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled extensively and are not easily impressed. That said, we had an exceptional experience at AKL. We were traveling with two children (2 and 4) and two grandmothers. We had two adjoining rooms on the 4th floor with Concierge level access. From check-in to check-out, the staff was pleasant but not intrusive, the room and lodge spotless, and the service efficient. Highlights included: - abundant wildlife on the savannah outside our balcony - BOMA (hands down the best buffet experience I have had) - the pool & kiddie play area at Kidani Village (the adjoining building to the Jambo House) - the breakfast, evening snacks, and African beer in the Kilimanjaro Club were well worth the extra $$ - the bus service to/from the lodge to the theme parks was surprisingly prompt and efficient -- we never waited more than 10 minutes All in all, a great experience. Our children thoroughly enjoyed themselves, and so did we.

Reviews.Title: “A 'wild' Disney experience!”
Reviews.Author: Sueshaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a standard room in Jambo House (Kudo wing) but were lucky to have a view of the savannah without paying the extra money. It was lovely having breakfast on the balcony watching giraffes and zebras feeding below. The rooms themselves were nicely themed and clean but a bit on the dark side. The pool area had good facilities including spa pools and a bar. The lobby was very impressive and again highly themed. Off the lobby was a quiet sports bar and the restaurants. We avoided Boma as it was always crowded and noisy. However we did eat at Jiko and thoroughly enjoyed the fare - definitely to be recommended. Mara was adequate for breakfast and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Airplane pillows, paper sheets, & beet salad.”
Reviews.Author: Jen74247
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (we are 30 yrs old with no children) frequent Orlando and wanted a nice resort for a getaway. We stayed at the Kidani Village, upgraded to a suite, and had a savanna view. The room was very small considering we paid extra for a suite and the bed was very uncomfortable. The pillows were half the size of a standard. Think airplaine pillows...seriously. The sheets were like paper and with every move they crinkled and crunched. Despite that, the room was very clean, well decorated in the African theme, and had a peaceful feel to it. The staff was friendly and personable. Just a few things to be aware of though: the resort is fairly isolated so it's convenient to eat on site. But ALL of the restaurants serve African food. We are talking watermelon and beet salad with tandoori chicken. No joke. It did not appeal to us so we ate every meal off site. The tv in the room has NO movie channels. You cannot get any on-demand or pay movies. The pool was overcrowded with kids. And lastly, the hotel overlooks a savanna with animals...this is why people come here. The animals are fun to watch but don't expect a whole herd to gallop towards your window. We had one lone wildebeast that grazed nearby. If your looking to be entertained by the animals, you will be...for about 10 minutes. In conclusion, this was not the romantic getaway we had in mind. Next time, we will go back to one of our favorite resorts: Universal's Portofino Bay Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but will stay closer to Magic Kingdom Next Time”
Reviews.Author: caps8fan
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and two daughters (5 & 2) to Disney over Thanksgiving. We left early to catch the first bus to the parks every day and came back late exhausted. We never got to experience the lagoon style pool which was beautiful. The grounds were well kept and we were upgraded to a Savannah view room upon arrival. The staff was friendly and courteous. The room was clean but small. We are used to much larger hotel rooms. We would have liked to have an extra day to hang around the hotel and just spend the day at the pool. The bus was very crowded to/from parks and it got to be too much for our family after a couple days. Trying to deal with two kids falling asleep every night on the bus along with strollers, bags, etc. was too much. Especially, since the Animal Kingdom it is the last stop and a 20 minute ride from MK, Epcot, etc. It was a very nice hotel, but we will choose stay at a Disney Property closer to MK next time. Can't wait to take the family back to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not deluxe”
Reviews.Author: holmes97
Reviews.Content: The rooms at DAKL are smaller than moderate resort rooms. Standard rooms are right at the parking area (lots of noise) and guest smoking areas (gross). The benefit from DAKL from a moderate is the ease of access from rooms to restaurants, pool, stores, activities, etc. As far as the expansive savannah with animals: three giraffes, a couple of zebras, some pelicans.... Its nice, but certainly not deluxe.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING!!!”
Reviews.Author: G-marieC
Reviews.Content: I only stayed her for one night to catch a disney cruise. But the hotel was amazing rooms were clean and well decorated. the staff were very helpful. the hotel animals were amazing, it was hard to believe that i was staying in a room and looking out off my balcony and seeing animals strolling around. I wish i stayed much longer!!!!Fantastic!!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay at a different hotel at Disney World! This was zen at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: alliecallie
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 9 day stay May 7- May 16 and my sister had to peel me out of the hotel to get on the bus to go home. This resort was breathtaking, fun, and relaxing all at the same time. I took this trip with my sister age 24 and I am 27. Have stayed on Disney property many times but this was my first time at AKL. (see my profile for review on Carribean Beach). I'll start my review with an awesome money saving tip! Since I was staying for 9 nights there was a huge price difference for a savannah view vs a pool view. I booked the pool view, but I also booked the Waynama safari. All safaris are for concierge guests- but Waynama is open to ANY guest of the lodge. It was $175 per person, and we got to see EVERY SINGLE ANIMAL AT THE LODGE UP CLOSE!! You get in an open 'bus'/trailer with bench seating. The tour is limited to 12 people so you get to have all of your questions answered on the animals. You get to see the barns where they keep the animals, learn all the animals names, and fun facts about them. (like one animal had sinus problems and has seen 3 different ENTs for it, and learn which animals are pregnant, etc). They pulled the truck RIGHT up to the animals and you got to take pictures of them- no zoom required! The safari also included dinner at Jinko (will talk about later in review). We saved a lot of money having the pool view and still got to see animals and learn so much about them! As for the pool view I was on the 3rd floor of Zebra trail. I didn't know what floor to ask for when I booked (Disney will often honor such requests if they can) but I was THRILLED with the 3rd floor. When you walk into the lodge you are on the 3rd floor- so I had no stairs/elevators to get to my room at night. Pool and all dining is on first floor but 2 flights of stairs is not bad at all! (we choose stairs over elevator to try and walk off that dining plan!) Our room was spotless and mouse keeping was wonderful. The pool view was very nice- of course we are in our 20s so the sight of a pool bar is a gorgeous site to us! :) It was a very quite room- even though the pool is open 24 hours- never really had any problems with noise. As with all disney resorts I could hear other peoples toilets flush, but never talking, tv, etc. I had read on Trip Advisor that the rooms are very dark. This is true- but only a problem at night. Its very dim in the lodge in the evening so the animals can have their normal sleep cycle. (thats what our safari guide told us). I enjoyed coming home to a quiet place in the evening- it was relaxing walking back to your room. If you will need to put on make up at night- bring a mirror with a light. Or if you have small kids afraid of the dark- a night light to plug in. Leaving your curtains open won't be a lot of light. During the day we just did our make up by the patio window (they have a table by it) and we had no problems at all with the lighting. We ate in all 3 restaruants that AKL had to offer. (we were on disney dining plan) Mara is the quick service location and is more of a food court. Breakfast was your standard mickey waffles, eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon, and an assortment of rolls and muffins. Lunch and dinner were not my favorite at this location. I tried the cheese flatbread but it was literally cheese with little to no sauce on a cracker. It wasn't filling or tasty. Another night I tried a chicken pita which was better- but nothing to rave about. My sister is a vegan and had a hard time finding things here because even the hummus had cheese in it. If you are self pay breakfast was ~$6 per adult, lunch and dinner ~$12-15 per adult Bohma was the buffett place and we ate breakfast here twice. (if self pay breakfast was I believe ~$30 per adult). It was really good- it did not have a lot of "african" offerings at breakfast (I hear it does at dinner) but they had scrambled eggs with goat cheese and chives (AMAZING) and an African oatmeal that is high in protein. Otherwise, it had standard breakfast fare, eggs, omlets made to order, pancakes, waffles, cereal, fruit, yougart, etc. Jinko is the place you HAVE to eat at it you stay at this hotel. We got to eat here after the safari and it was so good I made my sister go back! This place is very expensive if you are paying out of pocket (~$50 per adult) and costs 2 meals on the dining plan. It is WORTH it! Tried the nan with the spreads (hummus) and I could have licked the bowl clean. Had the steak with mac and cheese- and its the best steak in disney world! (beats canada Le Cellier in my opinion!) If you are looking for a place to really treat yourself- this is it! The most common complaint I had read in trip reports was the busses. It is true- bus rides are longer from this resort then more centralized resorts, however, only by 5 or 10 minutes. My sister and I were there 9 days and NEVER waited more then 15 minutes for a bus. NEVER. You only have 2 bus stops at AKL- Kidani villiage and Jambo house. Kidani village is the vacation club place, and Jamo house is the big lodge itself. 2 bus stops is not a big deal at all. Especially after last year being at CBR. I don't think there are many disney resorts that Don't have more then one bus stop. Yacht club and beach club share a bus, Boardwalk and Swan and Dolphin share a bus, Polynesian and Contomparay share a bus, Grand Floridian and Wilderness Lodge share a bus, and then the moderates all have numerous stops with in them. So more then one bus stop is next to impossible to avoid unless you stay at Pop. One other thing that I LOVED about this resort were the cast members. Many of them grew up in Africa and gave power points about their home towns, or did presentations on the animals of their country. They were all so engaging and I learned so much about Africa from them! I also can tell the difference between a cheetah, jaguar, and lepord. The only negative thing I have to say about this lodge was I had a little bit of trouble with the front desk. I got sick with a sinus infection the last 3 days. I found a pharmacy that delievers (Turner Drug) and the front desk said they would call my room when my medicine arrives. Noone ever called, and when I went to the desk to ask them they could not find my medicine. I am a pharmacist- and so I was pretty confident that the pharmacy had delievered it. I called them and they said they had. It took the cast memeber 2 trips to the back before they found it- but they did find it. The cast member was nice about it- but being sick and miserable I just wanted my medicine. Over all animal kingdom lodge was beautiful. You can look at pictures, but until you are standing in the lobby, over looking the savannah, you can't appericate the beauty and detail. My sister and I wanted to try a new hotel every trip- but it will be hard not to stay at this hotel again. It was a wonderful experience and I would recommend it to anyone and everyone. : )

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED it!”
Reviews.Author: JoMich
Reviews.Content: My husband, two daughters (11 and 17) and I stayed at AK Lodge last August and loved it! All of the reviews were accurate--rooms are pretty small, but the lodge itself is amazing! The architecture and the entire "feel" is unique in our experience. For first time Disney visitors, this was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “My family loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: julesingeorgia
Reviews.Content: We booked a Savanna View Room Concierge Level with a 40% off pin code I received from Disney and really enjoyed it. It was nice sitting on our balcony watching the animals while drinking a beer from the Concierge Lounge. Our room was a bit on the small side but very updated and nicely decorated. Beds were comfy, and room very clean every day. The Concierge was more than helpful and the extra snacks were nice especially the beverages and breakfast. The lobby of this hotel is just amazing! My older teenagers loved the pool. We went to Mara the food court and I thought it was very small but there was never very many people in there so maybe small is ok. The only complaint I would have would be the bus system, waiting 25 minutes for a MK bus kind of messed up our morning, especially when we watched 2 Animal Kingdom buses come and go while waiting. If you are not in a hurry, the buses are fine, but if you are trying to get to the park for opening I would most definitely drive myself. I will stay here again and again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Exciting & Different”
Reviews.Author: JasonL2
Reviews.Content: We had a suite for our wedding there for 5 days that had a balcony. Every day there was different wildlife outside the room. The restaurants inside the resort were delicious and the overall theme was very fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great for traveling with young children”
Reviews.Author: dins95
Reviews.Content: We stayed at AKL for 4 nights and had a great time. It is a beautifully designed hotel which really transports you out of the whole Disney mindframe. I believe what really makes the hotel special is having the Savannah room and having the children be able to wake up to the sight of the animals. We would bring some breakfast food from the concierge level and let them eat breakfast on the balcony while watching giraffe, zebra and other animals, they really got excited about this. Animals were almost always visable, anytime of day. The rooms are small and dark, but the "dark" kind of fits with the Dark Continent theme of the hotel. Really, my only complaint of the hotel is the bus transportation home from parks. As people mentioned earlier it is not really an issue in the mornng getting to the paks but getting home is terrible. There seems to be fewer buses to AKL than other hotels even though it is the only Disney transportation available (no boat, monorail, etc). Also, it stops at the village first and usually picks up passengers to bring back to the main lodge. For instance, it took us over 45 minutes to get back from Animal Kingdom on day after waiting for the bus and taking over 10 minutes to load passengers to go back to Jambo House. (Disney, please put in a small dedicated shuttle to get people between the 2 if they need it) I am convinced it would have been faster to walk. One last thing on the transportation, if you are taking the Magic Express from the airport, be aware thet stop at 3 hotels before you get to AKL and then you stop at the village 1st as well. Really for a deluxe hotel I think they should have a different route. All and all, I think for parents traveling with younger children who would really would really get a kick out of being so close to the animals, AKL is a fantastic choice. PS- We had great meals at Jiko and ate there multiple diners and there is a pool with a slide at the main lodge but from what I gather it is not as elobrate as the village or some other hotels but it was plenty fine for the younger children that I think the hotel caters too.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Disney Resort, just a bit better”
Reviews.Author: Beaker40
Reviews.Content: We've been to Disney a million time and usually stay in one of the "Deluxe" resorts, if not the Cabins at Fort Wilderness (still my all time favorite). AKL is one of the newer resorts, and as such isn't beat up yet. VERY small room for the four of us, although the kids liked the bunk beds. We didn't pay for the savannah view, and good thing because all we saw out there were some birds. Only one restaurant serving lunch, but the menu was decent and they had items such as ready made sandwiches, fruit, yogurt, etc to go. Be prepared to walk as it's a large resort and everything is pretty spread out. Great pool. Other than always feeling like we got raped by that big eared rat every time we go, Disney does a pretty good job overall.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay”
Reviews.Author: CincinnatiTeflon
Reviews.Content: I just want to start off by saying that this was the trip of a lifetime for me. It was my 25th wedding anniversary with my husband and we spared no expense to make this a wonderful lasting memory. I researched for months, read many books and watched alot of reviews to have the most knowledge about Disney as I could to make a decision about our visit and finally wanted to stay at the Animal Kindgom Lodge. I thought it would so cool to watch the animals from our balcony on the Savannah view. I must say that I am a very low maintainance person and was disappointed with my stay here. We saved our money to go on this trip and it was not worth all the hype for this hotel. It was not until the 3rd day that we even saw any animals except some pelicans and a few birds and would not pay the extra money for this perk. There are plenty of public viewing areas and the little time you spend in the room coupled with the fact that the animals are far away and never out close to your room made me frustrated. We were up all times of the day also to try to catch the animals. We were on the Zebra trail and maybe there are some savannahs that are better than others but the pictures are not quite accurate. In order to get pictures of the animals up close I had to leave my room and run down to the public viewing area and snap some shots. That was crazy to me. That being said it was a beautiful hotel. Lobby very impressive. Very cool theming. Staff very nice and helpful. The restaurants were great. The pool was beautiful with lots of seating but we didn't use the pool. The rooms were nice. Beds comfy. Shower great. Mouse keeping was so good that with dusting under the tv they disconnected the tv and there was no manuel way of turning it on and it took 5 hours and 3 calls to front desk to get it fixed. It took 2 seconds for them to fix it. They told us we had to be in the room to do this so the one night that we wanted to explore the different savannahs was wasted in our room waiting for someone to fix the tv. They apologized for this and probably would have done compensation but I didn't want that, I just wanted my time back and my tv fixed sooner. The gift shop is awesome and and the buses were great going but not coming home. Never had to wait long on the buses to take us to the parks but had to wait long amounts of time to get the buses from the parks home. One night at magic kindom after fireworks we waited 40 minutes for a bus to come and load and then another 20 minutes to get to the hotel. We left early from Fantasmic to "beat the crowd" out of the park home from Hollywood Studios and had to wait 35 minutes to get a bus. It seemed as though they only had 1 bus running to our hotel when I saw multiple buses picking up for other hotels and there were long lines for people to go back to Animal Kingdom Lodge. I'm glad we stayed here to say we did, but out of all the places I could have stayed for the same money I wouldn't stay here again. It is still Disney and they do alot of things right. They try to think of everything from the dining plan to magical express, airline check in from the hotel, and everyone wishing us a Happy Anniversary due to the 25 year buttons they gave us to wear saying Happy Anniversary with Mickey and Minnie. It really was the trip of a lifetime!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!!”
Reviews.Author: jee901
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Disney. I did read the reviews for AKL before booking my trip and was somewhat apprehensive of staying there because of the mixed reviews. However, all I can say is "I can't wait to go back!!" For me, it was a wonderful experience. The staff was helpful and courteous at every turn.. Anything we asked for was provided almost immediately. The Savanna room was well worth the extra money. Being able to wake up after a long day at the parks and being able to relax on the balcony and watch the animals was awesome!! There were always different animals there every day. The reviews regarding being far from the parks is correct. However, I loved coming home to the seclusion of AKL after all the "hoopla" of the day. It was our haven. We never waited longer than 10 minutes for any bus and the drivers were wonderful!! All and all a wonderful experience and I suggest staying at this wonderful and beautiful resort!! Definitely exceeded my expectations in every way!!

Reviews.Title: “Savana View”
Reviews.Author: RU_McLovin
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a room with the savana view. The room was nice but by no means large. The resort was very nice, clean and well upkept. You can see the animals from all over. The view from our room was good. There should be no fear that you will not see anything in the rooms with a view our did not disapoint. I did not give it 5 stars, because of the cost and the size of the rooms. The experiance did not disapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to hype or price”
Reviews.Author: kwbrown
Reviews.Content: I went with my family to Animal Kingdom Lodge to celebrate my mother's birthday. We got a big discount for annual pass members, so at a price of $160 per night, it was a fair value (although the same or worse than other cheaper options like the Buena Vista Hilton); had I spent the $300 - $400 a room typically goes for, I would have been horribly disappointed. It simply didn't live up to the hype. I've stayed at nearly all of the Disney hotels, and this one fared on the low side. Everything was very, very dark... the room was so dim you couldn't read a book. The pool was satisfactory, but not nearly as elaborate as many of its competitors. It was nice to see the animals, but the novelty wears off... how long do you sit around and watch a giraffe? I get better views at the zoo. The food options are very limited - far less variety than at other Disney hotels. Rooms were cramped and already seem in need of an update. Overall it was nice to go once to check it off the list, but I feel no desire to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Jamberline
Reviews.Content: I have dreamed of staying at Disney Animal Kingdom Lodge since it was built and last Sept I stayed there using my DVC points, did it live up to my dreams and expectations - you bet it did! Everything about this hotel is fabulous from the rooms, to the animals and everything else in between. The studio room was beautifully themed, we had a pool view which was lovely with very comfortable beds and a flat screen TV. The usual separate wash basins, bath and toilet. As it was a DVC studio we had a small sink, fridge, coffee machine and toaster, crockery etc. - very useful. There was also an ironing board, an iron and a safe. We ate at Mara, Boma and Jiko and the meals in all were great. The shop has a varied and wide choice of goods with additional day to day things e.g. food, plasters, pain killers etc. The staff in the shop go 'the extra mile' to help you purchase or locate something special. The pool is large with life guards, plenty of sun beds, a slide and jacuzzis, sun and shade can be found as necessary. Free laundry facilities and internet access are available to DVC members. There are viewing spots throughout the property to see the animals, which of course are the 'stars of the show'! A stroll among the savannah sections almost always allowed the animals to be seen, so if a savannah view is out of your price range, don't panic as the animals are there for everyone to see. Yes, it is a longer trip to the Magic Kingdom but still no more than 20 minutes at the worst and it is worth the longer bus trip to be staying there. It's not that far to any of the other parks. Buses were frequent and regular, we never had a problem getting on one to go to where we wanted to be. Would I recommend this hotel, certainly. Would I stay there again, definitely and as soon as possible if I get my way!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay at Animal Lodge was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: TripReview909
Reviews.Content: The service we received at Animal Lodge was fanatastic! It was my sons first trip to Disney World and his eyes were as big as saucers the whole time. He loved watching the animals on the savannah while staying at the lodge. The lady in the gift shop was great, and she took the time to tell us about the animals and the lodge. The buses ran on time, and it sure was nice to get dropped off right at the front door to the parks. The location, although a little further from the Magic Kingdom than the other parks, was not a problem at all. What I liked best about the lodge was the huge swimming pool with a waterslide, hot tub -- and the animals. The only bad experience I had during the entire stay was upon arrival the young man mishandling the luggage scratched my new truck (advice: do it yourself). I still give the lodge a 5 star rating and it was my best vacation ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Stay”
Reviews.Author: bobm128
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom Lodge is a beautiful piece of architecture. The lobby is gorgeous, the food very good, the rooms comfortable, and service is standard, high-quality Disney. The Savannah View guest rooms are a must – from them you can see giraffes, zebras, various cattle, many birds, and other wildlife. It’s a treat to sit on your balcony and watch the animals. Another thing I enjoyed at the AK Lodge was sitting in the bar and having a pot of good, loose leave tea. The breakfast buffet has many good food choices, including sufficient vegetarian selections. If there’s one minor issue with the AK Lodge is that it’s only conveniently located to the Animal Kingdom Park. Otherwise, it has some of the longest bus rides to the other parks; plan extra time to get to your destination if you stay here. In summary, it’s one of my two favorite Disney World Resorts (the other being the Contemporary) and I highly recommend it for those who want a unique and relaxing stay at Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “For a floridian that travels alot, i loved it!.”
Reviews.Author: Vintage_loveish
Reviews.Content: I go to diney alot, and have stayed at alot of the hotels and have never been dissapointed, I loved this hotel more then all the others, the staff was always nice, and for a disney hotel room is was nice sized, 9 if you stay at disney alot, you know the rooms arnt huge, but it dosnt matter, becuase You will be out of the room most of the day! all you will need it for is some eating and sleeping.) The pool was great and very big! and the beakfast are better then other disney hotels! around the hotel there are people statioined that can tell you about the animals and at night have night vison goggles so you can see the animals! i love this resort!. oh and if you are thinking about getting the dineing plan GET IT you can easly spend over 100 dollars a person a day and the meal plan helps you save money!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the View”
Reviews.Author: lakohls
Reviews.Content: Kidani Village section - Stayed in very large 2BR suite (1king room, 2 queens in 2nd BR, pullout sofa & oversize chair pullout in LR, and they provided 2 pack-in-plays - one in each BR closet standard) with 3 full bathrooms, Savanna View that easily accomodated our party of 8. Requested & received 2nd fl (which is actually main lobby level as the parking in under facility) near elevators. Our room location was perfect - close to pool, lobby, transportation. I would always request this - I could see how far a walk it could have been all around the savannah. Animals were out every day providing something for the 4 kids to watch and they took lots of photos. Surprisingly little noise from the hallways - despite large # of families over the easter/spring break week. Great water pressure - and the oversized shower stall with seating area was nice. All themed - even the tiles around the bathroom reminded me of a Lion King scene - a Disney standard. Resort is a little far from therest of the property, but buses arrived regularly. Pool on Kidani side is smaller than Jambo House (but we had access to both), and for small kids the splash area at Kidani is great. Also, Jambo House side has more eating options (3) and a larger gift shop area. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a view, are we still in Florida??”
Reviews.Author: PiccolaChef
Reviews.Content: My husband ,myself our 7 yr. old and Grandma all stayed in a 2 queen Savanna view room & the extra cost was well worth it. From the airport on the Magic Express we took advantage of the special tags and checked the lugged at the airport so we never had to lug anything around just went straight on the bus to the hotel. Once checked in we could go straight to the park, they would deliver our luggage to our room. We were running late to our Disney dinning reservation in Hollywood Studios so the hotel called ahead to save us. Buses for AKL don’t stop at other hotels but the time to MK does take 15-20 min. When we got back to the room the view wasn’t so great so we asked the front desk if we could have a better view, no problem they changed rooms right away and we were very pleased (rm 4517). The instant we got there a Giraffe was at our balcony & a Wildebeest was napping just under it incredible, you really feel like your somewhere special we forgot we were in Florida our daughter couldn’t wait to wake up in the morning to see what animal was stopping by to say hi. Very clean plenty of room for the 4 of us , with a fridge & table for snacks. It doesn’t hurt to ask to change rooms if you don’t like the one they give you, it worked out great for us! The lobby is breath taking and they have little sitting areas just to hang out and an area set up with a TV like a family room. The shop is nice and also has a little food mart in it to stock up that fridge with drinks & snacks. As for the food we only ate at Boma for breakfast and it was fantastic I’m a personal Chef so I can be very critical about restaurants. We ate at several other restaurants on the Deluxe dining plan the only complaint was every place is slow give yourself at least 2 ½ hrs for table service not sure why as all the restaurants have a set menu with only a few choices. The Coral Reef was everyone’s favorite. The hallways are large and open in some areas for viewing the Savanna , the resort is kinda shaped like a giant horseshoe with the Lobby at the bottom it is very large but it didn’t seem to take long to get around. My mother In law couldn’t do a lot of walking so we rented a Stay Cool scooter from AA Tourist Rentals, they delivered it to the hotel and we charged it right outside or hotel room door. It really was a life saver easy to use and great for our 7 yr old to ride on Grandmas lap at check out the valet took care of the scooter. We only had 3 days so we didn’t get to check out the pool but we did enjoy just walking around the hotel checking out the scenic views and they have night vision binoculars to see the animals at night. Overall we had a great time we left feeling like we needed to stay just one more day just t enjoy the hotel. We would definitely stay at this hotel again but I think I would get the bunk bed room for added fun.

Reviews.Title: “AKL Still my Favorite Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: wlb1204
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the AKL in mid May for a conference I was attending. The conference was held at the Westin Dolphin, but we elected to stay at AKL. The lodge is lovely, albeit large. The rooms are on the small side, but clen and comfortable. It's the ever changing savannah views which bring us back. The lodge restaurants are our favorite hotel options and this year Sanaa has overcome Jico as our preferred dinner spot. Boma is definitely interesting, but be ready for nearly overwhelming levels of noise and frenetic activity throughout your meal. We selected concierge level again for this trip, but it offers only two advantages for us. The first is nearly continous snack and appetizer options. My Dw must be fed almost every two hours to prevent "the vapors". Secondly, this level offers access to the sunrise and sunset safaris which are THE way to ecperience both the Park, and the Lodge wildlife. If you don't want or need either of these, skip the Concierge level.

Reviews.Title: “"Welcome Home"”
Reviews.Author: helloson
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we've stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge (now known as Jambo House), and it is by far my favourite Disney resort. On both trips we have been upgraded to a Savannah view room free of charge. Ten days prior to our reservation date, I contacted the hotel direct and requested a free upgrade. Although rooms aren't allocated until the day of arrival, I was told that my request had been noted. I'm not sure it made any difference, but we did get the upgrade so I would say it's worth a try (you don't get if you don't ask). The hotel is beautifully themed and all of the staff extremely helpful. When we checked into the hotel, we told the cast member on reception that it was our 4 year olds first trip to Disney World. He made a huge fuss of our son and gave him a 'first visit' badge and some stickers. Needless to say that (combined with the free room upgrade) got our holiday off to a great start. There are lots of activities for small children and African Guides are always on hand to answer any questions. One of the guides spent time with my 4 year old, writing Swahili and Zulu words in his Epcot passport. The food in the hotel is of good quality (even in the quck service restaurant). It can be quite a walk fom the lobby to your hotel room, but it's worth it when you get to see Zebra and Giraffe walking past your window. The location of the hotel is both a plus and minus. Although the hotel is quite a way from the parks, obviously with the exception of Animal Kingdom Park, it is only a mile away from a whole host of shops, supermarkets and restaurants located on the Irlo Bronson Memorial Highway. I would recommend hiring a car as the bus transportation is slowed by the addition of the Kidani Village. The bus now dives past Jambo House to pick up and drop off at Kidani first. This is an inconvenience when being collected in the morning as the bus sometimes arrived almost full. After a tiring day in the parks, it was also an irritation to have to drive past Jambo House to have to drop off other guests first. Security within the resort is excellent. Each time you return to the hotel, you are stopped at a security point and asked to show your room key or photo ID. Each time your identity is validated the cast members greet you by saying 'Welcome Home' and after a few days, you really do feel as if you have come home. I would recommend the hotel to anyone who enjoys feeling that extra bit special when on holiday. It really is a treat to be immersed in such a brilliantly themed hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Some Great Things, Some Not-So-Great”
Reviews.Author: wintersummer
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and enjoyed our stay. With that said, here's the rundown on my thoughts: Rooms - we had room with 2 queen beds and boy, was it small! We only had 2 carry-on suitcases, with just 2 of us, and it was tight. I'm not sure how a family with lots of luggage would manage. You are paying a lot for these rooms, because they are Disney rooms - but the bathroom part of the Animal Kingdom Lodge rooms remind me of less expensive motel bathrooms. Bathroom was not outright dirty, but could have used a good cleaning. Walls were splattered with assorted things (toothpaste? cosmetics? hairstuff? who knows what?). Room location - We were at end of hallway and it was really quiet. Walk from the lobby took about 5 minutes. Savanna view was average. I'd recommend staying closer to the main part of lodge. Service - absolutely exceptional! The cultural programs, with representatives from various countries in Africa, were wonderful. Dining - We ate at Jiko, Boma, and Saana. All were wonderful, with great food and great service. The fast food type restaurant (Mara) was just average, nothing really special. Convenience - the hotel is really convenient to Animal Kingdom but not to other hotels and parks. If you're going to be visiting a number of parks and want easy transport between dining options and parks, I'd consider staying someplace more accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere for kids!”
Reviews.Author: SaschaYork_PA
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge and we really, really enjoyed it. The atmosphere was great and my kids (aged 14 and 4) loved the safari animals. We booked a standard room and are glad we didn't upgrade-- we were rarely in our rooms long enough to have enjoyed a more expensive view. Plus, there are so many observation areas around the hotel that you are sure to see plenty of animals without having to pay the extra money for a Savahanna view. The pool was what really made this hotel great. The zero depth pool really made it feel like you are swimming in a watering hole. It was never overly crowded and the waterslide was perfect for both of my boys. Again they rarely had to wait in a long line to go down the water slide. Word of warning though -- we went in August and there was pretty much an afternoon thunderstorm every day. They will make everyone get out of the pool if there is thunder and lightening. So be prepared to take a little break and return later. The food was EXPENSIVE!! We did not purchase any of the Disney dining plan options. Next time we will. We primarily ate at the Mara cafe (Quick service) because the other restaurants seemed to have a long wait and were much more expensive. The Mara was okay though limited in choices if you eat there pretty much every morning. What we didn't know is that the room had a refrigerator and there is a staple of food supplies that you can purchase at the gift shop. We didn't realize this until about 4 days into our trip. The food supply area is kind of off to the side of the gift shop and you could easily miss it. So I recommend stocking up when you get there if you don't want to spend tons of money on food. Transportation -- it took a LONG time to get to the Magic Kingdom and Disney's Downtown area. So be prepared. We tried to take advantage of the early magic hours ... well it seems that everyone else was as well so the buses get crowded. Especially to the Magic Kingdom. If you use Disney's Magical Express-- Animal Kingdom Lodge is the very LAST stop on the way in, and the first stop on the way out. So basically, be prepared to be on that bus for an hour or more. That took a while. It was very convinient, but definitely took a while. The room was fine. I guess for the price you expect more, but it wasn't bad. The beds were really, really squeeky and noisy though. The first night we didn't get much sleep but after that we were all so tired from having been at the parks all day we slept fine. There are a couple of laundry rooms that came in handy as well. We used these at least twice. It was quite a walk from our room, but worth it to not have to pack as many clothes and get to wash them. We brought our own laundry supplies (those new detergent/softner sheets are small to pack and worked great!). Overall we would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Glorious Savannah”
Reviews.Author: Cnt_find_my_way_home
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in several Disney accommodations (Grand Floridian & Port Orleans) this one is worth the stay. Upon arrival I suffered a migraine and the staff were spot on in helping my husband get medication. When I finally could stand the light I discovered giraffes and wildebeasts grazing right under our balcony. I felt transported to my dream vacation in Africa. I looked forward to returning to our room each afternoon just to watch the show from our room. The menu offerings ranged from children's staples to the exotic. The staff took time to educate us on their home and life from various countries in Africa. The lobby if filled with historical artifacts and there are observation areas in various locations to view the savannah. This hotel is worth saving up the extra funds to enjoy a truly unique vacation. This is a don't miss hotel. We had conversations with couples (like us) who traveled w/o children (some of us still luv Disney) and return to this hotel for its world class service and natural wonders.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Magic!”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsFourOnTour
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks last Easter in the Animal Kingdom Lodge. Loved waking up to see the animals outside our window - made each day feel special right from when you wake up. Like all the Disney Resort Hotels the convenience of the shuttle buses, magic hours and being able to just carry the door card to pay for everything on your room made for a relaxed and easygoing holiday. We liked the fact that the hotel was not "full-on" disney themed and so and made a break from all the parks. Room service ffod was excellent and reasonably priced so dinner on the balcony looking at the animals was a big fave. Restaurants were superb but more pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: cricketrb
Reviews.Content: While Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge was beautiful, making guests feel like they were in fact in Africa, it missed the mark. Guests stay at the hotel because they love the Disney experience. When you are in other resorts by Disney, you can’t miss the magic all around you as the Disney characters are at every turn. At the Lodge, Disney is missing. I thoroughly enjoyed their table service restaurants Boma and Jiko. Their quick service cafeteria however, left much to be desired. For a deluxe resort, the menu was small, their food was edible but bland and there was inadequate seating, even during the slow season. I will never return to the Lodge and suggest you don’t either. Next time, it is back to the Caribbean Beach Resort or even Pop Century for that matter.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: chriscarm
Reviews.Content: My husband, 16 year old son & I stayed here for 6 nights in a room in Jambo House. The foyer is breathtakingly big and beautiful & definitely has the WOW factor when you walk in the door. The rooms however are not so breathtaking. Out of all the hotels we stayed in on this holiday around USA, this was by far the smallest room. The room itself had two queen sized beds, a small desk & chair, a cabinet with the tv and a small fridge. There was very little space anywhere else & we felt quite cramped, as this was near the end of our trip & we had quite a bit of luggage with nowhere to put it. The bathroom was absolutely tiny with just the bath/shower & toilet in a separate room. The vanity was open space adjoining the bedroom. This was quite annoying, as there wasn't much room in the bathroom to get changed, so either had to do that or tell my son to stay on the other side of the wall while I got changed in the vanity area. We had a savannah view room, which cost more. I didn't think it was worth it, as the view wasn't anything special & most of the time, the animals weren't anywhere to be found. We actually saw most of the animals as we were walking to the foyer (which was miles away). There are 3 food places there - Boma Restaurant which was buffet style african themed food for around $30 per person (beautiful food), Jinko Restaurant - which was quite expensive, so we didn't eat there, or Mari - which was a help yourself fast food type place. As you can imagine, Animal Kingdom Lodge is very close to the Animal Kingdom Park, but quite a distance from the other theme parks. The Disneyworld buses run regularly from outside the lodge, so transport isn't a problem. Their gift shop is fantastic & we brought quite a few unique souvenirs from there. The pool, which looked beautiful, was closed for maintenance while we were there, but it was too cold to go swimming anyway, so we didn't care. We also had to pay for the internet. All in all, it was a beautiful hotel, but don't think I would stay there again because of the size of the rooms and the cost.

Reviews.Title: “First timers!”
Reviews.Author: NMStack
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney World and will not be our last. I will keep going back to this resort. Just amazing. We stayed in the Jambo House with a Savanna view room. Our 4 year old loved it. We had different animals outside our room every day. The rooms are not huge but you realize quickly that you won't spend much time there. The hotel staff was friendly we never had any issues. But be prepared to walk. The hotel is really big. The only complaint I heard was how far it was from the rest of the Disney parks. But the bus service that is offered never really made it an issue to us. We were 15 minutes from everything. The pool is great for young and old. Good bar and plenty of room. The Boma restaurant was not our style. But a bit of advise. Go to Downtown Disney for dinner. You don't need reservations. We spent just about every night there. We found out if you don't have reservations to the restaurants in the parks or resorts chances are you won't eat. From the minute we arrived in Orlando until the morning we left we were treated first class.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Savannah view. Watched giraffes...”
Reviews.Author: AroundNAround
Reviews.Content: Lovely Savannah view. Watched giraffes, zebras, eland, and all kinds of other animals from our balcony. Average size room. Nice fire pit outside with rocking chairs. Loved it. Only downfall no wireless Internet. Did have Internet for a fee of $9.95 for 24 hours which is crazy after the big price you pay for a room. Did not pay extra for it and was really agitated by this!

Reviews.Title: “Unfortunately, third time is NOT the charm...”
Reviews.Author: CharlestonNative
Reviews.Content: I am a huge Disney fan! I have visited Disney World 12 times over the past 10 years. I always stay at a Disney owned property since I love the full "Disney experience." In February, I took my 5 year old son for a mommy & me trip without dad or other siblings. I opted for the Animal Kingdom Lodge since I had stayed there 2 previous times with enjoyable results. Unfortunately, this time was not as great. We arrived on February 8 during the "value season." Although our room was ready by 10am, I was not pleased with the room. It was located overlooking a parking lot and directly next to an ice vending machine. I heard the ice drop while unloading our bags and immediately asked to move. The front desk granted me request and moved me to a room that had some bamboo in front of the balcony. (Little did I know that my room was directly above the designated outdoor smoking area.) While my son slept in the first morning I stepped outside to read the paper and have coffee on the balcony. The smoking area had 12 smokers enjoying their morning ritual too. I went back inside to the dark room and tried not to wake up my exhausted son. On day 2 I found peanuts behind a chair I moved. That would normally not bother me except that my son has a life threatening food allergy to peanuts. I quickly picked them up and flushed them down the toilet. I shudder to think what would have happened had he found them first. The room itself is nicely appointed. It's a nice touch to have a small fridge in the room and a coffee maker. The bathroom has double sinks too. The beds were comfortable and having a balcony was an added bonus...minus the location. Where this Disney property falls down on the job is its front desk. All 3 times I have stayed here I have been displeased with the attitude of the front desk employees. They have all been competent, but never friendly or accommodating. Overall, this hotel is worth its premium priceonly if you have the savana view room. Without it, you might as well stay at a moderate resort. The property is issolated and requires a lengthy bus ride to get to any park except the Animal Kingdom. (No convenience here.) My favorite deluxe resort is The Polynesian...big rooms, convenient monorail location, & always friendly staff!

Reviews.Title: “Best themed Disney Hotel, but a little too far from the other parks”
Reviews.Author: aprilisis
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in October 2009 (my second time) for a week. This resort is one of my favorites in Disney. It isn't cheap, but the Savannah view is worth it to see the animals every morning. The restaurants (Jiko & Boma) are outstanding. The pool is a lot of fun. The gift shop is great- they have a lot of unique merchandise. The lounge is really dark & quiet. There are a ton of activities for children and adults- just ask for a guide when you check in.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge WOW”
Reviews.Author: Macl1uk
Reviews.Content: Staying at Animal Kingdom Lodge is like having two different holidays at the same time, at the hotel you could be in Africa not in the middle of Disney. The hotel is thatched and everything is themed around Africa including the food. Zawadi Marketplace - the gift shop has a great selection of African artefacts including drums, Ostrich eggs, carved elephants, beads and there a few Disney gifts. Animal Kingdom Lodge is a fantastic hotel and there are plenty of viewing areas around the hotel to see the animals. We have recently returned from Animal Kingdom Lodge and this was out third time there. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is magical. We love Animal Kingdom Lodge in 2004 we stayed 16 nights and had a fantastic view of the Uzima Savannah even though we only paid the standard rate. In 2006 we returned for 21 nights and were initially given a room overlooking the car park, soon swapped to the Sunset Savannah, view was not fantastic, but again I only paid the standard room rate. 2009 we stayed for 15 nights and had a fantastic Savannah room (this time we paid for the upgrade). Each room has a reasonable size fridge (empty), a large TV and DVD player, coffee/tea making facilities, a mini wall safe and the usual hairdryer. I would recommend that you hire a car for the full period, especially staying at this hotel. Besides it being isolated, it is also expensive to eat at. This time we only ate at Mara in the hotel (self service), the rest of the time we ate off site. Boma was expensive in 2006 – we could have 2 meals at TGI Fridays for the price of one at Boma. At Easter 2009, one English couple with two kids had a meal there with a bottle of wine the total bill was USD150. Mara is the self service restaurant down by the pool, it is open from about 6am to 11pm, the lunch/evening menu includes stews, seafood platter & chips, burgers, pizzas, chapatti filled with ham, chicken nuggets as well as a reasonable selection of salads and fruit. They also sell refillable mugs which cost about USD13 each and you can refill them with hot and cold drinks (excluding juices) as many times as you like at your hotel during your stay and they are a great souvenir to take home, this compares with a charge per drink of USD2.50 if you do not use the refillable mugs. Unfortunately you cannot refill them in the parks. We love sitting on the balcony watching the Giraffes, Zebra, Thomson Gazelle, Bongos, Wildebeest, Blesbok, Eland, Impala and a whole host of other animals. Also down by the pool are Flamingos. The theme is African and very little to indicate that you might be in a Disney hotel. Our daughter loves the place and painting ostrich eggs. I am up early watching the animals being fed by the hotel; I get some fantastic close-up photos of the animals. The pool is designed for kids, so the deepest area is about 5½ feet and gradually goes from a very shallow area to the deep area. There is also a good waterslide. Down by the pool there are two hot tubs and showers and changing rooms. Towels are provided free and can be found in portable bins, also life jackets are provided for non swimmers. The games room by the pool will keep any child happy for hours, with slot machines, air hockey & racing games. From memory we had to vacate our room by 11am on the day of departure, we took our cases to Downtown Disney as we were flying with Virgin and returned to the hotel and used the pool, later showering and changing for our flight home. The staff are friendly, but not pushy

Reviews.Title: “Disney Does it Best!!”
Reviews.Author: kennyben1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the animal Kingdom lodge Aug/Sept 09 with my Partner, 15 year old step-daughter and our 2 year old daughter. We did the trip as it would be my stepdaughters 16th birthday when we were away, and wanted to make it special. I chose this hotel as I wanted something different and couldnt have been more pleased.
