The holiday was excellent and the hotel was top class. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. We did vist every other Disney hotel and tried to have a drink in every bar. The other hotels that looked very good and would consider staying in next year are: 1. Grandfloridian 2. Coronado Springs 3. Yatch and Beach 4. Polynessian The Pool was large and there were about 4 life guards on duty every day. We did have a beer and a glass of wine in the bar. This cost us $14.50 (£11). So we then decided to drive to Wallmart and we got a large case of beer and 2 bottles of wine for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “African Paradise where tropical animals roam freely in the wildlife reserve surrounding your resort”
Reviews.Author: JSlarkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the AKL from 9th August to the 23rd August 2009. Overall The AKL has the WOW factor in particular the lobby and landscape window looking out onto the Savannah. The attention to detail is excellent, especially the lights, shades, wooden décor on the room doors, panelling, carpets and furnishings etc. Even the lift doors have a giraffe embossed on the metal. Rooms We had a Uzima partial Savannah view (Room 4547) and were not disappointed; the wildlife roamed freely beneath our balcony, providing great photographic opportunities. So think again if you are considering paying the difference for a full Savannah view. The room although on the small size comfortably accommodated 2 adults and 2 children. We had a queen size and bunk beds. The room had a tastefully decorated African theme and cleanliness was excellent. However, there was a distinct lack of storage space; only 2 drawers to satisfy 4 people. So we had to live out of suitcases, which was inconvenient. The walk from the lobby to our room was a bit of a trek, approx 5-7 minutes, however, ideally situated for the pool and Mara restaurant. Pool The pool can get quite busy during the day, but not over crowded. The pool is designed for relaxing and not the serious swimmer. It is a lovely pool surrounded by green shrubs and trees, and has two spas. Access to the pool is easy; ideal for children as the deepest part is 4’11”; plenty of sun loungers in and out of the shade; 4 life guards patrol the pool from 9 to 9; and pool towels are plentiful. The pool slide is on the tame side and therefore is preferable for under 8’s. Food The AKL provided a wide choice of dining options. The Mara offered a counter service (fast food) dining option. The food was freshly prepared and tasty, although there was a limited choice of healthy options Boma offered a table service buffet dining experience. There was plenty of choice to suit everyone’s taste and appetite. Jiko catered for the more discerning diner, providing a table service signature dining experience. Since our last visit (2003), we have noticed a significant increase in the price of food and drink. Therefore, for the British tourist, we would highly recommend the Disney Dining Plan. The plan we opted for included 1 table service meal, 1 counter service meal and 1 snack per person per day. And it may surprise you that we didn’t utilise all our counter service meals during our stay. Without the dining plan you can expect to pay the following:  Table service meal costs on average $50 per head and includes a main course (steak or fish), dessert and soft beverage.  Counter service meal costs on average $15 per head and includes burger and chips, soft beverage and a dessert such as fruit or yogurt.  Snack costs on average $2.50 per head and includes one bottle of water or coke, coffee, an ice cream etc. You do the maths. Over 14 days, you would be expected to pay a minimum of $945 per person. So a family of 4 would pay $3,780 (equivalent to £2362). In the US, waiters expect a tip. The going rate is 18%. For parties of 6 or more, this is automatically added to your bill. So you have to add this extra cost on top of your table service dining option. SO PLEASE CONSIDER DINING OPTIONS AND GET YOUR TRAVEL PROVIDER TO INCLUDE IT IN YOUR HOLIDAY. I would also recommend the refillable mugs. They cost $12 each but allow you to have unlimited refills of any soft beverage at the hotel. Staff We found the staff to be friendly. There was always a good morning and friendly banter. OK ‘some’ of the Waiters had an attitude, and cared more about the tip than the service. Transportation The AKL is remote from some Disney Parks and Attractions, however, is on the door step for the Animal Kingdom, Hollywood Studios and Epcot. No matter what other visitors say, our longest wait experience was 20 minutes and that only happened on 2 occasions, and we were living on the buses commuting between the Hotel and Parks. The bus service is regular to the AKL and if you have to queue then talk to your neighbour and have a laugh. You are on holiday! The buses can be often crowded particular in peak season, so be prepared to stand. It can sometimes be like sardines or peak times on the London Underground. But seats are often given up for woman and young children. Please feel free to email me about any details. General Disney Expectations As returning visitors to WDW, the previous visit being in 2003, we have noticed that Disney has lost some of its magic. Although we love Disney it still remains a wonderful place to visit, especially to the first time visitor. The principle of the dining plan is excellent as it saves you money overall. However, as there are 22 Disney hotels, the restaurants get booked up very early. What we noticed is that with the dining plan you are planning your holiday itinerary around restaurant availability, which takes away the fun, spontaneity and freedom of choice. Even when you have made a reservation, be prepared to wait up to 1 hour to be seated. It’s is very frustrating especially as they recommend you check in 15 minutes before your scheduled time. Our experience this holiday was:  Chef Mickey’s booked for 10:30 am seated 11:30 am  California Grill booked for 21:40 seated at 22:20  Le Cellier booked for 14:45 seated 15:15  Tusker’s House booked for 10:20 am seated 11:10 am  Sci-Fi Restaurant booked for 19:30 seated 20:15  Mama Melrose booked for 16:45 seated 17:30  San Angel booked for 19:30 seated 20:20 We also tried ‘Walk-ins’ but found it very difficult to get a table except for the Rose and Crown where we managed lunch without the wait. The Fast Pass (FP) system has deteriorated. Again it is good in principle but for the most popular attractions and rides the allocations of FP’s have gone by midday. So if you are ‘not’ in the Park early expect a stand-by wait up to 2 hours on the popular rides. For example, we got a FP at 10:00 am for the Toy Story ride in Hollywood Studios for our ride window at 15:15-16:15. We then had to wait a further 2 hours before we could use the FP again. Disney needs to learn from Universal Studios. We had a FP (paid extra for it though) that entitled us 1 FP per attraction available any time of day. You are then not planning your day around the FP system. Avoid the Extra Magic Hours in peak season. The FP does not apply and furthermore every man and his dog are there, so expect very long queuing times. For example, we queued 70 minutes to go on Soarin, 70 minutes for Test Track and 65 minutes for Mission Mars. We noticed that the Parks without the extra magic hours were quieter. The merchandise in the Disney shops is not as nice, and the choice is more limited, but prices have still inflated. It is not value for money. But if you are like us, it is always nice to bring back some mementoes. I recommend that if you are staying in a Disney Hotel and use the delivery service from the Parks to your Hotel, check your packages carefully, as on 2 occasions when using this service, the items were broken in transit. Disney did replace them, but if the hotel gift shop does not stock the item they will try and send elsewhere to exchange the item. So make a fuss and they will bring it into the shop. Disney is reactive to guest problems as opposed to proactive. I believe they are geared up to resolve problems. They probably see it as being cheaper to maintain. If you do have to complain, be prepared to be compensated by FP tickets for your inconvenience. And if the problem is severe, they will financially compensate you by refunding $X onto your hotel bill. This happened with us, as we were refunded $100 for our bad dining experience. So my advice is, complain and work the system to get FP Park tickets. I acknowledge it is not nice behaviour but seems to be the new Disney. Visitors with teenagers, who prefer more thrill rides, go to Universal as Disney are falling behind. They have let Universal catch up and overtake them. The Magic Kingdom is only for the younger visitor. My boys are aged 14 and 11 and soon got bored at the Magic Kingdom except for Thunder Mountain and Splash Mountain. Unfortunately, Space Mountain was under refurbishment. I could go on but we will return to Disney, with our expectations better managed. Disney is still a magical place. I hope you found this review helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, wow, wow - fantastic hotel - what dreams are made of!”
Reviews.Author: HappyWelshTraveller
Reviews.Content: I have been lucky enough to stay at this hotel twice and hope to go back soon. As you walk in through the doors, you are faced with the most amazing lobby you're ever likely to see. It really does impress and the rooms are beautifully decorated and appointed. To see a giraffe or zebra walking past your balcony is very special indeed. You really feel like you are looking out over an African Savannah and nothing about it seems 'man made'. The Uzima Pool area is also wonderful, the pool is great and is very relaxing which is a welcome break from the parks and the Hot Tub Jacuzzi's really do soothe those aching muscles after the amount of walking you do. We were lucky enough to be in the Jacuzzi when American child stars Zak and Cody of the Suite life and some of the other stars of the Disney Chanel were in there with us! They were superb and gladly posed with our nieces and other children for photographs which was priceless and made the kids holiday! I just love the shop at the hotel called Zawadi Market Place as along with sweets and chocolate, medication, drinks etc it also sells the most wonderful Aftrican carvings, paintings, instruments, and Disney clothing. I could browse around it for hours. The restaurants although very expensive are very good but the Mara Quick Service Food Court is fab. The food is of exceptional quality, varied choice and reasonable. The location is not a problem as you have to jump in the car or on the Disney Transport to go anywhere really so although some people have commented that it's a little far out, as Walt Disney World Resort is around 49 square miles, most places are a little far out if you're travelling to the other side of Disney! I would and do recommend this hotel to anyone who will listen and cant think of any downsides other than perhaps the restaurants being a little on the expensive side. I just love the place!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Disney Resort By Far!”
Reviews.Author: LilLex
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times. It is the best hotel on Disney property! The staff is amazing! It''s very quiet which is a nice change from the crowded parks. It is an unbalievable experience to wake up and have animals right outside your bed room window! The bus ride is a little long since it is further away from the parks than the other resorts, but the extra 10 min. on the bus are so worth it! The food is great! Boma had the best prime rib and Jiko's (though a bit pricey) is to die for! Def. the best food at Walt Disney World. I love this place and can't wait to go back! I highly recomend it!

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: pstry8
Reviews.Content: I must say service at the Animal Kingdom resort is wonderful, over the top great! The setting is wonderful, the animals outside the rooms are delightful. But trying to tell someone something is wrong is not so over the top perfect... I checked in on a Friday and left on Monday, on a busy weekend when the hotel was completely booked. The bathroom had a mold smell and I had to take aspirins every night to fight a dull headache , but no one else seemed to notice so I just put up with it.. But by the third day I was feeling sick and by the time I got home was in the middle of a full blown allergy attack. I saw my doctor and he told me my sinus were very swollen. I was so very sick for the next 2 weeks I saw my doctor twice during that week for more relief. I slept for 2 days straight, when I got home and when I felt well enough to call the hotel, I was told I should have told the manager as soon as I noticed something wasn't right with my room and they would have done a special cleaning for me before I came. HERE is my point...NO ONE SAID WE'RE SORRY THIS HAPPENED! I never heard back from anyone at the resort. I sent an email and talked to a person on the phone. Even the great and wonderful Disney is wrong sometimes.... I wanted to warn them of a problem, make it better for the next person. A simple heartfelt apology, and the feeling that the problem was important and going to be looked into and fixed was all I wanted. Disney is so perfect every way, I can't believe they got this piece of customer relations wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great theme, long crowded bus rides”
Reviews.Author: NJ2Virginia
Reviews.Content: Since our last visit to Disney World was 10 years ago we took a lot of time to plan our trip to Disney with our daughter and now grown sons and their families. I had read reviews of the long bus rides from the Animal Kingdom Lodge but I guess I didn't fully appreciate the agony of the trips to and from the theme parks. Not only are the rides long but in the very least they are uncomfortably crowded and at the very most they are dangerous. When riding back from most theme parks the buses were over filled with people crowding every inch of the bus. Strollers block every egress point (in violation of the posted law). We finally just drove to the theme parks near the end of our trip. The drive was short and made for much more enjoyable trip. Now for the lodge itself. We were checked in by a very pleasant front desk attendant who explained every detail of the ticketing process, dining plan and hotel attractions. We had checked our luggage and valet parked our car for $10 per day. After finding our room we were hungry so the family went to eat at Mira, the quick serve restaurant. I called for our luggage and waited in the room, and waited, and waited, waited. After an hour I called and the attendant said they were busy. After waiting some more I went to pick up the luggage myself. They finally found the luggage and would not let me take it to my room. I had to wait for a bellman to bring the luggage. He was very polite and said he was sorry for the wait. This was the worst of the stay and everything else was great. The theme at the AKL is the best. The lobby, hallways and rooms are decorated in a tasteful African theme. We had a savanna view room where Zebras, Giraffe and Elk roamed not far from our window. It really is a great theme for all ages. Mousekeeping was great every day even though the the room was sometime made up late. After a long day at the parks it was nice to come back to a nice clean room and watch the animals from the balcony. The room itself is very small, especially for the price charged, but it was otherwise just fine. The beds are less comfortable than the average hotel. The AKL has 3 places to eat. We ate at Boma's and the quick serve restaurant Mira. Boma's was great and the Mira was fine for quick serve. The pool is large and attended by life guards during the day. It is still open at night without lifeguards but not as pleasant when foul mouth teens rule the water. There are two hot tubs but for some reason management put a smoking area right next to one of the hot tubs. Internet is an extra $10 per day so leave the work at well, work, and enjoy the animals at the AKL. If you don't mind the long bus rides this is a nice place to stay when visiting Walt Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Communing with the jungle”
Reviews.Author: Fuzzball91
Reviews.Content: I stayed from August 15 - 18 at the new kidani Village in a 1 bedroom villa with my husband, we are DVC members and AKV and SSR are our home resorts. This was our first time staying at Animal Kingdom Lodge. We absolutely loved everything about it!!! The villa was nicely appointed and themed. It was clean and had everything we needed. As others have stated, the bathroom is huge. In my opinion the bathroom could be a little smaller and the bedroom itself a little bigger but the glass shower, large closet and whirlpool tub are luxurious! The closet toilet is not as nice. The expansive deck was WONDERFUL! We sat on the deck mornings, afternoons and evenngs watching giraffe, ostrich, antelope, wildebeest and zebra interact each day. At times it was hard to not watch the animals. It was so unique and fabulous!!! We swam in the pool, it was not as big as i expected it to be but it was clean and well-staffed. The walk to the pool from rooms is long but it is an indoor walk through air-conditioned hallways so I am not sure what all the complaining is about. The reception area is smaller and more homey than the massive one in Jambo House, I like it better for DVC members...find it more welcoming. The only negatives I have is that our room was not ready when we arrived at noon, but check-in is at 4:00. Our room was ready a little after 2 p.m. Also, we were celebrating an anniversary and we received a knock on our door and a towel sculpture and photo pass after we had already been there for two nights. Could have used for a number of days if we had received the pass at check-in. Staff was VERY friendly and helpful. I would highly recommend Kidani Village! We ate in Jiko, if you can afford to go there once...don't walk, run! It was unbelievable. Foood was amazing and the service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Disney disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: sparkygirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Animal Kingdom Lodge utilizing the free transportation. This went extremely well and has improved from the last time we were there. I was very frustrated that the hotel did so poorly on check-in. We were told that we would be called when the room was ready. Official check-in time is 3:00 p.m. I still hadn't heard by 5:30 so I called Disney Travel Center. This is who I booked this through and I would consider them my travel agent. They told me that they assume no responsibility to the client after they arrive. I then called the Animal Kingdom Lodge and they said, "Sunday's are busy and this usually happens"! For the price I paid I was very angry and frustrated. Our last night was spent at the park. We didn't get back until after 10:00 p.m. They should have had a copy of our charges and information for the return transportation on our door. I called the desk and they said I should call the Transportation and they said It is the hotel's responsibility!!!! The last thing I wanted to do was have to go to the lobby at this hour to work this out. They were unable to do this unless i came to the lobby. Overall I would not come here again for the price and the lack of customer service. They really don't seem to care whether your experience is positive or not. Ever notice how they never have satisfaction surveys for your stay? Seeing the animals was nice but we were there very little since most of the time we were at the parks.I should also mention that you are picked up and dropped off before and after the other Animal resort that is there. Buses are not as frequent so waits will be longer. One day we waited for one hour at Animal Kingdom Park before a bus even showed. We all cheered with delight when one finally came. Others I spoke to said this is the reason they would not come back here. On the positive side the beds were wonderful and each room had a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Animals at your patio with Disney's Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: jessicaclark81
Reviews.Content: I would recommended this hotel to anyone. You have the great customer service that comes with any Disney experience plus an up close view of the Animals on the African Safari of Animal Kingdom. The hotel also has awesome activities at the hotel such as story telling by the fire and the do not miss night safari complete with night vision goggles.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Lewesbeachfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge a few years ago and loved it and I have wanted to go back again. So this time we stayed at the new Kidani Villas and the room was gorgeous and roomy! We had an excellent view of the savannah from our 2BR 3 Bath villa. The only problem was the very long walk from the lobby and pool/fitness area to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Very fun but beds weren't very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Hotelman09
Reviews.Content: Okay animal kingdom lodge very fun except for the beds they were bunks and just weren't comfortable they just felt stiff.Aside from that trip was fun pool was outdoors and had a waterslide. And let me think about 5 hot tubs pool was big. And there was a smoothie bar outside very enjoyable arcade was fun too you got gamecards.Dining was good the mara i liked plus there was a resteraunt inside i forget the name but it was also good.Overall really liked the trip good resort to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: TPTWhitleyBay
Reviews.Content: Animal Kingdom lodge was a spectacular hotel. We were booked into a room without a Savannah view, however from our room, we saw zebras, giraffes, ibis and numerous other animals. Much more than we were expecting. The lobby and public areas were just beautiful, and everything you could wish for. The pool was gorgeous with free towel hire, and a lovely bar. There were free activities for children, such as sun catcher painting and pottery painting. Staff were so friendly and courteous and went out of their way to make our stay even more pleasurable. The only downside was the fact that the room itself was a little cramped. The decor and comfort levels were excellent, but considering the fact that you are paying a premium to stay here, the room was a basic sized hotel room with a few extra touches. As a family, we loved our stay, but have agreed that we would probably prefer to stay in a villa or apartment in future, only for the fact that we would have preferred a bit more room.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, clean & Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lewjam
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay here, we stayed for a week with our 2 boys 10 & 7- who turned 8 there. They gave him a birthday badge, and the odd staff would say Happy birthday. The rooms were very clean, large with 2 king size bed that were comfy. We got a savanna view, which was nice, waking up to giraffes our size. they were about 50 yards away. we thought that they could come closer but they can't as there is electric rails around. The pool as large not very deep, but it is for kids. With a small slide. Open 24 hours. Nice having the free shuttle buses to all the parks. You also get to stay later or go in first on certain days then the public.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to an African Safari in America”
Reviews.Author: OdieWhitePlains_NY
Reviews.Content: I thought the Hotel was amazing. They utilized this Magical Express Sevice with our Luggage that was so convenient. There restaurant Jiko had food to die for!!! The Meal Plan was simple and also convenient once you got the hang of it. The room was amazingly spacious and when I requested a DVD player they got me one in 2 Hours. I honestly thought there were not going to come through. There also was alot of English people staying there. Kinda nice to have your children play with international kids. The children clubs were great. My 7 year old sometimes prefered there rather than a park. So me and my 10 Year old would do parks at night also, while my 7 year old chilled doing arts and crafts. I also cant say enough for the view. Definitely get a Savannah view. I actually want to go to Africa now for a real Safari.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, everything costs something”
Reviews.Author: alesha_95
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Jambo house, 2nd floor with a savannah view (small room, rooms are not that big, compared to a Villa). We were celebrating our 10 year wedding anniversary and sadly (after I begged) they would NOT upgrade our room to the "deluxe suit" they wanted $40/night extra. On the bright-side, it was great waking up and seeing the animals. The pool was clean and the hot tubs were great. The fitness centre that is clean. Message therapy cost $$$. There’s an arcade too. Hotel activities for the kids cost money as well – be prepared to SPEND! Housekeeping is questionable. My son accidently wet the bed and I wasn't sure if housekeeping changed everything, the sheets still had a slight odour. THIS HOTEL IS NOT FOR ADULTS which made me upset. At 12am the bar closes? Why??? My kids went to sleep and there was nothing for adults to do after hours in the hotel. They closed the fire pit and the restaurants too (unless you want to swim –swimming is open) The hotel seemed abandoned at midnight. Also, we didn't spend much time in the hotel b/c we were busy going to all the Disney Theme parks. Shuttle service to the Theme Parks were regular, didn't have to wait long - a bonus! The staff was super friendly, it seemed almost robotic, they couldn't answer direct questions, they just kept saying "welcome home - if you have any questions one of our people will be happy to help you". Most hotel guests weren't socializing; everyone seemed to be doing their own thing. The restaurant in the hotel is over priced! Extremely overpriced. Better to buy some groceries at the supermarket and put them in your tiny fridge in your hotel room. Use the hotel located outside near the pool to toast bread or heat up milk. Tip: If you buy the Disney travel mug, you can refill it as many times as you want (tea, coffee, juice – a price saver!) All the parks were great (except for Epcot, don’t waste your money)

Reviews.Title: “Delightful view of nature at its best with superb sightings of animals daily.”
Reviews.Author: D-Ma8248
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent; dining is definitely some of the best in Disney World. This is a relaxing place to spend your vacation with all the pleasures right at your disposal. This staff if friendly and having animals we don't ordinarily see right out your window is a fabulous treat! I loved Kidani Villas and wish I could return again soon. Donna Helmericks.....Savannah, Georgia

Reviews.Title: “Magical Animal Kingdom Hotel”
Reviews.Author: crimecrackers
Reviews.Content: Wow what a fantastic hotel and it deserves its 5* . After 14 hours of travel we booked into a fuss free reception area and we were impressed with the reception area it has an africian theme to the hotel and nothing is cheap about this hotel its furnishing and ambience are second to none. The room we had was lovely near to all amenities with interconnecting facilities to our children's room, as we looked out across the balcony towards the Savannah where there were Zebras Giraffes and other amazing animals in a natural habitat with friendly guides to explain all about them in detail. The food was exceptional at the Bomo which is one of the main restaurants but expensive it cost us $130 for four of us and if your children are over 9 yrs of age you have to pay adult portion size .... my daughter was 11 and did not in any way eat an adult size meal which really annoyed me!!! The other take away facility on the complex call Mara was good for breakfast and a quick snack serving a variety of meals at good prices. Make sure you get the refill mug at $12 each as you can fill up all day as long as you are on the complex saves you a lot of money. The pool was fantastic lots of lifeguards and a slide for the kids but only a small one, there are some spa's which are nice for relaxation after a hard day at the Theme Park. The staff are lovely and nothing is too much trouble I had a wheelchair and it cost me nothing for the duration and was taken to all the parks, you can buy your tickets for the parks at the hotel and they are cheaper, they then put it on your key card which was really a good idea. The rooms are clean and bedding is changed on a regular basis along with the towels our room was not cleaned a few times but a quick phone call to housekeeper services and it was like the faries had been in along with the cleaner making disney faces with the towels on our return the children did find this fun even at teenager level. You do get extra access to the parks because you are in a Disney Hotel worth enquire about as during the day they do get over crowded. Also washing facilities at $2 a wash also $2 for drying no need to take the dirty clothes home with you at all. You can use the internet if you ask at he Reception for 15 mins free to keep in touch with the UK , no english channels on the TV and English newspapers at Downtown Disney at the Irish bar if you want one !!! I would find the room for 4 would be small but you could manage I was delighted with our two rooms and the kids could watch the TV late on at night without disturbing us after a long hard slog at the parks. This was our first vist and it won't be our last an exceptional Hotel and well worth the extra monies as it is very big with lots of rooms glad we had one near the reception area. There is a shop on site and sells a variety of goods including food / fancy goods worth a visit but expensive. All Disney is expensive get the Disney dinner plan if you are from the UK as you will benefit from this a great deal otherwise its deep pockets as remember they have the monopoly and there is no were else to go as you are restricted to the complex or the Parks. This did not put us off and we had a fantastic time the best holiday - now we are looking to go again in the not too distant future. Pay the extra for this Hotel as it is worth every penny ....Happy Holiday & Animal Magic Kingdom x ANY QUESTION PLEASE E-MAIL ME I AM VERY HAPPY TO HELP YOU ...............

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous theme; worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: travelingfam04
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our two kids, 17 and 7. We travel alot and been to Disney many times but not since AK was built. The hotel is clean, comfortable, and transports you to the African savannah. The views, all the animals, and the cultural activities offered(most free), really make you feel you have "gotten away" on your vacation. We had a pool view. Our son had a birthday while we were there and housekeeping left a "towel cake" with a signed pic of Mickey for him! The Mara Food Court is great for breakfast! Not too expensive. You do have a fridge in your room though. I loved the lobby!! Pool has a waterslide. The water was extremely warm however. Not sure why. Felt more like a hot tub. Kids loved it though.

Reviews.Title: “I didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: blcpearl
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in 7 of Disney's onsite resorts, and AKL is my absolute fave! The atmosphere is a true escape from the hustle and bustle of real life. This was our 2nd stay at AKL, and the rooms have been nicely renovated - new flat screen tvs, plenty of drawer space. Our room had one queen and one set of bunk beds - perfect for us. We prefer the pool view to the savanna view, pool view rooms are conveniently close to the elevators, lobby, pool, food court, etc. There are plenty of places to view the animals so we don't feel we missed out by now having a savanna view. Desk staff, housekeeping are all very friendly and accomodating. Good bus service, although now it shares buses with the Kidani Village next door (Disney Vacation Club resort). Great restaurants - one of the better Disney food courts with a nice variety of choices and plenty of seating. Boma is an excellent buffet for breakfast and dinner. A nighttime sit in front of the firepit is so relaxing - it's hard to believe you're still in Florida! A week wasn't nearly enough time to truly enjoy this beautiful, unique resort.

Reviews.Title: “I thought this resort was fine.”
Reviews.Author: SnuffleBugg
Reviews.Content: I thought this resort was fine. The lobby and restaurants are beautiful and the rooms are nice but nothing special. Ask for a room close to the lobby because we were one of the farthest rooms from the lobby and had a quite a hike each time we wanted to go to the pool, restaurant, buses to the parks or even our car (the lobby was central to everything). We reserved a standard room and still had a good view of the animals outside our balcony. The staff was super wonderful. The pool and playground is nice but again, nothing that special. Overall, this resort is nice to visit at least once but for the price and for what you get I wouldn't stay here again. I think the moderate resorts are just as good and for a lot less!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely an Amazing time”
Reviews.Author: ASHNARAN
Reviews.Content: Great room. Great service. Great place. A must, to do with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation and Luxury at Disney”
Reviews.Author: WxKristin
Reviews.Content: As a previous Disney Cast Member, I've visited or stayed at many of the other options on property and the Animal Kingdom Lodge tops my experiences. We were given a free upgrade to a savannah view room and there was nothing better than waking up the next morning and relaxing on the balcony with a cup a coffee or tea and watching the animals. I could easily see spending a week at this hotel and only three or so days at the parks. We didn't have kids with us, but the hotel provided plenty of activities including african drum lessons, arts and crafts, jewelry making and special lessons about the animals. Pool open 24 hrs and noticed first evening pool area was a bit loud, so may not want room near the pool. The pool itself is quite large, has a waterslide and walk-in entry. The hot tub was around the corner from the pool and secluded by large plants and bamboo and had a savannah area nearby, it provided a great get away on a rainy afternoon. It is the furtherest lodge from the magic kingdom area (20-30 min ride), but unlike at other disney hotels never had a long line for any of the buses even at closing time of the parks. Longest wait for a bus, 20 min mid-day. 5 min ride to Animal kingdom/blizzard beach. 10-20 for Hollywood studios, Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Dragonflylover52
Reviews.Content: I must first say that the Animal Kingdom Lodge is beautiful and well designed. However, I have never had such horrible service after the fact. I checked out of my room and realized about halfway home that I had left my cell phone charger in the bathroom plugged in. I called and they connected me with housekeeping and said she would ask the maid and call me right back. Four hours later........no call. I called again and that housekeeping person really was not interested in asking anyone or checking for me. I called back and spoke to someone else in the hotel who said she checked and that there was no charger there (which I knew there was) and told me to have a "MAGICAL DAY". After that.........the next day while checking on my bank statement I see that they overcharge my debit card for the room. They added on about 174.00 extra. I called and the hotel said that they could not do anything about that and I would have to call billing and of course,,,,,,they were closed for the weekend. Oh and by the way "Have a magical day". I am a Florida resident and I was excited for my vacation but this stuff just really brings it to a screeching halt. Oh and just a suggestion for Disney................A hot dog with about 10 fried SHOULD NOT cost 7.49. That is just rediculous. I mean I know they are Disney and all but geezzzzzzzzz.............give people a break. They just raised all their admission prices as of today again. Don't you think you could give us a break on something???

Reviews.Title: “A magical place”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaDisneyDreamer
Reviews.Content: There is something special about standing on your balcony and seeing giraffes and zebras in the morning. There aren't many places in the world where you can do this for $159 a night. When we first arrived at this resort, it was like were arriving at a remote, exotic place. The vegetation, decor, and all the surroundings really make you feel like you could be in Africa- not in a resort hotel just a few minutes away from giant amusement parks. The lobby is beautifully and elegantly decorated. There is plenty of comfortable seating, and it never seemed crowded while we were there. There are cast members everywhere waiting to answer questions and be of service. I never had a problem finding help when I needed it, and everyone was very friendly. I only had to wait a couple of minutes to check in, and I visited the concierge desk several times. There were never lines. The hotel is HUGE, and our room was near the back of the hotel, so we had quite a walk. But the hallways are so nice, and there are views of the animals as you walk down the halls, so this was not a problem for us. You can also get complimentary wheelchair access if you have guests in your party who have difficulty walking. You also have the chance to request a room near the front (we preferred having a room at the back to see more animals). We booked a standard view room, but they gave us a Sunset Savanna view, nonetheless. They considered it to be "partially obstructed" because there were some fences below our balcony, but we saw animals every morning. We usually saw 6 giraffes, three zebras, several ankole cattle, some birds, some wildebeests, and some other types as well. They gathered back there for morning feedings, so it was a perfect time to sit on the balcony with a cup of coffee and enjoy. Even if you don't have a room with a great view, you can see plenty of animals. All along the hallways are public balconies where you can sit and rock in huge wooden rocking chairs and watch them. We sat there several times for a different view and to rock in the chairs. There was hardly ever anyone on these balconies, so it was like having them to ourselves. The rooms are very nice. We had four adults and a 2 year old in our one room, so it was a little tight, but we got along just fine. The decor is really nice, the beds are firm but comfortable, and there is plenty of storage space for clothing. The bathroom was small but elegant, and we liked that the sinks were not inside the same room as the toilet and the shower. The balconies are a nice size. You can't really sit down for a breakfast for four out there, but for just sitting to relax and watch the animals, they don't need to be any bigger. The pool is fabulous. There is a zero depth entry, which my two year old loved. She could walk right into the water without being scared. The water was clean and felt great in the afternoons after a hot day at the park. We watched the flamingos near the pool and she played on the playground. There were always plenty of chairs and towels, though perhaps not enough umbrellas for everyone. The pool never seemed too crowded. There are two spas, which were wonderful for massaging and comforting tired, sore muscles after a long day at the park. They were never crowded, and a few times I had the spa all to myself. The food was very good. We ate at both The Mara and Jiko, though we did not eat the buffet at Boma. The Mara actually pleased my husband, who is a bit of a food snob. He thought it was quite good, as did my mom and my sister. The food at Jiko was amazing. I ate scallops, which were perfectly cooked and came with a delicious cucumber salad, and my husband had the braised beef short ribs. The meat melted in the mouth. It was very expensive- our meal for the two of us was $120 which included one appetizer, two entrees, one beer, and one specialty cocktail. The service was not great. Our server was a little casual for our taste at such a restaurant, but it was okay. Nice ambience in the restaurant. We had a view of the resort pool from our table. Although we chose Jiko because my husband does not like buffets, I would probably skip Jiko next time and try Boma. From what I could tell, you probably get more for your money- and you get a much larger variety. For the price we paid, I think the location was fine. Although I would certainly prefer to ride the monorail to the parks, I don't think it is worth the extra money to stay at one of the monorail hotels. We had a car and drove to the park the first day, but thereafter decided to ride the buses. It took about the same amount of time to ride the buses as it did to drive, when you consider that the buses drop you off right in front of the parks and you don't have to bother with the huge parking lots or riding trams. We never had to wait long for a bus, and we never missed a bus due to large crowds, though sometimes we did have to stand. I had a large stroller, but it was not a problem getting it on and off the bus quickly, as the crowds were not too large. I would not, however, want to handle a stroller and a child by myself on the buses. You need at least two people for that. Another thing I love about this hotel was the willingness of the staff to make our stay as nice as possible. My mom developed a problem with her leg from walking so much, so I asked about renting a wheelchair. The bellhop said he could get her one that she could use for the entire length of her stay. She could even take it to the parks with her- free of charge. He immediately brought one out and gave it to us. I thought that was very nice. We had only a couple of small issues while we were here. It took about twenty-five minutes to get our luggage after we arrived, because they were slow getting it up to our room. It wasn't a big inconvenience, but we did have to sit and wait in the room for a little while. That wasn't too bad, since we had a nice view of the animals. Our refrigerator did not work, but quickly after we called they sent someone up who brought another refrigerator. We also found a lipstick stain on one of the glasses. Other than those minor things, we had no concerns whatsoever. All in all, we loved this hotel. I don't think you can beat it for the price, the service, and the ambiance. It is great for all ages. Everyone in my party had fun- from my 67 year old mother to my 2 1/2 year old daughter. I highly recommend it, and I hope one day to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucinda78
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family between 18 and 25 July 09. Magical Express – used this to and from the airport and thought it was a great service. The trip to the hotel took slightly longer as the bus was busy and we dropped off at 3 hotels before getting to AKL which was slightly annoying after a long flight. Check in was a breeze, despite being a Saturday which seemed to be one of the busier days for arrivals. Took less than 5 minutes. Room - mine was on the Kudu trail. After reading other reviews on Tripadvisor, when we booked we had requested rooms that were near to the lobby/restaurants. I was on the 4th floor with a partial Savannah view. The room was immaculate, not a speck of dirt or dust anywhere. The rooms are a little dark but like others have said its in keeping with the resorts theme. I found the room to be plenty big enough, with ample storage space. Beds were comfortable, no problem with the air conditioning, plenty of clean towels and toiletries provided. Was great being able to sit on the balcony and watch the animals outside. I would not pay the extra for a Savannah view room because even if you aren't lucky enough to get a partial view there are so many places around the hotel where you can view the animals I don't think it is worth the additional expense. Pool - we spent most of our days around the pool, choosing to visit the parks in the evening when the weather was slightly cooler. The pool didn't start to get busy until 10/11am. We always tended to arrive before then so could get seats in our favourite spot, just behind the pool and right by the bar!! The lounger’s right around the pool were always taken by lunchtime when the pool was at its busiest. However we always managed to get chairs even if we came down in the late afternoon. Plenty of towels available. Lifeguards on duty for most of the day and were really attentive. Great slide that the children loved. Dining - ate in Boma for breakfast and dinner. Was a little disappointed both times after reading such great reviews here, maybe I was expecting too much. I thought dinner was better than breakfast - prime beef was amazing. Did not eat in Jiko myself but some of my family did and really enjoyed it. We ate breakfast and lunch most days from Mara, I thought there was a good selection and prices were reasonable for a resort hotel. The one thing we all thought was missing from the hotel was just a normal restaurant – so not a fine dining one like Jiko or a buffet like Boma. Somewhere to grab some lunch without having to go and get it from Mara. Would have been nice to enjoy a bite to eat at the pool bar for example. Transportation – other reviews have complained about the length of time either waiting for a bus or the time it took to get to the various parks. We did not experience any of these problems. Only once we had to wait in a long line at Magic Kingdom for about 40 mins. Other than that the buses always arrived promptly and I thought the system worked very well. Yes the ride could take up to 15 mins but it was nice to get a break to sit down in an air conditioned bus! Overall, I thought this was a fantastic hotel. All public areas and rooms spotless. Staff were friendly and helpful as you would expect at a Disney hotel. There were lots of viewing places to watch the animals and despite going during the busy season there was always somewhere to sit. Would defiantly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “What a waste of money”
Reviews.Author: GloriaLloyd
Reviews.Content: There were some good aspects of AKL - bus service to parks was excellent ( 5 minute wait (some of the other hotels share routes and therefore large queues). Lobby etc is spectacular. 24hrs gym (good to use during rainy periods). Restaurant really good but poor service (waitress literally ran to our table as she was so busy - why didn't they have more staff??). The canteen area was just yuk!! Dont bother paying for a savannah room - there are a number of viewing areas around the hotel to see the animals (which was also very good). Our children really really enjoyed this place but I felt it was just a big rip off. And the constant piped music!! After a day in the parks it was just Disney overload. If you are a Disney buff you will like it (though it was the only hotel I ever stayed in that I saw two cockroaches:o(

Reviews.Title: “Our 10 Year Anniversary Was a BLAST!”
Reviews.Author: pandd1
Reviews.Content: May 31st – June 6th Room 4214 Two Queen Bedroom Two Persons This resort is one of the most magical places we have EVER stayed at. We had been planning our 10 year anniversary for over a year now and we were very excited as the days counted down. If you have never experienced this place before, prepare yourself as you walk through the main doors. You need to stop and just soak in the scenery as you enter. It will literally take your breath away. From endless couches to lounge on, to a TV area playing cartoons for big and little kids to watch, to a fantastic collection of artifacts from Africa found THROUGHOUT the entire resort…you will be absolutely amazed. I know I was. We DID have a bit of a hiccup during check-in (which we had NO wait for and were checking in about 4:30PM on a Sunday). When we had made the reservations back in March, we knew that what we were asking for were just “requests”, but when we called back in April to pay off the trip, we were “told” what room we were going to be getting…down to the floor and view…which made us happy because it was all what we wanted. This was not the case when we checked in. We were expecting to be on the 3rd floor facing towards the main circular savannah, but we ended up on the 4th floor facing the left savannah. We had a lovely post blocking our view and very rarely had any animals to see. So word of advice…if you’ve been talking to Disney via the phone and they give you specifics about room and location, you might want to take it with a grain of salt OR confirm it a week before you check-in. Be sure and get ALL names. We told the customer service lady this and she actually told us to complain. Meh…just one bump in the road. We really wanted a nice vacation, so we made the best of it. Besides, we got to see a darling Eland just about every time we looked out our sliding door. The decorations for the rooms are quite impressive. Keeping with the theme, you will see animals in nearly everything in your room…from the Lion King animals in the curtains (behind the drapes) to the hidden Mickeys you’ll see throughout the resort in the carpets, comforters and shower curtains. The wallpaper in the bathroom is very neat. Dual sinks perfect for just the two of us. There are shower and bath combos. Always plenty of towels (housekeeping here is wonderful). A nice ceiling fan you can turn on and off with the flip of a switch. BIG TV! Just the attention to details is phenomenal. It made for a very memorable stay. We had the two queen bed setup and unfortunately we had horrible sleep while staying here. I know, I know…more complaining. I wish I didn’t “have” to, but I have to share my experience. The sheets are extremely uncomfortable…almost felt like plastic. I actually had to take sleep medicine nearly every night to make myself fall asleep. This part actually made the stay not pleasant, but we really tried to make the best of it. If you are able to fall asleep on just about anything, then you shouldn’t have a problem. I agree with what others say when they mention that the rooms were small. It was absolutely perfect for just the two of us, but with a family of four or more…I can imagine it getting downright cramped! As for the sheets, if we ever decide to stay on Disney property again, we may decide to bring our own. And a bit of advice for parents with small children…you might want to put in a request about NOT being next to newlyweds. I’m quite sure we were next to some …and well…they were consummating their marriage nearly EVERY night and were quite loud about it too. Yeah…thin walls I guess. But it IS a hotel! No biggie, but I thought I’d throw that out there. Even though we didn’t see many animals from our room, they do provide a list of what you can find and even a place to mark off what you’ve seen. They also add identification pointers and behavior tips too. Very cool. We even had the pleasure of talking to several cast members while roaming out in the Arusha Rock Savannah Overlook. We learned a lot about Elands and cows. Another nice touch is the “welcome home” you will receive each time you come through the security check. It’s very pleasant to receive after a long day of playing at the parks. People who are driving will get to experience this. You might not get to if you are taking the bus. If you ARE driving, you will get free parking at all the parks. Parking now is $12 for cars. OUCH! There is LOTS of parking for the Animal Kingdom Lodge and some people complain that it’s too far from the main door. But there are LOTS of rooms for this enormous resort, so you need someplace for these folks to park! It’s Disney, you will be walking almost the whole time anyways. It’s all part of the experience. If you just can’t stand the walk, they have valet parking available. There’s always somebody at the front waiting to help you out. The Animal Kingdom Lodge definitely has an impressive staff THAT’S for sure. We were very impressed with everybody that we talked to there. We ate at two of the restaurants at the hotel (see my other reviews for these). We had breakfast at both Boma and The Mara. If I could have Boma for breakfast every day for the rest of my life…I would die a happy person. It is a buffet full service restaurant and they are always preparing food to make sure the bowls are FILLED. The Mara is your usual quick service…waffles and eggs type…which was good. We didn’t experience either of these for lunch or dinner, but Boma always seemed busy. We always heard lots of drums playing down there in the PM. Such a wondrous experience for those dining I’m sure. We only nosed around the resort for a little bit during our stay, but what we saw was really nice. They have a very big spacious swimming pool which always had lots of people in it when we walked by. Life guards were on duty. The Mara is located right next to the pool as was Pumba’s Fun and Games Arcade. I was able to mail a bill in the room located just to the right of the Lobby Concierge. You can also find internet and payphone access in the same room. They also have a gift shop located just beside the main doors. Here you will find souvenirs that you can only get at The Animal Kingdom Lodge and then there are the usual goodies you can get throughout the parks. Also there’s a little “convenience” section in case you forgot to bring something…bathroom stuff, etc. Overall, I would highly recommend staying at this resort! There were so many more good things that we experienced than bad. I saw so many smiles on children and adults alike that it was just contagious. It’s such a happy place and something that you just have to experience for yourself. If you are staying here in the future…be prepared to be amazed. You are so LUCKY!!! Enjoy your vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice...but TOO far from the parks”
Reviews.Author: deMom09
Reviews.Content: First, the highlights: Lobby is lovely with rich, warm colors, exceptional decorative touches to match the theming, with a comfortable, peaceful feel throughout. Rooms are the same, great theming albeit rather dark and at times the lighting is just not sufficient. Very nice main pool with lavish foliage and waterslide. BUT... AKL is SO large and spread out that you can literally get lost in it. It has a strange layout...the lucky ones were close to the lobby, we were not so lucky. There are also some extremely LONG hallways which lead to some rooms that make you feel quite isolated. If you like to feel as though you're part of the action, you won't if you're at the end of the hall...it feels as though you're off in no-man's land. When we saw the standard room we were given, with it's not-too-thrilling view of the parking area, we politely asked to switch rooms. NOTHING else available--in the entire, enormous resort--unless of course we wanted to pay more. And it was expressed quite rudely, too. This is the first time I've ever experienced such a lack of helpfulness, accommodation or understanding; usually Disney tries to make their guests happy but by the unfriendly staff's demeanor, I could tell they were not about to go even an extra millimeter or do anything remotely accommodating to help us out. Our only options were to pay $15 more for a pool view, or $75 more for a Savannah view. Figuring that this would give us a rare opportunity to see animals up close, we opted to pay the $75 extra and go with the Savannah view--after all it IS the AK Lodge, seeing animals is what it's all about, right? This is where the extremely long walk to our room came in...we found ourselves having to be escorted (the attendant said he didn't want us to get lost, since the route from the lobby to the rooms is "very confusing"--no kidding) down hall after hall, finally to nearly the last room on what seemed to be an endless and empty hallway. Frankly, it bothered us to be so isolated and removed, but we tried to focus on the positive and were eager to see the view, which the front desk called "one of the best savannah views." Wow, what a disappointment. Yes, there were animals, although very far away--but I didn't have any illusions that they'd be right outside our balcony all day long. But in this supposedly great Savannah view room on the edge of the resort, we also got to see the high chain-link fencing, the large gate where the vehicles enter and exit, some sort of utility building, associated machinery/equipment, etc, and a striking lack of natural beauty--no grass, few bushes, trees were well off into the distance...mainly just dusty desolate acreage. And it seemed like the animals were rather avoiding this area too; I don't blame them, it really was a rather depressing sight. I loathed dragging my family around to switch rooms yet again, but common sense prevailed to say "why are we paying $75 more for THIS?" So, I went to the lobby while my family waited and switched rooms again...for a pool view. Most pool view rooms are partially or fully obstructed by some sort of foliage which, while lovely, natural, fits in with the theme etc., really does need to be trimmed or managed so that those who want a pool view are actually getting one. But at least when we were above the pool we could again hear music and activity, see other people and hear happy voices in the air, like we were actually at a Disney resort. We learned that we don't like to feel that isolated. Some people might...it just wasn't what we wanted. Also note: these rooms are noticeably smaller than nearly all other deluxe resorts--hence the lower price. The bus situation is pitiful--a real knock when you have sleepy children who need to get back to their room. The distance from nearly ALL the parks was quite a disadvantage at AKL. This resort made up my mind that I'll never stay this far from the parks again. WDW being about 48 square miles, it's an arduous journey back at the end of the night--even IF you're lucky enough to catch the first bus...don't be surprised if you have to wait for the next one. And there's no such thing as a quick afternoon break to use the pool at your resort--AKL's just too far away to make any midday break practical unless you really cut into your day. If you absolutely love animals you'll love this resort. But for us it was a bit different, perhaps in part because the expectation is built up so high with regard to the animal viewing, theming etc., that after a couple minutes we were already thinking: "Okay, it's a giraffe...it's lovely...and pretty much looks exactly like the one we just saw at the Animal Kingdom. Very nice. Not thrilling, but nice..." It is pleasant to see them out of your hotel window; for some guests, this may make all the difference. However, I found a lot more enjoyment seeing the animals from the observation deck at the end of the hall (in lush surroundings that look a lot more pleasant for the animals, since it was the INTERIOR courtyard) than from that savannah view room--the cost difference didn't seem worth it AT ALL--or by simply going to the Animal Kingdom itself. The distance and location of AKL simply overshadowed our enjoyment of this resort such that we're unlikely to return. We're glad we tried it, but see no compelling reason to ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chazanddi
Reviews.Content: Better late than never review . Stayed for 10 days May 2008 free upgarded to savava room on check in had a family of giraffes outside our room for the full holiday it was amazing. Would i have paid for the upgrade probably not. Disney bus service to parks are very good had to wait 10 mins at the most . Food at hotel not so good and over priced so stay well clear. Dinner at the royal table with cinderella is a most for anyone with small children most book before you leave uk .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Disney at its best!”
Reviews.Author: hazelzak
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 2 weeks at the beginning of July. Check in went very quickly and smoothly - arrived at 3pm after just over an hours drive from Sanford International. Only slight down side was that it was difficult to understand the check-in clerks accent even though his disney badge said he was from London! However he was very informative and went over all of the hotel amienities and recommended booking for Jiko and Boma - we had done this from home already! After explaining on the map how to get to our room we made our way there. Our room (2484) was on the second floor although from the lobby this is actually down one level. The lobby is actually on level 3! After 5 minutes the luggage arrived and we were very pleased by what we saw. I was staying with my mum so had 2 queen size beds. The room was not at all dark and although we had a standard room we saw giraffes nearly every day from our balcony - bonus! Overall I can't fault the room or location. We ate at Boma during our stay - fantastic - one of the best meals we had at Disney. We had booked - via the american disney internet site - and I would thouroughly recommed doing this. The restaurant was VERY busy. We stood in queues for up to 10 minutes at a time to pick our food from the buffet. It was worth it though. Try the Zebra Domes - pudding - they are delicious. We also ate alot at The Mara - the quick service restaurant - serving burgers, chicken nuggets , pizzas and soups. A quick and simple way to grab something to eat between trips to the parks. Buy a refillable mug - about $13 - you can refill it with soft drinks, tea, coffee and hot chocolate as many times as you want for your entire stay! $13 for a 2 week stay was well worth it. The disney bus service to the parks was excellent. The longest we stood at the hotel or a park waiting for a bus was 15 minutes - and that was on the 4th of July at the Magic Kingdom after the fireworks! If you arrive at the hotel bus stop and see your bus leaving wave at it - more often than not the bus driver will stop for you! A word of warning. The Animal Kingdom Lodge now has 2 bus stops - Kidani Village and Jambo House. The first stop on the way back from the parks is usually Kidani Village (Disney Vacation Club Members) do not get off here! We and several other people we spoke to made this mistake. The two parts of the hotel are Not joined and it is a good 15 minute walk in the blistering heat back to Jambo House - the original Hotel! Remember to stay on the bus - some drivers warn you , others do not! Overall this was an amazing hotel - I would definetly stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A Disney paradise”
Reviews.Author: yankeeMaryland
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel and I had the same experience as the first time staying there, an outstanding vacation. From check in to checkout everything went very smoothly. They even had a room ready for me early( a savanna view, no less). The entire week I was there, I didn't have to ask for anything from housekeeping. The room was always clean. There were plenty of animals roaming around, and the night goggles viewing is an experience you should try. I don't know why people complain sometimes about the bus service, and the lodge being a little further away from some of the parks. It's a bad rap because I didn't wait for a bus for more than 15-20 minutes the entire week I was there. The longest ride I had was only 20 minutes to Magic Kingdom. The food at Boma's was very good, both the breakfast & dinner buffets. A nice place to finish the night is at Victoria Falls, the hotel bar right above Boma's. It's small but friendly, and the bartenders are really nice and make great mixed drinks, try the rum runners or mudslides. The pool is also nice and roomy. They also have an upscale restaurant named Jiko's which has great steaks, and a quick serve called The Mara, for a fast breakfast, or lunch. As they say ,"Try it you will like it"!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: iwantohavefun
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Disney world and could not have picked a better hotel. We stay for 5 days and that was not nearly enough time for this vacation. Staff was great. The rooms were clean. Housekeeping cleaned daily and accomadated to our schedule. The African buffet was terrific, although the price of the buffet was outrageous. The best part of the hotel was the animals. We paid for a standard view, but was upgraded to a savannah view free of charge. Some moments you wouldnt see animals and some night late in the everning or early in the morning you find a giraffe hanging out right outside your balacony. The hotel 3 restaurants and an arcade. There is plenty to do in this hotel if you choice not to go out and about disney. I would recommend anyone to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful resort.”
Reviews.Author: chonga999
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this resort. The rooms are a bit small but other than that I have nothing bad to say. Our savana view was great. It brought tears to my husband's eyes. He is such a softy. We were there for nine days and the only bad experience was one of the cast members in guest services had a little attitude. Room service every morning and never had to wait over 30 minutes. I recommend room service for breakfast as the only other choice is the buffet and it is 16.99 per adult. You can get full breakfast for less than that thru room service. Recommend 1 order of the Continental Breakfast for two adults. It includes large pot of coffee and a basket full of pastries and juice. This is only $11.99. It is the best deal on the menu. The pool was very nice and you also have privledges at Kidani Village which is less than a 10 minute walk from the Jambo House. Kidani Village is the new area of the AK lodge that was built for the Vacation Club members. Pool is very, very nice and great area for children. The housekeeping staff was amazing. They cleaned our room every day. When I say "cleaned" I mean vacuum, scrub shower and sinks, and so on. More than just making the beds. I also recommend that you get a car if you are staying at the AK lodge. (Great self parking area/very close to lobby entrance). It is on the very edge of Disney property and you can be in the city in less than 5 minutes. This opens up your options for eating and sight seeing. We took an air boat ride on Lake Toho. It was one of the most beautiful things I have every seen. Do the parks early or late because of the heat. We spent most of the mid-day by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “We're "wild" about the Animal Kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: travelincarls
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Animal Kingdom in a Savannah view room for 3 nights. The lodge and it amenities are wonderful! We truly felt like we were transported away from it all at this location. We rented points from a DVC member for a suite and paid approximately $145 a night for our accommodations. As great as this place is, I'm not sure I would spend around approximately the $250 - $350 rate the resort would charge for similar accommodations. There were some minor negatives as related below (Check In & Check Out). Check In - It took us a while to check in. The person who checked us in gave the typical Disney speech "Welcome home, . . ." however she said it in a montone without smiling and we felt as if we were bothering her. My husband and I noticed that the girl at the next check out stand had the same monologe but was animated and smiling. She went out of her way to give restaurant recommendations and make sure sure the guests knew special events happening that day. Our person did no such thing. She bascially handed us our packet and told us how much we owed for the Disney Dining Plan. We had checked in advance to make sure we could pay for the Dining Plan with gift cards and were informed it would not be a problem. Well, it was. Our attendant didn't know how to process the cards and then told us that people usually don't pay that way. She got some assistance and put them through. Unfortunately $200 worth wouldn't go through. She said we had probably used them in the parks and said we could pay the rest with a credit card. When we told her no such thing had happened and asked if she could try manually importing the number or calling she again restated that we had probably used the cards. We were told that we could take the cards back and get the credit later. We knew we hadn't used the cards and getting a Disney credit later wouldn't really be helpful as we would have left the area. The clerk finally agreed to keep the cards and try them later through a computer link. Everything did finally work out and the clerk left a message on our room's phone to apologize for the problem . Later someone told us that they always have difficulties with gift cards because the cards get demagnetized and people shouldn't use them. If this is the case, then they should have told us this when we first inquired. The clerk told us we would be called later to let us know when the room was available. This never happened, so once again we had to wait in the check-in lane to get our room assignment. The clerk who helped us this time was very friendly and helpful. Lobby & Room - The lobby of this hotel is beautiful. It might seem a little dark during the daytime, however, it's real beauty shines through at night when it is lit in a soft glow. Our room was clean and had a microwave, toaster, refrigerator, coffee maker, and paper goods for eating. Ample towels were provided for our stay. The room was average in size when compared to other hotels, however, it's the detail given to decorating and bedding that make it exceptional. Disney is great with the details at their resorts! Savannah Views - Not all Savannah view rooms are the same. I'n not sure of it's name, but I would recommend the rooms on the back end of Jambo house. We had a room facing the "feeding area" of a savannah but did not see many animals, instead we saw more people performing maintenance. However, it was a thrill to my children to walk out and see the animals from the back of the resort. The people stationed there were always helpful and tried to answer any questions we had. Ammenities - There are so many activities and amenities at this resort! The kids loved the night goggle vision, crayon rubbing, and pool. You could easily spend several days just at the resort and never touch the parks. Dining - Bomas was our favorite restaurant from all of the places we ate. The servers were friendly and all of their recommendations were excellent choices. My children loved the food at this restaurant, howvever it's not your typical fare. If you have picky eaters or like traditional American food then this restaurant may not be for you. We also dined at their quick service counter and found the food here to be good too. The quick service has menu items that appeall to young children (pizza, chicken nuggets) as well as adults. You can visit a website (I think its www. allears.net) to pull up the menus and pricing at various Disney restaurants. This might be helpful in finding restaurants that will appeal to the people in your group. Transportation - Can't comment as we used our car to get around. When you stay at a Disney resort you also get free parking at the theme parks. It did appear that the shuttle came around every 20-30 minutes. Check Out/Bell Service - At the end of our stay we asked for bell service to take our luggage and souvenirs to the car. After waiting almost 30 minutes we called again to see how long it would be. They said they didn't have our name on the list and it would be another 20 minutes. At this point we said to just forget it and we would do it ourself and asked if we could come get a luggage cart. We were told no, carts are only for bell service. However, this time the girl at bell service would be there within 5 minutes. The gentleman who showed up was very helpful and apologized for the wait. It turned out he orginally lived 30 minutes away from us and we had a nice discussion as he got the luggage to the car. Overall it was a great experience and we would definitely stay there again given the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “Animals outside the balcony were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cpl1775
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights in March and it was incredible! Arrival - Typical Disney style. Hopped on a bus at the airport and was driven to the resort. About an hour drive in a comfortable air-conditioned bus. Check-in - Went very fast. From the time we entered the resort to the time we were in our room was only about 30 minutes and that was only because we had lots of questions that got answered while checking in. Room - Very clean and again was typical Disney but not cheesy. The room had subtle hints of Disney all around but some of it blended in very well to where you almost didn't notice it. We had 2 queen beds that were very comfortable. Either that or we were just to tired at the end of the day to notice. The bathroom was divided with the sink and mirrors outside of the bath/shower and toilet part. The best part for me was the balcony watching the animals. Pool - I'm not a pool person so I didn't spend any time in it but it looked very nice and a lot of people seemed to enjoy it. There were tons of chairs to lounge in and a bar next to it. (not a swim up bar though) Food - We ate at the buffet restaurant most nights and it was very good, but the variety didn't change much. Luckily there were lots of choices. (try the amarula ball desert - incredible!) The small cafeteria area by the pool was good and served stuff like pizza, french fries, chicken sticks. My recommendation would be to purchase the meal and quick meal options before you go. You can save a lot in the long run, especially in the parks. Activities - Lots to choose from! We were out late most nights at the theme parks but the ones we participated in were the nightvision animal viewing and story telling by the firepit. Kind of cheesy but fun and family safe. Animals - Best part of the lodge for me! I was very disappointed the first night we got in cause I sat out and waited to see some of the animals and didn't see a single one. But the next day and all the days after we always had Giraffes, Greater Kuku's, and Ankole Cattle outside our balcony with an occasional visit from other animals. The zebras tended to stay in the middle part of the resort and the impalas and nyalas stayed on the pool side, but all were visible from different spots at the resort. The animals seemed to be well taken care of and the grounds keepers did a fantastic job at "picking up after them". Complaints - I'm going to have to pick a little here just to find something to gripe about. Prices were high in the gift shop, but what else can you expect from Disney. The only person we had a problem with was the lady at the Disney Cruise booth. We were trying to change our cruise information and she wouldn't help us and told us to contact their phone number. (minor detail) And the family staying next to us had a very "excited" young boy that was very loud. There were other minor little details here and there but nothing to write about. The high prices and loud neighbors are what kept me from giving this 5 stars. Overall, an awesome experience! In fact we booked another stay before we even left.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Brilliant - Nothing much we could fault!”
Reviews.Author: Yel1owglen
Reviews.Content: This review is going to be pretty short and sweet, as there's nothing much we could fault. I am 20 and I travelled with my girlfriend who was 18 during the stay for a birthday holiday to see all the parks across Orlando. We were pleasantly surprised with our experience of our Disney Stay. For a start, as hotels go this was pretty top notch. No check-in queues, spotless environment and everything was very professional. The rooms were very in touch with the hotel environment, it's just a shame we hadn't booked a Savanna view room!! Hotel restaurants were superb and the quick service restaurant was very efficient. All staff were friendly and willing to help with everything. Overall, the best holiday we have been on by far.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING RESORT”
Reviews.Author: ndnzfan
Reviews.Content: Check in--Check in was quick and easy. We had made arrangements through AAA and everything was ready for us. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. They were very attentive to our 8 and 5 year old sons, asking them if it were their first visit to DisneyWorld or if we were celebrating birthdays, anniversaries or any other special occasion. They both admitted that their birthdays were coming up in the next month and they were each given a birthday button to wear throughout the parks. They also loaded them up with pages to color, crayons, Disney character stickers, etc. Also, we were upgraded from a standard room with a standard view to a room with bunkbeds for the boys and a Savannah room without even asking for it! Even though we arrived early in the morning, around 10-10:30AM, our room was ready for us upon our arrival. The hotel--The hotel was almost constantly bustling with activity in the lobby. Lots to see and very clean and tidy. Very welcoming. Staff were all very friendly and ready to welcome us "home" upon our returns from the parks. The pool is huge and very kid friendly. The boys got to help open the pool slide one day and got certificates from the lifeguards which they were excited about. Plenty of lounge chairs are available poolside in both sun and shady locations. We were there for the 4th of July weekend and there were plenty of activites at poolside that day for kids. The pool is under lifeguard supervison from 10-10 and is open "at your own risk" 24 hrs a day. our room--our room was cleaned daily and plenty of towels and washcloths left for us. It was spotless upon our arrival. A couple of days the towels were made into the shapes of animals which the kids enjoyed. The free in room safe was handy. The room was quiet at night. Very comfortable room overall. We immediately spotted giraffes upon our arrival from our balcony and were never without being able to see some kind of animal from our window. check out--We left early (3:35 AM) and the process was very quick. (remember, we had already paid for it all through AAA). The Magical Express was prompt to pick us up at the time we had been told and we arrived at the airport in plenty of time to check in and check our baggage. We were leaving too early to take advantage of the resort check-in procedure. Shuttles--The shuttle service to the parks and Downtown Disney were awesome. No matter what time of day we were at the bus stops either at the resort or at the parks, the wait was never longer than 20-25 mins. We could go straight to our resort from any of the parks or Downtown Disney without making any other stops and vice versa. I have read on this site many people complaining of the shuttle service being too slow and too many stops between one place and another. I did not find this to be true. If anything, I noticed that there are many people who just do not understand the whole shuttle service issue and probably are not getting on the right shuttles to begin with. Overall, this was a great vacation and I definately would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, magical and amazing stay....!”
Reviews.Author: RobLabbett
