Reviews.Content: As we were driving over a bridge we could see the hotel and I knew it was going to good but I was mistaken...it was amazing! Walking into the lobby for the first time was fantastic, the staff and theming are brillant. The room was again brill, the view we had was of the sunset safari and we always had animals outside window, giraffe, ostrich and edland. not bad for a standard room. The sevice was good and had a good price range of restaurants. To sum the hotel up, fantastic theming, amazing views and a great location for getting to the theme parks using the WDW buses and if you want to go other attractions the road network was good. If you have one chance to go to Walt Disney World then stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A unique experience you shouldn't miss”
Reviews.Author: Englewoodlian
Reviews.Content: Where else can you look our your window and see zebras grazing? My sisters and I took our mother here for a "big girls only" trip and it was perfect. This resort is the farthest out, so be forwarded that buses may be a bit slow. We didn't have any trouble, but we also went at a slow time of year and are calm, relaxed travelers. I've stayed here four times and have never had rude service. It's a wonderful experience. As I tell everyone, stay here only a couple nights of your trip so that the cost is not so scary. We resort-hop every time we come to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: Ruledbycats
Reviews.Content: From the moment we got off the bus, until the moment we left for home, this place offered the best in accommodations, service, ambiance, and atmosphere. We are in the upper fifties age bracket and were traveling with our son, his wife and a 5 year old. Although for us it was a very expensive trip, it is one that we will never forget. Our only negatives were that the rooms were a little small, and had very little storage for clothes. This was a trip that was booked entirely through Disney. We had the meal plan which I do not recommend. When you have paid for everything in advance, you feel like you have to get everything that is due you, and therefore I found that I ate too much. However, all things considered, one of the best hotels were stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Best African stay I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: kego520
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here during our first trip to Disney World. We stayed a total of six nights since we were both receiving a free 5 day park hopper with water parks pass. We flew in on Sunday evening and the Magical Express picked us up. About 15 minutes after we got into our room (which was just a standard room, yet we got a view anyways), our luggage arrived. The room itself was very comfortable and quiet. This was surprising since the terrace area outside the door can be noisy from the lobby area. We dined at Boma, the buffet, once for dinner and once for breakfast, and used our dining plan for each. Their dinner buffet was amazing, with some of the best foods I have ever tasted. The assortment of meats is excellent and I wanted to try everything to see what something new would be like; unfortunately, my belly decided not to allow me. I was just too full. Oh, and while we were eating, the waiter brought us a plate with two zebra cake thingys and the words "Happy Anniversary" written in chocolate sauce on the plate. Indeed, we were celebrating our 2nd anniversary along with my return from Iraq. During breakfast, the have a hot cereal offered that is made with sesame seeds and other grains, and my wife ended up getting like 3 bowls of that. She fell in love with it because of the taste and the fact that it's healthy. The pool at the hotel is huge and has a slide for kids. Their are also two "hidden" jacuzzis. The temperature of the pool was warm, yet cool enough to use as a retreat from the Florida heat. I don't know if I could afford to stay there for that long of a stay again without the kind of discount I got (military), but if I can, I will.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely consider AKL again for a return visit”
Reviews.Author: Iluvdiving
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was first rate. Our room was fantastic, always clean when we would return from the park, and no request of the housekeeping staff was ever denied. The savannah is in full view and animals are seen at all hours. The busses run about every 15 minutes both to and from the park. AKL is the furthest from EPCOT and Magic Kingdom, so bus ride was a little longer (I'd say 20 minutes) but it beats driving your own vehicle. The Mara always had grab and go foods available as well as grill service and awesome breakfast (Mickey waffles!!) We didn't eat at Jiko or Boma simply because there were other places we wanted to try. Would definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “It was that bad!!!1”
Reviews.Author: olive2009
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The people behind the desk were very rude. The supervisor behind the desk never even looked at us as we were asking questions. Paid for a savannah room, when we got to our room, all we saw was a punch of old pipes, no animals. After complaing about the room, we received a much better room. If your room is not to your satisfaction, complain, it really works. The buses to the park were terrible. We were always the last ones to be picked up. They were little and to far in between. Next time I will probably stay at a hotel with the monorail, and much better service behind the desk.

Reviews.Title: “An unforgetable trip!”
Reviews.Author: Holli6
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Animal Kingdom Lodge in 2007. Everything about this hotel was fab! The swimming pool was great, the food was great, the staff couldn't have been more friendly. The savannah veiw was amazing. Imagine not only waking up to a blast of heat when you go out onto your balcony, but you're welcomed by a giraffe staring into your window! Which is totally unique for hotels. We only had 2 main problems when we stayed there which was the hotel was quite far away from any parks- the nearest was 'Animal Kingdom Park.' Also, in the evenings there wasn't much to do apart from eat and go for a walk. However, i'd definatley stay there again and I would definatley advise people who are trying America out to stay there! We're going back this year and staying at a different hotel, which will hopefully we just as brilliant as Animal Kingdom Lodge.

Reviews.Title: “I loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gym4
Reviews.Content: This resort is absolutely wonderful. The hotel itself is beautiful. The people who work there are very friendly and helpful. I dined at two of the three restaurants and they were both very good. Our room was very nice- my husband and I shared a queen bed and my children, ages 6 and 15 had bunk beds. We had a Savannah view that allowed us to sit out on the balcony and see zebra, giraffes, exotic birds and various other species. The pool was a great place to re-energize after a day at the different parks. We looked at the animals at night with night vision goggles. Transportation to all Disney attractions was easily accessible. It was great- I'll be back asap.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Lisadsnyhd
Reviews.Content: This stunning hotel is full of hidden surprises. It is an artistic rendering of Africa, clearly not meant to be Africa, with the exception of the Savannah, but the salute is lovely. The art work is all authentic and a pleasure to behold. It was fun to talk with the employees from Africa who were all very friendly and open to our questions about their homeland and culture. On this visit we had four adults, three children 9,7 and 4 and two teenagers 15 and 13 in our group. CHECK IN: We were immediately greeted by valet and bell services upon arrival. Our items were put in storage until our room was ready. I utilized their new online check in and was able to go to a special queue upon arrival but since the lobby was empty it didn't make much of a difference to my check-in. I still had to go through the routine of verifying my address, etc so I didn't see much point. The only thing different was that they already had my credit card number. I was able to add my dining plan at the check in desk but I had to go to concierge to add my park passes. I don't recall ever having to do that before. I wish we could do that in the online check in process, now that would make a difference! Our room was also not ready until after 5 p.m. which was rather inconvenient as it made us late for our dinner reservations because we wanted to freshen up (We ended up missing the dinner entirely, read below) THE HOTEL : The Jambo House lobby is far more impressive than the small but beautiful Kidani Village lobby. Following a theme which are true to their roots, Jambo is more akin to a large ceremonial house and Kidani is more like a home or small village. They each exhibit traditional African architectural styles. Kidani still looks a bit barren at the moment, but that is because the Village has only just opened and the plants have not had a chance to really take root and flourish whereas on the Jambo side, well, we often commented that we felt like we were really in a jungle. What an experience to walk out on to our balcony at any time, day or night and see magnificent giraffes, zebras, pelicans, cranes, wildebeests, ostriches, emus, flamingos, well lets just say there were plenty of animals to watch. The Savannah has feeding stations set near the rooms so the animals will definitely stop by, but even when they weren't eating they had no problem hanging out near the people, screaming kids, whistling grown-ups, whatever the humans were doing didn't seem to make them run off. We even had the chance to watch them weather a severe lightning and rain storm at 2 a.m.. They just stood there nonchalantly chewing, I was a wreck. Turns out there were almost 19,000 lightning strikes during the storm (thanks Doppler radar, some things I don't actually need to know LOL). The point is it was interesting to learn that their reaction was not what I had expected. THE ROOMS: We are DVC members and rented a studio and a two bedroom suite in the Jambo House. I cannot imagine paying the 'asking' price of nearly $13,000 for the seven nights we had these accommodations but I guess someone does. The rooms were a few doors away from each other. Both were Savannah View rentals. Rooms without a Savannah view looked over gardens, the pool, or had a distant view of the parking lot. Everyone has access to the Savannah in the halls and the lobby. Guests not staying at the resort are not permitted to use this resort's pools or attend it's activities. They may dine at it's restaurants. Having said that, I'm not sure how they would know you weren't a guest as they don't police it like they do at the Yacht and Beach Club. The studio room and two bedroom suite are nicely decorated, as expected, better than the average hotel, with cute Lion King carvings, tile decor and not so hidden Mickey's on the bed, carpet, shower curtain and even the furniture. They studio is of average size for a hotel room, and the two bedroom was a studio attached to a one bedroom suite. ** TIP: I would check with members of your party to see if anyone has an issue with sleeping on a sofa bed. Big teens may not find it any more comfortable than an adult would. My 13 year old son is taller than I am and found it uncomfortable. Our 15 year old slightly built daughter ended up sleeping there and said it was OK but was glad she only weighs 100 because the mattress was thin. I am 5'6" and weigh 200lbs and found it uncomfortable. ** The regular beds were VERY comfortable and all the pillows and sheets felt luscious and soft and were pleasingly white. The blankets were nice, but we had to remove the comforter because it felt so heavy on our tired feet! We had everything we needed in the kitchen except dishwasher soap which was supplied to us for free when we tried to buy some in the store. **TIP: I suggest you seriously think about your needs before arriving and shop at the local Publix or Winn Dixie. The on site store is very expensive. Water in the park is $2.50 a bottle. We buy a few cases freeze them the night before and drink them as they melt while in the park. We had two a piece this trip but it was convenient because we had a stroller, normally we only carry one a piece. Yes there are water fountains in the park-but FL water is a bit unpleasant to the palette and Disney does not make any effort to keep the fountains cold. ** I really liked the square plates and animal print on the coffee cups. Yes I'm a nerd. My only real difficulty was with the lighting in the bathroom. The interior lighting of the resort and rooms is rather dim. The resort is dedicated to energy conservation and uses fluorescent bulbs, and I think in view of the African theme maybe we were supposed to be in "fire light", and maybe they needed it dim on the balconies (because there was no light at all) to minimize disturbing the animals, but the light in the bathroom made it impossible to apply make up without holding a mirror. I think this problem could be fixed by attaching a make-up mirror on an expendable arm to the wall that either lights up itself or reaches the light illuminating the sink. I assume though that older guests or guests with partial blindness may find this 'feature' rather difficult to deal with. WHAT TO DO: There is a huge list of activities to attend at this resort. If you can it is worth it to build a day into your schedule to spend at the resort attending these activities. Almost all of them are free. They are like participating in a National Geographic show. The little ones in our group loved it. Our teenagers, not so much, but they happen to be avid readers so they knew a lot of the info offered. For casual observers not interested in 'signing up' for an activity there is night viewing of the animals with night vision binoculars, story telling by a fire, and lots of employees on hand to tell you whatever you wanted to know about the animals on the Savannah. The Jambo Pool and slide are lovely with beautiful plants shading many areas from the harsh sun. We never had any trouble getting a lounge chair. The flamingos which hang out in their own area are a must see. The new Kidani pool was a blast, in particular the "Uwanja Camp" kid's area which feature water falls, spray guns, rope bridges and a mini slide for the kids to play in. We had a blast squirting each other 'defending' the fort. Yes the teens got into this activity with the little ones. Smiles all around. DINING: On our first night we had 5:15 reservations for Sanaa, Kidani's table service restaurant. Unfortunately after making sure we got on the correct bus (DownTown Disney) we were taken to DownTown Disney (DTD) instead of the Kidani Village which was supposed to be the next stop before heading to DTD. The bus driver admitted he had gone to Kidani first instead of Jambo. We ended up not being able to eat for another 2 1/2 hours which was not an impressive way to start our first night of vacation. We ate at the counter service Mara's three nights. The veggie pizza, African stew, fallafel, chicken pita and bacon double cheeseburger were all very good. The employees were all very nice as well. In the past we have eaten at Boma's, a buffet with African and American food. It is always booked and always loud. The atmosphere, food and service are very good, definitely a family friendly restaurant and worth the table service coupon on the dining plan. When we missed eating at Sanaa we decided to give up a reservation at EPCOT and use two table service vouchers at Jikos instead. We felt guilty about bringing three little kids to this fine dining establishment but were immediately made comfortable when they put us in a room with other kids separate from the adult diners. Our waiter was quick and efficient, friendly and very knowledgeable about the wine. We were very happy with his advice and enjoyed what we were served. The food was absolutely delicious, in particular the ostrich appetizer, lamb, scallop and steak entrees and the pistachio brulee dessert. I have stayed at almost all of Disney's Resorts, the Animal Kingdom Lodge is a jewel in Disney's crown. I never expect everything to go absolutely perfect, so the few inconveniences (late room, bus driver who went to the wrong location) we experienced did not mar this lovely resort's reputation for me. Besides, as soon a I spoke with anyone about these problems we were apologized to and given a perk (Fast Passes, I know they're free, but we could use them anywhere, didn't have to rush to get them so they were much appreciated). I think given their volume of guests Disney does a fantastic job and handles glitches well. I have never actually spent $8000 on a room for a week so I don't know how to compare it's value with another $8000 resort, but I definitely felt I got my "points" worth from my DVC membership. I am looking forward to coming here again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: NikkiJH
Reviews.Content: From day 1 this hotel exceeded my expectations. Imagine opening the curtains on your first morning to be met by giraffes, zebra and red river hogs.......and we hadn't paid extra for the savanah view! The children (9 &6) could not believe their eyes and would spend hours sometimes just watching the animals go about their daily routines. Room were nicely decorated though not very big - but we didn't go there to stay in the room so it wasn't a problem. Friendly staff and nice to stay within the Disney Resort but in a hotel that is African themed rather than Mickey themed. Food in the restaurant very good - excellent buffet choice and good quality. Food in the restaurant by the pool was fast food and you get what you pay for. Just a little tip - if you don't want to pay out for breakfast in the main resaurant every morning, get a take out from the rest.... by the pool and eat there or your room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: tammy_0179
Reviews.Content: We just returned from AKL. I cannot say enough how fabulous we found this resort to be. I was a little apprehensive over some of the recent negative reviews - but was pleased to find them inaccurate to say the least. The resort was awesome - I woke up every morning to several animals outside of our room. It was so quiet and peaceful while sitting on your private balcony that you would never know you were visiting a major tourist attraction. Our room was great! It was cleaned perfectly daily and we were treated to "towel animals" as well. We didn't try the two main restaurants as my son is very picky & probably wouldn't have liked the African food served there - but we went to the Mara daily and it was better than average for what they had available (and we NEVER waited in long lines). The bus rides were not that long even to the Magic Kingdom - only approximately 17 minutes. My biggest complaint - the extremely rude - other tourists. I have never been to Disney and experienced such complete and total disregard/disrespect for other people as I did on this most recent trip. Cutting in line, pushing & yelling (and this was from the adults). But you can't blame WDW for the actions of their "guests" who for some reason think that they & their kids are the only ones that want to experience Disney and lack the patience and consideration of people around them. But in regards to the AKL - in one word - Outstanding! I am already planning on another trip - possibly skipping the theme parks all together & just staying at the lodge as that was the highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: jbarmand
Reviews.Content: This June, we took our first trip to Walt Disney World -- my husband and I, my 12-year-old daughter and my 9-year-old son. We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge with a savanna-view room and LOVED IT!! The grounds were beautiful. We saw animals outside of our balcony just about every morning and every evening. The pool was very large and the pool area was very pretty. Staff members greeted us with "Welcome Home," each day we arrived back at the resort from the parks, and were very knowledgeable about the animals we were seeing out on the viewing area. Bus transportation to the parks was great -- nothing to complain about except for transportation to Downtown Disney which seemed to take forever (but that's what I hear from friends who stay at other resorts too!)The only downside was the room was that the room was rather small for a deluxe property, but I hear the rooms are the same size as those at Wilderness Lodge, another very popular Disney resort. If you are not adamant about staying as close as possible to Magic Kingdom, I would highly recommend the Animal Kingdom Lodge. It feels like you are in another world!

Reviews.Title: “brilliant enjoyed every moment!!!”
Reviews.Author: qwertyBirmingham
Reviews.Content: i thuroughly enjoyed my stay from the second we arriveed to the second we left. as you walk in you feel the brilliant african atmosphere an the music playing and you are greeted straight away by the staff who were top notch,they were freindly and couldn do enough for you! the rooms are nice and the views are brilliant! i was seeing animals like zebras and giraffes what ive never seen before! the pool was very good and warm, lots of lifeguard on duty (i would say atleast 5 ) the poolside bar soldl drinks and the slide was good but only from children roughly from about 5 years old to 11 years old but nether the less still good (: the arcade was fun and VERY addictive which you could say is a bad thing but is only my fault for keep going in there but still left with prizes. above i mention the lobby but it is also very good when you have jus woke up and down from your rooms as it is very relaxing and gets you in the mood for a fun filled day. hopefully ill be able 2 go back soon if i can make my parents mind (im 13)i strongly reccomend trying this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!11

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Very Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: anemales
Reviews.Content: Are family has visited this hotel both in December 2006 and in December 2008. We keep coming back because it feels so comfortable. It houses two of the best restaurants in Disney World; Jiko and Boma. When we go back it'll probably be at the AKL again (in Dec. 2009). The decor is beautiful and comforting. There has been some reviews in my opinion that greatly exaggerate the distance and time it takes to travel somewhere using the Disney bus system. One review stated it took 45 minutes to get to Downtown Disney. Of the four total weeks we had stayed at this property, it never took more than 15 minutes. Folks, it's only about 5 miles away. One of the biggest complaints about the buses is how long it takes to get anywhere. I will say it is not the closest hotel to the Magic Kingdom but what others fail to mention is that because the hotel is somewhat secluded, you don't have to share the bus with other hotels. The AKL buses only make one stop. Your destination. After a long day and tired kids, how would you like to make two stops at other hotels before getting to yours? By the way, did I mention the buses are FREE? Honestly folks, the bus system for the AKL is beyond excellent for the price. The only other knock on the hotel would be the room size for the price. It is on the smaller size for the price but we still find it well worth it. If I had strollers and/or a crib in the room, I would say the rooms are very small. Our overall opinion is that we love this hotel and would stay here as often as we can. Keep it real folks. Enjoy it! It's Disney World!

Reviews.Title: “TOO FAR TOO SMALL TOO EXPENSIVE”
Reviews.Author: Roxana5
Reviews.Content: Definitely NOT a 4 star hotel. The hotel is very nice with lots of detail but the room accommodations are definitely not up to par. They are small and not as you would expect for a 4 star hotel. This location is so far from everything. I guess it is great if you only plan to go the the Animal Kingdom which is great and you can pretend you are in a far away place. But if you do want to do the rest of the attractions, you don't have to pretend, you really are in far away place considering the distance and traffic. We always drive because those shuttle buses take for ever not a good thing when you have very tired, sleepy children (and parents). The more I stay on Disney site, the more I am dissappointed. [At least this place was clean]. I don't think I ask too much when they charge that much!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed every moment!”
Reviews.Author: dachuns
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at the Animal Kingdom Lodge Jambo House! (Kidani Village is the Villas.) It was a stay of a lifetime, I don't know where in the world you could stay at a hotel and have the same experience! We felt like we were on a safari with all the comforts of home and more! The room was cozy, with African decor and dim lighting, you feel the ambience of a safari. The rooms were very quiet. with AC and a dark room, we had a very restful sleep. Our room was on the Zebra trail facing the Uzima Savanna on the second floor. We saw animals most of the time, although I would have preferred a room facing the Arusha Savanna. There are different animals in different savannas, and some animals roam around different savannas. You can see the different savannas around the hotel's various viewing areas. Second floor has a good vantage point. Being on the Zebra trail was very convenient to all the hotel amenities. All cast members were very friendly and provided first class service. Yes the hotel location is the remotest of all disney resort hotels If it is important to be close to the park, then you should stay at a different hotel. Yes food options are very limited. With a little planning you can eat at the parks and get more variety. The Dining plan was great, you just order what you wanted without much thought to price and you get dessert even when you don't really want it. Now that's a vacation! Yes they do give a lot of food! We used Disney transportation. Magical Express from airport to hotel, it was great, no problems. We did not recieve our luggage tags, so we picked up our own luggage and brought it with us. The park shuttles worked fine. Didn't have to wait too long. Going back to the hotel at park closing was the longest and the most crowded. I would definitely recomend staying at a Disney resort when going to Disney World! It makes all the difference! I can say that because we moved to a non-Disney hotel for three more days for our vacation. All I can say it's not the same!

Reviews.Title: “Too far away, small rooms”
Reviews.Author: BillMMiami
Reviews.Content: The Lodge is nice however too far away from the parks, especially DOwntown Disney: almost 45 minute shuttle ride. The rooms are way too small for the price. Other Disney resorts like Port Orleans are closer and cheaper. The places to buy food are too small and few for the amount of guests. A bit dissapointed I{d say.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: loopyloo22
Reviews.Content: Unfortunatley only stayed 2 nights here at the end of May. Had a room with bunk beds for the 11nad 14 year old which was much better than them sharing a bed! Was lucky enough to be upgraded to have acces to the concierge lounge.This was a lovely place to sit in relative peace and watch people milling around the lobby.The hotel itself really was a great reminder of the lodges we stayed in last year on safari but on a much bigger scale. if resources and time were endless I would be heading back asap.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Kids”
Reviews.Author: TheECs
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 13 days, should have been 14 but a 24 hour delay leaving London meant we missed a day. Due to travel company not passing on our delay to the hotel when we arrived we were told our reservation had been cancelled as we had not turned up. However once we had explained what had happened everything was sorted promptly. We had booked a Savanah room and the kids were absolutly amazed when we got into our room and looked over the balcony to Giraffes, Bongos and other such creatures. The room was a reasonable size, but not massive. However once we had emptied cases etc into the wardrobes and chest of draws there was enough room for the children to run up and down in. The hotel itself was decorated as you would expect from an African themed hotel. The staff were helpful and polite all the time, the room was cleaned everyday. The pool was excellent and there was always somewhere to leave your towels etc. The children spent most of the time on the water slide but there was plenty of room within the pool for swimming in. There was lots going on in and around the hotel, to much for us to take in even in 13 days and we did not find the kiddies park until a couple of days before the end of our holiday. We only ate in the main resturant once and found plenty to choose from. All in all probably the best hotel we have stayed in in our 4 visits to Orlando, Disney is for some once in a life time holiday and if you can stretch the budget this far its worth every penny just for the reaction on the childrens faces when they see the animals.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic”
Reviews.Author: memphiswheels
Reviews.Content: Amazing having read some reviews some people must be hard to please or just unlucky we went for our 10th wedding anniversary and we were not dissapointed although not in dearer savanahh room we had a view over a waterhole at the end of Sunset. Everyday animals but we never knew which came to the area, could have spend days just watching this. The architecture of the hotel is amazing and there is so much to look at including displays of African artwork that it would take another two days to look at all this. the Lobby is well thought out and beutiful with plenty of seating, the bar and restraunt areas fantastic apart from the fast food area Mara which could do with a little TLC. If your kids are really into arts and crafts and wildlife there is a good activities program(for junior school age) The staff were fantastic and helpful, as a Disabled person I had a puncture in my wheelchair which they fixed and also bought me a spare tube with no charge. For the more interested there is a program for adults based on wildlife and the Wanyama Safari Game drive and dinner (extra cost) although expensive is fantastic. the observation points for animal wathcing are great our room was clean and tidy and well cared for, bad points If all you want is Mickey mouse and the theme parks go somewhere cheaper as the charm of this hotel can be found in enjoying the building, the animals and the pool area (stop and smell the roses) For some people we spoke to15 minutes on a coach to Magic kindom This was the furthest away)was to far (but Hey Did you see the wildebeast from your bedroom window) and is'nt holiday about relaxing The only uncleanliness we saw in 2 weeks was that it seemed to take a while for room service items to be removed from hallways Our room although beutiful and well kitted out (best wheel in shower i ever used) was a little small for a manual wheelchair and would be no good for a larger powered chair The food is fantastic but if you do not like spicy or are not adventurous then your choice could be limited the lighting systems in the bedrooms could be better as the initial light inside our door took ages to come brighter The themed music can get annoying especially when animal watching would you really have pounding drums out on a safari? Older kids if not into wildlife or the pool might get a little bored. But it is a fantastic pool good points too many to mention but enough to say that I am saving up to stay there again as soon as possible

Reviews.Title: “3 star with Disney Flare”
Reviews.Author: Sagandang
Reviews.Content: This hotel was nothing more than a 3 star with Disney Flare. The room was clean but nothing special. I thought the Villas were much better. We ordered room service and the tray from our meal sat outside our door for 3days. My hubby and I would make bets on how long they would take to pick it up. The pool was very nice along with the dinning. I guess I just wanted more for the price. Overall good.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: VacationblissIndiana
Reviews.Content: The resort was perfect. My husband and I could not have asked for a better experience. The room was very clean and the entire staff was professional and friendly. I am surprised by some of the other reviews. I honestly can not say a bad thing about our stay. We enjoyed the animals while we sat on our balcony and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely breathtaking - perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: scrappinmomto3
Reviews.Content: While we are experienced Disney travelers, this was our first stay at AKL. My girls (9 &14) have been begging to stay here for a few years. This year our travel party included myself, my 2 girls, my friend with her 2 kids (9 yr old son& 14 yr old daughter). We stayed for 7 nights, 4th floor, savannah view. I simply cannot tell you the feeling of waking up every morning and sitting on the little balcony and drinking my coffee in the peace and quiet with a giraffe or two, ot a sebra or 2 or 3. If you are an animal lover, this is the absolute perfect place for you. There are so many places to view and watch the animals, the overlooks, the quiet places with rocking chairs, the night vision spot, and many more. My 9 year old simply loved the kids activities and actually preferred that to swimming! The swimming pool is very cool itself as well. It's designed to look like a "watering hole" so it's zero entry & just fun. While there my kids made bead neckklaces, t-shirts, windchimes, and did the animal tracking. I was able to enjoy the poolside and indoor bar for some tasty cocktails. Boma and Jiko the 2 onsite restraunts, are just awesome. Jiko is probably now my very favorite place to eat in all of Disney and Boma has the best breakfast buffet I've ever had. The staff was wonderful and friendly. I don't think I walked past a staff member ever who didn't greet me or tell me to have a nice day. If it seems that I am completely in love with this resort, that's because it's true. This was my 14th trip to Disney, and my 10th time staying onsite. I don't think I will ever stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Disney has to offer”
Reviews.Author: piphow
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge on our 2nd trip to Disney as we stayed there on our 1st trip in 2007 and loved it so much. Myself, my husband and 9-year-old son stayed there for a week this time and from the moment that you step into the impressive lobby, you feel totally relaxed. We ate breakfast at Boma every morning, like our last holiday, didn't have reservations for any morning but never waited more than 15 minutes. The staff at Boma are very pleasant and the food exceptional and very good value for money. My only comment regarding Boma is that their evening buffet does not have enough choice for children. The bedrooms at the lodge are very nicely appointed and quiet, however, are a bit dim in the evening, but this in a way does add to the ambience of the place. My comment regarding the rooms is that they do need to have way more storage space for clothing. Room service was always delivered quickly. Transportation to the parks is by bus and they are very frequent and we never waited more than 10 minutes for a bus. I spoke to quite a lot of people at the Lodge who had stayed at other resorts at Disney and they said that Animal Kingdom Lodge was by far the best. I would say that meals at Boma are very good value and the food is plentiful and cooked to a high standard, the Mara food is not to my taste and Jiko is gorgeous. AKL is maintained to a very high standard and should be very proud of its service and reputation.

Reviews.Title: “How can you beat a room with animals right outside your window?”
Reviews.Author: NBarry
Reviews.Content: Our family loved this experience. Disney certainly knows how to do things right. The rooms were so clean and it was just very cool to have different animals outside your room each day, as they rotate the animals they have on thier grounds. The food was amazing... just great family experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay....Absolutely love this property!”
Reviews.Author: SheraBella
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge since it opened 10 years ago, and I still love it! I can't imagine staying at another property. We had a great view of animals 24 hours a day, the pool is amazing, and the lobby is beautiful. The one thing I would recommend when staying at Disney is renting a car. It saves so much time instead of waiting for buses. This is my first trip driving in which I drove to all the theme parks instead of using Disney transportation. The AKL buses now have to stop at the new vacation club first. I got so used to being the only hotel stop on the buses. Many of the other properties usually share their buses with another hotel or have other stops on the way (ex: Blizzard Beach). Someone had mentioned that staying at a monorail resort would eliminate this wait. Well, it will elminate the wait to the Magic Kingdom, but not to other theme parks, where you will have to stand in line like the other properties. Also, when taking a bus to any theme park, there will always be a walk to the theme park entrance. You can't have buses dropping off people in middle of a crowd trying to enter the park. So, be expected to wait for buses and walk to entrances no matter what property you are staying at. If you plan on eating at any of the Disney dining, definately make reservations far in advance, especially for Boma. Everyone in the staff was very friendly. If you want to know more about the animals, make sure to visit the night vision viewing area. The animal staff was amazing and told us great stories of the animals. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, terrific concierge, great restaurants... what else could you want?”
Reviews.Author: fafaaway
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here with my 2 - 2 year old twins last month and had a regular room with a Savannah View. All I can say is "how amazingly cool" to sit on your (smallish) deck looking out at Zebras and Giraffes, among other animals. The kids couldn't get enough. In another review someone talks about the animals being caged up at night. I am not sure what they're talking about because I saw them every time I looked out. There are some berms constructed, I presume to allow the animals some down-time... maybe some of them were asleep back there for that person. But I can promise you that I saw no less than 6 exotic animals each time I looked out. The staff there is over-the-top wonderful. No one does customer service better than Disney. We didn't have dining reservations when we arrived and the Concierge worked very hard to get us some great reservations... he was 50/50 successful, but that's certainly more than what I would have expected in a busy weekend. There are several places to eat. The two best restaurants are incredibly great. Jiko is the nicest tableside service restaurant there. I'd say my meal quality was comparable to the top 20% of restaurants. The wine list focuses on Africa, mostly South Africa. I'm comfortable with "traditional" fine dining wine lists but am completely unfamiliar with South African wines. The waiter was rather knowledgeable regarding the wines and we had a very pleasant discussion about our likes and dislikes in various, more familiar, wines and he brought us a mid-range bottle that fit our tastes to a T. There are plenty of kids there and it's one of the first times I've felt comfortable having a great meal with my kids eating plain kid food. Boma is a buffet. In my mind, buffet = bland food, overcooked, and people confusing quantity with quality. Oh, how wrong was I. Absolutely delicious! The food had a variety of flavor and spices like I've never seen in a buffet. The quality of the food was top notch. There were several selections of meats, vegetables, breads, salads, and soups, and desserts. The wine list is similar (identical?) to Jiko. The service was excellent. It was a little pricey, but totally worth it for breakfast and dinner. The only 2 complaints/cautions I have are this: 1) They recently opened up the Kidanni lodge and bus service to/from the various parks stops there first. The signage and announcements aren't up to snuff yet. Hopefully WDW addresses this soon. 2) Some of the hallways are exceptionally long. We were in one of the end rooms, which was great because you were able to see 2 different savannas (and 2 different sets of animals). But if you have difficulty walking distances, then you might want to request a room close to the front desk. Yes, the rooms are a little small-ish given what you pay, but they are comparably sized to the Polynesian for the same level of room.

Reviews.Title: “Spoiled our "Fun Weekend Getaway"”
Reviews.Author: TravelingAnnNaples
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travel frequently and we choose to pay for the comfort and amenities of a 4 to 5 star resort. This resort has a very nice theme, excellent location, awesome animal savanna, but very poor customer service and poor management. You will pay for a 4 to 5 star resort service and don't expect more than 1 star. Upon our arrival we discovered that Savanna view room with a King bed we paid for and reserved over a month in advance wasn't available and instead we were given 2 double beds for our entire stay. The room was so small that we kept bumping in to the sharp wooden corners of the beds several times and I suffered huge bruises on my legs. The room was dirty and we discovered cleaned drinking glass, had someone's cigarette ashes stuck to the bottom of it. Apparently it was used as an ashtray. The worst disappointment was that we were unable to have dinner on the first evening or any other evening at the Boma restaurant. We settled in our room by 5:30 PM and called down to Boma, but all we got is a recording that they are not taking reservations. At 6:00 PM we went down to Boma and when I said to the Host - "Two for Dinner", he asked if I had reservations and I said "No, I couldn't get through but I'd like to make reservation for this evening" he replied with a very sarcastic smile and said, "Nope, we're not taking reservations and you're not eating here tonight". We were surprised with his attitude. Apparently the resort is so busy that customer courtesy goes out the window. We were too mad to order room service. After traveling since early morning, and very tired, we went to bed hungry. For breakfast expect to wait for a minimum of half hour, and through our 5 day stay, not once were we able to eat at Boma. The resort was totally unable to accommodate all of their guests for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday - only home one day and missing it already”
Reviews.Author: debandchloe
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from the most amazing holiday staying at akl. i feel like we must have stayed at a totally different hotel from the one described by some people because our room was always immaculately cleaned and the staff were friendly and went out of their way to help us with everything from booking meals to educating us on some of the many animals roaming the savannah. we all felt sad to be leaving and cant wait until we can afford to return again. thank you akl staff for making our whole stay really magical

Reviews.Title: “Great Lodge but not so great location it was a long travel time to Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: dagirlamanda
Reviews.Content: The Jambo Lodge at Animal Kingdom Lodge was very nice with all the animals. There are two resorts at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. The only thing about it that I did not like is that you have to take a bus to get to the parks because it is the farthest away from them. It took about 20 to 25 minutes on the bus to get to Magic Kingdom. The bus does not drop you off near the park entrance so you have to be prepared to walk a lot to get to the main entrance. We will be going again soon but I would recommend staying at a resort that has the monorail so that you don't have to do as much walking before you get in the parks. We spent most of our time traveling by Disney bus to get to our destinations which sucked up most of our fun time in the parks. Another thing that will save time if you have small kids.....bring your own stroller. When you get off the bus if you don't have a stroller you will have to carry your child to the main entrance of the park so that you can rent a stroller. Also you must park your stroller at designated areas in the park or the park staff will take them. There is no stroller parking areas near all the rides so most of the time you are dropping off your child with family and one parent is searching for a stroller parking area. To me they should have a stroller parking area near every ride. So my opinion is that the Animal Kingdom Lodge is nice but not close enough to the parks. We were so tired of waiting in lines for buses and then walking so far from the bus drop off areas to the main entrance of the parks. Stay at a resort that has monorail access. It is more money but very much worth it. Also, purchase the Deluxe Dining Plan. You can make reservations ahead of time to eat at all the popular Disney resteraunts. We really enjoyed eating the variety of food. All them were great!

Reviews.Title: “Experience ruined by low housekeeping standards”
Reviews.Author: summerfun33
Reviews.Content: We have been to the Animal kingdom Lodge twice before and in enjoyed our stay tremonedously. However, I am sad to report the huge drop in standards...after this stay I never want to stay there again. We checked in this past April for 7 nights--check in was pleasant. We arrived at out room, and at first glance it was okay. We went to eat in the Bomba restaurant--fantastic. We were now exhausted after traveling all day, so we went to pull back the covers on the bed where my 5 year old daughter was to sleep and there was somebody else's black thick back hair (I'm assuming) that was 1/2 way down the bed. I took a picture of it...but I will spare you that. I called housekeeping, and the housekeeping manager did call to apologize...and assured me that there wouldn't be any more issues...but we waited another 25minutes (now 11pm) for a sheet change. When the woman arrived she just seemed annoyed. In the other bed there was some crumbs in it--again not ours b/c we just checked in. The sheets were changed finally and we went to sleep. I also informed the front desk of the back hair issue and was re-directed to housekeeping...at this point , I feel like a room change and upgrade was in order. But neither was offered. later that night, my daughter woke up coughing coughing coughing in the ...no problem before arrival, her only allergy is dust. I got her back to sleep, and in the morning I realized the thick coat of dust all over the Tv armoire and head boards....so I wiped that down with a sock, since I left my cleaning supplies at home. We went to the park the following day and spent the whole day there. We came back after the fireworks exhausted. The day before my daughter had some snacks in the bed. When we returned the same crumbs were in the bed...I mean I guess at least I knew they were hers...but confused why the sheets weren't changed. But on top of that our bathroom sink and mirror area hadn't been cleaned. The same soap and conditioner that was spilled on the counter tops was still there. The same glasses that we had used to rinse our mouths out with and had toothpaste marks were still there. The iron that was still too hot to put away when we left was in the middle of the floor,and the mirror was dusty. I contacted housekeeping for a sheet change for both beds since it was evident that neither had been changed...trust me...and then I was informed by housekeeping management that they only change the sheets every 3rd day....okay what??? But shouldn't better judgment prevail when the sheets are dirty???? I then requested to be put down for a daily sheet change...and he said of course no problem. I also explained about the vanity area,and it was clear the floor wasn't being vacuumed either. I will spare you the rest of the details, but your room was never properly cleaned. After day 4 of a dirty room, they finally offered us a room change--so my relaxing afternoon at the pool, I spent packign up all the suit cases, etc...to move to a new room where ther sheets were dirty thre as well...For a five star hotel, the room quality is a 1...very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Little faults....”
Reviews.Author: BrazilAca
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! Great lobby, clean rooms, helping staff. Great for Kids! We actually extended in two days our stay! The Hotel lacks Wi-Fi connection. You have to be patient with the foreign staff. The rooms could be a little bigger, especially for a family of 4. All around a great Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE, BEWARE This hotel doesnt even compare to other disney resorts”
Reviews.Author: jeep1242
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort in early May 2009...It was filthy we travel to disney usually twice a year and this is our first time at animal kingdom lodge we always stay on disney property and are always very happy until...............dirty room at check in .....garbage on property was overflowing from most cans....... same room service trays were in the hall from when we left AM till we returned in PM............not usual go out of their way disney service this hotel really disappointed us......in sept.we stayed at wilderness lodge and loved everything....shame on you animal kingdom lodge........

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, loved it”
Reviews.Author: akgirl51997
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights in early May at AKL in a 2 queen bed club level room. We absolutely enjoyed the hotel. Because we were club level we had a savanna view room on the fourth floor. Everyone was very friendly. I would have given the service a very good if our housekeeper had not been so stingy with shampoo and lotion. I had to request more twice. Other than that annoyance the service was very good. We had a long walk from the lobby to our room but we had a good location on the savanna and were close to the pool and restaurants. The hotel is gorgeous. There is so much detail involved in the hotel design. I enjoyed just walking around looking at the art and fixtures. Words really cannot capture how beautiful it is. We took advantage of many of the hotel's activities - especially the "bead" activities geared toward kids. They offer a lesson about flamingos and pelicans, animal tracking, and habitats and one with various mucial instruments. Our daughter liked doing them and getting a bead at the completion of them. She enjoyed getting her face painted with an African design and of course seeing all the animals. Besides taking advantage of the activities we dined at all three restaurants at the hotel, used the pool and its slide, played in the arcade, shopped in the gift shop, went to the club level lounge daily and had our child go to Simba's Clubhouse (the kid center) one evening while we dined. We also used both resort buses and drove. The room was well-appointed. Very pretty but not huge. It was fine for us because we have one child and we not in the room a lot but if you have 2 kids esp teen-aged it could feel a bit tight. The room had teh 2 queen beds, table and 2 chairs, dresser with large flat screen TV, closet, ipod dock, safe, small frig, coffee pot, double sinks and of course the balcony. We rarely heard any noise except when extreme (example - baby next door screamed for a few minutes our first evening and we could hear it but not as if in the room). The beds are very high but I think they provided guard rails for kids because I saw something in the closet which looked like those. Our daughter althou just 5 did not need them. We really found the beds comfortable. In fact we tried to find out what they were. If I could change anything besides size about the room I would add another towel bar somewhere because the rack by the tub and the one outside my the sinks is not enough. I would also increase teh wattage of the lighting in the tub part of the bathroom. Just too dim. Before going I read the lighting in the room was inadequate and I disagree. The lighting in the room is fine with the exception of the tub room and the entry way light of the room. The pool was great. Don't think it is dirty when you see it. It is very clean but the bottom was painted greys and browns to resemble a watering hole in Africa and fir with the theme. Plenty of chairs and towels. The pool was cool not cold and so refreshing given the warm/hot days we had. The pool slide is not as good as the one at Disney's Coronado Springs Resort but still a good slide for the kids. The pool has a zero entry and gets no deeper than say 4.5 ft about. We liked the drinks from the pool bar esp the pina colava. The restaurants: Mara offers counter service. We mostly bought snacks, ice cream, kids pizza and burgers there. All were good and the prices were reasonabel for a resort. We ate at the buffet Boma for dinner one night. I really liked it for all the different foods they offered. My husband prefers more meat and potatos so it did not fly his kite by he found plenty to eat. The soups were really good as well as the salads. I read breakfast is wonderful but since we'd eaten so much this vacation and continentla breakfast was provided as part of the club level we decided to skip it. My DH and I also dined at Jiko. We shared the briout and filet mignon. Both were excellent. The service was wonderful and the restaurant design beautiful. Our DD went to the Simba Clubhouse that night. She had a good time and even asked to go back. We used the bus service offered to go to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom. It works well and was great because no other stops - just direct to the parks. We also rode to the parks since we had a car. I prefer that method only because I hate waiting at all for buses. But the bus worked for those days we really needed it. We liked the location of AKL - did not think it seemed too far away. We visited the Grand Floridian, Contemporary and Polynesian while at WDW and were so glad we chose AKL. We also stayed at the Coronado Springs Resort for 4 nights which we very much enjoyed too. The expereince was very different but equally enjoyable. We think we made 2 great picks for our stay at WDW. AKL's Club level was super too. I rated the value as very good because we got a great deal with recent promotions. I would not have paid rack rate but having said that I cannot imagine paying rack rate for any hotel. The club level was really worth it. We stocked up on fruit and sodas as weel has had our breakfast, evening appetizers and sometimes our dessrt there. One night we skipped dinner althogether and just foraged at the lounge. The club lounge had some great fruit in the am plus cereals, breads, juices, coffee and espressos. I liked the afternoon snacks esp the cookies and spiced nuts. The 5-7p offerings were good too - both hot and cold offerings from Boma as well as cheeses, fruit, African wines, beer, sodas and an African smoothie drink. The desserts from 8-10pm were a nice touch too with several liquers provided and coffee. I loved waking up each morning and sitting out on the balconey watching the animals. We were on the Zebra trail/Arusha savanna. We had zebra, giraffe, roan antelope, ankole cattle, crested cranes, guinea fowl, blesbok, kuda and eland out our window. I enjoyed all the sounds of the night and even the guniea fowls' calls in the morning. I also spent sunset on the balconey a number of evenings too. To us the lodge was magical and we would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: JMBZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a savannah view room arriving with our two daughter aged 11 and 7 ,arriving 10 days before the state school Easter break in the UK. Taking the kids out of school (2 days in their case) was well worth it, my virgin flight was only gbp 1400 and the parks were empty, we did all the disney stuff with hardly any queing. At the end of the stay the masses descended on the parks , on the last 2 days it was not even possible to get to the parks as the carparks were full , what a contrast it was, i was so glad that i had come before Easter. Regarding the hotel. Staff were always friendly and helpfull. Rooms , not huge , but more than adequate for a holiday of this type , disney is not the sort of place where you chill in the room all day is it ? Beds very comfortable indeed. Views of the animals amazing and no buliding works in sight (as some suggested on previous reviews).The pool area was a great place for the kids and us to relax after a day in the parks, water was warm . Dining at Boma i would only recommed for breakfast, it gets v busy in there and loud which is fine for breakfast but not so great for dinner . The mara is ok if u want some fast food. Jiko was ok but not really worth the money . As a side note there is a mc donalds v close to the hotel off one of the main roads (4 min drive) . Dont be put off by the fact that the hotel is on the edge of the WDW resort, its well worth staying here for the uniqeness of the animals . Forget paying for valet parking its a 3 min extra walk. Room service v good and speedy fast (you can even order food from Jiko if you pre warn them .)

Reviews.Title: “Savannah view of Giraffes the New Oceanfront”
Reviews.Author: drjonman2u
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. Rooms a little small and dark but seeing giraffes and zebrasgetting rowdy were definitely a hit. The Mara is their cafeteria style restaraunt. It is priced well and food is decent. Breakfast for my family of four was $17. The pool was cold. I guess Disney can not afford to heat pools. Housekeeping was attentive.

Reviews.Title: “stay here!”
Reviews.Author: j1m3bo
Reviews.Content: We just spent 2 weeks at Animal Kingdom Lodge and I really have no complaints at all. From the moment we arrived until the moment we left there were no issues. We had a savanna view (floor 3 is probably the best, so we were lucky cos that's what we got, on the zebra trail...concierge obviously has it's perks but it's more difficult to see the animals up there) and some of my family opted for a standard room so it was interesting to see the difference. They may not have had the main savanna view but they still got to see animals in the grassland behind them (including giraffe). so that was a real bonus. The theming is overwhelming when you firat walk through the doors. People "welome" you "home" as you walk in and the sheer size and detail of the lobby are amazing. Check in was swift and painless. First impressions of the room were very good. Some of the other deluxe hotels have bigger rooms, there is no denying that, but it was plenty big enough. The bathroom is a little small but more than acceptable and clean. A mini bar would have been good too but you can buy alcohol in the shop or Mara and put it in the fridge. It probably saved us money! We ate in all 3 restaurants. Jiko is beautiful...try the coffee rubbed beef short rib...it's divine, as were the pulled beef naans. Boma offers a fantastic biffuet for breakfast and dinner. Don't miss it. The Mara serves basic food when you are on the go, but it is fine. Room serive was prompt when delivering our dinner one eve and the choice of food is varied. The shop is fairly large and offers something for everyone including essentials if you leave anything at home. The pool area is fantastic and there are always sun longers free no matter when you use the pool area. The hot tubs are, erm, very hot! There are animal view points from all around the pool which is a lovely touch. I cannot believe people on here who have complained about the smell of the animals!!!! It's barely noticeable the majority of time and surely you wouldn't expect to smell sweet frangrances while watching a whole variety of animals! And for those people who had a 5 minute walk to their room which they consider a long way, do your homework better and maybe a 5 minute walk would do you some good! As if that's far!! If you have a disability then tell them on booking!! Common sense? The bus system was surprisingly good. Rarely waited more than 5 to 10 mins. No problems. The longest wait was about 15 minutes. Buses were rarely full unlike when I stayed at Port Orleans and the All Star resorts, even when coming back from parks. Bonus! Some people have complained that this hotel is too far removed from the other theme parks. Here's the reality check. Animal Kingom is 5 mins away. Blizzard Beach = 7 minutes. Studios = 10 mins. Epcot = 14 mins. Magic Kingom = 18 mins. Typhoon Lagoon = 18 mins. Downtown = 20 mins-25 mins (depending which part you are getting off at). I can't see how any of those journeys are too long. I really recommend this hotel. It is totally unique. The weather in April was beautiful over the two weeks, a couple of cloudy / stormy days but the rest were lovely. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “A high quality resort.”
Reviews.Author: ajscherer
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a lovely resort. Great programs for children and the pool is excellent. We took advantage of the activities in the Simba Room adjacent to the laundry facilities whenever possible. Our daughter loved art activities (which are high quality) and she also enjoyed spending an evening there while my husband and I had dinner. She (and we) felt very comfortable with the staff which doesn't always come easy for a somewhat shy 6 year old. We had originally booked a room in the Villas but discovered on arrival that they had booked us a room with a queen bed and pull out couch. For the extra cost for the Villas, I didn't want anyone being on a pull out couch so I asked to be moved to the lodge (which is just a few floors below) so we could have 2 queens (as I had requested at booking). They accommodated us and refunded the difference. I also had dropped my credit card on the floor and the concierge was very accommodating in helping me by giving me access to a computer so I could check to see that no unauthorized activity occurred. Luckily, a guest picked it up and returned it to the concierge (no harm done). I couldn't thank them enough for helping me during the time my card was lost. A few negatives. There was a fellow at the concierge desk who was not all that accommodating when I was trying to straighten out the room issue (not the same people that helped me with the credit card debacle). He lacked the friendly demeanor that all other staff had and wasn't all that helpful. The beds are comfortable but not the best. I've had more comfortable beds in the newer Hampton Inns so I was a little disappointed in this area. Also, the buses don't come all that often so give plenty of time if you have to make a dinner engagement. If I did it again (and I would), I wouldn't bother with the Villas since for the extra $ all we would have got was a small microwave (which can be requested) and a sink (other than the bathroom sink). The room was essentially the same size as in the lodge.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Animal Kingdom Lodge!!!”
Reviews.Author: GASOCCERMOM
Reviews.Content: My family & I recently stayed at AKL from Apr 11-Apr 17. This was our first trip to WDW, and we were very hesitant at first of our choice to stay at AKL (based on some reviews). I must say we were pleasantly surprised! The lodge was absolutely beautiful! The rooms, although a little small, were very clean and comforatable for a family of four (2 adults, a 10 yr old & a 4 yr old). You really aren't in the rooms that much to be concerned about space. My kids enjoyed waking up in the morning and sitting on the balcony to watch the many animals that grazed nearby. There are numerous activities at the lodge that are planned through out the day for the kids to do. Most people arent at the lodge during the day and miss them. If you plan to have a leisure day and not do the parks, check into the activities. There is a childrens' parade in the evenings where they get to play African instruments and march around the hotel. I absolutely reccomend this for the kids, just to see the smiles on their faces as they play, march, and chant along with the guide! The pool is great! The restaurants are very good, too. Definite reservations needed for dinner at Bomas, however for their breakfast, we were able to walk right up and be seated within 5 minutes. Mara is your quick service restaurant with (depending on the time of day) items like mickey waffles, eggs, burgers, african stew, pita's, chicken sandwiches, salads...all very good. The AKL staff was always very helpful, and answered any questions that we had. The buses ran every 15 minutes to the parks, and made no other stops at other resorts, which was nice. Yes, AKL is the farthest away, but after walking all day, we enjoyed the 15 minute ride!! The only thing that some may not like is that there is no *free* wi-fi access in the rooms. In order to have internet access (if you brought your laptop) was to pay $9.95 per 24 hour access. What we chose to do was pay for one 24 hour period during the middle of our trip so that we could email family and friends with some pictures. FYI...there is a room to the left of the front desk that has a computer that can be used free of charge with internet access and a printer. There is only one, but it is available if needed. We 100% enjoyed our trip and are already planning our next one. We will definitely be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFromMinnesota
Reviews.Content: My husband, 3 1/2 year old daughter and I stayed for 6 nights. Considering AKL is a deluxe Disney resort, we expected more - way more. I expected the property to be well cared for. Instead, we found trash in the fountains, hallways, piled into garbage cans and inconsistent housekeeping in our room. The decor is extremely dark and the halls and common areas are dimly lit. It felt like we were in a cave. The rooms were very small. We had 1 queen and 1 set of bunk beds for 3 people. I can't imaging having 4 people in that room. We were already tripping over each other. The quick-service restaurant, The Mara, had sticky floors, dirty tables and chairs, slow service and cold, unappealing food. The full service buffet restaurant was average. Some raved hot, basic food seems like a baseline expectation vs. something with which to be impressed. Room service never answered our call, and it was during an off-peak time. Could they have been severly understaffed? The service was exceptionally poor. For example, we called the bell service to see if our bags had arrived. They said no, but when my husband went down to the lobby he found them sitting there. At one point we were misinformed by one of the staff members. When we called the error to their attention it was if they couldn't have cared less. We did appreciate seeing animals from our room - daily views of giraffes, birds, etc. We also liked the pool area. It was fairly small but had zero entry, which our daughter loved. Because this was a deluxe resort with a deluxe price, we expected deluxe service, food and amenities. We were sorely disappointed that AKL failed to meet even basic expectations. My husband and I have traveled to Disney World multiple times. We have had phenomenal experiences. We will be back, but not to AKL.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad at all.......”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddyreg
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed from April 8-15, and it was a pretty nice visit. From the information that was sent well in advance, until the moment we left sunny Florida, it was a nice experience. I'm sure my children (7 & 10) really enjoyed themselves. The Disney Magical Express, from the airport to the hotel was excellent, because once we checked out luggage in at the airport, we never had to worry about it again until we got to our rooms, some 5 or 6 hours later! The "keys to the world" are an excellent idea, because you only had to worry about carrying one thing, that allowed you to do everything, from getting into your room, to getting into the parks, to getting meals! I remember when i came on a school trip several years before, you had to worry about a room key, a park ticket and a separate ticket for meals.... The lobby to the AKL was amazing, and the staff were excellent. I didn't get a chance to go to the observation decks to view the animals, and our room wasn't located where we could see them from our balcony. The ambience of the entire site was great. We only at at The Mara, when we ate from the hotel, and the food and options on the dining plan were definitely filling. I hate to fly, but I can't wait to take my next trip to Disney.... (hopefully I can drive down this time!) The only down thing is, the basic room was a little small for a family of four to live in for a week, especially when the kids want to watch the Disney Channel, and Mom and Dad want to watch other stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip at AKL”
Reviews.Author: sscat
Reviews.Content: We just came back from Disney World yesturday and my children (8 & 12) had a blast. They loved the hotel and everything about it. The airport shuttle was a great serves and I was so suprised how easy it was with our bags in our room before we were back from the part at 3pm! We also did the only check in 10 days before our trip and that was great as well. We arrived at the hotel at 10am so I was sure that our room would not be ready but to our surprise our room was ready and just what we had asked for. From my reseach I was told the best rooms are pool rooms because they are closest to everything. That was right on the mark, we loved the animals but could see them whenever we wanted and truely we were never in the room except to change and sleep ( great beds). The pool was a dream, it was a busy week but I never felt the pool was too crowded because it was so big. The water slide was just right for our girls and they loved it. Every afternoon we would come back from the park just in time to do the crafts and hang out at the pool. There is also an arcade that is right next to the pool so they could play with there arcade card which they load with cash and use. We also bought the cups so the girls could get free refills on drinks from Mara which they loved. We had dinner at the Boma and really was not impressed. I think the issue was our server...he was just not interested in providing any help and you really need to understand what the food is you are getting ready to eat. He just wanted us in and out. Breakfast was a totally different story, our sever was great explained everything and because it was our daughers birthday he brought out a birthday dessert! The bus serves was not as others have reported. Yes you do have to wait for the bus but not anymore than at other resorts and the time it takes to get to and from the parks is about 5-10 minutes longer but for us it was not that big a deal. The serves from all the staff was just great, we were always treated well by whomever we incountered we would recommend the AKL to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: MisseySWorcester
Reviews.Content: Myself, huby and 7 year old stayed here over Easter 2009 for 1 week - what an amazing place it was. Loved the room, the view over the savana, the pool was great, staff were wonderful so friendly and warm. We had some great annimals to view - Eland, Nyala, Giraffe, Antelope, Blesbok, Impala,Thomsons Gazelles, Waterbuck, Griffon Vultures and East African Crowned Crane. The maid service was everyday - loads of towels and shampoo etc everyday and cleaned well no gripes at all. Resturants were out of this world and you must eat in both Boma and Jika they were just great. Childrens activities were very good and although fun for them they were informative to as they were based on how to look after and protect the animals in there natural homes. They did run a nursery at $11 per hour and you had to book in - usful if you want a couple of ours to yourself in the resturant or pool. We did not drive and used the disney transport - yes the Magic Kingdom was the furthest away but - Annimal kingdom and Hollywood Studio's were only a 10 minutes away, we never had to wait longer than 10-15 minutes for a bus so getting about was not a problem. I have read many reviews about this hotel moaning about the pool - why ???? it was really nice yes the water is not dyed blue it is ment to look like a watering hole hence the green colour - it was big enough with a slide and loads of guards looking after the children it was heated and clean with ample seating to be had. Would I recomend this hotel - YES YES YES go there it was fantastic!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: BermudaBermudaMama
Reviews.Content: We brought our 5-yr old to Disney World for the first time and thought the Animal Kingdom Lodge would particularly appeal to him. I really do not have any negative comments to make about the trip. We had a great time but since it was our first time, I would definitely do a few things differently next time around. The lobby and common areas of the hotel are absolutely spectacular. We opted for the Savannha-view room and the Park Hopper option with the Disney Deluxe Dining plan. The room was a bit far way from the lobby but was clean and well-stocked with towels and shampoo, etc. We honestly spent very little time in our hotel room so we didn't spend much time watching animals from our hotel room. While it was pretty cool - there are plenty of other places to view the animals from public spaces so if you are looking to save a few dollars you can certainly opt for a standard room. My parents also stayed in the Animal Kingdom with us. I had no problem with our reservations. I called Guest Services and provided both reservations numbers and requested adjoining rooms or rooms in close proximity to each other. Although the rooms were not adjoining, they were right next to each other so I have no complaints about that. I am very happy that I chose the Park Hopper option as we returned to Magic Kingdom and Animal Kingdom multiple times during our stay - I couldn't imagine having to tell my son that we couldn't go back to a particular park to ride his favorite again. The Deluxe Dining Plan was also a good choice - we used all of our meals but did have a number of snacks left over. The Dining plan is very convenient because you've already paid for your meals and just present your Key to the World whenever you purchase a meal or snack. Only one person in your party needs to present the card as they are all linked. With respect to dining, I would definitely make all my reservations well in advance. I only made one character breakfast reservation in advance so we did have to make some concessions with respect to our restaurant options. Jiko is a Signature Dining Restaurant. Our meal was nice and they had a great selection of wines. We only had breakfast at Boma but it too was very nice. The breakfast buffet had some unusual choices but had the old standards as well so it was not difficult to find something a 5-yr old will eat. We had one meal at The Mara which was ok. It's a bit like a cafeteria so it is not a place I would choose to eat all my meals but it's fine for a snack or quick bite by the pool. Definitely plan your days and make breakfast and dinner reservations well in advance. Lunch was spent in the parks and we just grabbed a quick service meal so we could minimize our meal time and maximize our fun time. The one time we did go to the pool, it was closed for maintenance. I'm still not sure what that was all about because we really didn't get any information from the pool staff about when it would open - they would only tell us that it would open when their boss gave them the go-ahead. Just when I was about to go back to our room, they opened the pool. The resort is the farthest from all the theme parks so allow extra time to reach your destination especially if you have dinner reservations. One evening, we had made plans to have dinner at Magic Kingdom and waited at least 30 minutes for a bus at which point most of the other people on the bus were already late for their dinner reservations. All-in-all, I think we made a wise choice in staying at the Animal Kingdom and would recommend this resort to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: kclintp
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is beautiful. The restaurants are incredible. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are a nice size, very clean, and the savannah view is great. If you do not get a savannah view there are great viewing areas with rocking chairs. There are plenty of scheduled activities for kids and adults through out the resort. The buses do not share with other resorts, so usually you can sit on the way to and from a park.

Reviews.Title: “Loved AKL - can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: wagner98
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at AKL and can't say enough good things about the hotel. Unlike another reviewer, I never got tired of seeing animals from my hotel balcony and neither did my children. They loved the pool (ages 5,8 & 9) and the hot tubs and water slide. We only ate at Mara, the quick service restaurant, and were impressed with the wide selection of healthy food as well as Disney favorites (Mickey waffles) and the speed with which we were served. Despite being the farthest Disney resort from the Magic Kingdom, the buses ran regularly (rarely had to wait more than 15 minutes) and never took us more than 15 minutes to get to any other park. Rooms are nice - dark, cozy and quiet though the bathrooms are downright small. I like the fact that the hotel is decorated with an understated Disney decor and on the quieter side.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: hnswst
Reviews.Content: Stayed 27 March- 6 April. It’s expensive (especially for impoverished Brits) but very good. The design is really impressive. We’re too poor to pay for a savannah view room, but we saw lots of animals from our room anyway- so I’m not sure the extra cost is worth it. The slightly isolated location is mostly OK. We didn’t have any problem with the buses, but it would have been nice to have a wider choice of places to eat in walking distance. The food in Jiko and Boma is very good, though expensive. I’m no expert, but I don’t think it’s very authentic. Mara is OK for breakfast and burger & chips, but is a bit like eating in a canteen. The pool is good, though it did close unexpectedly a couple of times, once for a thunderstorm which never appeared, and once for ‘unscheduled cleaning’. Concierge desk very helpful, though you usually had to queue. There’s no business centre, so if you want internet access you have to pay to have it in your room, and bring your own laptop. However, the concierge did check us in for our flights, and print off the boarding passes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with unique animal experience.”
Reviews.Author: coast911
