Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge from March 29th through April 2nd. We paid for a savanna view room and we were given room 4309 which has a great view of the main savanna. We did book a room with a queen bed and bunk beds but were given a room with two queen beds. It wasn't a huge deal but we also had to call and remind the front desk that we had requested bed rails and a pack and play also. As it turns out, most rooms have a pack and play in the closet but they sent someone quickly to install the requested bed rails. Our room was on the fourth floor; the lobby and hotel entrance are on the third floor so we had to walk a little ways and then take an elevator up to our floor and walk a little more. I would recommend requesting a third floor room - no elevator ride required and a great height for viewing the animals (if you get the savanna view room.) The room was small but I think it's b/c they give you a balcony which a lot of hotel rooms do not have so you have to deal with that sacrifice. There isn't a lot of storage besides the closet so you will have to adjust accordingly. I've heard others complaining that the rooms were a bit on the dark side. There were five lamps inside our room that made it plenty bright if you chose to have them all on at the same time. The bathroom was well lit and the room also had a ceiling fan which was a nice touch. The Boma restaurant was very busy the night we visited. We had made prior reservations which I highly recommend because it was very busy as soon as it opened at 4:30. Our reservations were at 5:10 and were seated right as we checked in. The food was quite varied in options and everything I tried was tasty. I highly recommend the spiced rotisserie chicken. Our server was great about our children's needs and requests and also about replenishing drinks and clearing dirty plates and utensils. We did not visit the more upscale Jiko during our visit but it looked lovely from the outside. The menu was a bit more "acquired taste" than Boma and even though Jiko appeared to offer a kid's menu, I would not feel comfortable taking children into Jiko's white tablecloth atmosphere. We also used room service for breakfast and dinner and they were both delivered with quick, gracious service. The pool was decent sized with a water slide. lifeguards and private hot tubs hidden around the perimeter. The water isn't a typical chlorinated pool, it looks like clear river water. I'm sure it was to coordinate with the outdoorsy/nature feel of the resort. There is also a nice playground area just off the pool which was a nice touch. The playground also served as a convenient place for parents to let their kids burn off energy while waiting to be called for their dinner seating at Boma or Jiko. Even if you don't have a savanna view room, there are a few animal viewing spots around the resort. Check your resort map for locations. I would highly recommend asking when feeding times are during the day because that seems to bring out the animals in droves. It was awesome to watch giraffes, zebras, and antelope run and eat just fifteen or twenty feet away. We had rented a car so we did not use the bus transportation service but there always seemed to be buses coming and going so I doubt the wait was ever very long. We also utilized a grocery delivery service called the Garden Grocer. I highly recommend their service if you want to pay for the convenience of not having to stop at a grocery store to stock up on your needs. They even have baby staples like formula, baby food and diapers. Our delivery came right to the hotel bell service before we even checked in and all our items had been stored perfectly (some needed to be refrigerated) and they were brought to us once we were in our room. Overall, I loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge - the service was friendly and helpful and the atmosphere was warm and inviting. Even the lobby looks like a large living room. The little extra touches like towel animals and turn down service makes you feel like you are special. You do pay for all of this of course, it is Disney after all. Our final bill was a bit shocking but you have to expect that with staying inside Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Great place must see”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireNone
Reviews.Content: What an amazing place, fantastic and great for kids we will go again

Reviews.Title: “It Turns Out Disney Is not the happiest place on earth”
Reviews.Author: AngelGrandma
Reviews.Content: In fact it is not even close. Imagine a vacation where you booked well ahead of time making sure to find a resort that included round trip airport transportation like Disney's Animal Kingdom Resort. When I booked I asked about the airport transportation and asked if we would still get it if we decided to stay longer and added nights onto our reservation at a good neighbor hotel. I was assured it would be fine..but now that the time is near the story changes. I called ahead to see if we needed to reserve a time for transportation we were told they only transport on the day you stay at their resort.. I asked to talk to a manager and was REFUSED! I was eventually given to guest services who was condesending at best. I explained that I only wanted to be transported to and from the Animal Kingdom rosort but was treated with disregard such disregard that I have a whole new outlook on Disney who use to take pride in customer service. Now that they have our money they could care less about customer service. If we decide to go this will be our first and last trip to Disneyworld. They must not need customers or they would not treat them with suich disregard. I spoke with four different representatives and all lacked customer service skills. In fact none of them gave a hoot about customer service or retention. I am not a happy customer... I bet Wat Disney would be turning over in his grave.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: wert4444
Reviews.Content: We recently became Disney Vacation Club members at Animal Kingdom and stayed for the first time last October. Because of a special joining deal we were able to stay in a grand 3 bedroom villa for 5 nights. We obviously loved it, as anyone would in a huge place like that. We know on future visits we'll be in a 1 or 2 bedroom villa and are just as excited. My opinion; watching the animals from your balcony (and we had 3 huge balconies) becomes ordinary rather quickly. I even noticed this with the children in our group. Don't stay here if the animals are your main reason! We loved the decor of the rooms, the lobby area and of course dining at Boma! Yeah, the pool isn't great. The waterslide is great for young childern but at age 8 or 9 would get boring. My advice to anyone going to Disney for at least 8 nights and wanting great accomodations: stay at Animal Kingdon for 4 nights and then at the Beach Club for 4 nights. Animal Kingdom is newer and unique while the Beach Club offers the GREAT pool and the awesome option of walking home from Epcot at night!

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay on Disney property”
Reviews.Author: gatorian
Reviews.Content: My wife loves Disney so we go there about 4-5 times a year. We have stayed at almost every Disney hotel and this is my favorite. What makes it special is the animal viewing. Nothing like waking up in the morning and seeing a giraffe eating about 50 feet from your window. If you can't get a room that overlooks the "Savannah" the hotel is probably not worth the extra cost. The pool is nice, but in summers it is crowded. The buffet restaurant, Boma, is probably the second best hotel restaurant in Disney (behind the very expensive Victoria and Albert's). On a weekend expect to wait for your table, even if you have reservations. Unfortunately check-in is extremely time consuming if there is any line at all. This is the case at pretty much every Disney resort. Trying to get adjoining rooms if your party isn't checking in at the same time is nearly impossible. These tend to be system wide issues with Disney hotels, and not a specific problem with Animal Kingdom Lodge. A lot of the Disney hotels are the same rooms with a slightly different theme. Animal Kingdom Lodge is a unique Disney hotel because of the animals. It is really a special experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a Huge Disappointment!”
Reviews.Author: TGRLILLY
Reviews.Content: What a huge disappointment! I had heard and read so many wonderful things about this property, I was eager to experience it with my young (animal loving) children and was sorely disappointed. We choose this hotel over all the other more expensive Disney properties because our young sons LOVE wild animals and they too were very sad with our experience. Our arrival was great, with a personal guide to our small one bedroom suite. Our conceive assured us we would see lots of animals grazing and roaming in the yards. We did see a few very distant cattle the first night and saw NOTHING for the remainder of our five day trip. Other than our initial greeter, the staff was hard to communicate with and even at one point very rude. There is an "Animal Information" button on the phone, when my inquisitive seven year old called down to ask questions about the animals the "animal expert" told him he was very busy and to stop playing with the phone. It's Disney for Heaven's Sake!! Most of the people using that line will be young people. I considered this behavior unacceptable, rude and very out of line. Our maid service was very shabby, with the staff only doing the bare minimum each day. Never were our towels arranged in characters of anything interesting or out of the ordinary as they have been at other properties. Even when my husband left a detailed note about something, it was completely ignored. The beds were made and new towels given and that is it. Trash was often left and things left in thrown about. The food was also another huge disappointment. It is either very basic kid fare or very heavily influenced African fare for adults. The food itself was not bad but it did get old very quickly. The bottom of the pool is a dirty brown and makes the water look nasty but the pool is open late. No Disney movies in the rooms either, just 17 channels of Disney World property promotions. To top it off, my children left an item on the desk when as we left. We called three times within 24 hours our departure. We never received a call back or any information at all about the item. This property sounds wonderful for children but it is NOT worth the price. We will not stay there again. This property sounds so great for children who love animals but you will be better off going on the Animal Kingdom Safari. I realize the staff cannot control when the animals will appear but since they bill themselves as "the" property to see the animals they need to at the very least ,be friendly when the young children ask about them. Good idea but don't expect Wild Kingdom to be in your backyard.

Reviews.Title: “Animal Kingdom Lodge was great!”
Reviews.Author: trashedbunny
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week stay at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. (March 14-21, 2009). We arrived around noon and check in was quick and easy. Our room had a view of the front of the hotel where the taxi's are parked. The front desk said that the hotel was busy but by Tuesday we could change rooms if we wanted too. We decided to stay where we were. There were plenty of viewing areas to go to if we wanted to see the animals. We had a room with two queen beds. Very nice and clean. There were only two of us so I didn't think the room was too small. We didn't spend too much time at the resort or in our room. I did think that the beds and especially the pillows were very comfortable. After a long day at the parks, the bed was very comfortable. The only thing I could complain about was the remote control of the TV. It didn't work very well. We used one of the hot tubs one night and sat at the pool one day. The pool was heated and actually open 24 hours . We didn't have reservations to get into Boma but we went down 15 minutes before they opened and were at a table within the half hour. So worth it!! The food was wonderful!!! The coconut curry seafood stew was delicious as was the butternut squash soup! The staff was very friendly. We did eat at the quick service place called Mara. The vegetable flat bread was tasty. The night before we left, a sheet of paper was left on our door, explaining what time to come down to the airport desk to get your boarding pass and to get your luggage tagged for the return trip and also what time your bus would take you to the airport. Very easy so you don't have to worry about anything. I would reccomend The Animal Kingdom Lodge but would probably try a different one on a return trip since Disney has so many places to choose from. And by the way what construction?????

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: dreksfreks
Reviews.Content: Loved, Loved this hotel. Beautiful spacious rooms. Great staff. Great views no matter what room you're in. The Magical Express Buss was also great. I will def stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: JAKC5
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my 7 year old son for a short trip to Disney and we loved it. We were able to see animals throughout the day and evening, zebras, giraffes, etc. We had a pool view room, as I didn't want to have a parking lot view, but didn't want to pay extra for the savanna view. We didn't get upgraded, as I think the hotel was probably full, but there were lots of areas to view the animals, including one right across from our room that we had all to ourselves whenever we were out there. Our room was right next to the elevator, but was very quiet. The pool was great, with a great slide that my son loved, and the pool area was very nice. We ate at Boma one night, which was really good, and at Mara, which was fine. You can also buy fruit and snacks at Mara to take with you into the parks, which would be a more convenient and healthier option than waiting in a line to eat lunch at the park. The room was big enough, the bathroom clean and nice, with granite countertops in the sink area, and a nice shelf over the sinks to put your stuff. I thought the staff was very pleasant, and there are a lot of activites - at night there was an area where you could watch the animals through night vision goggles - pretty neat. I spent a lot of time deciding where to stay for our trip, and I'm very glad we picked this hotel - we actually would have had fun spending a day away from the parks and just hanging out at the pool, viewing the animals, and having a rest day. I think for the money (we paid $220 through hotels.com) it was worth it to stay on Disney property, close to the parks, and take advantage of the Disney Extra Magic Hours available only to Disney hotel guests - on our day at the Animal Kingdom the park was open 3 hours later, until 8, and around 4 the crowd really thinned out, and we were able to ride all the rides again with no wait at all. We didn't do the Disney Dining plan, but if we go back to Disney I would do it, as I think it is a good deal - the food in the parks is pretty expensive. This hotel exceeded my expectations and I will definitely stay here again when we return to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Peggy55Canada
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week on the current buy 4 nights, get three free. Agree the basic room is small, due to two queen beds taking up most of the room. I spoke to a manager about my concerns with the size of the room, and was upgraded to a one bedroom savannah view room at no additional charge. The one bedroom was such a great experience that we took advantage of the offer in our room, to return at 40% off the regular rate, if booked before we checked out. However, we booked a studio due to the high cost of a one bedroom. With the 40% reduction, it works out to a price similar to the buy four nights, get three free. We found the one bedroom was actually quite large for two people.....the hotel premises were extremely clean, and no problems with the lighting or furnishings. I would recommend staying at this resort, to anyone who is thinking of planning a trip to Disneyworld. We had a totally enjoyable and stress free vacation. The meals at Mara were reasonably priced and great tasting. The buffet at Boma was fantastic. The free bus service was a bonus, as we had no long waits (we went to the parks 5 days out of 7); and found it much more convenient, than driving our own vehicle. We also purchased the Dining Plan and my only complaint with it, would be the amount of food we received. The meals were of the highest quality and there were no restrictions. I would have preferred a salad option, to the desserts occasionally, but the desserts were wonderful. Staff were very helpful and one of the employees even gave us three of his own personal fast passes for Test Trac in Epcot. Overall, we had a great experience and are staying at the same resort again in October 2009.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific stay”
Reviews.Author: jhawkwalk
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our three nights here. Beautiful lobby, with bonus of good smells wafting up from Boma downstairs. Desk was efficient and helpful. Our room was right off the lobby, but we had no noise problems. Room was standard size, nice but nothing too fancy. We had a savannah view from the third floor, and it was great! Lots of animals to look at. Pool area was great. Ate at Boma (terrific buffet) and Mara (slightly above average counter service). The kids really enjoyed the evening storyteller. Only two drawbacks that we could see: 1) Price -- We were there in a relatively inexpensive season, though; and 2) Because the hotel is laid out in long wings, you can have a very long walk from your room to the lobby or pool. Might want to put in a request for something close to the lobby if you want to avoid that.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel experience, will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: ArmenNY
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights with my wife and son while visiting Disney World. This was the best hotel experience I have ever had. I would definitely recommend you to stay here especially if you have kids, they will love it. Although we paid for standard room reserved through hotels.com, we were placed in room with animal views, which was incredible. We could see giraffes, and zebras out of window every morning. Needless to say that our 3 year old was thrilled. They also offer nighttime animal viewing with night vision goggles for free, amazing.. The Hotel was so lovely that on the last day of our trip we decided to scrap our plans of going to Disney and stayed in the pool pf the hotel. It is little pricey, but totally worth it. One downside- they don't have wireless internet access, which is kind of odd for this high class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kerry1977
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 3 small children aged 6, 2 and 6 weeks. We needed 2 travel cots which were provided. We took our own steriliser but needed some way of boiling the water to make up the milk. They provided us with a microwave for this. The service was good although they always do everything in the expectation of a tip, which is America in general. The restaurants are good and so is the pool. Although everytime there is a storm, the whole outside area is closed. We had a really lovely time here and would not hesitate to go back to this hotel, except our family is too big to be accommodated as it is limited to 4 + a baby. The babysitting service offered is not disney run and the call in outside people. We did not feel comfortable with this so did not use this service.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: zambukamum
Reviews.Content: Visited Disney World in January of 2009 for one week. Got a great deal on Animal Kingdom Lodge, so we decided to try it. We opted for a Savannah Room, which was a great upgrade. Upon checking in, the hosts behind the counter was extremely pleasant and helpful. He answered all of our questions, and showed us on a map how to get to our room. Upon arriving to our Savannah Room, however, we noticed we had an obstructed view of the savannah and the animals, and our room was above the service entrance for the vehicles that care for the animals. We went back to the desk and expressed our concern, and they put us into another room which had a terrifice view, unobstructed. The rooms was immaculate, the bathroom pristine, the beds super comfy, and plenty of pillows!! The dinner buffet was filled up, everytable was full, but our server was prompt and courteous and never appeared rushed. We ordered take out from the restaurant in the hotel, it was fast and delicious (try the specialty pizzas!) We also went to the Victoria Falls bar in the evening, and the bartenders were fantastic, they even remembered our name after our first time there. The halls ways are dimly lit, to give the feel of the african jungle, it was amazing. There were plenty of open areas in the hallways to view the animals, with adjoining viewing areas outside. Everywhere you looked there were such a variety of animals. They provide you with an animal guide in your hotel room also. All in all I would highly recommend this hotel, and would definitely return on future Disney World Trips.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return to the lodge”
Reviews.Author: SierraSun
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge from Feb.13-19, 2009. Our flight arrived in the morning and because check-in is at 3pm, we were 'homeless' for a few hours. We were able to keep our luggage locked in Bell Service at the lodge until check-in which allowed us to explore the resort and get some lunch in the meantime. We decided to spend the extra money for a savannah view and when our room was finally ready and we went up to check it out I almost started sobbing. We must have been given the room with the WORST view in the resort!! It was on the savannah SIDE of the hotel, but with a view blocked by a HUGE rock covered in bird poop, a very large steel pole, and some dead plants.....not even sunlight was getting through our doorwall! Now...if you leaned WAAAAAY over the balcony railing you might catch a glimpse of an animal off to the left in the distance but for the price...that was completely unacceptable and I requested a new room. I have to admit that I was extremely angry that they would even attempt to represent that room as a 'savannah view'. For future travellers...it was room #2211. If you are assigned that room at the front desk don't even bother walking all the way there, just hand the key back. Better yet, when booking a savannah view room...tell them you want an 'unobstructed view' since I'm told there are several along that rock formation which share the same shameful view of the rocks. Our new room on the 3rd floor (#3565) had an amazing view and the animals were right there to greet us every time we stepped out onto the balcony. THAT room was well worth the price. Yes, the rooms are small but we did fine with 2 adults and a 7-year-old....(we had 2 queen beds). The TV channels are scarce...mostly Disney promotional programming and a few select news, weather, and Lifetime channels so don't plan on catching many of your favorite shows while you're there. Also, cleaning & towel service is not provided daily. We were given 4 bath towels, 4 wash cloths, & 2 hand towels in the room and those were not replaced until the 4th day so I suggest that if you have more than 2 or 3 people in your group, bring some additional towels...or pay the extra $6 and request early towel service at the resort. The pool is perfect for kids...not too deep and the water is delightfully warm so it worked out well on our cool February evenings. The hotel and grounds are incredibly clean and the staff was friendly and helpful throughout our entire stay....many of them extending extra attention to making my daughter's experience there wonderful. Many, if not most, of the staff are from Africa and are more than happy to share all about their homes and culture! They have crafts and activities all day long for the kids and we participated in many of them. The bus transportation to and from the parks is easy and convenient and we never waited more than 15 minutes for a ride. The Mara quick service restaurant serves good food but pretty much the same thing every day so if you can grab a few meals out at the parks for variety, do it. The travel mugs they provide allow for free refills of soda, coffee, & tea at the resort (not the parks) and is very nice to have since a 20oz bottle of soda would otherwise cost $2.75. NOTE: Bring a little bottle of dishwashing liquid with you so you can wash your mugs up in the room. After a few days, just rinsing with water just doesn't seem CLEAN. Oh! Make sure you take your kids down to the pool area after dark so they can view the animals through night-vision goggles! I gave this resort a rating of 4 instead of 5 because of their misrepresentation of our first 'savannah view' room ...and the lack of basic daily towel service that is offered even in the cheapest motels around the nation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience! Animals Everywhere!”
Reviews.Author: jandebnan
Reviews.Content: My husband, 10 year old son, and I stayed 2/14 thru 2/21/09. This was our first trip to Disney and the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We found it to be a great experience. When we first arrived we were assisted with luggage and check in was really quick. Staff were very pleasant and courteous. Our room was located on the Uzima Savannah with a view of the animals. We had the queen with bunks and the room, although a little small, was very clean and well kept. We had plenty of room for the three of us, though it could be a problem if you have older kids- as far as space. The lighting in the room is low, but the double vanity has bright enough light for make-up needs. The drapes on the balcony window were very thick and enabled one to have a nice dark room if you wanted to sleep late! There is a large flat screen TV with limited channels, but who watched TV on vacation anyway. The temperature in the room was well controlled and comfortable. We saw animals every day we were there. They were so close to our room- our son was absolutely thrilled (we were too)! There was also a variety of animals, not just the same ones all the time. Part of the package was a refillable mug that could be used only in the hotel, but it was great! The Mara (counter service-fast food) was open until 11:30 at night and you had access to all the drinks you wanted (coke products, tea, coffee etc) while in the hotel. The pool was large (though not as large as the picture looks) and there were two hot spas, and a wading pool as well. The whole thing is surrounded by the savannahs and animals of all kinds (none predatory)- zebra, giraffe, impalas, kudu, flamingos, crowned cranes, anoke cattle, antelope, eland, wildebeast, gazelle, ---well, all kinds of animals. (also you see people frequently out cleaning up after them so there are no unplesant smells anywhere!) The walk to the room was a bit of a distance, but the quality of the lodge and the amenities, make it well worth it. It was so quiet! After a long day in the crowds at the parks, it was nice to return to the room and the wonderful silence. There were animal calls at times, but that was nice to hear. There are two "table service" resturants in the lodge, the Boma and the Jiko. We did not eat at the Jiko, but the Boma was a wonderful buffet for breakfast and dinner with foods with an African flair! The service was great, but it could be a bit noisy at times. The Mara was the fast-food-snack place, really quick and the food (burgers, sandwiches, cereal, breakfast items-mickey waffles-snacks) was good as well. There are many activities at the hotel for all ages so just check the activity schedule if you plan to stay around the hotel for a day. The bus service to the parks was great. We had virtually no waiting time from the hotel to any of the parks. The lodge is the farthest from the Magic Kingdom, but closest to the Animal Kindgom park so the bus ride to Magic Kingdom is of course about 20 minutes or more. The only wait we had for a bus was returning from EPCOT after fireworks, but it wasn't that bad. We were extremely pleased with the Animal Kingdom Lodge. There is really nothing negative we can say about it. Before this trip I read some negative reviews about it, that there were hardly any animals seen from the savannah view rooms,and dirty rooms, so I was a little concerned, but ours was a wonderful experience. Thanks Animal Kingdom Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge!”
Reviews.Author: globetreck07
Reviews.Content: The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a wonderful place to stay! We stayed in a savanna room and my 2.5 year old son was fascinated with the giraffes and the African Crane! Staying in the savanna room was worth every penny. If a stay in a savanna room is not possible, there are plenty of areas to view the animals. Everyone we met at the hotel was wonderful, many of the employees come from different parts of Africa and are very knowledgeable about the animals and plant life around the resort. It is such an amazing place, you will feel like you have traveled to Africa. They even have a greeter at the door who welcomes you home upon return, a nice touch. The room itself was cozy, beds are high for toddlers. The only issue we had with the room was that it smelled like smoke when we arrived. We called the front desk and they sent up a air sanitizer. There were ashes on the balcony. I was surprised that housekeeping did not notice. They have you sign a form stating that you will not smoke so it was a little surprising to experience a room that smelled of smoke. The staff took care of the situation right away which was great. We ate at both Jiko and Boma and loved having such wonderful restaurants on site. Mara the self service restaurant was great to grab a quick snack or lunch by the pool. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a great property to stay at when visiting Disney. It is an attraction all to itself and the whole family can enjoy the many activities while unwinding from the day.

Reviews.Title: “Fun For Kids”
Reviews.Author: BickAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Savannah View room with bunk beds and our kids (ages 6, 3, and 1) loved it. We saw a variety of animals every day (giraffe, zebra, African cattle, etc) which made a fun treat for the kids. The room was a bit snug but the reality is, we came to spend time at the parks and not in our room so it didn't really matter. The hotel always has tons of activities going on if you don't feel like treking to one of the parks, and the African fare at the buffet is fun to try. Staff was helpful and friendly and our room was always cleaned very well which says a lot considering how much stuff you have when you travel with kids. Depending on where your room is it can be a bit of a walk to the front lobby and getting to the "market" area (to buy quick snacks or light fare)is a bit odd, but those were the only negatives. This is the 2nd Disney property we have stayed at and I would return with my family again without any second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased after reading many negative reviews”
Reviews.Author: WanderingGypsyMama
Reviews.Content: After recently reading many negative reviews, my husband and I were wondering if we would regret choosing AKL for our family's first stay on Disney property. We were very pleased to have an overall wonderful experience. Our family includes two children, ages just-turned-6 and 3 1/2. We picked up a free birthday buttonfor my daughter at City Hall at Magic Kingdom, and she received birthday wishes and a free goodies all week. We took advantage of the Disney Magical Express. As we approached the Magical Express counter at the airport, we were dismayed to see a VERY long, slow-moving line. In Disney's defense, the line was long and slow because most people had forgotten their Magical Express documentation and the Disney reps had to do research and reprint paperwork. I had my documentation, and it took the rep less than 1 minute to scan my booklet and send me to the AKL line. Not having to get our luggage ourselves was worth it!!! The luggage arrived in our room shorlty after we checked in. Once in our bus line, we waited about 10 minutes for the bus to appear and begin loading. There was one other resort on the bus with us, and we were dropped off last. We landed at 9:30 and were at the hotel by 11:30. Our friends who landed after us said they had no wait in the M.E. express line. The hotel is very nice by Disney standards. The grounds are lush and the aesthetics pleasing. From the lobby to the pool area, attention to detail was obvious. Our check in was quick and smooth. The rep was polite and professional. He clearly explained everything we needed to know. We were thrilled that our room was ready and went there immediately to unpack. My friend who lives in Orlando had dropped off some groceries for us at the bell hop station at AKL. She had the Disney cast member's name and a confirmation number. When we stopped by to pick up our packages, there was some confusion and the packages could not be found. We've found, in all our dealings with Disney cast members, that if you ask 3 different people the same question, you generally get 3 different answers. So, we asked another bell hop where our packages were and she found them and had them sent to our room quickly. Everyone with whom we dealt in the bell hop and check-in area was friendly and helpful. Our room was not as small as we had expected after reading the reviews. We had savannah room 3425 on the zebra trail. We liked it b/c it was on the same floor as the lobby and only one building away, so our walk wasn't long at all. There was little noise, even though many people use that hallway. We were never awakened at night by passers-by. Upon entering the room, our kids ran right to the balcony and were excited to see giraffe, zebra, and other animals. They were not at our balcony, so if you expect them to be very close, you might be disappointed. My husband and I decided that we would not pay the extra for the view next time; it was very nice but not exceptional. There were not always animals out and our kids, although they loved it at first, had more fun playing with the hotel phone and fridge. I'm glad we did savannah view this time but would spend that money somewhere else next time. The room was very nice and spotlessly clean and we appreciated the jungle motif. It was an adjoining room, so we parked our stroller in the space by the adjoining door. I saw a room across the hall that was not adjoining, and they had a dresser in that spot. We wish we had an extra dresser, as there was very little storage. We had a t.v. armoire with two small drawers below it and a closet. We could not fit all the clothes for our family of four (with two small children) in the drawers, so more space would have been nice. There was a narrow shelf on the bathroom sink area that was not wide enough to fit my cosmetic bag. Aside from space issues, there were a few more things that made us check "above average" instead of "excellent" for our stay. We had a great time, but I want to be as thorough as possible, so here are the negatives: -little storage -LG brand t.v. remote didn't work well. A few people we met at the pool complained about the same thing. Trying to change channels was frustrating. -Disney offers very few channels. We were out of the room most of the day, but, for $300+ a night, I expect to be able to find a Law & Order rerun to watch when I'm in bed! Ironically, they offered the TV Japan channel but not USA network!! -We had a passive-aggressive relationship with our maid. There were animal towels left on our bed after the first night there. My kids left a thank you note. No more animal towels. On our 3rd night, I left a nice note asking for animal towels the next day. No animal towels. The maid unplugged our clock, which is not easy to do b/c of its placement, so it was not illuminated. We thought it was broken. We called housekeeping. The guy said to check the plug. My husband and I joked that the maid was trying to irritate us by ignoring our requests or not doing basic things, such as replacing the hotel shampoo. The room was very clean, however, so we didn't complain. These were minor issues that didn't ruin anything for us. We understood, though, how many people complained about housekeeping on tripadvisor. -The beds are VERY high off the ground. If you have young kids, request railings. We called housekeeping, The nice man came and installed us for them. He said he had given out seven that day and we got the last pair. Reserve them early if you need them. I couldn't sleep the first night b/c I thought the kids would roll out of bed. Because it was very cold during the week we were there, only a few brave souls were in the pool. We enjoyed the pool area and its surroundings. We had our pick of chairs, and we appreciated the life vest for the kids. The slide and outdoor bar were great. I'm wondering how noisy it would be for pool-side rooms when it's crowded??? My kids loved the few hotel activities in which they participated: the parade, story telling and night vision binocular viewing. They wanted their caricatures done. The artist is there from about 6-11 or something like that-- evening hours only and late for little kids. We ate dinner at Boma; the buffet was fine and the kids tried some African foods. There was enough to fill us up, but nothing extraordinary. We don't have advanced palates, so maybe a gourmand would love the selection more than we did. We ate at the quick-service Mara restaurant a few times. Breakfast was adequate. We liked the lunch/dinner selections better. Something for everyone. We had the meal plan, which worked really well for us. Be sure to use up all your snacks to get your money's worth. We received a 30-minute game card w/ our package, and the kids liked the arcade. It was family -friendly. I'm a control freak and was concerned about not renting a car and having to use Disney transportation. Mostly the buses ran very smoothly. Once, at AKL, we had to wait 40 minutes for a bus. People were understandably angry. I agree w/ other reviewers-- don't expect to get on the bus first if you're there first. Everyone moves en masse toward the bus doors. I found myself organzing the crowd to ensure the early arrivers got on first. Overall we waited anywhere from 5-15 minutes for buses. Sometimes the ride was pleasant, and sometimes we were packed too tightly-- people standing. With strollers, packages, etc., they needed to run more buses. We used the express check out, which was perfectly smooth. We had no issues. We were spending more time in Florida, so we rented a car from Alamo (they and National rent cars at the Disney car care center) so we didn't use the return to airport service. The car care center requires at least an hour and a half to pick you up after you call, so plan accordingly. Aside from minor negative issues, we really had a great week. I checked out the Wilderness Lodge where our friends stayed, and I preferred AKL. It's a beautiful resort; it's clean; The frenetic pace you'd experience at other resorts is not present here. It's a very nice place to stay while visiting Disney World. Enjoy your trip!

Reviews.Title: “great time at animal kingdom lodge”
Reviews.Author: km262
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days at the Animal Kingdom Lodge and had a great time. Our check in was smooth and the customer service was fanatastic during our entire stay. Although our room was on the small side (we had a queen with bunk beds) we had a great view of the savannah and daily saw zebras, giraffes and other exotic species. Unfortunatley we didn't have a chance to try out the pool because it was so COLD! I found both Mara and Boma surprisingly good ( I am usually not a fan of Disney restaurants) which lots of different food options and something to please everyone. I particularly like the African food options at Boma. What I like most about the hotel was that it had a very calming atmosphere. I was a great place to unwind after a hectic day at the parks. They keep the hotel quite dark (apparently it's for the animals), and that combined with the African vibe was very serene. I think it says something about the hotel when our entire party (6 adults and 3 kids) all loved the hotel. We would definitly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: iluvkermit
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge from Jan 25 - Feb 1. Travellers were myself, my husband, our 3-year-old son and our 6-year-old daughter. We had a WONDERFUL experience at this hotel. Rooms: the rooms were a fair size. Not as big as the Polynesian (but the rooms there are enormous, so not really a fair comparison). There was plenty of room for the 4 of us. I had booked just a standard view, so we were expecting the parking lot, but upon check-in we were pleasantly surprised with a Savannah room! Across the green space, and beyond all the wonderful animals we got to look at, we could see the construction of the new Disney Vacation Club Villas (which is probably why we got that room). This did not bother us AT ALL. We were never kept awake, and we did know there was construction going on, because we did our homework BEFORE we booked. The room was always clean. The mini refrigerator was nice, although quite loud (don't put items in the door overnight - they tend to rattle). The only real complaint about the room is that the beds were rather uncomfortable. Still, we were so tried at the end of every day it didn't really hinder our sleep at all. All in all, I probably wouldn't pay extra for the Savannah room, as there are so many wonderful animal viewing areas around the hotel. But it was certainly enjoyed by all of us! Housekeeping: wonderful, wonderful, wonderful. Our room was SPOTLESS everyday, and we always had plenty of towels and soaps, etc. We left a tip everyday in appreciation of this. We didn't get towel animals everyday, but we knew that wasn't a given, so we weren't terribly disappointed. A word of advice to those complaining about how disappointed your children were - DON'T PROMISE THEM TOWEL ANIMALS! I read a lot of reviews before booking this hotel and MANY of them said no towel animals. So we didn't tell the children there would be any. Problem solved. These housekeepers work hard. They clean a lot of rooms. I'd rather my room be clean with fancy towel art than dirty with towel animals all over the place. And no, no one filled the ice buket for me. I don't think, no matter how much I paid, I have ever stayed in a hotel where housekeeping filled the ice bucket for me. It's not really so hard to do it yourself. Really not hard at all. Buses: never had a problem. Once the Magic Kingdom bus broke down and we had to wait a little longer than usual, but no big deal. It really isn't such a long ride anywhere either. I know other reviewers complained about the long bus rides, and I was prepared for that, but was NOT long at all! I think the longest trip was about 20 minutes, and really, it takes me longer than that to drive my daughter to her ballet class, AND I have to battle rush hour traffic on the way home. So much easier to let someone else handle the driving while I enjoy the scenery. Don't worry about long bus rides. They're not that long and they're really no big deal. We don't ride the bus at home, so my children thought it was really cool! Service: terrific! Everyone we encountered at this hotel was SUPER friendly, and always ready to help out. We wanted for nothing. Restaurants: We were on the Quick-Service Dining plan (which I do recommend!) so we only ate at The Mara. It was good food. Quite a bit of variety, even for the children. We never went hungry, and the staff was SO helpful in deciphering the dining plan. The made sure you got everything you paid for! Pool: LARGE! Lots of room, lots of chairs, and a pretty neat little waterslide. The only problem we had was that the waterslide was one person at a time - NO expceptions, so my 3-year-old didn't get to go on it like he wanted. He was a little scared to go on his own. HOWEVER, it was SO nice to see them enforcing their own pool rules, unlike other vacations we have been on (i.e., Disney cruise line). Other things: the hotel itself is really neat. The decor is beautiful. There's also a playground for the kids if you need something to do. All in all, a great hotel. I would definately stay here again! Look for the hidden Mickey's everywhere!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: In the shadows of Pikes Peak
Reviews.Title: “Ask for an updated room & Goofy Challenge 1/2 & full marathon review”
Reviews.Author: CO-TriGirl
Reviews.Content: Ask and you shall receive! There are big differences between the updated rooms and the older wings of the hotel. Although it is a newer disney property - the updated rooms are much nicer. We even tried to upgrade to the concierge level - but it was all sold out. (Definately spend the money to do this if it is available!) But a simple request for an updated room when checking in put us in the perfect room from day one. We had fantastic views of the animals in the morning and late afternoon. There was quite a bit of construction going on at the adjacent villas - but we never lost a wink of sleep from the noise. Good: Animals & updated rooms. All staff with the exception of our room attendant. She was not very friendly and we never got the fun towel animals that everyone else got. My kids were disappointed. After the first day- we never had ice in our bucket. We have been to several of the deluxe resorts - and this one paled in comparasion. Fitness Center: LOVED IT! I worked out here every morning prior to the race. They opened the center early every morning to accomodate the race participants prior to the race. Staff was great and so were the spa treatments. Jiko & Boma : Both EXECELLENT dining experiences! I LOVED the extensive wine selection at Jiko! Golf: After 2pm rates at the golf courses dropped to $70 per round! My husband and I had mid 70's weather and a great time golfing. No issues with getting T times either! They also pay your cab fare to/from the golf courses! Bad: You can hear the start of the circle of life race from your room. No chairs available on nice days at the pool. Pool is very small but well maintained. The pool in the villas area will be a nice compliment when it is finished. Bus transportation everywhere. We were actually passed by twice (different times) at the ticket and transportation center. You can't take advange of all of the concierge perks even if they are sold out. Ugly: The older rooms in the resort. A little dusty and in need of updates (we saw a friend's room). Don't book a breakfast at 1500 Park Fare before 9am! There is no way to get there via Disney Transportation and it costs $25 for a cab ride! I was exceptionally disappointed! Disney gives you a cab voucher for $70 round of golf - but not for a $150 breakfast! Go figure! The adjacent construction. Goofy Challenge .... My family and I stayed here for the marathon weekend. Disney did a great job with transportation to/from the expo and marathon start. We did have tons of people who were not runners getting on the buses as early as 4 am. It was difficult to weigh the late hours in the parks with my family against getting up at 3:30 am two mornings in a row to make sure I get to the start line in time. UUUGGHHH! Boma did offer some snacks for sale as early as 3am - but I didn't venture down there as I have a specific pre-race diet. The shuttles from the marathon to the hotel were equally as pleasant. My family boarded the post race shuttle with me and had received no negative feedback from the other riders or drivers. Everyone was exceptionally nice and very helpful! I book the race retreat - and it wasn't worth the price. The food was nasty and nothing you wanted to eat after a marathon! The only plus was the lack of lines at the porta potty! I tried to get a "$10" massage and they only took cash. No credit cards! So I asked the "concierge" in the tent to book me a spa appointment back at animal kingdom lodge and after 15 minutes of waiting for her to find the number - I left and used my treo phone to do it in 5 minutes (about the same amount of time it took the shuttle to get me from the tent to the animal kingdom lodge)! I would say skip the massage at the race and go right for the spa at the lodge! The therapist I had was a certified PT and did wonders for my legs. After 39.3 miles she got all of the knots out and left me in a fabulous position to spend the rest of the afternoon at Blizzard Beach and the remainder of the evening in Epot! NO KIDDING! Don't get me wrong - I didn't walk as fast as usual - but I had very little soreness and really enjoyed the remainder of the day with my family!

Reviews.Title: “Escape to the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Brav3Heart
Reviews.Content: We transferred to the Animal Kingdom Lodge from the Polynesian Resort and stayed for 10 nights. In short it was awesome. We had a Savannah view room on the zebra trail (all the way at the back) and it was (small criticism) quite a hike! (Like I imagine it would be in Africa). The view was breathtaking and especially great as any time my 10 month old daughter was feeling cranky, we'd walk her to the balcony so she could watch the parade of zebras, giraffes, ankole cattle, etc. parading passed our room, which made us happy too! Finding the room was a lot easier than at the polynesian and slightly smaller but that's where the comparison ends as they are 2 different resorts. The lobby is a sight to see as well as the entire resort (by that I mean where there are animal viewing spots (pretty much everywhere). Check in was a breeze - could've just been due to the fact we spent the day at cape canaveral and checked in at around 6 in the evening. All the staff were friendly and greeted as we walked by. The room wasn't huge but big enough for the 3 of us but even if we had 2 fully grown children with us I think it would still have been big enough to be comfortable. Again the towel animal on welcome was a great touch and housekeeping did a great job in maintaining the room as well as creating a new towel animal each day. The only complaint I have with housekeeping was that we had bathers hanging on the line in the shower in the morning but upon returning in the evening they were gone. Can only summise that they must have fallen down and were mistakenly taken down to the laundry with the towels. Not a huge deal but couldn't go back out to the pool the next day as we wanted. Climate control in the room is good, but needs an on/off switch - my wife and daughter had developed a cold and trying to get the temperature right was too hard. Easily overcome with a call to housekeeping who turned it off for us but if we wanted to turn it back on, we would have had to call again (luckily we didn't need to). Bathroom was a little small as the toilet right in between the door and the bath made it seem a little crowded. (Again not a huge deal). The pool wasn't huge but not small either. My daughter enjoyed it and if she were tall enough would have enjoyed the slide too! She really enjoyed the playground next to where the pink flamingos gather as if she got tired she could look at the birds for a while and then go back and play. No shortage of viewing areas all around the resort during the day but the night viewing while enjoyable can prove frustrating when standing in a queue for a short glimpse through the nightvision. Only dined at 2 of the 3 restaurants on offer, Mara which is really convenient and cheapest of the 3 and Boma (which I think is the buffet one). Buffet's not really to my liking but even I enjoyed this restaurant. Buses around disney were never a problem and never waited more than 20 mins for one to arrive to take us where we wanted to go. The rides can take a long time though to the magic kingdom and downtown disney. The other's aren't too far away. Checkout was easy due to the convenience of express checkout and magical express made it even easier to get to the airport. If flying domestically, I recommend using the resort airline check-in as it takes away the hustle and bustle of putting up with the long queues at the airport. Overall it was a great experience and would stay there again, just so I could see my daughter's reaction every time she saw the animals go by. Worth the price? For the unforgettable experience we had, absolutely.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: disjunkie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 and a half weeks at Animal Kingdom lodge in October. The first 2 weeks were in a Pool View room, and the last 4 nights in a club level room. We arrived quite late in the evening and check in was quick and efficient. I loved the decor of the hotel common areas and our room. The lobby is truly breathtaking, and our room was clean, reasonably spacious and decorated in keeping with the african theme. The only criticism I have of the room is that although it faced the pool, the view was incredibly limited due to the tree right in front of our balcony. We ate at The Mara a few times which was a good quick service option, and Boma and Jiko both of which were excellent. Boma was loud and crowded, but we enjoyed the food selections, whereas Jiko had a much quieter atmosphere, fantastic food and service. We also ordered room service a couple of times, and it was always good, with big portions and delivered quickly. The bus transportation to the parks was excellent with only one unacceptable wait in over two weeks. After 2 weeks here, we re-checked in for our club level reservation. We were escorted up to the lounge for a private check in, which was very pleasant and were told our rooms would be ready by 3. One of the draws of a club level stay was the savannah view, and when we got into our room I was incredibly disappointed to see construction (painting and sawing) going on right outside of our balcony, effectively making the balcony (and thus the savannah view) unusable. Our complaint was dealt with quickly and we were moved to a room not affected by the construction, but I felt the hotel staff should have informed us of the construction while checking in. After this inital disruption we had a great view of the savannah, and watched zebra and giraffe from our balcony. The offerings in the concierge lounge were very good, and we also took part in the sunrise safari which was a fantastic experience and one of the highlights of our holiday. Overall, I loved Animal Kingdom Lodge and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “OMG you're kidding”
Reviews.Author: moreskillz
Reviews.Content: when I first walked into Animal Kingdon, I was amazed by the astounding lobby, lush with african delights.....unfortunately, the service we received was rightfully matched with the country...after getting our "room" keys in the moring, we attempted to unlock our door with no success....thinking it was our fault and possibly de-magnitized the keys, we brought them back to the front desk....they made us all new keys, but reversed our friend's name so it wasn't only backwards, but with the wrong letters, to the point where she was so embarassed she started crying....anyway, after the second round of keys, they also didn't work...hours later, they finally figured out that they never even GAVE US ROOM KEYS, they gave us NON-ROOM KEYS, which is why they didn't work.....imagine that, a non-room key. makes sense when checking in TWICE at a hotel....after finally getting into the room, we noted that the room felt like we were back in the 70s or 80s in a Holiday Inn, the same ceiling fan my grandma has in her guest bedroom.....and a bathroom without any lights and crappy water pressure...sure we paid extra for the svanna view, and guess what? two monkeys and a zebra don't make the extra $400 worth it at all.....on to the pool, did i say pool? I mean african watering hole, complete with no vaccuuming and lots of smelly kids....oh, the kids, they're everywhere.....non-stop crying and screaming and crying.....wtf, seriously, never again.

Reviews.Title: “"Something For Everyone"”
Reviews.Author: vacationer1029
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at AKL for 7 nights and 8 days. We had a wonderful time.ROOM: We booked a standard room, but were upgraded to a Pool View, and it was beautiful. Our balcony overlooked the pool, and the smell of incense burning fills the air. I really thought I'd be disappointed not having a Savannah view, but was not. There are so many viewing spots to watch the animals, so in my opinion to pay for the Savannah view isn't worth it. We saw giraffe, zebra, and much more. We couldn't hear anything from the rooms around us. Our room was newly renovated and had some upgrades, like a flat screen TV. There are two dressers,and a large closet. As for the room size, it isn't huge, but we were comfortable. It was my husband, myself, and our three children: ages 12, 3, and 18mnths. POOL: The pool is heated, and we were able to enjoy it even with the cold temps Orlando was having that week. The hot tub was great also, and both were open 24 hrs. They have life vests for the kids right where you get your towels. The kiddie pool is a little secluded, and we didn't see it right away. It was great for our 18 mnth old, however the bottom is very rough. There is so much to hold the children's interest, like the game room, looking at the animals, the pool and the playground. They even have face painting for the kids, and they do scheduled arts and crafts. My 3 year old loved making wooden animals. In the evenings, they have the children play with musical instruments (drums and such) and they listened to a woman educate them about African culture and then danced around the hotel lobby playing their instruments. VERY CUTE! The hotel is large, so yes there is a lot of walking. But, after the meals you will eat at Disney, the walking won't hurt! I read some negatives about hotel staff, but we had all positive experiences with staff, from maids to hotel desk, and even cashiers in the food court. Everyone was very friendly and courteous. The lobby is gorgeous, and you just have to look around. There is a firepit inside, as well as one outside. FOOD: The restaurant, Boma was great.It's a buffet with many African dishes as well as chicken and macaroni and cheese for the kids. Jiko's looked amazing, however with two toddlers, we never had a chance to dine there. Its not a "kid place". We were on Disney's dining plan, and let me say its well worth it! We had 4 people eating,and our youngest eating off our plates. Our average bill was $90-$100. I definitely recommend the dining plan. The only thing not included is tips. Make reservations for all your sit-down dinners, because they book up. Ohana's at the Polynesian is outstanding, and Yik & Yaks at Animal Kingdom. Hollywood Studios has a (Fifties Diner) not sure of name, that is great for families, and they have great malts. The MARA, at AKL is very convenient, you can dine in or outside, or at times we took our tray back to room because the kids were tired. Its cafeteria style. The (dessert) Zebra Domes are delicious. The African stew and flat bread chicken pizza is great. PARKS: We saw the finale show of the American Idol experience and it was just like being at the show. Everyone enjoyed that. TRANSPORTATION: The buses were ok. Wait time wasn't too bad, however stand near curb because people will come at last minute,and walk right up, as there is no real order to waiting for bus.They fill up pretty quick. However leaving parks, there are lines for waiting for the bus. The gift shop at the AKL is great, with many authentic items. There is some construction going on, but it didn't affect us. I definitely recommend this hotel. It was one of our best family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “Best place for animal lovers!”
Reviews.Author: jrabbit3
Reviews.Content: Check-in was easy, long walk to our room but that it was worth it. We had a beautiful view of the savannah and every morning and night we would sit out on our balcony to watch the animals. Yes, the room was small. We don't have any kids, so it was just my boyfriend (28) and I (27). My boyfriend was very skeptical of our vacation to Disney World, which is why I chose the Animal Kingdom Lodge for us. We are both HUGE animal lovers and this was the perfect place for us to stay. The restaurants were easy to get into, pool was never crowded and the bus line was easy to use, even though we had a rental car the Disney bus service was quicker. My bf was very impressed at check-out. We just handed our bags to be checked in at the airport, over to the AKL and they got our bags to the airport for us. All we had to take were our carry on bags, and they had already checked us in so there were no lines-- no waiting:) Also-- I would HIGHLY suggest checking out Discovery Cove. We both agreed that Discovery Cove (while expensive) was the best day of our lives. I love Orlando- I did my internship at the Animal Kingdom in college and I continue to be impressed with all their new ways to serve their "guests!"

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Bearsfn
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Orlando International Airport and were amazed at how easy Disney's Magical Express was. We didn't have to wait around at baggage claim after our flight. We just boarded our Magical Express bus and we were on our way. Our bags were taken to our Hotel and we were told that our bags would be delivered to our room upon our arrival, which they were with no problems. We ended up renting a car our second day which gave us a little more freedom rather than relying on Disney transportation from the AKL to the different Disney Parks. We noticed quite a long wait (approx 20 – 40 minutes) going from the AKL to the parks. AKL is the furthest resort from the parks. I booked a Kilimanjaro Club Level room as a surprise for my new bride. We were told that a Concierge Cast member would be available to meet us at the Concierge Kiosk in valet once we arrived. We arrived at the AKL approx 1100am and no one was available to meet us at the kiosk. I was told that a Club level cast member would be down to assist us within a few minutes. I waited approx 20 minutes and was escorted up to the club level (6th floor) by a valet cast member...again there were no club level cast members available to assist us. The Kilimanjaro Club was very nice and very crowded. My wife and I decided to grab a quick snack (fruit and water) and wait for a concierge cast member to check us in. There were only two cast members assisting other guests. After waiting approx 90 minutes (we were a little upset at this point) we were assisted by cast member Jack. Jack was extremely apologetic and offered to get us a private car for our trip that was planned to DTD later in the week. I appreciated him doing that and before we left the concierge lounge he gave us some tips on the AKL signature restaurant (Jiko) and we were then on our way to our room. Our room was a Savannah view room overlooking the Arusha Savannah. We had a Giraffe and several Zebras just off of our balcony and they were frequent visitors throughout our stay. The other animals along our trail seemed to stay more to the back of our Savannah and out of view. The beds in our room had been made, but the bathroom hadn't been cleaned. We called and spoke to housekeeping and they said someone would be right up to clean the bathroom. Approx 5 minutes later a Housekeeping Manager was at our door with a housekeeping cast member and she (Manager) asked to see the bathroom. She was very apologetic and gave us her business card and told us to call her if we needed anything during our stay. After a few hours of rest, we decided to take a stroll around the AKL and check out the different guest areas and dining options. The main pool looked very comfortable and relaxing. The firepit outside the main lobby was great. It was very romantic and the storytelling by AKL cast members was great. These "storytellers" were from Africa and it was great to hear stories about their life while growing up in Africa. We decided to take the advice of Jack and try out Jiko. Jiko is an amazing restaurant with a beautiful decor and wonderful food. Jack had recommended the Filet Mignon on top of Mac and Cheese. Wow!!!! The meat was very good and seasoned just right and this wasn't your every day Kraft Mac n Cheese. My Wife ordered the Scallops and she kept raving about how good the food was. After Dinner we decided to check out the Savannah with night vision binoculars that were available at a viewing station near the main pool. That was awesome and we were able to see many animals on the savannah. When we arrived back at our room we were shocked to see Chocolate covered strawberries had been delivered to our room. It was such a beautiful display with the chocolate elephant and AKL sign that was also in chocolate. The strawberries were also very good. I wasn't sure if this was because it was our honeymoon and housekeeping's way of apologizing for the bathroom not being cleaned. A great surprise none the less. A benefit of booking a club level room was the opportunity to take a morning Safari. We got up early on Thursday morning and proceeded to the Concierge lounge for our breakfast safari (approx $55 per person) check in. It was very cold at 645am and my wife and I were given blankets (that had to be returned) for our Safari. We were taken by bus (50 people/2 buses) to the Animal Kingdom Park where we boarded the Kilimanjaro Safari attraction. Our guide throughout the morning was cast member Greg (AKL Curator for animals) and he was extremely knowledgeable regarding all the animals. The Safari Attraction normally lasts approx 15 minutes when taken as a park guest with no stopping on along the way, however the breakfast Safari was approx 1 hour with many stops along the way throughout the Savannah's. My wife and I were able to get many pictures. After the Safari was over, we were escorted to Pizzafari for a buffet breakfast prepared special for our safari group. The food was very good and since this was our honeymoon...we were given special attention from the Pizzafari cast members. We received a certificate of congratulations for our honeymoon. Upon our initial check in several days before, we were given "Just Married Buttons" to wear during our stay. I can't tell you how many cast members offered us congratulations throughout our entire stay. It was an amazing honeymoon and booking the Kilimanjaro club was definitely worth it. We were able to get a quick breakfast or other snacks throughout the day and Disney's attention to detail during our stay was incredible. I would recommend staying at the AKL to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “"Disney's perfetion"”
Reviews.Author: puss14
Reviews.Content: Well i dont think disney could ever get it wrong, We stayed in a savanna room with views of the animals which were always out for you to see. After we checked in we had a 10 min walk to our room which was at the end of the hotel, the room was lovely , how ever there is never much room for 4 people's clothes so we got an extra 20 coat hangers., Restaurants Boma- over priced and not very nice same food every day morning and evening no need to book The Mara-only found this after 5 days great for breackfast if all you want is toast , tea and rice krispies and good for lunch, buy a souvenir mug which you get from here about $15 but then you have unlimited hot and cold drinks for all of your stay (only here), there is also a tv for the kids to watch. Never tryed the other restaurant never any time spare Room servce- you pay $3 just to use it and then you have to tip them and its more money The pool- was lovely clean and as many towels as you like and open really late at night, did not do kids club again over priced for what was on offer. The hotel has a shop which sells all the disney stuff but at the back you can get the basics Well thats it for the hotel it really was lovely . If any one is reading this and has just booked or thinking of booking for christmas and new year i will personal review if you e-mail me as our travel agent gave us no information on what its like at christmas we have been many other times of the year and i have never seen the magic kingdom closed by 11 am (which it was) We book christmas dinner at cinderellas royal table (inside the castle) 7 months befor we went and they only had 3 spaces left thank god we did that or we would of had hot dogs for christmas dinner , same with new years eve we booked befor we went , and on new years eve the wait time for a meal was about 2-3 hours SO BOOK !! befor you go , you really have to sit and do all you bookings you can cancel at the last min which we did with no probs. We did Discovery cove , you get the whole day 9 till 5.30 but you only get half an hour with the dolphins and your with other familys its a lot of money but our kids loved it , its one of them things you do once oh, we booked a cabana (a good move). We did boggy creek which is an air boat to find crocs great fun and cheep . There is so much more a could rabbit on about but id be here all day so please feel free to e-mail me we have been 5 times now and love the place i do hope i can help any one..

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay, but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: JustAReviewer
Reviews.Content: My mother and I (both adults) stayed at AKL for two nights, January 2 - 3. We've stayed at other disney deluxe hotels and wanted to try this one to see what it was like. Overall, we had a very nice stay. Keep in mind that what disney calls deluxe, it is not the type of deluxe you might find in 5-star hotels. Disney's deluxe hotels are VERY, VERY nice, but the rooms are not always as plush as some might expect them to be from the prices charged. I think what makes them deluxe is the fact that the hotels have beautiful grounds for viewing and walking though, good facilities and services, extensive recreation options (pools, boating, etc.), close proximity to the disney parks and entertainment areas, and other disney perks. Frankly, when I compare the prices to many of the hotels I've stayed at for business travel, disney hotels are truly worth the price paid - especially if you are able to travel in the off season or are able to take advantage of some other discount offered. What we liked: Hotel grounds, lobby, halls, and room are beautiful. Though dark, the hotel has a very rich feeling and is keeping with the African theme. We actually found it very relaxing. The room was smaller then what we had remembered from other disney deluxe hotels (for example, the contemporary or grand floridian), but since it was just the two of us, we felt we had plenty of room. Our room had a balcony that was overlooking the pool area. The balcony was very nice, felt large and was comfortable. The room was very comfortable as well - even the beds! I did not find hotel noise to be a problem at all. Rooms were quiet, very clean, nice towels and bath ammenities. The shower/toilet area was in a separate room from the vanity. The pool area was fantastic - plenty of shady areas if you need one. There is also one or two whirlpool spas as well. What we didn't like: Since disney was still busy for the holiday season, my mother and I were really looking forward to a drink in the lounge after a day at the park. The hotel lounge could have been nice, but there were a couple of problems. 1) Nobody came to our table to take drink orders, I had to order from the bar. Not a huge problem, but I would expect a deluxe resort to offer the service. 2. There was a family of about 5 kids hanging out at one table. they were noisy, bouncing a ball in the lounge - it escalated into running circles through the lounge/lobby area. Where were the parents??? Where were the disney staff to say something about this??? Very disappointing. Other notes: We had a car and drove to the parks on our own for the first day. However, I'm not yet convinced using your own transportation gets you to where you are going that much faster than the disney transportaion. The second day, we used the disney transportaion to get where we wanted to go. It was more relaxing for me to let someone else do the driving! If I were visiting disney for a week, I would forgo a rental car and just use the disney transportation. I don't think the disney transportation has direct hotel to hotel service either. For example, you cannot take a bus from the Animal Kingdom lodge to the Boardwalk hotel. If you want to go from hotel to hotel, and need to get there fast, consider taking a taxi. Still a lot cheaper than keeping a rental car for a week. If you plan to have a late night snack back at the hotel after an evening at the parks beware - I don't think the AKL has any food service available after 11:30 or 12AM. Check the times of the restaurants or room service (or bar) if you think you want a snack or drink after returning from the parks so that you can plan accordingly. Or consider staying at another disney resort (like the grand floridian)that has 24 hour food service. Also, take advantage of the Disney Photo Pass! I really like this service. At the disney parks, they have photographers available to take your pictures. The service is free. You can view your pictures online, and purchase any that you are interested in (or none at all). Overall, I think this was a really good stay and I would definitely stay at AKL again. I would recommend it for both families as well as for couples.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JellybabyCheshire
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 nights at Animal Kingdom Lodge in January - we are a party of 5 ((2 Ad, 2 Ch (7 + 3), 1 Infant 7mnths)). I am going to start with a very general - we loved the whole experience here. The lodge is very very beautiful, welcoming and felt like 'home'. I will try now to be a little more specific. Many reviews indicate that the Hotel is very dark, it is true that when I first entered the Hotel i thought it was quite dark, but upon having a good look around, it is very much about the theme of the Hotel - 'Africa'. As many have stated the Lobby is stunning - it is also buzzing, has much atmosphere, feels very luxurious whilst also maintaining an air of informality. Bedrooms The Hotel rooms - were beautiful - the furniture very substantial and had little extras that would be expected of Deluxe Resort e.g. Fridge, I-Pod docking station, LCD TV. True the rooms are not huge - but we managed perfectly well as a party of 5 - they are typical of Orlando Hotels - if you are looking for a sitting area perhaps a Disney Villa would be more appropriate. The rooms were spotlessly clean - and all carpets / decoration was very new. Views We had a Savannah room (this was a huge bonus as we had booked a standard room) on Kudu Trail overlooking Ostrich savannah - we had veiews every day of Ostrich & Antelope, and some days of Giraffes & Zebras - we were not disappointed. If I was staying again I would ask for a view overlooking Zebra Trail or Giraffe Trail just primarily because these animals are located there every day. If your budget won't stretch to a Savannah room - no problem, there are so many viewing stations around the resort. They even provide night vision goggles for evening viewing. There is usually a cast member at the viewing points to discuss the animals with you. Pools / Facs Pool area was beautiful, had plenty of loungers, towels, sunshades and had lifeguards on until 9pm - 10pm (i think). The pool was used by all ages until late into the evening and had a real hoilday atmosphere. The Hot tubs were a real bonus too. Hotel has a good fitness centre, Arcade room & also Childcare drop-in centre all which were very well maintained. We felt that this Hotel was family friendly and there were many children staying at the resort with their families. Eating Boma is fantastic - we found that it was suitable for our children. There was always plenty of selections for them to choose from if your children do not eat Adult fare. I would agree the cuisine is African inspired but that adds to the interest. This restaurant is very popular and always busy - so reservations are advised. Mara - Quick Service Restaurant was absolutely fine, we generally only used it for breakfast which was typical cooked breakfast / mickey waffles / Cereals / Bagels / Pastries / Muffins. (It is not a Buffet). Also sold botttles of wine / snacks / at reasonable prices. Jiko - A signature Restaurant - we did not eat in there due to make up of our party. In summary - I have read many of the reviews about AKL and this web is about personal opinion - I have stayed in many 4* + 5* Hotels and found this to be worthy of its rating. We were not disappointed in the least - in fact we would go again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CourtneyR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here just after the hotel opened but visited for the great food the next year! Usually stayed in Wilderness Lodge with Disney however this hotel is very similar and just as good. Rooms are good size with all expected amenities of a Disney hotel. Views of the "savannah" are great however don't expect to see animals all the time as they are free to roam around the complex confines. Maid and room service good as with all other disney delux properties. Restaurants and fast service are exceptionally good. Good choice in fast service of slighly african dishes, standard fast food, salad and desert. Pool will become crowded in afternoon, and there is not a large amount of sunloungers available. Buses do take some time getting to magic kingdom etc as they are further away so be prepared to wait. Only criticism of the hotel is the size it is a long walk to some rooms due to the size however after a few days it gets easier to find.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: julibeth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the AKL Jan. 4 - 11, 2009. We had an excellent overall experience. The lobby is outstanding. We wanted a king bed, but when we booked our room in September, we were told they only had a room with a queen and 2 bunk beds. It was fine, and we got lots of extra pillows because of the extra beds. The size of the room was also fine, and the bed was very comfortable. Large towels, and lots of them. The refrigerator came in handy, because we were on the meal plan and there was always too much food for us to finish. We had a savanna room, #3521 on the Zebra Trail, and we constantly saw animals. Giraffes, zebras, gazelles, kudus, elands, cattle, all kinds of birds. The housekeeping was fine...no problems. Also the airline check-in and Magical Express worked pretty much as advertised. Ate at Boma's. LOVED it! Very different flavors, but excellent. The soups, salads and the Zebra Domes for dessert were my favorite. The other reviewers are correct when they say you need reservations. You MUST have reservations for every sit-down restaurant on the property. We were there at a very slow time (never waited for any attraction) and the restaurants were still crowded. The bus system works just fine.
