Sure, I wish the time between the lodge and the parks was shorter, but it was never that big a deal. Cons: The cable TV was pretty basic. They have HD sets and HD channels, but if you take out the various Disney channels, the sports channels, the news channels and the religious channels, all you have are the networks. The soundproofing is terrible. You can hear the people in the rooms next to you urinating in their bathrooms. Gross! And the frequently unhappy small child in the room next door might as well have been having her tantrums while sitting in our laps, it was so loud. Our bags took over 5 hours to get to our room from the Magical Express. It says 3 hours on their literature. You have to walk right past the smoking area to get to and from the bus stop. It was not a good location for this area as the clouds of smoke were frequently overwhelming as you walked by.

Reviews.Title: “A room built for a mouse!!!”
Reviews.Author: Abaxter007
Reviews.Content: First let me start by saying that Popeye2625's review pretty much sums up how we felt about this establishment. I just wanted to add two small caveats. First, if you went to Disney when you were small and had great memories and think that you can relive those fantasies as an adult with your own child and reluctant husband beware if you decide to do it at this resort. This place is way over priced. If you do not mind spending $300 plus dollars to stay at a Days Inn collocated on a zoo then the AKL is for you. The lobby is truly amazing but that only lasts 1 day before you say...there goes that nice lobby but the room sucks. Maybe I should have had my family sleep in the lobby. The rooms are very very small. Internet is not free. Towels are small. It is like it was built for a little mouse. Hmmmm!!!!!!! Second, they snare you with the savannah room as opposed to the ones facing the parking lot. It’s like a spouse saying "you do not want to spend two pay checks on a Jlo diamond wedding ring. Are you too cheap for your family"? Don't fall for it. The savannah view is a BFR (Big Fat Rip Off). You see the same old zoo animals again and again. Why? Because, in order for them to eat they have to parade their happy butts outside your window to pick up the food. They are NOT running around in nature. This is not a wild kingdom voyeur site. It is a zoo!!!!! You will see the same big horned ox shaking his head back and forth. Save up your cash, learn another language and go to Africa. If the motherland is not in your near future, you could instead stay at a hotel closer to the action and do a day trip to the AKL and see the same animals that the $300 guys are seeing but closer. The animals do not come up to your window. There are metal devices that protrude towards the animals so they can not roam freely. Also if you decide to ignore my warning, watch out for the lip of the balcony sliding door in your room. Definite trip hazard. We had to lay a towel down on top of it so my daughter would not crack her skull. I will end on a good note. The bathroom had really cool African wall paper. Truly Magical!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun for all ages!”
Reviews.Author: JMLECMom
Reviews.Content: We loved the AK Lodge! Very convenient to travel to the Disney parks via bus--makes it nice with young children. We would open up our blinds each morning and be within 50 feet of gorgeous giraffes enjoying the morning sun. Rooms are small, but that is to be expected at the Disney theme resorts. We loved our stay at the AKL!

Reviews.Title: “Not so great for Kids under 12....”
Reviews.Author: mommaof3Oklahoma
Reviews.Content: While our visit at AKL was nice there were many downfalls... Transporation to the parks was awful!! It took an eternity to get anywhere. I would reccomend staying somewhere a little more centrally located. Hotel staff was not accomodating at all. Lodge was nice if you were going to sit in your room and WAIT for the 2 or 3 times the animals would come to the savannah each day but overall, very disappointing for myself and my 3 kids. Food was not kid friendly unless you eat at The Mara and after 3 meals a day that gets pretty old. Not much selection for food in this lodge. I suppose if you were only going to stay at the lodge and not visit any of the parks it would be worth the money but for our family it was a HUGE disappointment. I would recommend staying at one of the more kid friendly resorts if you are traveling with children under the age of 12.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: gone_again18
Reviews.Content: The staff at AKL were awesome, from arrival to check out. We had a rental car and paid for and used the valet service - soooo worth while. $10.00 per day plus tips. The consierge staff were very accomodating - we asked for a can opener and also a cork screw - they were in our room when we returned later in the day. They changed dinner reservations for us. They phoned a restaurant for us to find out what they had going for New Year's Eve and left us a message in our room, as we were on our way out to meet family and couldn't wait. They deleted a tip that I had added to a lunch bill (I didn't know that the tip had already been included). The housekeeping staff left plenty of towels. Every day they gave us shampoo, conditioner and soap. We didn't have a savannah room, but we saw animals everyday from our room. There are viewing areas around the hotel, but we didn't have to go to them as we saw animals daily. I went to the bar 1 evening and requested an empty wine glass, and tom collins glass to take back to our room, not a problem. There didn't seem to be as many small children at this resort. The rest of our family were staying at the Polyenisian Resort. (10 of them). Hubby and I don't have kids, so the travel agent suggested AKL for us. Keep in mind that it is the furthest away from the Magic Kingdom. We ate dinner at Boma the first night. Excellent. African buffet. Would highly recommend it. (My parents have travelled to Africa, they came over to Boma themselves 1 evening and said it was what they remembered from Aftrica. We got breakfast from Mara 1 morning, otherwise we ate our breakfast's elsewhere (just out of convience). The decor of the hotel again was African. Amazing decorations, pictures, the music, carpeting... right down to the bedspreads, and vent covers in the hall ways. The staff dressed in African costume as well. All staff (valet, consierge, housekeepers, and the animal keepers, bartenders etc...) Lovely. All staff were helpful, polite and friendly. Can't say enought about any of the Disney staff. All wonderful. I am going to write a review on Walt Disney Workd itself - as I can't say enough about it. I only have 1 negative thing to say, and it's about the dining time. If you want a relaxed sit down and enjoy meal (1 1/2 to 2 hours in length) you've got to book signature dining that's the 3 $$$'s. Otherwise, it's all about turning the tables and you're in and out in no time. If you're with kids I guess that's expected. I myself would go back to the AKL. But then again there are so many hotels, I might try the Disney Dolphin Hotel. It was beautiful. Hope this review is helpful to those of you planning a disney vacation. As they say in Disney World "Have a Magical Day"

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and overrated”
Reviews.Author: popeye2625
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge in December 2008 for our family vacation. We were extremely excited for the trip as it was our first to Disney in seven years -- and because of the promotional videos and pictures we saw about the Animal Kingdom Lodge. While the hotel is gorgeous, it was not worth the price or the hype. A striking lobby means nothing when you wait in line for 30-45 minutes for a concierge, have a room with two drawers for a family of four, and towels that would barely wrap around a 6-year-old, let alone a normal-sized adult. We found most of the staff to be "in training." I needed tickets that I had pre-purchased for Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party, and was directed by Disney to simply visit our hotel concierge, who could print out the tickets for us. The concierge at AKL took 20 minutes with me, continually asking me to be patient as he was trying to figure it out, and I walked away WITHOUT TICKETS. He couldn't figure it out and didn't have anyone to help him. When I went back to get the tickets later, I waited in line for 45 minutes before I found a capable concierge to execute the task. If I'm paying more than $200 a night for a hotel, I'm expecting more than two drawers in my hotel room. Is that crazy? As a result of the scant storage room for clothes in the room, our room was cluttered and messy for the duration of the trip as we lived out of suitcases on suitcase stands in our rooms. The other big issue that I had with AKL was the bus system. While it's awesome that there are dedicated buses for AKL that preclude you from stopping at other hotels for pickup, the buses came every 15-20 minutes, and there was no system for bus boarding. While I appreciate Disney betting that the everyday human will be in good spirits on his/her vacation and therefore not have the nerve to board a bus before a load of people who waited the entire 15-minute duration, they underestimate the gall of many, many a guest. I cannot tell you how many times we'd get to the bus stop and be the first to wait for a bus, only to watch someone stroll up right as the bus arrived and right in front of us as we loaded our small children. Disney is asking for Tyson-like fights to erupt with this "every Mouse for himself" system. Everyone channels their inner Grumpy as they board (and often, stand on a moving bus for the 15 minute ride to the parks). AKL is an investment. And when you make an investment in a nice hotel, you expect a return. AKL was a losing investment for us. Check out Port Orleans, Key West, Saratoga or any of the economy resorts. There ALWAYS seemed to be buses for them waiting outside the parks! You'll save in frustration and in the wallet.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Knoxvoltn
Reviews.Content: My wife (who was my girlfriend at the time) and I stayed here during October 2006 for four nights. We had a very good time. I loved the room. It was very, very quiet. Also, it was clean and comfortable. The staff was very friendly (as about 99% of Disney "cast members" are very friendly). The hotel had a very nice fitness center, but it opened too late for me to use it (it opens at 9:00 AM, I think, and we prefer to get to the park early and stay until late evening). The pool was beautiful and clean. The hotel has some live animals on its property, so you can walk outside and see giraffes and a few other animals. If you're like us, when you visit Disney World, you don't stay in your hotel room very long (basically just to sleep and get ready to go out). You might consider staying at a moderate or value resort. I don't know if I would stay here again due to the price, but it is a very, very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and overrated”
Reviews.Author: caitlinsdad35
Reviews.Content: This was our third time to Florida, so as a treat we decided to spend 7 nights of our 2 week vacation in Animal Kingdom Lodge. I have never been so disappointed in my life. There is only 1 smoking area in the hotel, (the room they offered us was miles away). The rooms are tiny . I was constantly banging my knees and bumping into things. The whole hotel is dark and dingy (i know this is the theme and for the animals benefit, but it still makes you depressed). All kids activities cost extra, and i mean everything!!! The car park is a hell of a trek from the lobby. Check in/out takes a lifetime. My advice is unless money is no object do not bother with this hotel. This place is way overpriced!! Stay in the Hard Rock Hotel at Universal instead!!! That hotel is how a 5 star hotel should be. And you get to fast pass all the rides with your room key.

Reviews.Title: “Great atomosphere with ok sized rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mich_AuburnHills
Reviews.Content: OK, this may stray from the average experience at the Animal Kingdom Lodge. I agree that this is a fantastic atmosphere with wonderful amenities including a wonderful pool area and great views of animals everywhere. The views from the balcony were also nice with animals galore. The lobby is and inside hotel is breathtaking and relaxing. That said, I would give high points for all of this. The room however would rate much lower. Now I give high points for the style of the room. It is nice and the beds are comfortable. However, for the price, the rooms are quite small. I have stayed in hotels with a full living room and kitchen for half the price. I know that the atmosphere and animals make it worth the price for many, but the room was just average for this price. Overall the Animal Kingdom lodge is a winner and one -of -a kind and visitors will enjoy the uniqueness of the property.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed on Disney Property before - didn't fail”
Reviews.Author: hurley22
Reviews.Content: As someone who has stayed at Disney's Moderate and Deluxe resorts (Polynesian twice and the Port Orleans French Quarter), we were very very pleased with the Animal Kingdom Lodge. We had actually booked 2 rooms for 6 adults the the Caribbean Beach resort, but they had overbooked the Value resorts so we got bumped to the Animal Kingdom lodge, while the other Value guests were bumped to the Caribbean Resort. Not only that but when we checked in we weren't exactly ecstatic about the view of the parking lot so they bumped us up to a Savannah View room on Kudu Trail. It was quite the hike to our room, but really is absolutely NO different than staying at any of the Deluxe Resorts. At least at this resort you are attached inside. Also, our room faced the construction that is going on where they are building the Villas, and honestly IT DID NOT BOTHER US AT ALL. And it certainly did not bother the animals, there was always a giraffe or Zebra hanging out right in front of the balcony. People complaining that the rooms and resort are dark may not be aware that this is actually done on purpose for the animals for their benefit and ours! It also so we can see the nocturnal animals who come out night. The resort also has night vision so you can see them around the resort! After hearing complaints about the bus service here, I didn't find that we waited longer than at any other resort. The most we waited was 20 minutes and this was near the end of the night when they weren't running as frequently. The housekeeping was the only small complaint. And I mean small. It wasn't as thorough as at the Polynesian, but the beds were made and everything was replenished. Mara, the quick service restaurant was wonderful for a quick bite with Burgers, Chicken Tenders, Wraps, Sandwiches, Roast Chicken and African Stew. We used the Dining Plan which I strongly recommend, it is a great deal and saves the hassle of worrying about food all the time. The staff is really friendly! The lady who works at the bar near the pool is awesome, she remembered all our names every day. It was just that little extra Disney attitude that really makes the trip amazing. I witnessed some picky and rude customers complaining to the concierge one morning and I can't believe how well they handled them, honestly I would not have been so pleasant... Advice: ~ Request any of the rooms on Giraffe or Kudu Trail, each side faces a Savannah. We looked the opposite direction of the main inner Savannah and had more animals than the main one almost all of the time ~We found that it wasn't really necessary to reserve breakfast at Boma as long as you were there before 8:00. The buffet at breakfast is amazing. ~EAT AT JIKO. We ate at Narcoosees, California Grill, Ohana's and The Brown Derby and this restaurant had the best atmosphere and menu. Not to mention our server was above and beyond with the wine list knowledge. This will most likely require reservations in advance. ~We recommend making your room requests when you book your trip but then call again a few days before you arrive. They will usually know when you are gonna be and then they can perhaps make adjustments before you get there. ~Just ask. They will go out of their way to assist you. We were a forgetful bunch and lost jewelry, a wallet, Key card and sunglasses and all were either returned to us or are being shipped home free of charge. This is a wonderful resort to stay at, it is such a quiet, cozy place to come home to after a long noisy day at the park.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful View”
Reviews.Author: Colleen S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights last weekend. The hotel was decorated very nicely for Christmas. I had a wonderful experience with all of the staff. Everyone was very friendly and more than happy to help us with anything we needed. We had a great view from our balcony and saw many giraffes, zebras, the watusi cattle, and deer. The most wonderful experience was when we came back to our room to get ready for dinner, there was a giraffe laying directly in front of our room. It was the first thing we saw when we opened the door to our room. Amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected...But Rent A Car!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisFanNYC
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 3 night stay at Disney's Animal Kingdom Lodge 12/13-12/16/08. I was nervous after reading these reviews but wanted to share with you my experience. STAFF - the staff was much nicer to us than these reviews let on. We were checked in by Carlos after arriving early (12:30pm) and he not only got us into a room right away, but he had upgraded us to a Sunset Savannah room (one of the 3280s). We had gotten an amazing rate as a Disney Passholder (159 per night). The room was GREAT (not small like everyone states on here). We had an amazing view of giraffes, zebra, antelope, ostrich, and other animals on the "Sunset Savannah". There was construction going on across the way but it didn't bother us. We did not eat in the hotel restaurants...Jiko was too pricey and Boma had disappointed me once previously. We did eat at the counter service MARA and that was fine. Pool and whirlpools were amazing, as were the "night vision" goggles to watch to animals at night! One thing the reviews have pegged right, the Disney Bus transportation was AWFUL. This lodge is very far out and it often seemed like we were the lone waiters as scores of buses for the cheaper hotels passed by us. One driver even got lost on our way home from Magic Kingdom, and we were halfway up 192 at 11pm at night before he realized it. I definitely would NOT recommend staying here WITHOUT renting a car. Otherwise it was great...lobby was beautiful with Christmas decorations. I do wish they had food options available after midnight. Overall: It was better than I expected but I am not sure I would stay here again. It's priced as a deluxe hotel but really doesn't pull off the right level service to deserve that category. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great 60th Birthday!”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: We stayed at DAKL last month to celebrate my 60th. We had gone to Di
